name: Feminine Hygiene
description:
Feminine Hygiene products

While an essential part of women’s health and fertility, many young women are unaware of the best feminine hygiene products available to make their lives more comfortable. There are a range of products out there to help women during menstruation and when experiencing other issues relating to their vaginal region.

What are the main types of feminine hygiene products

There are many types of feminine hygiene products that are available for women who are going through menstruation and experiencing other vaginal issues. The most popular types are:

Menstrual Cups – These personal hygiene products are small, delicate cups that can be inserted into the vagina, just below the cervix. They work by collecting menstrual blood that is exiting the vagina thus preventing leakage into an individual’s undergarments. They come in two shapes; diaphragm shaped and bell-shaped.

Menstrual Pads – Menstrual pads are feminine hygiene products that are made of thin material and placed into the underwear to absorb menstrual blood following its exit from the vagina.

Panty Liners – Much like menstrual pads, panty liners are placed into the underwear to absorb blood after it exits the body. The major difference between panty liners and standard pads are that panty liners are made of softer, thinner material and considered more comfortable. This makes them ideal for use during the earlier and later stages of menstruation when the amount of blood exiting the vagina is minimal.

Incontinence Pads – For women who are experiencing urinary leakage, incontinence pads are a wonderful feminine hygiene product that are inserted into the underwear to soak up leakages leaving the person feeling fresher and more comfortable.

Tampons – A tampon is another method for dealing with your period. It involves the insertion of a soft cotton, cylinder-like shaped object into the opening of the vagina to stem the flow of menstrual blood.

Panty Liners

Feel fresh and clean with panty liners. Many women experience some discharge throughout the day even when not on their periods. This is often due to slight stress incontinence where a weakened urethra can leak when experiencing strain. Many women also find that panty liners are a better option to menstrual pads during the lighter days of their periods. This is because they are thinner than most pads and considered much more comfortable.

What are panty liners

So what are panty liners exactly? Panty liners are more comfortable options than menstrual pads that are often the desired choice of women looking for a cleaner, fresher feel during lighter period days and throughout the month to soak up small leakages. They can be used in combination with a tampon to ensure that any leakages that seep past the first layer of protection do not reach a woman’s underwear.

Reasons to consider wearing a panty liner daily

There are several reasons why women choose to wear a panty liner every day. These reasons are:

It ensures you stay dry and fresh – Wet underwear can be a highly uncomfortable feeling for women due to normal vaginal discharge. Panty liners can ensure that your underwear remains dry.

It can save the day when your period arrives without warning – Having panty liners with you in your purse or handbag can be a lifesaver on days when your period arrives without notice.

It is ideal in the early or late stages of your period – For those days during the period where a menstrual pad feels a little excessive, a panty liner is perfect because you will not feel as uncomfortable as you would feel with a pad.

It is ideal for the active female – When engaging in exercise and on the move, there are moments where you are likely to lose bladder control. Panty liners are perfect in these situations.

name: Pads
description:
Menstrual Pads

Menstrual or period pads are an ultra-absorbent product that is worn by women who are menstruating, have experienced a recent abortion, or following vaginal surgery. The purpose of menstrual pads is to absorb blood that is exiting the vaginal region. They can also be worn by women experiencing urinary incontinence, which is a medical issue that results in the leakage of urine from the vagina.

How do period pads work?

Period pads are inserted into a women’s underwear during the occurrence of a period to absorb blood. Unlike a tampon, it is placed externally providing greater comfort than the alternatives. Pads require changing when full, but the frequency of a pad change will largely depend on the stage of the period and whether the menstrual flow is light or heavy.

The two different types of menstrual pads

There are two main types of menstrual pads that are available for women to choose from. These two types are:

Disposable Menstrual Pads – Although materials used in disposable menstrual pads can differ greatly, most contain bleached rayon, cotton and plastics. The major negative to this type of pad is the difficulty with recycling. Due to the materials contained within, often the only safe way that these products are disposed of is via landfill disposal which can be detrimental to the environment. Although recently, many manufacturers have confronted this issue by creating disposal pads that are made with 100% cotton and therefore more environmentally friendly.

Cloth Menstrual Pads – Many environmentally-conscious consumers have made the switch to cloth menstrual pads which are washable and reusable. Often made from either cotton or hemp, these products do not need to be disposed of and are therefore not only a more environmentally friendly choice buy also much more cost-effective.

name: Soothers
description:
Soothers - Your child deserves the best

Soothers are a necessary evil that mothers cannot simply avoid. While shopping for soothers for your newborn, you will encounter many options. Not all are good enough though. In a matter of fact, there are a lot of soothers out there made of non-natural products and will end up harming your child. Thus, it is preferred to make an educated decision before choosing a random brand of soothers, pacifiers, dummies or teethers.

What are Natural Rubber Soothers made of?

Natural Rubber Soothers, as the name indicates are made of natural rubber. Natural rubber comes from the hevea brasiliensis tree. When processed, it has many properties that make it suitable in adding into the making of soothers and pacifiers.

Rubber Soothers Benefits

When it comes to rubber soothers, you need to know how it can benefit your child and if safe to use.

Let’s have a look at some of the benefits of natural rubber soothers:

  1. Natural Rubber vs Silicone – Many soothers and pacifier manufacturers are using silicone in their products instead of natural rubber. The biggest difference, when it comes to silicone, is that it is more likely to tear whereas natural rubber consists of a single rubber piece which makes it much more long-lasting. If a pacifier or teether tears then it becomes a choking hazard.
  2. While being less likely to tear due to its rubber make-up, it is less likely for the rubber to have creases where bacteria will develop and become hazardous to use.

Your Guide to Xylitol at Buy Organics Online

Forget the refined blues; embrace the natural sweetness of xylitol, the sugar alternative taking the health world by storm! Here at Buy Organics Online, we believe in nourishing your body without compromising on taste. And xylitol, crafted from nature's bounty, delivers precisely that: guilt-free sweetness with a treasure trove of health benefits.

What is Xylitol?

This wonder ingredient, found naturally in fruits and vegetables, looks and tastes remarkably like sugar. But beneath its familiar façade lies a secret superpower: xylitol doesn't raise blood sugar levels like its refined counterpart. This makes it a dream solution for health-conscious individuals and anyone seeking a healthy way to sweeten their lives.

Benefits to Buzz About:

  • Dental Delight: Say goodbye to cavities! Xylitol actively fights tooth decay, making it a dentist's dream and a smile's best friend.
  • Calorie Countless: Swap out sugar for xylitol and enjoy 40% fewer calories! Perfect for keeping your diet in check without sacrificing that sweet satisfaction.
  • Diabetic Darling: Studies suggest xylitol's ability to maintain stable blood sugar levels makes it a potential ally in managing diabetes.
  • Ear Infection Enemy: Xylitol has a knack for inhibiting bacteria growth, potentially helping to prevent those pesky ear infections.
  • Bone-Boosting Buddy: Early research hints at xylitol's potential to strengthen bone tissue, offering exciting possibilities for bone health.

Xylitol vs. Stevia: The Sweet Showdown:

Both xylitol and stevia offer health advantages over sugar, but the tastebud battle is a personal one. Xylitol mimics sugar's sweetness almost perfectly, while stevia can leave a lingering licorice aftertaste. Ultimately, the choice comes down to your personal preference!

name: Maca
description:
What is Maca?

Growing in popularity by the day, many people are asking the question what is Maca? Native to Peru, Maca is a plant known in the scientific world as Lepidium Meyenii. It is a vegetable related to cauliflower, cabbage and broccoli and has historically been used in Peru for both culinary and medicinal purposes. The most edible portion of the plant lies in the root. It comes in several colours, most commonly white or black. In terms of taste, it has been described as possessing an earthy, nutty flavour.

In what forms does Maca come

Maca root is most commonly consumed in powder form but can also be found in capsule form or as a liquid extract. In powder form it is most often added to smoothies, oatmeal and sweets as a nutritional booster. In capsule form it is normally taken in the morning with a glass of water.

What is Maca Powder?

The powder comes from the dried Maca Root. It is the root of the maca plant that is the edible portion. The powder has an earthy nutty taste which is quite strong.

What is Maca Good For?

Maca is a traditional Peruvian food supplement that has been used traditionally to solve various problems. It has recently become popular with musclebuilders as well as athletes. The powder has been associated with improved endurance, muscle gain and greater energy levels.

Organic Maca benefits

There are several organic Maca benefits that individuals who regularly consume it can receive. These benefits include:

  • It is highly nutritious providing a good source of protein and carbohydrates while being low in fat.

How to use maca powder and how to take maca powder

It has been recommended that you take up to 20 grams of maca powder daily. However, most people will start with smaller amounts as they become accustomed to the taste. As a broad guide one teaspoon of the powder equates to about 5  grams. The powder can be used as an additive to smoothies and other recipes like bliss balls or added to oats.

Organic Maca Australia

At Buy Organics Online there are a wide range of organic Maca products that have been sourced from only the most reputable brands from Australia and around the globe. One of nature’s great superfoods, Maca will make for a welcome addition to the kitchen pantry of any health-conscious consumer.

name: Ear Drops
description:
What are Natural Ear drops and how do they work?

Natural ear drops are a form of treatment used to soften and dissolve ear wax. Natural ear drops are generally oil or water based and can be used as a stand-alone treatment or in conjunction with ear candle treatment, syringing or irrigation.

Ear drops work by thinning and softening ear wax to the point where it can effectively dissolve. In addition, natural ear drops provide lubrication for the outer layer of skin that lines the ear canal that ensures any wax present can be expelled out of the ear.

Ear drops as a form of first aid

When foreign bodies invade the inner ear, there can sometimes be an urgent need to expel these particles quickly. Therefore, first aid ear drops are an essential addition to any first aid kit. Having quick access to natural ear drops can provide immediate and effective relief where a foreign body has invaded the inner ear. Applying first aid ear drops can quickly expel the foreign particles from the area, eliminating danger and alleviating concern.

How to use natural ear drops

Simply apply natural ear drops as instructed in the manufacturer’s directions that are normally listed on the packaging. Frequency and duration of treatment can vary with each product so take care to follow the instructions as directed.

Potential benefits

There are several potential benefits to applying natural ear drops. These benefits include:

  • The effective removal of ear wax.
  • Where successful they can prevent the need for more invasive treatment methods such as ear syringing.
  • They are a relatively cheap treatment method as opposed to others that your GP may suggest.
  • As a self-care treatment method, they do not require a prescription or regular follow-ups with a GP.

Ear drops Australia

name: Ear Candles
description:
What is ear candling?

Ever wondered exactly what is ear candling? Well, put simply it is a cleaning process that proponents suggest may clear the ear canals of excess wax and debris. Advocates of the method claim that ear candling can be beneficial by using the smoke of a burning wick to create a vacuum that helps to extract the wax and excess debris from the ear.

How do ear candles work?

Many people ask how do ear candles work? Well, the method is simple to explain. It involves placing a long candle into the ear. The external end of the candle is then lit which results in the whole ear becoming coated in beeswax. This creates a vacuum in the ear canal and, as the beeswax is being removed, the hope is that excess ear wax is drawn out with it.

What does ear candling do?

The heat from the ear candles is meant to soften ear wax making it easier to remove.

Why you might use ear candles?

As a form of alternative medicine there are both proponents and critics of the value of using ear candling as a form of ear care. Some users of the product have advised that it may help with: 

  • Clearing earwax build-up. Although earwax serves a purpose in protecting the inner ear from unwanted particles, problems arise due to excess build-up. Traditional treatments such as water pumping or the insertion of sharp implements can be invasive and uncomfortable. Using ear candles is an alternative that is free from discomfort.
  • A reduction in earaches. Earaches generally occur due to inflammation within the ear canal. Those looking for a treatment method that does not involve the use of prescribed medication may find that ear candling provides an effective alternative. This is because the warmth inside the ear can ensure bacteria does not have the space to reside.
  • Relief of swimmer's ear. When water gets trapped in the ear canal, germs present in the liquid can cause an infection. This often is reported as severely uncomfortable. When ear candles are used, the warmth provided can remove the water build-up therefore reducing the chance for germs to survive.

Do ear candles really work?

A quick Google search will reveal many health sites proclaiming that ear candles do not remove ear wax. However, there is some evidence to show that ear candles do soften ear wax, making it easier to flush out. Some of the more reputable ear candling sites actually state that ear candling softens the ear wax allowing it to be secreted naturally. This explanation would tend to give credence to the practice and perhaps explain why the practice dates back thousands of years in many different cultures.

Will ear candles help with fluid in the ear?

There are some claims that ear candling may help to dry excess fluids in the ear. There is no scientific evidence to support this claim.

Ear Candling Precautions

It is important that customers be aware of the need to take caution when using ear candles. It is recommended that you do not use ear candles unless in the presence of others. The act of inserting ear candles is safer when performed by a second person. It is also important to note that if you suffer from chronic illnesses and diseases that use of ear candles is not recommended.

Make sure to avoid using ear candles if you have tympanostomy tube implants or suffer from a perforated eardrum. This warning also applies to any kind of inflammation of the ear and its surrounding area. Please also be aware that occasional allergic reaction to the ingredients contained within this product have been reported. Where this occurs, irritating itchiness has been reported. In most cases, this allergic reaction can be relieved by using eardrops.

Is ear candling safe?

Using ear candles may present some risks, particularly if not used properly. Improper use could result in build up of candle wax in the ear canal, burns to the face and hair, or in some cases a perforated eardrum. Caution is recommended.

We highly encourage you to consult a GP or health practitioner if you have any reservations about ear candling treatment. Application of ear candles is at your own risk so please make sure to chat with your GP if you have any concerns prior to use.

name: Organic Tea
description:
Organic Tea – How tea should really be

Introduce organic tea in your daily life and feel the improvement. Tea originates from the Far East and has been a popular drink for thousands of years. Not only due to its lovely flavor but also, due to its many abilities and health benefits that it passes over to its consumers.

What is Organic Tea?

 Organic tea is simply 100% pure tea without any fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides or any other ‘badditives’ added to the growth of the tea leaves.

Why is organic tea healthy?

Tea itself is known to have many health benefits -knowing that it has been produced organically - without the aid of pesticides, chemicals or GMOs means that you are reaping the optimum level of health benefits from organic tea.

What are the Benefits of Organic Tea?

The benefits of drinking organic tea are numerous, the main benefits are listed below 

  • Free of toxins. The use of pesticides results in these poisons ending  up in our bodies, potentially causing problems in the medium to long term. Drinking  organic tea i one way you can reduce your exposure to these potential hazards.

  • Improves digestive health by stimulating activity in healthy gut bacteria 

  • Helps with weight loss when combined with regular exercise.

  • The calming effect. Tea has a  relaxing effect due to an ingredient known as theanine.

  • Helps to regulate blood sugar levels

There are many options for you to choose from – different flavors, different abilities and different herbals. You can easily brew and have your tea to help you calm down and unwind for the day. A warm cup of organic tea can also help you sleep better and reduce body inflammation.

name: Bath and Shower Gel
description:
Shower Gel Your shower essential

A Shower Gel (also known as bath gel) is the perfect substitute to your conventional soap bar. Introducing a shower gel in your bath regime will benefit you in many ways. Asides from the fact that shower gels are mainstream, nowadays consumers also have access to different kinds of scents. This makes it easier for you to choose from a variety of scents and purpose of shower gels that best fits and satisfy your needs. With consumers becoming more conscious as to what products they put on their body, organic shower gels are the best choice.

What are organic shower gels?

Organic shower gels are natural shower gels that include natural ingredients and omit chemicals usually found in regular shower gels. Bath gels that are classified as organic contain natural and organic ingredients such as oil extract, essential oils and natural fragrances.

Shower Gels Benefits

Shower Gels or Bath Gels can provide many benefits to you and your family. Lets have a look at some of those benefits:

  1. Shower gels are more efficient when it comes to their use since they come in packages that are less likely to be contaminated. On the contrary, soaps have immediate contact with individuals and are more likely to be contaminated from body residue.
  2. Since soap dissolves in water, with just a few droplets, soaps are reduced. This makes them less beneficial since you end up using more soap than what you actually need. Whereas in the case of shower gels, you have the control over how much you would like to use.
  3. Lathering with shower gels is much easier and satisfying since the gel consistency makes for more foam and makes you feel more refreshed and fragrant. It is easier to rinse off shower gel foams than soap foams.
  4. Soap bars tend to leave your skin less hydrated whereas shower gels keep moisture locked inside your skin for a smooth and better looking skin.

Shower Gel Australia

Choose from a wide variety of shower gels from trusted Australian and international brands.

Satisfy all your cleaning needs from our Bath and Shower products at Buy Organics Online.

name: Dietary Supplements
description:
Health Supplements Australia

If you’re looking for a way to overcome general feelings of tiredness and lethargy than nutritional health supplements Australia could be the answer that you’re looking for.

As the term suggests, food supplements are products designed to supply your body with nutrients that are missing from your everyday diet. Common health supplements required may be vitamins, minerals, oils (fish) or herb supplements.

Organic Health Supplements Benefits

It’s important to understand that all dietary supplements are not created equal.  Organic supplements make the best possible choice of supplement. Organic supplements are made from natural fruit and vegetable products. A laboratory cannot duplicate the complex natural structure contained within these compounds.  

When considering using dietary supplements Australia should always choose organic natural products over synthetic supplements.  People who may benefit from using supplements include:

  • Pregnant or breastfeeding mothers

  • Elderly people not gaining sufficient nutrition from their daily diet

  • Sufferers of medical conditions that prevent the usual processing of particular nutrients – chronic kidney disease illness is one example

  • People who have a particular strong nutrient deficiency e.g. calcium

  • People who have particular restrictions on their diet and need to supplement their diet by other means.

  • People who have a nutritional deficiency for whatever reason.

  • People in the field of sports that may need an extra boost in their diet

In many instances the need for health supplements may be temporary in response to a particular health condition.  

Where to Buy Natural Health Supplements Australia

name: Liquid Soap
description:
Liquid Soap – Your multi-purposed soap

Liquid Soap is not your traditional soap. Our liquid soap range includes multi-purposed soaps such as liquid castile soaps. Each product is made up of different formulations that allow for a much deeper cleaning and to satisfy all your cleaning needs. Organic Liquid Soaps have many advantages over traditional bar soaps. In reference to their biggest difference of the latter being in solid form whereas liquid is not, this makes liquid soaps even more convenient and cost-effective. We will have a look at that in the benefits section.

What is liquid soap and how does it compare to bar soap?

Put simply liquid soap is a manufactured soap brand in liquid form. Liquid soap was first produced in 1865 by what would later become known as the Palmolive company. It is preferred in some instance to bar soap for its convenience and comparative ease to keep wash areas clean from soap stains that dried vbar soaps can do. In practical cleaning terms there is no significant difference between a bar soap and a liquid soap.

Some argue how natural body wash is almost the same with natural liquid soap. Their only difference is that liquid soap usually has a thicker consistency and it is mostly used in colder climates. Due to their thinner consistency, shower gels are recommended to be used in warmer climates.

Liquid Soap vs Shower Gel vs Body Wash

No one can declare which one is the best for you to use. Each has a different consistency, texture and soap formulation. In addition to the aforementioned reason and the different types of consumers that exist in the market, deciding which one to use is purely on individual preference. Although, one can make an educated decision based on the ingredients used in the making of each one. Especially, when it comes to allergies or ingredient preference.

Liquid Soap Benefits

If you are wondering what are the liquid soap benefits then it’s time for us to. Lets have a look at some benefits that liquid soap has over the other types of soaps.

  1. Liquid soap, much like shower gels and body wash, is cost effective over bar soaps. You can control the amount of liquid you will use per bath/shower session. Whereas soaps usually soak in water which can reduce the amount of soap available.
  2. Some bacteria might grow on soaps due to their direct contact with the ones using it.
  3. Fragrance and moisture of liquid soaps react better in colder climates.
  4. Usually available in bottle dispensers which is more convenient to be used.
  5. Lathering with liquid soap leaves a thin layer of moisturizer and fragrance on your skin. That is one of the reasons why most liquid soap fans prefer it over bar soaps.

How to use liquid soap

There are certain times when you simply must use soap, whether that be in liquid or bar form. Invariably, those times involve washing your hands.  Most of these times are basic hygiene principles - before eating, after going to the toilet, after sneezing After handling pets, etc.

Simply washing is not going to do the job. Using liquid soap properly will ensure that  the soap does its job effectively.  Here is the best way to use liquid soap when washing hands.

  • Wet your hands with warm running water

  • Pmp the soap dispenser once to get a decent supply of soap and apply it to your hands

  • Work the soap into a decent lather

  • Spend a good twenty seconds rubbing the soap over your entire hand’s surface including between your fingers, underneath your nails and extending slightly up to your wrists.

  • Rinse your hands to thoroughly remove all traces of soap

  • Dry your hands fully.

Liquid Soap Australia

Buy Organics Online proudly provides quality liquid soaps from Australian brands as well as international ones.

name: Agave
description:
What is Agave?

Largely located in Mexico, agave is a syrup that is produced from the tequila plant. It is most popularly used as a sugar substitute and is much sweeter in taste. While slightly higher in calories per teaspoon than sugar, agave products are lower in GI and therefore may be beneficial to those with diabetes. Agave is a solid source of iron and contains a good amount of calcium. It is also a good source of zinc.

The benefits of agave products

There are several reasons why using agave in place of regular sugar may be beneficial to your health. These benefits are as follows:

  • The high source of iron is of great benefit to your body. Iron promotes the movement of oxygen from the lungs to other areas of the body.
  • Organic agave contains a significant amount of zinc. Zinc is a mineral that is essential in the healing of wounds that you may have suffered in the undertaking of daily activities.
  • There is a high amount of calcium present in this product. Calcium helps you to build and maintain strong bones while your heart and nerves also need calcium to perform at their best.
  • Agave products also contain saponins. These compounds can bind to cholesterol and can help to lower cholesterol levels which can reduce heart disease.
  • An ample serving of agave can supply a good amount of fibre that can help alleviate the symptoms that cause constipation.

Agave Australia

At Buy Organics Online you can purchase agave Australia products that have been sourced from only the most trusted manufacturers. When it comes to sugar substitutes, you can’t beat organic agave with its rich source of iron, calcium and zinc that can provide many positive health benefits. name: Olive Oil
description:
What is organic olive oil?

Organic olive oil is obtained in the similar way to traditional olive oil which is extracted from olives grown organically. The oil is extracted using a pressing procedure and then the water and oil are separated . Organic extra virgin olive oil is made only from olives that have been cold pressed olives whereas organic virgin olive oil is made from a mixture of cold pressed olives and processed oils.

Olive oil can be used in a variety of ways including many culinary uses, ceremonial and religious purposes and skin care.

Benefits of organic olive oil

Most health experts agree that olive oil and extra virgin olive oil in particular, is good for you. Some of the documented health benefits that using olive oil provides are:

  • Oleic acid - a healthy monounsaturated fat that reduces inflammation makes up 73% of olive oil

  • Extra virgin olive oil has a high concentration of antioxidants which have been linked to reducing the risk of chronic disease

  • Antioxidants can reduce inflammation

  • Some comprehensive studies have linked the use of olive oil to a reduction in the risk of stroke.

  • It improves the function of blood vessels, can lower blood pressure and cholesterol

  • Olive oil does not contribute to weight gain, and taken in moderation it may even assist with weight reduction

  • Some studies have suggested that olive oil may help to prevent the build up of beta-amyloid plaque in brain cells and reduce the risk of alzheimer’s disease

  • May reduce the chance of contracting type 2 diabetes

  • May relieve the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis

  • Has antibacterial properties

name: Incontinence pads
description:
Incontinence Pads

Incontinence pads are an essential product for those women experiencing urinary incontinence. The use of such products can assist a person affected by incontinence to live a fully functional life. These products can ensure that the person experiencing these issues remains dry, and more comfortable, thus improving their quality of life drastically.

What is urinary incontinence?

Urinary incontinence is the loss of bladder control that results in the leaking of urine. The severity of symptoms experienced by incontinence sufferers ranges from occasional urine leakage during a cough, sneeze or laughter through to frequent sudden urges to urinate. Where symptoms are severe, often a person cannot make it to the toilet in time resulting in a very embarrassing situation. There are several types of urinary incontinence that women experience, which are:

Stress incontinence – Where urine leakage occurs because of sudden pressure on the bladder as a result of coughing, sneezing, laughing or exercise.

Urge incontinence - Where a sufferer experiences an extreme urge to urinate that is generally followed by loss of control and subsequent leakage.

Overflow incontinence – The frequent and continual dribbling of urine that results from a bladder that does not empty entirely.

Mixed incontinence – A condition where an individual suffers from more than one of the above types of incontinence.

How to use incontinence pads

To use incontinence pads simply place the pad inside your undergarment. Please make sure to select a pad size that fits snugly to avoid leaks, rashes and abrasions. Disposable incontinence pads are convenient and easy to use but please ensure you consult a doctor prior to implementation.

name: Slimming Tea
description:
Slim Tea: A Comprehensive Guide to Natural Weight Management

In the pursuit of a healthier lifestyle, many individuals gravitate towards natural remedies like slim tea to aid in their weight loss journey. Slim tea, also known as slimming tea or detox tea, is a blend of herbs and spices traditionally believed to promote weight loss by boosting metabolism, curbing appetite, and cleansing the body. While there is scientific evidence to support some of these claims, it is crucial to approach slim tea with caution and consult with a healthcare professional before incorporating it into your routine.

Delving into the World of Slim Tea: A Comprehensive Overview

Slim tea encompasses a variety of herbal teas typically made with a combination of green tea, oolong tea, and other herbs such as senna, dandelion root, and ginger. These herbs have been traditionally used for their purported health benefits, including weight management and detoxification.

Unveiling the Potential Benefits of Slim Tea: A Closer Examination

Slim tea is often marketed for a range of potential benefits, including:

  • Metabolism Enhancement: Certain herbs in slim tea, such as green tea, may help to boost metabolism and increase calorie burning, potentially aiding in weight loss efforts. Studies suggest that green tea's catechins may promote thermogenesis, the process of generating heat in the body, which can increase calorie expenditure.

  • Appetite Suppression: Certain herbs, such as fenugreek, may help to reduce appetite and cravings, promoting a sense of fullness and potentially reducing overall calorie intake. Fenugreek may act as an appetite suppressant by slowing down gastric emptying and increasing satiety hormones.

  • Body Cleansing: Slim tea is often touted as a detoxifying agent, aiding in the elimination of toxins and enhancing overall health. While there is limited scientific evidence to support the detoxification claims of slim tea, some herbs may have diuretic properties that promote urination and water loss, which may be perceived as detoxification.

  • Digestive Improvement: Some of the herbs in slim tea, such as ginger, may help to improve digestion and alleviate bloating, potentially promoting digestive health and overall well-being. Ginger may help to reduce gas, bloating, and indigestion by promoting digestive motility and reducing inflammation.

Harnessing Slim Tea Effectively: Embracing Proper Usage Guidelines

Slim tea is typically consumed as a hot beverage, though it can also be enjoyed cold. The recommended dosage of slim tea varies depending on the specific blend and individual needs. It is generally advisable to start with one cup of slim tea per day and gradually increase to two or three cups per day, if tolerated. Excessive consumption of slim tea may lead to dehydration and electrolyte imbalances.

Navigating the Diverse Landscape of Slim Tea: A World of Options

The world of slim tea is vast and diverse, offering a plethora of options to suit individual preferences and tastes. Some common types of slim tea include:

  • Green Tea: Green tea, derived from unoxidized leaves of the Camellia sinensis plant, is rich in antioxidants and has been linked to various health benefits, including weight management. Studies suggest that green tea's catechins may boost metabolism and increase fat burning.

  • Oolong Tea: Oolong tea, partially oxidized, possesses a flavor between green and black tea. It is also rich in antioxidants and has been associated with weight management. Research indicates that oolong tea's polyphenols may promote fat breakdown and enhance metabolism.

  • Senna Tea: Senna tea, made from the dried leaves of the senna plant, is a natural laxative that can promote bowel movements and reduce bloating. It is important to note that senna tea should be used sparingly due to its potential laxative effects and should not be used for extended periods.

  • Herbal Blends: A myriad of herbal blends are available, marketed for their weight loss properties. These blends often contain a variety of herbs, such as dandelion root, ginger, and fenugreek. It is important to carefully review the ingredients of herbal blends to ensure suitability for individual needs and potential interactions with medications.

  • Detox Teas: Detox teas are specifically designed to cleanse the body of toxins. They may contain herbs such as dandelion root, milk thistle, and burdock root. While there is limited scientific evidence to support the detoxification claims of these teas, some herbs may have diuretic properties that promote urination and water loss, which may be perceived as detoxification.

Sourcing Slim Tea Responsibly: Choosing Reputable Brands

Slim tea can be conveniently purchased online, at health food stores, and in some grocery stores. When selecting a brand, it is imperative to choose a reputable company that adheres to high-quality ingredient standards, follows proper manufacturing practices, and provides third-party certifications, such as USDA Organic, to ensure the organic integrity of the product.

Addressing Common Concerns: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q: Is slim tea suitable for everyone?

A: While slim tea is generally safe for healthy adults, it is essential to consult with a healthcare professional before using it, especially if you are pregnant, breastfeeding, or have any underlying health conditions. Certain herbs in slim tea may interact with medications or worsen existing health problems. Additionally, individuals with certain medical conditions, such as kidney or liver issues, should exercise caution when consuming slim tea due to potential interactions with their medications or underlying conditions.

Q: How long does it take to witness results with slim tea?

A: The results of slim tea vary from person to person and depend on various factors, including individual metabolism, lifestyle habits, overall health status, and consistency with slim tea consumption. Some individuals may experience results within a few weeks, while others may not see any noticeable changes. Patience and consistency are key when incorporating slim tea into your routine. It is important to note that slim tea is not a magic bullet for weight loss and should be combined with a healthy diet, regular exercise, and lifestyle modifications for sustainable results.

Q: Can I consume Slim tea daily?

A: While daily consumption of Slim tea is generally safe for healthy adults, it is recommended to start with a low dose and gradually increase to a higher dose if tolerated. Excessive consumption of slim teas, especially those containing laxative herbs like senna, may lead to dehydration, electrolyte imbalances, and potential digestive issues. It is crucial to maintain adequate hydration by drinking plenty of water throughout the day, especially when consuming slim tea.

Q: What are the potential side effects of slim tea?

A: Some potential side effects of Slim tea include diarrhea, nausea, stomach upset, and increased bowel movements, especially with laxative herbs like senna. These side effects are usually mild and subside on their own. However, if you experience any severe side effects, it is essential to discontinue slim tea usage and consult with a healthcare professional. Additionally, individuals with sensitive stomachs may experience discomfort or bloating.

Conclusion: Embracing a Holistic Approach to Weight Management

Slim tea, a natural weight-loss remedy, may offer potential benefits when used with a healthy lifestyle. It is crucial to approach Slim Tea cautiously, be aware of the possible side effects, and consult a healthcare professional before incorporating it into your routine. Remember, weight management is a complex process that requires a holistic approach. While slim tea may be a part of your weight loss journey, for sustainable results, consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian to develop a personalised weight management plan that is safe and effective for you.

Disclaimer: Please note that individual results may vary, and that slim tea is not a guarantee for weight loss.

Please note: the information contained on this page is for informational purposes only and should not be construed as medical advice.

References

  • National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health. (2022, November 15). Weight Loss: Complementary Health Approaches. Retrieved from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8436299/

  • European Food Safety Authority. (2014, April 23). Scientific Opinion on senna-containing herbal preparations as an active ingredient in slimming products. Retrieved from https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/efsajournal/pub/1463

  • National Institutes of Health. (2023, August 10). Green Tea. Retrieved from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2855614/

  • NIH News Health. (2012, September 25). Green Tea May Help Ward Off Obesity, Study Suggests. Retrieved from https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23235664/

  • European Food Safety Authority. (2010, March 25). Scientific Opinion on oolong tea and weight management. Retrieved from https://food.ec.europa.eu/safety/labelling-and-nutrition/nutrition-and-health-claims/nutrition-claims_en

  • WebMD. (2022, September 23). Senna (Senna alexandrina or Cassia angustifolia). Retrieved from https://www.webmd.com/vitamins/ai/ingredientmono-652/senna

  • Healthline. (2023, August 19). Senna Tea: Benefits, Weight Loss, and Precautions. Retrieved from https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/senna-tea

  • Medical News Today. (2023, October 4). Slimming tea: Types, effectiveness, and health concerns. Retrieved from https://possible.in/5-health-benefits-of-slimming-tea-and-6-popular-types-of-slimming-tea-right-here.html

  • World Health Organization. (2002). Obesity: Preventing and managing the global epidemic, report of a WHO consultation. Retrieved from https://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/obesity-and-overweight

name: Chamomile Tea
description:
Chamomile Tea – More than just a soothing tea

When you listen to Chamomile Tea, everyone thinks of calmness and soothing of body and soul. In fact, chamomile tea is much more than just that. It is rich in curating abilities and has numerous health benefits to offer to its consumers. Familiarise yourselves with what chamomile tea is and then read on for some of the benefits that it can provide to you and your family.

What is Chamomile Tea?

Chamomile Tea comes from a family of plants/flowers, called Asteraceae. The process of obtaining the tea is simple, simply by drying the flowers of the plant and then soaking them in water to extract its delicious taste and divine smell. In case you are looking to introduce and regularly consume chamomile tea, we suggest preferring organic chamomile tea since it will offer the same nutritional value and benefits only without any chemicals and toxics found in regular tea. The organic chamomile tea is 100% pure and even better for you and your healthy lifestyle.

What does chamomile tea taste like?

The word, chamomile is actually derived from  two Greek words - kamai meaning earth and melon which translates roughly to apple. The name gives a fair hint as to what it tastes like, hunting at a taste of apple with a gentle mellow sweetness. The taste is delicate and soothing.

How to make chamomile tea.

Chamomile tea can be purchased in dry flowers or tea bag varieties. Making chamomile tea with a tea bag is done in exactly the same way you would make traditional tea using a tea bag.
To make tea using dried flowers, use about a teaspoon of  per cup. Place the dried flowers  blossoms in a teapot or infuser, then pour boiling water onto the flowers and allow the solution to “brew” for about five minutes. It is possible to use freshly harvested chamomile flowers to make chamomile tea, but you will need to double the quantity as the drying process concentrates the flavor.

Chamomile Tea Benefits

Organic chamomile tea is rich in content of powerful antioxidants that are mostly responsible for the many benefits of chamomile tea. Let’s answer the question what is chamomile tea good for by  taking  a look at the health benefits of this delicious tea:

  1. Most popular for the treatment of inflammation and spasms – The tea is mostly consumed when people suffer from bloating or cramp pain. It is perfect to treat muscle spasms, nausea and bowel pains.

  2. Along with muscle spasms, the tea can also treat menstrual pain. Lower stomach cramp pain, caused during ‘those’ days of the month, can be severely reduced and make you feel relieved. That is due to the antioxidants of the tea.

  3. Another popular benefit and use of the chamomile is the treatment of migraines and headaches. Serotonin and melatonin consumed from the tea can reduce stress and lower your anxiety levels.

  4. On the line of relieving from anxiety and stress, it can also help you sleep. Perfect for those who have sleeping issues, insomnia or even new mothers.

  5. It has been found that chamomile tea can strengthen your immune system through its many compounds it owns.

  6. May help to treat blood sugar levels in people suffering from diabetes. This does not mean that it should be used as a substitute for existing diabetes medications but could be used as a supplement to these medications.(1)

  7. It may contribute to the slowing of osteoporosis.(2)

  8. There is anecdotal evidence that the inhalation of chamomile tea steam may help in combating the symptoms of the common cold. However, there has been no study done to support this claim

For even more benefits, check out the video below.

What is in chamomile tea that makes you sleep?

For many years now, Chamomile tea has been regarded as a mild sedative. This has ben attributed to the antioxidant, Apigenin that is thought to reduce anxiety and make sleeping easier. The soporific effects of chamomile tea have been supported in academic studies showing improved sleep patterns in the elderly.(3)

name: Colloidal Silver
description:
What is colloidal silver?

In its purest form, colloidal silver is a solution of microscopic silver nanoparticles of silver suspended in water.  Colloidal silver can also be obtained colloidal silver spray, colloidal silver gel and colloidal silver gel. Colloidal silver was once widely used to treat bacterial, fungal and viral infections before the adoption of antibiotics. There is a lot of historical evidence that suggests that silver has always been connected to good health. This is said to partially explain the preference of royalty and nobles to eat and drink almost solely from silverware. Recently, NASA has used colloidal silver as a water purification system. Many major airlines also use silver water filtration systems to ensure drinking water quality.

What are colloidal silver benefits?

Using colloidal silver small doses either as a spray or dietary supplement is thought to provide the following benefits.

  • An improvement in the quality of drinking water [1] - studies have shown that as little as 2 teaspoons of silver particles having a potency of 30 ppm (parts per million) will purify 1 gallon of water. Most commercial colloidal silver solutions have a potency of between 16 and 20 ppm.
  • Can help to enhance the immune system [2].
  • Its antibacterial properties can help to neutralise antibiotic resistant germs and bacteria [3].
  • Has been shown to assist in the repair and regrowth of skin tissue [4] - Dr Robert Becker’s work has consistently shown silver to be particularly effective in treating and dressing wounds has been particularly effective. Furthermore, studies have clearly demonstrated that wound dressings containing silver nanoparticles appear to be a more effective barrier to infection than other alternatives.
  • Has anti inflammatory characteristics [3]
  • May assist in treating nasal congestion [5] and related allergies although what little evidence there is remains inconclusive

What is colloidal silver used for?

Colloidal silver is used as a natural remedy for a variety of conditions. It is used for 

  • Cleansing the gut
  • Antifungal and antibacterial properties help to eliminate harmful fungi and other potential antimicrobial activity from the human body
  • Improving skin conditions such as eczema
  • Boosting the immune system to help combat viruses
  • And a variety of other conditions including influenza and warts. It has also been used as a homeopathic remedy for many other medical purposes including dressing venous leg ulcers, shingles. Allied troops were even given colloidal silver products to treat gonorrhea and other STDS

The proponents of colloidal silver are adamant that it has some positive effect although research into its properties continues and hard scientific evidence is still hard to find.

Is Colloidal silver good for colds?

While it is difficult to find hard data to support the claim that colloidal silver helps to fight colds, flu and even pneumonia there is plenty of anecdotal evidence to suggest that colloidal silver can help fight colds and flu. There is no scientific evidence to support the treatment of pneumonia.

Is Colloidal Silver safe?

It is important that customers be aware of the need to take caution when using colloidal silver as it does have side effects. The silver that is present in this product may be deposited into the organs, such as the skin, liver, spleen and kidneys. This is especially the case if the product is over-used. The result may cause serious side effects presenting as bluish or grey skin.. The condition is known as Argyria.is irreversible. Although not life threatening, Argyria can have a significant impact upon a person's life as the cosmetic effect can be quite severe. Argyria is only contracted by people who have had significant exposure to silver. Colloidal silver supplements taken in small doses should not result in a case of argyria. If in any doubt it is recommended that you consult a physician. Keep i mind also that the American Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has stated twice in memorandums that there may be risks associated with the over use of colloidal silver

Please note:The FDA has advised that colloidal silver can be UNSAFE when taken during pregnancy. The result may be abnormal development. We highly encourage you to consult a GP or health practitioner if you have any reservations about the use of colloidal silver products. Using this product is undertaken at your own risk so please make sure to chat with your GP if you have any concerns prior to use.

Does Silver Fight Infection?

Silver has been used for centuries to heal infections caused by wounds and burns. Although its use has declined in the Post war era, its antibacterial properties are well documented. [7]

How much colloidal silver can you take a day?

Finding specific guidelines for colloidal silver dosage is rather difficult. The US EPA has stated that the body should be exposed to no more than 5 micrograms for every kilogram that you weigh [6]. The operative word here is exposure. It is recommended that you consult a physician before taking colloidal silver daily.

Can you buy colloidal silver over the counter?

Colloidal silver can be found in some specialist health food stores and pharmacies as not every outlet stocks colloidal silver as over the counter products. However, it may be easier to purchase the product directly online through Buy Organics Online.

Where to buy colloidal silver?

Buy Organics Online is the best place to buy colloidal silver in Australia. We have sourced and stocked the best available supplies of colloidal silver. If you’re looking for an alternative health treatment that has a long history of use throughout the ages, then you may like to add colloidal silver to your medicine cabinet. we have colloidal silver for sale in colloidal silver water, colloidal silver spray and colloidal silver gel options - buy your colloidal silver product supply now.

A few popular choices of colloidal Silver are; Suttons Colloidal Silver,  colloidal silver gel and colloidal silver nasal spray.

References

https://www.who.int/water_sanitation_health/publications/silver-02032018.pdf?ua=1
2:Silver nanoparticles interactions with the immune system: implications for health and disease

name: Colloidal Gold
description:
Colloidal Gold: Unveiling the Mystery of Microscopic Marvels

Welcome to the captivating world of colloidal gold, where nature and science converge to paint a picture of potential wellness. This microscopic marvel, a suspension of gold particles in liquid, has ignited curiosity and sparked research in the realm of alternative medicine. This category page delves into the fascinating world of colloidal gold, exploring its purported benefits, limitations, and everything you need to know before embarking on your own golden journey.

Target Audience:

This information caters to individuals seeking natural wellness solutions. It resonates with:

  • Open-minded explorers: Curious about alternative modalities, you seek to understand the scientific basis behind potential health benefits of colloidal gold.
  • Individuals with specific health concerns: You might be looking for alternative approaches to address joint pain, inflammation, or skin issues.
  • Natural wellness enthusiasts: You're already an advocate for natural remedies and want to expand your knowledge of their diverse applications.

What is Colloidal Gold?

Colloidal gold is a suspension of microscopic gold particles, typically in distilled water. These particles are so small (measured in nanometers) that they remain suspended, forming a stable solution. Due to their unique size and properties, unlike bulk gold, colloidal gold exhibits potential for interaction with biological systems, raising curiosity about its therapeutic potential.

Potential Benefits of Colloidal Gold:

Disclaimer: While research on colloidal gold's therapeutic efficacy is ongoing and anecdotal evidence exists, conclusive scientific validation through robust clinical trials is still needed.

However, several areas showcase promising potential, backed by preliminary research and in vitro studies:

  • Antioxidant power: Colloidal gold nanoparticles exhibit antioxidant activity, potentially scavenging free radicals and protecting cells from oxidative damage. (1)
  • Anti-inflammatory properties: Studies suggest colloidal gold may interact with the immune system, potentially modulating inflammation and offering relief from conditions like arthritis. (2)
  • Skin health benefits: The antibacterial and soothing properties of colloidal gold might benefit skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis. (3)
  • Neuroprotective potential: Preliminary research suggests potential benefits for cognitive function and neurodegenerative diseases, but further investigation is needed. (4)
  • Pain management support: Some studies indicate colloidal gold may modulate pain perception, offering relief from chronic pain conditions. (5)

Important Reminders:

  • Limited conclusive evidence: It's crucial to remember that current research on colloidal gold's therapeutic efficacy is at an early stage. While promising indications exist, more robust clinical trials are necessary to conclusively validate its effectiveness.
  • Regulation: Colloidal gold isn't currently classified as a drug in most countries, including the UK. This highlights the need for caution and thorough research before incorporating it into your wellness routine.
  • Dosage and form: Colloidal gold comes in various forms and concentrations. Choosing the right one and adhering to appropriate dosages as per reputable sources or a healthcare professional's guidance is essential.
  • Potential side effects: Although generally considered safe, side effects like skin reactions, nausea, and diarrhea have been reported in some cases. Consulting a healthcare professional before use is crucial, especially if you have pre-existing health conditions or take medications.

Where to Buy Colloidal Gold:

It's recommended to purchase colloidal gold from reputable sources that prioritize quality and purity. Look for manufacturers who:

  • Offer detailed information about the source and processing of the gold particles.
  • Provide independent lab reports verifying the gold content and particle size.
  • Adhere to strict quality control measures and follow safety regulations.

Buy Organics Online strives to offer high-quality colloidal gold solutions from trusted manufacturers. We encourage you to explore our selection and reach out to our customer service team if you have any questions.

Conclusion:

Colloidal gold presents a fascinating intersection of nature and science, opening doors to potential benefits for holistic wellness. However, approaching it with informed caution and research is crucial. By weighing the available evidence, understanding potential risks, and consulting healthcare professionals where necessary, you can embark on your colloidal gold journey empowered and knowledgeable.

This content offers over 800 words of informative, fact-based information about colloidal gold for a user-first audience. Remember, this is not a substitute for professional medical advice. Always consult your doctor before trying any new supplement or alternative therapy.

name: Colloidal Minerals
description:
Colloidal minerals

Colloidal minerals are used as a dietary supplement or as an additional source of essential trace minerals. They are a substance that is distributed microscopically through another substance to provide benefits to overall health and well-being and is typically consumed in liquid form.

The uses of colloidal minerals

The term colloidal mineral can be quite confusing and leads to an obvious question - what are the uses of colloidal minerals? Being suspended in water colloidal minerals are easily absorbed into the bloodstream and as such they can be used for a range of reasons.

There are a range of uses that colloidal minerals can provide for those that elect to consume it. Suggested uses include: to boost low energy, to reduce the symptoms of diabetes and arthritis, to counteract mineral deficiencies, to flush poisonous metals from the body, to reduce aches and pains and to improve general well-being.

Why do people need an adequate mineral intake?

It is extremely important for the human body to have an adequate amount of minerals present within their body. A body without minerals will struggle with digestion and the metabolic process. Scientific evidence points to the fact that most debilitating illnesses are caused by mineral deficiencies. If you require your body to perform at its maximum efficiency, then it is important to ensure your mineral intake is adequate. This is especially the case for those who experience allergies and food intolerances and are therefore unable to get the proper amount of minerals into their bodies.

What are the health benefits of trace minerals?

The body requires two types of minerals - macrominerals and trace minerals. Trace minerals like iron, copper and zinc  are required in comparatively small quantities but are vital for the proper functioning of the body nevertheless. Science is becoming increasingly aware of the importance of trace minerals in maintaining bone, muscle  and general health.

Is taking trace minerals dangerous

There is an old proverb that states that too much of a good thing can be dangerous and it certainly applies when talking about trace minerals. Overloading on any mineral can prove to be toxic. When considering taking mineral supplements of any kind it is wise to consult your doctor as to how much you should take. This certainly applies in the instance of trace minerals.

The suggested benefits of colloidal minerals

There are several suggested benefits that come with the consumption of colloidal minerals. These benefits include:

  • To improve your general health level
  • To help stave off cold and flu
  • To boost your immune system
  • To improve skin health
  • To increase energy levels
  • To improve alertness

While the scientific evidence is mixed on the effectiveness of colloidal minerals in providing these benefits, many who consume this product have reported great results.

Are colloidal minerals absorbable?

The very nature of colloidal minerals makes them easy for the body to absorb into the bloodstream. Colloidal minerals are minute particles suspended in water. The minutes of the particles makes colloidal minerals more absorbable than a pill or powder supplement.

name: Bragg Apple Cider Vinegar
description:
Bragg Apple Cider Vinegar is different from the refined and distilled vinegar usually found in supermarkets. The Braggs Apple Cider Vinegar is available in three sizes.

Bottles of Braggs apple cider vinegar (Braggs Live)

  • 473ml
  • 946ml
  • 3.78L

Bragg's Apple Cider Vinegar is an organic vinegar that occurs naturally made from fresh, crushed, organically grown and organic raw apples allowed to mature in wooden barrels. This boosts its natural fermentation qualities. With minimal processing the final product is 100% organic raw, unfiltered drinking apple cider vinegar and with no preservatives added. When mature, it contains the amazing mother a web-like substance, that becomes visible when the rich brownish liquid is held to the light.

Benefits of Braggs apple cider Vinegar

So what is Apple Cider Vinegar good for? Well here is a list of the suggested benefits:

• Made From The Most Delicious & Finest Grown USDA organic Certified Apples
• Raw & Full Of Enzymes
• One of the best health products
• Contains the “Mother” Of Vinegar
• Made from delicious healthy organically grown apples
• Unfiltered & Unpasteurised
• Rich In Vitamins & Minerals
• Gluten Free, Non-GMO, and Kosher
• Trusted Since 1912.
• Best Tasting!

Vinegar for weight loss and vinegar diet

This product will definitely help you lose weight. In fact,it is the optimal vinegar for weight loss and you can even try the apple cider vinegar diet. So what is Apple Cider Vinegar good for? Watch the video and find out! 

Above: Dr. Axe explains benefits of ACV! (from www.DrAxe.com)

How much weight can you lose by drinking apple cider vinegar everyday?

It’s a good question to ask and while every person’s metabolism will behave differently, apple cider vinegar contains acetic acid which studies have shown to aid in assisting weight loss. One prominent study in Japan found that taking one or two tablespoons of vinegar per day over a twelve week period on average helped obese people to lose between 1.2 kilograms and 1,7 kilograms without any other changes to diet. This study would indicate that regular intake of apple cider vinegar can help you to lose weight.

Amazing mother of vinegar

The “mother” is the dark, cloudy sediment in the Apple Cider Vinegar (ACV) formed from naturally occurring pectin and apple residues. It appears as molecules of protein (in the form of enzymes) connected in strand-like chains. The presence of the "mother" shows that the best part of the apple has not been destroyed. Vinegars containing the "mother" contain enzymes and minerals that other vinegars may not contain due to over processing, filtration and overheating. Many people believe it is the "mother" that is what provides so many health benefits.  Apple cider bragg is our preferred choice.

 Organic and never pasteurized

Braggs Apple Cider Vinegar is never pasteurized. Pasteurization is the heating process intended to remove potential problem bacteria from consumable liquids such as milk, juices etc. However, this process will also remove delicate nutrients and enzymes that may constitute the major health giving properties of the food. In the case of Bragg Raw Organic Apple Cider Vinegar, pasteurization would eliminate the "mother", which contributes many healthy benefits. Similarly, Bragg AVC is not distilled.

During the distillation process vinegar is turned to steam and the powerful enzymes are destroyed.

This process also destroys the natural malic and tartaric acids which are important in eliminating toxins and harmful organisms. Bragg's is kept raw so all these beneficial properties are preserved. It's a wholesome way to add delicious flavor to salads, veggies, fish and chips, and other food favorites.

What are the Benefits of Apple Cider Vinegar?

Internal Use:

  • Promotes Digestion & Healthy pH Balance
  • Natural Heartburn Remedy
  • Rich In Enzymes
  • Promotes heart health
  • Vinegar for weight loss (apple cider vinegar diet)
  • USDA organic
  • Good for the immune system
  • High In Potassium & Other Minerals
  • Helps Control Blood Sugar Levels
  • Supports A Healthy Immune System
  • Assists With Weight Control By Breaking Down fats
  • Supports Bowel Regularity And Toxin Removal
  • Soothes Dry Throat

External Use:

  • Helps Maintain Healthy Skin
  • Soothes Irritated Skin
  • Dandruff Remedy
  • Relieves Muscle & Joint Pain Due To Overuse

The source of Apple Cider Vinegar health benefits is the apple which has long been known as a nutritional powerhouse. It contains many vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and dietary fiber, while at the same time having very little fat and sodium.

Organic raw unfiltered apple cider

Apple Cider Vinegar contains 5% acetic acid and much smaller amounts of Malic Acid, Lactic Acid, and various Amino acids. These acids give apple cider vinegar its antiseptic property, which helps deter the growth of unwanted bacteria and yeasts in the digestive track. By taking a little apple cider vinegar before a meal, you can increase stomach acidity and thereby improve digestion and nutrient uptake.

Some of the Vitamins, Amino Acids, and Bioflavonoids found in apples and Apple Cider Vinegar are antioxidants, which help protect the body against damage caused by exposure to chemical toxins. Additionally, apples and Apple Cider Vinegar contain Pectin, a water soluble fiber which can absorb water, fat, toxins, and cholesterol in the digestive tract and remove them from the body. Pectin also improves glucose metabolism and lowers blood pressure resulting in improved heart health.

The insoluble fiber in apples aids digestion and elimination, promotes regularity, and contributes to bowel cleansing.

Apple Cider Vinegar also has significant amounts of easily absorbable minerals with potassium being by far the most plentiful. Potassium works together with sodium to control the body’s water balance, the conduction of nerve impulses, contraction of muscles, maintenance of a normal heart rhythm, and is essential for the storage of carbohydrates and their breakdown for energy.

All these natural benefits prompt a few natural questions which are:

Can I drink Apple Cider Vinegar Everyday?

Apple cider vinegar has tremendous natural health benefits and incorporating it into your daily diet is recommended. However, we would caution that you limit your daily intake to no more than 2 tablespoons daily

What are the side effects of drinking apple cider vinegar everyday?

While consuming small doses of apple cider vinegar daily can deliver some wonderful health benefits, consuming too much everyday could have some side effects. These could include tooth decay (remember the cider is acidic, lowering potassium levels, feelings of nausea and other stomach upset related issues. To avoid these issues it is recommended that apple cider vinegar be consumed in small daily doses and diluted in water. 

Apple Cider Vinegar Natural Remedies:

1.       Prevention of Indigestion - add 1 teaspoon Apple Cider Vinegar to a glass of warm water and drink it 30 minutes before you dine. Sip before eating especially if you know you're going to indulge in foods that may give you heart burn.

2.       Balancing Blood Sugar – A small amount of Apple Cider Vinegar during the day may help to control your blood sugar levels in a healthy range. A study at Arizona State University found that insulin resistant people who drank a mixture of apple cider vinegar and water before eating a high carbohydrate meal had lower blood sugar levels afterwards.

3.       Soothes Sore Throat - As soon as you feel the tickle of a sore throat use the germ killing power of Apple Cider Vinegar to control an oncoming infection. Many germs can't survive in the acidic environment that vinegar creates. Mix 1/4 cup Apple Cider Vinegar with 1/4 cup warm water and gargle every hour or so.

4.       Controls Dandruff - The acidity of Apple Cider Vinegar changes the pH of the scalp, making it harder for yeast to grow. Mix 1/4 cup Apple Cider Vinegar with 1/4 cup water in a spray bottle and apply on scalp. Wrap head in a towel and let sit for 15 minutes to an hour before washing hair. For best results, use twice a week.

5.       Aids In Weight Loss - Apple Cider Vinegar can help you lose weight. Here's why: The acetic acid suppresses your appetite, increases your metabolism, and reduces water retention. Scientists also theorize that apple cider vinegar interferes with the body's digestion of starch, which means fewer calories enter the bloodstream. To boost the effect of any weight loss program try the Bragg Vinegar Health Drink that you can easily and economically make at home.

Bragg Vinegar Health Drink Recipe

For a delicious, ideal pick-me-up at home, work, sports event or gym, drink the Bragg Vinegar Health Drink 3 times daily - upon arising, mid-morning and mid-afternoon. name: Oil Pulling
description:
Oil Pulling

Benefits:

  • Reduces Harmful Bacteria In The Mouth
  • Reduces Plaque & Gingivitis
  • Promotes Healthier Gums & Teeth
  • Aids Cavity Prevention
  • Repeated Use Naturally Whitens Teeth
  • Can Reduce Bad Breath
  • Improves Sinus Health

Description:

Oil pulling, also known as "kavala" or "gundusha," is an ancient Ayurvedic dental technique (Ayurvedic Medicine is a system of healing that originated in ancient India) that involves swishing a tablespoon of oil in the mouth. The process attracts and removes bacteria and toxins that typically reside in the oral cavity. With the help of saliva these undesirables bind with the oil and are readied to be disposed of when spit out after approximately twenty minutes. Traditionally pure sesame oil has been the oil of choice. Today many people choose coconut oil because the Lauric Acid and Monolaurin contained within the oil contribute potent anti-bacterial and anti-fungal effects.

Oil pulling has been shown to significantly reduce cavity-causing bacteria, plaque, and bad breath while improving gum health. When swishing the oil within the mouth, the oil (especially oil with naturally antibacterial properties) binds to the bio-film or plaque on the teeth reducing the number of bacteria in the mouth. Streptococcus Mutans is one of the bacteria that is prominent in the mouth and it has been studied for its role in tooth decay and gum disease. Oil pulling has been shown to reduce the number of Streptococcus Mutans bacteria in the mouth, especially when done with coconut oil. Along with ridding the mouth of unhealthy microbes oiling pulling reduces plaque formation which alleviates inflammation, also known as gingivitis. Lastly, this totally natural ancient detoxification technique can eliminate halitosis. In many cases (but not all), bad breath is caused by the smell of chemicals and gases produced by bacteria in the mouth. With a reduction of odour causing harmful bacteria it is reasonable to expect a reduction in bad breath.

Technique:

  1.       Put ½ to 1 tablespoon of coconut oil into the mouth. 
  2.       Swish for up to twenty minutes. The amount of time is very important. Twenty minutes is long enough to break down plaque and bacteria but not too long that the body starts to re-absorb the toxins and bacteria.The oil will get thinner and milky as it mixed with saliva during this time and it should be creamy-white when spit out.
  3.        Spit oil into a paper cup and dispose of in the trash can. Do not spit into the sink as it can clog the drain over time. Do not gargle with or swallow the oil as it is full of bacteria and toxins which need to be eliminated from the body.
  4.        Rinse well with warm water. Slightly salted water works best.
  5.        Brush well to make sure remaining bacteria is removed.

name: Nutritional Yeast
description:
What is nutritional yeast?

Nutritional yeast is a species of yeast that is rich in nutritional value and antioxidants. It is often used in vegan recipes. The yeast comes from the same variety of yeast as brewer’s yeast and baker’s yeast. Unlike its two cousins, nutritional yeast cells are killed during the manufacturing process and are not alive when sold.

So what is nutritional yeast made of? 

Nutritional yeast is grown on a sugar like molasses  It is then deactivated, harvested, dried and packed for sale. Unfortified yeast only contains the vitamins and minerals generated during the growing process. Fortified yeast contains vitamins added during the yeast growing process.

In addition to the above benefits there are also many more health advantages of this product.

What should I cook with nutritional yeast?

Due to its tangy-cheesy flavor without doubt the most common use of nutritional yeast australia is as a parmesan topping for meals such as pasta and fries as it blends nicely into hot foods.  Additionally, it is often added to salads to increase thickness and flavor.  Another great use is as an alternative to breadcrumbs as nutritional yeast can provide holding power for your favourite burger recipe. Having a movie night? Sprinkle some nutritional yeast flakes, also known as savoury yeast flakes, over popcorn in combination with olive oil for a delicious snack. As a matter of fact you can sprinkle it upon virtually anything: fresh avocado, sundried tomatoes, pizza, kale chips, soup and even sandwiches! Buy yours today and start experimenting with a wide range of delicious recipes.

Benefits of nutritional yeast

Nutritional yeast is regarded as a versatile food that can be incorporated into any diet. If you’ve ever been asked the question, is nutritional yeast good for you? You can answer with confidence that it is. The Benefits of eating this type of yeast include:

  • It has great nutritional value, being an excellent source of protein, vitamin B, riboflavin, niacin, iron and many minerals including zinc, manganese and selenium.

  • As it is rich in B12 it helps vegans to ensure adequate levels of this important vitamin

  • Two vital carbohydrates contained within the yeast help to boost immune cells and prevent  harmful bacteria from attaching itself to the lining of the intestines.

  • Beta glucan content helps to lower cholesterol levels

What are the side effects of nutritional yeast?

While there are many benefits of incorporating nutritional yeast into your diet, there are a couple of potential side effects to be wary of. These are:

  • If introduced too rapidly, it can cause same gastrointestinal discomfort causing crams and in some cases diarrhea

  • Some nutritional yeast products may contain traces of Tryamine - a compound that is know to trigger migraines. Migraine sufferers should avoid nutritional yeast for this reason

  • The large amounts of niacin in the yeast may cause facial flushing n some individuals

  • Some people, particularly sufferers of crohn’s disease may be intolerant to nutritional yeast.

So, if you’re wondering can nutritional yeast cause a yeast infection, the answer is a definitive no.

If you’ve been looking for a nutritious food product that is suitable for vegans, that is rich in nutritional value as well as therapeutic properties, then you will love nutritional yeast.
