name: Brewer's Yeast
description:
What is Brewers Yeast?

Brewer’s yeast is commonly used in the making of beer and bread. It is also regarded as a nutritional supplement. Brewers yeast is bitter to taste and is obtained from a one-celled fungus with the scientific name Saccharomyces cerevisiae. As the name suggests, it is commonly combined with malt, hops, and water to brew beer.

The yeast has long been thought to have natural remedy properties, with the founder of Western medicine, Hippocrates, often recommending it for its diuretic properties. Later, in the middle ages, monks caring for lepers took brewers yeast to ward off catching the disease. In the twentieth century, it was given to soldiers in both world wars as a nutritional supplement and has often been prescribed to mothers to help fight the effects of fatigue.

Saccharomyces cerevisiae is known to lower cholesterol, boost the immune system and reduce inflammation.

What is the difference between brewers yeast and regular yeast?

Brewer's Yeast Baker's (Regular) Yeast
Purpose: Used in brewing alcoholic beverages, especially beer. Purpose: Used in baking to ferment sugars and make dough rise.
Taste: Bitter, especially as a byproduct of the beer-making process. Taste: mild, yeasty aroma when activated.
Form: Available in liquid, dried flakes, or powder. Form: Found in active dry, fresh, and instant forms.
Nutritional Content: Rich in B-vitamins (except B12), protein, and minerals like chromium. Nutritional Content: Contains some B-vitamins and minerals.
Byproduct: Produces alcohol during fermentation. Byproduct: Produces minimal alcohol which evaporates during baking.

The term brewer's yeast is applied to

  • The active yeast used in the brewing and fermentation process
  • The leftover S. cerevisiae from the brewing process, this form of yeast has a very bitter flavour.
  • Yeast that is not a product of beer but has grown on grain.

One of Australia’s iconic foods - vegemite is made from leftover brewer’s yeast extract. Organic brewer's yeast is made without the use of chemicals.

Brewer's yeast is closely related to nutritional yeast although there are some differences between the two. Both yeasts are grown from S. cerevisiae, however while brewer's yeast is produced through grain fermentation, nutritional yeast is a type of yeast that has been grown specifically as a dietary supplement. Nutritional yeast is a species of yeast that is often fortified with folic acid and vitamin B12.

Brewers yeast is not the same as baker's yeast but can be used for baking purposes. However, due to its somewhat bitter taste it is not recommended for baked goods that are intended to taste sweet.

recommended for baked goods that are intended to taste sweet.

Brewer's yeast in Australia can be found in powder, liquid, tablets or flakes. It can be added to meals in small quantities or taken separately. 

The yeast is a source of vitamin B, chromium and its use is considered a digestion aid. The microflora within the yeast help to keep the digestive tract functioning properly. Advocates claim that it helps to keep you feeling young and healthy while also assisting with skin complexion. Some low level small clinical trials have suggested that brewers yeast has some surprising health benefits. The benefits demonstrated in these studies are -:

  • A believed improvement in overall gut health.[1] The s. cerevisiae is instrumental in supporting healthy gut bacteria while clearing away bad bacteria. It is also said to help prevent infections and reduce gut inflammation.
  • There is some evidence to show that s. cerevisiae also may help reduce the incidence of diarrhea in some cases[2].
  • It contains glucose tolerance factor (GTF), a compound that is rich in chromium and is known to decrease blood sugar[3].It has been demonstrated to improve the good cholesterol levels while helping reduce the bad cholesterol levels.
  • S. cerevisiae contains natural nucleotides which are known to help improve endurance and reduce fatigue.
  • It is a good source of lithium an ingredient that may help in improving mood.[4]
  • There is some evidence to indicate that it may help to reduce weight [5]- although the evidence is by no means conclusive. Yeast derived from s. cerevisiae is known to play a part in reducing hunger as well as decreasing fat production by reducing liver enzyme activity which is required to produce fatty acids.
  • May improve heart health by improving cholesterol and reducing blood pressure. [3] Before opting to use brewer's yeast to treat cholesterol or blood pressure symptoms, it is advisable to seek medical advice.
  • S. cerevisiae Contains a form of vitamin B3 that has been linked to improving cognition. More studies need to be done to confirm whether this ingredient has a particular effect on cognitive functions.[6]
  • Some small studies have demonstrated that it may help to relieve premenstrual pain.[7]
  • Initial studies have shown that the range of b complex vitamins and beta glucans contained in S. cerevisiae help to improve the immune system.[8]
  • This rich source of b vitamins has also been linked to improved hearing[9], the prevention of major birth defects (folate content)[10] and perhaps even slowing the effects of ageing.[11]

Can brewers yeast be harmful?

While the potential benefits of S. cerevisiae are numerous and its healthy ingredients of chromium,essential amino acids and vitamin B12 in particular make it appealing, there are some potential side effects associated with it. In particular these side effects are most likely to manifest in people suffering from digestive diseases, celiac disease, mould allergies and kidney stones. It is highly recommended that if you suffer from any of these problems or any other medical condition that you seek professional medical advice prior to taking any form of S. cerevisiae.

Is there a difference between brewers yeast and regular yeast?

The main difference between baking yeast and brewer's yeast is that brewer's yeast produces alcohol and baker's yeast produced virtually no alcohol at all.

name: Gluten Free Oats
description:
There are very few options healthier than gluten free oats to get you up and going in the morning. Oats are a whole-grain food that are most frequently consumed at breakfast. This is usually consumed as oatmeal, which is made by boiling oats in water, milk or a milk alternative. You can use gluten free oats to make a delicious gluten free porridge - remembering of course that all oats contain some levels of gluten.

In addition, oats are often added into muffins, health food bars, cookies and other baked foods.

Organic oats gluten free have been grown without the aid of potentially harmful chemicals used in conventional farming and processing methods.

Are oats gluten free?

Many consumers wonder whether oats are gluten free? Despite conflicting information, particularly from overseas the short answer is no, oats are not gluten-free. Most oat products are processed alongside other gluten containing grains such as wheat, rye and barley. Therefore it is highly likely that many oat products that are called gluten free contain traces of other gluten containing grains due to cross contamination. It is impossible to find 100% gluten-free oats, but there are uncontaminated oats processed in facilities to avoid cross-contamination.  These are the best options for sourcing lower-gluten oats.

*Where oats are marketed as gluten-free and uncontaminated with wheat, rye or barley, they may still not be suitable for those who suffer from Coeliac disease. This is due to a protein called Avenin, and whilst they are considered naturally gluten free this protein is only safe for around 95% of people with Coeliac disease. In the US, UK & Europe, oats that are labelled gluten free are considered safe for people with Coeliac disease and are classified as gluten free if they contain less than 20 milligrams of gluten per kilogram. Uncontaminated oats such as GF Oats are celebrated as a super nutritious food for people wanting low gluten and suffering with Coeliac disease in these particular locations. Every batch of GF Oats is tested to ensure they are below the thresholds applied for US, UK & European markets. In Australia, different standards apply to be certified as gluten free . Products with any detectable gluten cannot be labelled gluten-free. They can be called wheat-free. 

** Those who suffer from Coeliac disease or are concerned may contain gluten. 

 

Which brand of oats are gluten free?

It is very difficult to claim that any oats are 100% free of gluten. However, the ones that are uncontaminated oats, such as GF Oats are celebrated as being gluten-free and a super nutritious food for people suffering from Coeliac disease in these areas. Every batch of GF Oats is tested to ensure they are below thresholds applied for US, UK & European standards. In Australia, different standards apply. Products with any detectable gluten cannot be called gluten-free. They can be called low-gluten or wheat-free. 

Can Oats be labelled gluten-free in Australia?

How is it possible that a country like Australia can have fewer gluten-free products? The answer lies in part with the strict standards. The ASDA standards prevent oats from being labelled gluten-free. What other countries call gluten-free oats can only be labelled as wheat-free or uncontaminated oats. The strict controls are understandable as the risk factors associated with coeliac disease are quite severe.

Are gluten-free foods good for you?

Some considerable benefits come with the consumption of a single batch of gluten-free oats at breakfast time. These benefits include:

  • They are a well-balanced, nutritious choice. Oats are a great source of carbs and fibre and have more protein than most grains.
  • The presence of beta-glucan can lead to a full feeling. The presence of beta-glucan can help consumers to feel full and satisfied following the consumption of oatmeal. This can lead to less likelihood of diving back into the cupboards and over-consuming snacks throughout the day.
  • Oats are full of vitamins, minerals and a healthy dose of fibre.

Gluten free oats Australia

At Buy Organics Online we are pleased to supply uncontaminated organic oats. To start your day off the right way consider purchasing this and other great organic breakfast food products today!

Chicory coffee comes from the chicory root, hence it s sometimes referred to as chicory root coffee. The root is grown on the ground and it is then roasted and ground into the amazing beverage that we enjoy as a coffee substitute. What is chicory in coffee?

Chicory is often added to coffee as a taste supplement or differential. Its use in coffee or as a coffee substitute dates back centuries and is often related to times of economic hardship and necessity - the result is an interesting and enjoyable taste alternative.

Chicory Coffee Benefits

Unlike other coffee substitutes, chicory coffee is a plant based alternative which makes it even more beneficial as it is able to promote numerous health benefits upon consumption.

  1. Stress reducer – Being a caffeine free drink, chicory coffee can act as a stress reliever and help you go through the day without any tension or nerves.
  2. Acts as a Probiotic - Chicory root contains fiber and inulin which both help stabilize gut function and improves gut health. Chicory is made up of 68% inulin. Inulin works to improve gut health by improving mineral absorption, fighting harmful bacteria and reducing inflammation of the gut - all encouraging the growth of healthy gut bacteria.
  3. Against constipation – Due to the root’s fiber contents, it can improve bowel movements and help reduce constipation. It is perfect for those with bowel problems and suffering from constipation. Studies have shown that the inulin component of chicory does help to soften stools and improve bowel movement.
  4. Anti-inflammatory – Inflammation is the source of many health problems and diseases. With chicory coffee, inflammation is reduced hence, chicory consumption becomes proactive against many diseases.
  5. Liver Cleanser – Antioxidants found in chicory coffee have proven to cleanse the liver and help it function more effectively while boosting your immune system.
  6. May help with blood sugar control. This is thought to be due to the inulin which helps to produce healthy bacteria that break carbohydrates down into sugars. Early studies suggest that this may help people suffering from diabetes
  7. May support weight loss by helping to suppress appetite and reducing calorie intake as a result. More research is required to support this

Why do they add chicory to coffee?

You may have heard of chicory being added to natural coffee and wonder why this is done. Adding chicory to coffee helps to take some of the bitterness out of some brands of coffee. Some liken the taste of chicory being added to coffee to a chocolate flavour.

Does chicory make coffee stronger?

What is decaf coffee?

Decaf coffee is coffee that has been subjected to an extraction process that removes most but not all of coffee’s caffeine content. While the coffee will still taste like coffee, the process does affect the taste, making decaf coffee taste milder and have a slightly different color to its original state.

What is Organic Decaf Coffee?

Organic coffee is the coffee that is grown and cropped following the governing regulations that entitle any product as organic. The process of cropping and producing organic coffee includes not having any chemicals or additives added in the product or any contact with radiation contamination. What makes it decaffeinated is the fact that crops that produce organic coffee are then processed into removing caffeine and thus, labeling it as decaffeinated.

How is decaf coffee made?

Decaffeinating coffee usually involves a process of waterlogging green coffee beans in order to make the caffeine soluble. Then the caffeine is “washed out of the coffee bean using one of several methods.

Companies that use chemicals to isolate the caffeine usually use ethyl acetate or methylene chloride. If the decaffeination process uses ethyl acetate that has been obtained naturally, then the process meets strict organic standards.

Another way to achieve decaffeination is to pump heated highly pressurised carbon dioxide through coffee beans. This method, perfected by German chemist Kurt Zosel had been widely used since the mid seventies up until the present day.

How much caffeine is in decaffeinated coffee?

All brands of decaffeinated coffee will contain traces of caffeine. How much will be dependent upon where the coffee was grown and the decaffeination process itself. As a  broad rule of thumb a standard ci[ of decaffeinated coffee (approximately 240ml) will contain about seven grams of caffeine. This compares to a standard drink of coffee that can contain anywhere between seventy and one hundred and forty grams of coffee. The key takeaway here is that drinking between five and ten cups of decaf coffee is roughly equivalent to drinking one or two cups of regular coffee.

Organic Decaf Coffee Benefits

Organic coffee is even more beneficial over regular coffee. Having organic decaf coffee adds up to the benefits of organic coffee alone. Let’s have a look at some of the benefits that organic decaf coffee can offer to its consumers.

  1. Great source of antioxidants

  2. Filled with nutrients – It has been found that organic decaf coffee includes nutrients like magnesium, potassium and Vitamin B3 that can fulfill your daily intake.

  3. Substitute suitable for pregnant women

  4. Stress relief

name: Castile Soap
description:
What is castile soap?

Castile soap is a natural non biodegradable soap that is made from vegetable matter. It is free from animal fats and other synthetic ingredients that go into the manufacture of many commercially produced soaps. Traditionally made using olive oil, castile soap may now have coconut, avocado, almond, castor or hemp oils. The oils give the soap its remarkable both its lathering and cleansing abilities. Organic castile soap is available in bar and liquid forms. 

What does castile soap do?

Pure castile soap is a remarkably versatile product, being equally suitable to be used to wash your body, clean your home or even for pet grooming purposes. Additionally, this liquid soap product can be used to clean the home, without exposing the family to nasty chemicals.

What are the benefits of using castile soap?

If you’ve been wondering what are the benefits of castile soap you will be glad to discover that this amazingly gentle and environmentally friendly soap can be used in a myriad of ways and you may find that regular use will see you reduce or eliminate the need for many cleaning products. As a bathroom soap, it has the following benefits-:

  • Unlike most commercial soaps, its ingredients allow it to lather naturally, meaning that there is no need to add harmful sulfates to make the soap lather.
  • Suitable for all skin types
  • Antibacterial properties help to reduce the incidence of acne
  • Contains healthy plant oils that help to soothe irritated skin
  • Contains glycerin which helps to naturally moisturise the skin
  • Olive oil helps the skin to breathe - many commercial soaps contain ingredients that tend to clog up skin pores
  • Contains oleocanthal which helps to reduce inflammation of the skin

As well as being used a bathroom soap castile soap can also be used for the following purposes 

  • Dish soap and dishwasher detergent. Simply add 1 part castile soap to 10 parts of water to make dishwashing soap, or mix equal portions of castile soap and water to make a natural dishwashing detergent.
  • Window cleaner
  • Shampoo - either scrub directly into hair or max 1 tablespoon into a cup of water and apply as you would do with any other shampoo
  • Household cleaner - mix a cup or two of soap with a litre of water for an all purpose environmentally friendly cleaner that can even be applied to floor mopping
  • Half of cup of soap makes an excellent laundry detergent
  • Toilet cleaner, Mix one cup of soap with four cups of water.
  • Make up remover
  • Plant spray
  • Pet wash

Is Castile soap good for your hair?

Castile soap is used by a growing number of people as an alternative to commercially produced shampoos. It is potent enough to clean sebum from the scalp but gentle enough not to dry the hair out

Before choosing to use the soap as a shampoo, you need to consider these points

  • Castile soap is not color safe
  • It is very strong and direct use can leave the hair feeling like straw. Making up a solution of watered down soap is a safe bet if you choose to use it as a shampoo

Is Castile soap antibacterial?

Castile soap is a natural disinfectant that works by attaching itself to germs and washing them away. It is not considered to be antibacterial. You can make castile soap antibacterial by adding some tea tree oil to any castile soap solution that you make up

name: Hemp Protein Powder
description:
Hemp Protein Powder – A great choice for vegans

With its high amount of essential amino acids that cannot be produced naturally, Hemp Protein Powder is considered the best choice for a vegan protein supplement. As well as being significantly high in protein, hemp powder contains a vast amount of healthy omega fats and fiber that many other organic proteins are lacking.

What is Hemp Protein Powder

Hemp Protein Powder is produced from the Cannabis sativa plant. Unlike its illegal cousin Marijuana, hemp seed has very little measurable quantities of the psychoactive compound THC. Empirical research has uncovered that THC when people are eating hemp has significant health benefits and very little in the way of side effects. Because organic hemp powder contains only a small trace amount of THC (normally between 0.3 to 1.5 percent) consumers do not run the risk of getting high.

If you’ve been wondering what is hemp powder used for, it is widely used as a vegan protein supplement and it can be added to a wide range of recipes as well as being a staple ingredient in many vegan smoothies and shakes.

What are the health benefits of organic hemp powder

There are some considerable health benefits that comes with the consumption of organic hemp powder as part of your healthy eating lifestyle. These benefits include:

  • A sizeable increase in protein. Regular consumption of protein such as that found when eating hemp in powder form can help assist the body in the development, growth and maintenance of muscles. Furthermore, it can help boost your metabolism and increase the body’s ability to burn fat.
  • An improvement in overall heart health. The rich source of omega3 fatty acids in hemp protein powder leads to a boost in cardiovascular health. As hemp protein is high in fiber it can assist in lowering blood pressure, reducing cholesterol and heart disease
  • A cleansed colon. The high amount of fiber in hemp powder, both soluble and insoluble, helps cleanse the colon by reducing constipation and helping to rid toxins from the body.
  • Leads to a reduction in cravings for sugar. Due to its high nutrient content, hemp powder is ideal to fight off sugar cravings. As it can help regulate blood glucose, you are much less likely to experience a crash in energy and are not likely to turn to sugar to boost your fatigue levels.
  • Inserting hemp protein powder into your diet can give your immune system a valuable spike. This is due to the presence of edestin and albumin which are crucial proteins responsible for stronger immune functioning.
  • Animal friendly and cruelty free, organic protein powder is the perfect choice for vegans and those who are concerned about the treatment of animals.  
  • And if you’ve been wondering “Is hemp protein good for weight loss?” There is much anecdotal evidence to suggest that hemp protein  helps people to burn fat ,build muscle and lose weight. However, there is no conclusive evidence to support this. However, there is little doubt that taking hemp protein powder does make people feel fuller and more satisfied, thereby reducing hunger cravings and perhaps indirectly helping people to reduce weight loss.

Is hemp protein better than whey protein?

Both protein powders have their advocates. There are some clear differences between the two powders . The key differences are:

  • Hemp protein powder is a plant based powder whereas whey is a dairy based powder. This obviously is a key factor for vegans looking for the best protein powder.

  • There are no additives in hemp protein powder while the production of whey powder necessitates the use of hexane to separate the powder. The no additive feature of hemp protein powder makes it easier to digest

  • Perhaps the one key area that whey powder has a clear advantage is the amount of protein contained within it (over 90%) compared to 50% protein contained in hemp powder.

  • Hemp protein contains over 20 different amino acids and only contains unsaturated fats. Whey protein powder on the other hand contains saturated fats and traces of cholesterol.

A common question asked in relation to hemp powder is - does hemp powder have CBD? The answer is generally no, as the protein powder is made from the seeds of the hemp plant and CBD is present in the leaves and flowers of the plant.

name: Hemp Oil Australia
description:
Hemp oil, a product of the Cannabis sativa plant, is gaining traction in Australia for its health benefits. This article offers an in-depth look at hemp oil, from its nutritional value to its practical uses.

Detailed Explanation of Hemp Oil's Nutritional Profile

Hemp oil is rich in essential nutrients. It boasts a high content of omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids in a ratio optimal for human health. These fatty acids are crucial for brain function and heart health. Hemp oil also contains gamma-linolenic acid, known for its anti-inflammatory properties. Additionally, it's a good source of vitamin E, an antioxidant that supports skin health. Quantitative data from sources like the USDA National Nutrient Database can provide more specific nutrient levels.

Mechanism of Action

The health benefits of hemp oil are attributed to its rich fatty acid profile and bioactive compounds. These components interact with the body’s endocannabinoid system, which plays a role in regulating various physiological processes. The fatty acids in hemp oil help maintain cell membrane integrity and influence inflammatory responses.

Evidence-Based Support

Clinical trials and scientific studies, available on platforms like PubMed and the WHO, support the health benefits of hemp oil. For instance, studies have shown its effectiveness in improving skin conditions and reducing inflammation.

Potential Side Effects and Interactions

While hemp oil is generally safe, it can interact with certain medications and may not be suitable for individuals with specific health conditions. Potential side effects include digestive discomfort and allergic reactions. It's crucial to consult healthcare professionals before starting supplementation.

Dosage Recommendations

Dosage varies based on the health concern and individual factors. Starting with a low dose, such as 1-2 teaspoons daily, and gradually increasing is advisable. For specific conditions, consult a healthcare provider for tailored dosage advice.

Quality and Sourcing

The quality of hemp oil depends on its sourcing and production. Opt for products with organic certification and third-party testing to ensure purity. Products like Essential Hemp Foods Organic Hemp Oil are examples of high-quality options.

Sustainability Considerations

Hemp is a sustainable crop, requiring minimal pesticides and water. Organic farming and eco-friendly extraction methods enhance its environmental benefits, making hemp oil a sustainable choice.

Comparative Analysis

Hemp oil offers unique benefits compared to other natural remedies. For example, its omega-3 content is higher than in flaxseed oil, making it a superior choice for heart health. However, for specific needs like high antioxidant content, other supplements like rosehip oil might be more appropriate.

Conclusion

Hemp oil is a versatile and beneficial natural product. Its rich nutritional profile and potential health benefits make it a valuable addition to the wellness sector in Australia. Explore high-quality hemp oil products, such as those mentioned, for a holistic approach to health.

References and Further Reading

Explore in-depth information on hemp oil at:

  • PubMed
  • Cochrane Library
  • National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)
  • World Health Organization (WHO)

name: Coconut Sugar
description:
What is coconut sugar?

Sometimes called coconut palm sugar, coconut sugar is a natural sugar obtained from coconut palm sap - a sugary fluid present in the coconut plant. It is similar to but not the same as palm sugar which is obtained from a different plant. It is generally regarded as being a healthier alternative to refined sugar, retaining many of the nutrients of the coconut plant. Organic coconut sugar is made using coconut plants that have been grown and harvested without the use of harmful pesticides or chemicals. 

How is coconut sugar made? 

The process of making coconut sugar is a simple entirely natural two step process.

  1. Liquid sap is collected from the coconut plant after a cut is made in the coconut flower

  2. The sap is then subjected to heat until all the liquid is dissolved, leaving behind brown granules similar in appearance to raw sugar

Coconut sugar can be substituted for refined regular sugar on a 1:1 basis.

Benefits of switching to coconut sugar

Coconut sugar represents a more natural way to sweeten food than refined sugar which essentially has no nutritional value. Some of the benefits associated with coconut sugar include:

  • Lower on the glycemic index. Refined sugar has a GI of 65 compared to Coconut sugar’s 35. Naturally occurring sugars in fruits have a GI of around 25

  • Contains essential minerals, iron , zinc and calcium

  • Is a source of vitamin C

  • Being a raw food it contains plenty of healthy antioxidants

  • Healthy chain fatty acids are found in this sugar. These fatty acids help to keep cholesterol in check

Coconut sugar where to buy

At Buy Organics Online you can buy sugar that has been sourced from highly regarded suppliers within the coconut industry.  Now is the time to switch to a healthier more nutritious type of sugar that is rich in nutrition and less sucrose than refined sugars. name: Erythritol
description:
The health benefits of erythritol

There are several benefits to the overall health of the consumer that comes with consumption of erythritol instead of sugar. These benefits are:

  • It is helpful with weight loss. Because erythritol contains almost no calories, it can provide benefits to those seeking to lose weight. By replacing daily sugar intake with erythritol, a consumer can reduce the number of overall calories they consume in a day considerably.
  • It can ensure blood sugar levels don’t spike. One of the major benefits of erythritol is that it has a zero glycemic index. This makes it extremely popular for people on low carb diets as well as those who are suffering from diabetes.
  • It will help keep you out of the dentist’s chair. A major advantage of this sugar substitute is that it does not cause tooth decay. Where sugar is used by harmful bacteria in the mouth to grow and erode teeth, erythritol cannot be affected in the same way by bacteria and therefore does not cause cavities to appear.

What is erythritol?

Many people ask the question what is erythritol? Simply put, it is an all-natural sugar alternative. It is created through a fermentation process and has a taste that is very similar to sugar yet possesses almost zero calories. Historically, it was used in Japan during the early 1990s, not only as a sugar substitute, but in jellies, jams, chocolates and beverages. Erythritol is what is known as a sugar alcohol, similar to Xylitol, and these alcohols occur naturally within plants.

How healthy is Erythritol?

On all the available evidence, erythritol appears to be a very healthy alternative to sugar and other sweeteners. Multiple studies have shown there to be little negative consequences from consuming the product.

There is however, one area of concern and that is that as erythritol is a sugar alcohol, it cannot be digested and will pass through the body until it reaches the colon where the colon’s bacteria will cause the sugar alcohol to ferment and generate digestive gases - this can lead to feelings of bloating, particularly when erythritol is consumed in significant quantities.

Is stevia and erythritol the same thing?

Although stevia and erythritol are both popular sugar substitutes and both obtained from plants they are not the same thing. Stevia is obtained from the leaves of a South American native plant Stevia Rebaudiana. It is usually made available in granulated, powdered or liquid form. O the other hand erythritol is a fermented sugar alcohol commonly obtained from plants such as corn or birch.

Is erythritol better than sugar?

All in all erythritol makes a healthier choice than sugar although to say it is better than sugar will depend on individual taste. Here are some key facts to consider when comparing the two sweeteners.

  • It contains fewer calories than sugar on average containing 0.24 calories per gram compared to sugar’s 4 calories per gram
  • It is considered to be 70% as sweet as sugar
  • Itl has no effect on blood sugar levels

Where to buy erythritol?

So, you may be wondering where to buy erythritol? Well you’ve come to the right place. name: Coconut Butter
description:
What is coconut butter?

Coconut butter is a tasty paste obtained from the fruit of the coconut. It can be used straight from the jar as a condiment or spread or as part of various recipes. It is often compared to coconut oil  and is made up of mostly polyunsaturated fats.  The butter is obtained by grinding the coconut pulp together until it achieves a paste-like consistency.  There is much debate over the health benefits of coconut butter. Advocates will declare that the polyunsaturated fats are the healthy type namely Lauric acid  which helps deliver the good type of cholesterol. Despite this evidence, many cardiologists still consider it to be an unhealthy food. This debate will be settled in time with further research. however, the lines are clearly drawn. Whatever the truth turns out to, be it is recommended that  you choose the butter that has been minimally processed

Organic coconut butter is obtained in exactly the same way, using organically grown coconuts that have been grown and harvested without the aid of synthetic chemicals, fertilizers, pesticides or genetically modified organisms.

How to use coconut butter 

Coconut butter makes an excellent addition to many beverages and meals. Some suggestions for use include

  • Using it as a sugar substitute for hot beverages such as tea or coffee. Simply place coconut butter in your empty mug and then pour the hot beverage over it and allow it  to melt

  •  Adding it to smoothies for extra taste

  •  Drizzling over many dishes including fruit and pancakes

  •  Adding to savoury dishes for extra creaminess

  •  Using it as a spread for your morning toast or sandwiches 

  •  Adding it to Porridge

  •  Use it for skin care - by applying to your skin and gently rubbing in a circular motion and then washing with warm water and applying moisturiser afterwards

Natural peanut butters generally contain at least 90 percent peanuts. No artificial colours, preservatives or sweeteners are added to the product, whereas traditional peanut butter or commercial peanut butter often contains additives such as hydrogenated oils, corn syrup, salt, sugar and soy protein.

Natural peanut butter in its purest form is a purely natural product and  is not homogenized. As such it requires regular stirring and is sometimes referred to as stir peanut butter.

Commercial product manufacturers often produce a no stir natural variety that contains palm oil to act as a stabilizer. The palm oil prevents oil separation and helps to make the butter easier to spread and creamier in texture.

This slight difference in ingredient content and texture compared to regular peanut butter can take a little getting used to from a taste perspective. However, after a few servings, you will find that your taste buds will adjust.

Benefits of eating organic peanut butter

The simple ingredients contained within peanut butter make it a perfect healthy addition to a quick sandwich, multiple recipes and even smoothies. Before purchasing from the grocery store, it is wise to read the jar to gain an understanding of exactly what you are buying. The jar should contain such important product information as salt content, additives and importantly state 90 percent peanuts. Keep an eye out for other information such as added sugar content. Some regular peanut butter products can have as much as 250 mg of sugar per tablespoon.  When buying online this information and general nutrition advice can be obtained by viewing the product description

The key benefit of choosing to eat peanut butter organic is the obvious improved dietary aspect. Peanut butter consumed in small quantities has several benefits - these are-:

  • Peanuts are rich in the “good fats” - monounsaturated fats that help provide nutrients to the body and reduce cholesterol

  • Contains potassium and protein which helps to lower blood pressure

  • Rich in fibre content to aid bowel movements

  • Also contains magnesium, antioxidants and Vitamin E.

  • Known to boost energy

  • Minerals such as iron, magnesium and potassium aid better blood circulation.

Choosing organic peanut butter allows you to gain all these benefits while avoiding the potential risks that eating conventionally made peanut butter carries.

name: Himalayan Salt
description:
Himalayan Salt

Himalayan salt is very similar to regular table salt. It is 98% sodium chloride, with the remaining 2% being made up of essential trace minerals. It is distinguished from other table salt products through its pink colouration.

What is Himalayan salt?

Pink Himalayan salt is thought to have formed millions of years ago as ancient seas evaporated. Hand labor and minimal processing are both used to extract the salt from the mines. As it is largely unrefined and additive-free, it is believed to be more natural than conventional table salt.

It is mostly made up of sodium chloride; however, the natural mining process allows it to retain many other minerals that regular table salt does not contain.

It has been estimated that Himalayan salt may contain as many as 84 minerals and trace elements. 

Why is Himalayan salt pink?

But why is Himalayan salt pink? It gets its pink colouration from the combination of the three trace minerals potassium, magnesium, and calcium. These three minerals also explain the contrasting taste between Himalayan salt and regular table salt.

Where does Himalayan salt come from?

As the name suggests, the salt is mined from the Himalayan regions, most notably the Punjab region of Pakistan

The health benefits of Himalayan salt

There are some suggested health benefits that come from using Himalayan salt, particularly instead of regular table salt. These benefits include:

  • It contains less sodium per teaspoon than table salt. Because of the larger crystals that Himalayan salt contains, there is less sodium per serving on average. Where excess sodium is present, blood pressure increases, which puts extra pressure on the heart and can cause significant health issues.

  • It contains more natural ingredients than table salt. While table salt is usually mixed with anticaking agents such as magnesium carbonate, Himalayan salt is far less processed and generally free of additives.

  • It can help you hydrate more effectively. Research has shown that adding a sprinkling of Himalayan salt to drinks and meals can help avoid dehydration.

  • It can improve respiratory ailments. Because salt contain anti-inflammatory and antibacterial properties, it can loosen excessive mucus from the lungs while removing pathogens from the air, creating an environment that is easier to breath in.

In Australia, we have seen a spike in demand for Celtic salt which has some helpful articles written to help you compare this as a viable alternative.

How to use Himalayan salt

Himalayan salt can be used for both  dietary and non-dietary purposes

Eating and cooking with Himalayan Salt

Himalayan salt can be used pretty much the same way you would use regular salt to cook or eat with. It goes well with sauces and marinades or can be added to food according to taste.

There are some instances of Himalayan salt being used as a cooking surface. It is possible to purchase large blocks of salt and use them to grill, sear meats, and cook other foods. This process gives the food an added salty flavour.

Non-Dietary Uses of Pink Himalayan Salt

The salt is an ingredient in some bath salts. Bath salts are said to offer many therapeutic benefits, including improving skin conditions and soothing sore muscles.

The salt is also often used to make salt lamps. These devices are said to help cleanse and purify the air.

Himalayan salt, Australia

Buy Organics Online is the place to be if your looking to buy Himalayan salt in Australia. With a great range of salt products that have been supplied by only the most trusted companies from Australia and around the world, there really is no reason not to replace your regular table salt with that of the pink variety. name: Xanthan Gum
description:
Xanthan gum is a natural food additives derived from the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris. It is a versatile ingredient that can be used as a thickener, stabiliser, and emulsifier in a variety of foods and beverages. Xanthan gum is gluten-free, vegan, and has a wide range of health benefits.

Benefits of Xanthan Gum:

  • Gluten-free and vegan
  • Promotes digestive health
  • Low calorie
  • Stabilises and thickens foods
  • Prevents separation of ingredients
  • Enhances texture and mouthfeel
  • Extends shelf life of foods

Uses of Xanthan Gum:

  • Baking: Cakes, cookies, muffins, bread
  • Sauces and dressings: Salad dressings, dips, gravies
  • Ice cream and sorbet
  • Gluten-free baking
  • Vegan cooking
  • Meat alternatives
  • Dairy-free products
  • Personal care products
  • Industrial applications

How to Use Xanthan Gum:

Xanthan gum is a powerful thickener and stabiliser, so a little goes a long way. Start with a small amount and add more as needed until you reach the desired consistency. Xanthan gum can be dissolved in liquids or added directly to dry ingredients.

Recipes Using Xanthan Gum:

  • Gluten-free bread
  • Vegan cheesecake
  • Homemade ice cream
  • Salad dressing
  • Chocolate sauce

Where to Buy Xanthan Gum:

Xanthan gum can be found in most health food stores and some online retailers. It is typically sold in powder form.

Additional Considerations:

  • Xanthan gum can cause thickening and gelling in liquids, so it is important to use it in moderation.
  • Xanthan gum can be affected by heat, so it is best to add it to foods after they have been cooked or cooled.
  • Xanthan gum can sometimes cause digestive issues in people with sensitive stomachs.

name: Menstrual Cup
description:
What is a menstrual cup?

Menstrual cups are another form of reusable feminine hygiene products that have an environmentally responsible impact. These small funnel shaped silicone or rubber cups are designed to collect period fluids after being inserted into the vagina.

The period cup is favored by some women because it is capable of holding more fluid than other methods and can be worn for as long as 12 hours, depending on period flow. These facts make the menstrual cup a viable eco-friendly alternative to tampons and sanitary pads. When inserted correctly, the menstruation cup will not cause any feelings of discomfort nor hinder you in your daily activities. Before choosing to use a reusable menstrual cup you should consult your gynaecologist to determine the right cup size for you.

How to insert and remove your menstrual cup

If you’re accustomed to inserting a tampon, then inserting a menstrual cup won’t be totally unfamiliar. The process is as follows:

  • Thoroughly wash your hands

  • “Grease” the rim of the cup by applying water or a water based lubricant to the rim

  • Fold the cup tightly in half

  • Hold it in one hand with the rim facing upwards

  • Gently insert the menstrual cup into your vagina  with the rim up similarly to the way you would insert a tampon without an applicator. The cup should sit a few inches below your cervix

  • Once the cup has been inserted, rotate it and it will pop open, creating an airtight, leak proof seal

To remove the cup you again wash your hands thoroughly and then:

  • Using your index finger and thumb gently pull the stem of the cup until you can touch its base.

  • Pinch the base - this will release the seal

  • Pull down and the cup will be released

  • Empty the removed cup into the toilet or sink.

name: Aloe Vera Gel
description:
What is aloe vera gel?

Aloe vera gel is a natural product  derived from the inner portion of the Aloe vera plant (botanical name  Aloe barbadensis). Often referred to as nature's miracle plant, its leaves produce a clear jelly-like substance that has been used in ancient remedies, pain relief  and personal care treatments for centuries.

The Aloe plant is a small succulent plant that grows to a height of between 60 and 90 centimetres. Its leaves are usually serrated and vary between gray and green in colour. Large quantities of water are stored in the aloe plant leaves and the aloe vera  liquid is the famous gel.

While many people are aware of the benefits of using pure aloe vera gel to treat sunburn, aloe vera gel can be used for a variety of treatment and beauty purposes. The gel contains vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and amino acids that can assist in the treatment and care for the skin.

Aloe products include hand sanitizer, aloe vera juice and aloe lotion,

Aloe gel has been found to have therapeutic properties that can assist in the treatment of wounds and aid faster healing. The gel also appears to be harmful to certain varieties of fungi and bacteria. While packed full of vitamins and natural goodness aloe has not reached the heights of popular superfoods such as cranberries and pomegranates, this could be attributed to the fact that the clear gel or juice has a taste that could be best described as acquired.Despite its taste the juice has developed a reputation for aiding digestive health[9] and the immune system.

 

Uses and benefits of pure aloe vera gel

Aloe vera contains organic natural ingredients that have known therapeutic and organic beauty properties. These benefits include-:

  •  Being rich in healthy plant compounds and vitamins including vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin E and vitamin B12, as well as various  minerals and amino acids.
  • Contains powerful antioxidants known as polyphenols. These antioxidants can help fight harmful bacteria and improve the immune system.
  • Has antiseptic properties. 
  • Aloe latex can improve digestive health by acting as a laxative by increasing intestinal water content, stimulating mucus secretion and increasing intestinal peristalsis. Aloe latex is a yellow compound found on the underside of the aloe vera leaf.
  • Pure aloe gel when used as a mouthwash can help to reduce the incidence of dental plaque.
  • Topical use of Aloe vera may help to reduce wrinkles and signs of ageing by increasing collagen production and improving skin elasticity.

 

Aloe gel can be used for a variety of purposes including:

  • Regular application of organic aloe vera gel can help reduce the incidence of acne.[1]

  • Organic aloe vera gel has been known to alleviate skin irritation caused by insect bites. [2]

  • Assists in the treatment of first and second degree burns by reducing healing time. Four experimental studies have shown that external application of aloe vera can reduce burn healing time by up to nine days. [3]

  • Aloe gel can help with mouth pain relief. It has been shown to alleviate pain caused by itchy rashes in the mouth. The gel can be combined with mouthwash or  by applying aloe gel directly [4]

  • Reduced irritation and inflammation are other aloe pain relief benefits[5]

  • External use of aloe gel may help to reduce cold sores.[6]

  • May help the healing process with wounds[7]

  • There are benefits of using aloe vera gel for hair care as well. These include soothing an itchy scalp, the deep cleansing of oily hair, promoting hair growth[8] and the strengthening of hair strands.

  • Can be used to make your own hand sanitizer by following this simple hand sanitizer recipe. Combine one quarter cup of aloe vera gel with three quarters of a cup of isopropyl alcohol and about ten drops of one of the essential oils like lavender oil. Lemon juice can substitute for the essential oil if need be. Pour the three ingredients into a bowl then stir with a spoon before whisking until well blended. Pour the contents into a jar and label it hand sanitizer. Be careful to wash your hands before making your own hand sanitizer The aloe vera hand sanitizer mix is in line with that recommended by the World Health Organization. It is important to take care when making this mix as incorrect proportions could lead to skin irritations and potentially an ineffective mix.

Potential side of effects of aloe vera

Aloe is generally considered safe to be applied externally. However in some rare instances, aloe may cause skin irritation. To be safe it is suggested that aloe be applied to a small patch of skin before applying more liberally.

When taken in accordance with directions aloe juice or gel is considered generally safe for consumption. However prolonged use at high levels can have some adverse effects including stomach cramps, diarrhea and in very rare cases, liver problems. While these side effects are considered to be rare, if you have an existing health problem or  are in any doubt at all, consultation with a medical professional is advisable before consuming aloe juice or aloe in any form.

Personal care

Being widely recognised for its vitamins, enzymes and soothing properties, aloe vera is widely used in personal care routines. Being a source of vitamin E, it is widely used in irritated skin and face treatments and is a common ingredient in acne and eczema treatments. One common acne home health care treatment involves mixing aloe with two other antibacterial organic beauty substances - honey and cinnamon to make a face mask . Simply mix 2 tablespoons of honey with a tablespoon of aloe  and then add a quarter tablespoon of cinnamon and then mix thoroughly. Apply the paste as a face mask for a period of approximately ten minutes before thoroughly rinsing away.

name: Dandelion Tea
description:
What is dandelion tea?

Despite being regarded as an annoying weed in many quarters, the dandelion. Dandelion tea can be made from the dandelion's flowers, leaves or roots. The taste will differ according to which part of the dandelion is used to make the tea. Dandelion tea flower petals make a sweet-tasting tea, while tea made from the root of the dandelion plant tastes bolder older and smokier. Teas made from the leaves have an earthy, herby flavour.

There are many home recipes for dandelion tea out there, however, while making your own may be appealing, it is important to remember that many dandelions may have been exposed to pesticides and other chemicals. A safe bet is to choose organic dandelion tea made in an organically safe environment.

Additionally dandelion tea makes a great coffee/caffeine substitute.

Dandelion tea is caffeine-free - which is great if you’re looking to reduce your caffeine intake. However, for many of us reliant upon getting a burst of energy from caffeine, this may be a little off-putting. Interestingly, some research suggests that weaning ourselves off caffeine can actually result in us being more energetic than ever. The theory is that our body becomes conditioned to receiving the caffeine hit, and by weaning ourselves off it, our body may work to stimulate more energy naturally.

name: Nut Milk Bag
description:
What is a Nut Milk Bag?

Made from natural, unbleached materials, a nut milk bag is used to separate solids from liquids. They are a great addition to have in your kitchen as they are particularly useful for straining nut milk.

Nut milk is becoming increasingly popular as more people are discovering its health benefits. Nut milk is a great alternative to dairy milk and can be made from a variety of nuts, including almonds, cashews, and coconuts. Nut milk bags are essential if you want to make almond milk at home, but they can be used for straining a variety of other liquids as well.

Benefits of Using a Nut Milk Bag

Easy to Use: Nut milk bags are designed to be easy to use. Simply fill the bag with ground nuts and submerge it in water. The fine mesh of the bag will allow the nut milk to pass through while trapping the solids. 

Versatile: In addition to straining nut milk, nut milk bags can be used for a variety of other purposes, including:

  • Straining smoothies and green juice drinks to remove pulp.
  • Making clarified butter by separating milk solids.
  • Producing real almond milk that can be added to smoothies, puddings, or any recipe that calls for milk to be used.
  • Strain the solids extracted from the milk to add to pie crusts, make flours, or even be used as a facial scrub.

Where to Buy Nut Milk Bag Australia

Australian online store Buy Organics Online has a wide selection of organic nut milk bag products for you to choose from. Buy your nut milk bag from Buy Organics Online and start enjoying the benefits of nut milk produced in your own home today.

  1. Wound Healing: Manuka honey's antibacterial properties have earned it FDA approval for wound healing applications, promoting tissue regeneration and reducing infection risk.

  3. Sore Throat Soother: The antibacterial prowess of Manuka honey extends to easing sore throats, reducing inflammation, and eliminating the bacteria responsible for throat discomfort.

  4. Stomach Ulcer Relief: Research suggests that Manuka honey's antiviral and antibacterial properties can aid in treating stomach ulcers, reducing inflammation and promoting healing.

  5. Digestive Aid: Manuka honey has shown promise in alleviating symptoms of Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), reducing constipation, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.

  6. Upper Respiratory Infection Fighter: Manuka honey's antibacterial properties make it a valuable tool against upper respiratory infections, particularly in cystic fibrosis patients who are more prone to these infections.

  7. Acne Control: The anti-inflammatory properties of Manuka honey may help manage acne, reducing inflammation and promoting clearer skin.

Harnessing the Power of Manuka Honey: Simple Yet Effective

Incorporating one to two tablespoons of Manuka honey into your daily diet is a simple yet effective way to reap its health benefits. Enjoy it straight, add it to your favorite recipes, or use it as a natural sweetener.

name: Maca Powder
description:
Maca powder, a remarkable adaptogen from the high Andes of Peru, has garnered acclaim for its health benefits and nutritional value. As an authority on natural wellness and nutrition, this comprehensive guide explores the essence of maca powder, covering its origins, nutritional profile, health benefits, culinary uses, storage, and ethical sourcing. Additionally, a FAQ section is included to address common queries.

Warning: 

Maca powder is generally safe for most people when consumed in moderation. However, pregnant or breastfeeding women, individuals with thyroid issues, and those taking medications should consult with a healthcare professional before consuming maca powder.  Read more information below under Potential Risks for Individuals.

Understanding Different Types of Maca Powder

Gelatinized Maca Powder

  • Processing: Gelatinized maca is heat-processed to remove starch, making it easier to digest.
  • Benefits: Ideal for those with sensitive stomachs; the gelatinization process concentrates the active ingredients, potentially enhancing its efficacy.

Red Maca Powder

  • Characteristics: Derived from red maca roots, known for their vibrant colour.
  • Benefits: Red maca is often used for balancing hormone levels and is believed to have a higher content of certain compounds like glucosinolates and antioxidants.

Black Maca Powder

  • Distinctive Features: Sourced from rare black maca roots.
  • Benefits: Black maca is reputed for its positive effects on stamina, energy, and athletic performance. It's also associated with improving memory and concentration.

Unveiling the Origins of Maca Powder

  • Background: Indigenous to Peru, maca is a root vegetable historically revered for its endurance and vitality-enhancing properties.
  • Cultivation: Thriving in harsh climates, maca is a testament to the ingenuity of traditional Peruvian agriculture.

Nutritional Profile of Maca Powder

  • Rich in Nutrients: Maca is packed with vitamins, minerals, and essential amino acids, making it a nutrient-dense superfood.
  • Adaptogenic Properties: Known for its ability to help the body adapt to stress.

Health Benefits of Maca Powder

  • Energy Boost: Often taken to increase energy and stamina.
  • Mood Improvement: Can help in balancing mood and reducing stress.
  • Hormonal Balance: Used to support hormonal equilibrium, particularly in women.

Culinary Uses of Maca Powder

  • Versatility: Adds a unique nutty flavour to smoothies, baked goods, and breakfast dishes.
  • Recommendations: Best used in moderation due to its potent flavour and effect.

Storing Maca Powder

  • Storage Tips: Keep in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight to maintain its potency.

Ethical Sourcing of Maca Powder

  • Sustainability: Opt for organic and fair trade options to ensure sustainable and ethical practices in its production and distribution.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Can maca powder be used daily? A: Yes, maca powder can be consumed daily. However, it's advisable to start with a small amount and gradually increase to see how your body reacts.

Q: Is maca powder suitable for everyone? A: While maca is generally safe for most people, those with thyroid issues should consult a healthcare provider due to its goitrogen content.

Q: Can maca powder improve athletic performance? A: Some studies suggest that maca may enhance endurance and energy, making it popular among athletes for performance improvement.

Q: How does maca powder compare to other superfoods? A: Maca is unique in its adaptogenic qualities, which help in stress management and hormonal balance, setting it apart from other superfoods.

Q: Are there different types of maca powder? A: Yes, maca powder comes in various forms, including raw, gelatinized (heat-treated), and in different colours like red and black, each with unique properties.

Conclusion

Maca powder, in its various forms like gelatinised, red, and black maca, offers a range of health benefits. Understanding these different types can help you choose the right one for your specific health needs and culinary preferences.

At Buy Organics Online there is a wide range of organic maca powder products available for purchase that have been supplied by reputable brands from Australia and around the globe. Don’t delay to purchase this and other wonderful maca superfood products from our online store today!

 

Potential Risks for Individuals with Thyroid Issues:

Maca powder contains goitrogens, which are substances that can interfere with iodine uptake and thyroid hormone production. Individuals with pre-existing thyroid conditions or those at risk of developing thyroid issues should exercise caution when consuming maca powder.

Recommended Precautions:

  • If you have a thyroid condition or are taking thyroid medications, consult with your healthcare provider before consuming maca powder.
  • Start with a low dose of maca powder and gradually increase it as tolerated.
  • Monitor your thyroid function regularly and promptly report any changes to your healthcare provider.

General Guidelines for Maca Powder Consumption:

  • Consume maca powder in moderation, typically around 3-5 grams per day.
  • Avoid consuming maca powder in excessive amounts, especially if you have any underlying health conditions.
  • If you experience any adverse reactions after consuming maca powder, discontinue use and seek medical advice.

name: Maternity Pads
description:
Maternity Pads

Make life a little more comfortable post-birth with maternity pads. After child birth, it is important that women are as comfortable as possible. Following delivery, a mother will start to bleed very heavily during the uterus recovery process. Normally the bleeding experienced is much heavier than during her usual period and can last from 10 days to six weeks. This vaginal bleeding is known as Lochia and is the regular post child birth process experienced until all excess uterine surface and placenta is eradicated.

Why wear maternity pads?

Because the vaginal bleeding experienced is excessive and heavy, it is essential that women use maternity pads where they would otherwise wear standard menstrual pads or tampons. This is because maternity pads are larger, more absorbable and provide a greater level of comfort to deal with the excessive bleeding that occurs. Women must change their maternity pads often, not only to stay comfortable and fresh, but also to stave off infection.

Could I just continue to wear standard menstrual pads?

There is a considerable negative to continuing to use your standard menstrual pads following child birth. This is because standard pads do not provide as much absorption, are smaller in size and can irritate the skin where stitches are present. Maternity pads are much thicker in size, are longer to cover a larger surface area, and are much softer thus preventing irritation to a sensitive post pregnancy vaginal region.

How many maternity pads are required post pregnancy?

A pregnant woman will need to ensure that they have plenty of maternity pads with them post birth. The excessive bleeding that occurs will mean that regular replacements will be required. The general rule of thumb is to store 2 packets in your maternity bag to begin with and replace when necessary.

Maternity Pads Australia

name: Cocoa Powder
description:
Cocoa powder, celebrated for its rich and intense flavour, is a staple in various culinary delights. From morning smoothies and coffees to cereal, the use of cocoa powder, particularly organic and unsweetened varieties, not only enhances flavour but also offers numerous health benefits.

Unveiling the Origins of Cocoa Powder

Cocoa powder's journey begins with the processing of cacao beans at high temperatures. The beans undergo fermentation and roasting, a critical process that differentiates cocoa powder from cacao powder, which is only fermented and not roasted. The finely ground and sifted product is what we know as natural cocoa powder.

Delving into the Nutritional Profile of Cocoa Powder

With approximately 15 calories per tablespoon (6 grams), unsweetened cocoa powder is a low-calorie addition to various dishes. Its nutritional density, including its rich content of flavonoids and antioxidants, makes it an excellent choice for a health-conscious diet.

Unmasking the Health Benefits of Cocoa Powder

The consumption of organic, unsweetened cocoa powder can benefit individual health when included regularly in the diet. It's known for improving heart health, offering antioxidant properties, enhancing mood, and boosting brain health.

Culinary Explorations with Cocoa Powder: A Versatile Ingredient

Cocoa powder is incredibly versatile. Beyond its common use in desserts, it can be a delightful addition to smoothies, coffees, and even savory dishes, thanks to its rich and intense flavour.

Tempting Recipes Featuring Cocoa Powder

Experimenting with cocoa powder in recipes can be an exciting culinary adventure. For those interested in creating their own cocoa powder, the process involves fermenting cacao beans, drying, roasting, and grinding them—a laborious but rewarding process.

Storing Cocoa Powder for Optimal Quality

To maintain the potent antioxidant properties and rich flavour of cocoa powder, it's crucial to store it properly. A cool, dry place away from direct sunlight is ideal for preserving its quality.

Discover the Difference: Organic Cocoa Powder vs. Cacao Powder

The distinction between cocoa and cacao powders is significant. While both originate from the same plant, the processing methods differ, with cocoa powder undergoing fermentation and roasting, leading to a different flavour and nutritional profile.

Embracing Ethical Sourcing: Fair Trade and Non-GMO Cocoa Powder

Choosing organic, fair trade, and non-GMO cocoa powder not only ensures a quality product but also supports sustainable and ethical farming practices.

Conclusion

Organic cocoa powder offers more than just a rich flavour; it's a nutrient-rich ingredient that can enhance both the taste and health benefits of various dishes. Its versatility in culinary applications, combined with the benefits of ethical sourcing, makes it an essential component of a health-conscious and environmentally aware kitchen.

References

  2. Healthline - Cocoa Powder Health Benefits
  3. NCBI - Cardiovascular Health and Polyphenols

name: Guar Gum
description:
What is Guar Gum?

Many people consume it, but few are aware precisely what is Guar Gum. Originating from the dry regions of Asia and Africa, guar gum is made from legumes known as guar beans. It is a polysaccharide, made up of the sugars mannose and galactose. Most people encounter it as a food additive that is found in many popular processed foods, most notably ice cream, yoghurts, salad dressings and sauces. Its major advantage as a food additive lies in its ability to provide stability and thickness to food and snacks. Guar gum is high in soluble fiber while low in calories.

Where does guar gum come from?

Guar beans are principally grown in India where between 2.3 and 3 million tons of beans are produced annually. This represents about 80% of the world’s guar bean production.  Other commercial levels of guar bean production occur in Pakistan, Africa, Australia and the USA. 

What is guar gum used for?

Guar gum is often used in keto recipes and serves several practical purposes including 

  • Use as an emulsifier or stabiliser, a small amount can help to prevent ingredients from separating or “settling.”

  • Acting as a thickening agent instead of common starches or flours. Guar Gum actually has nearly eight times the thickening capacity as cornstarch.

  • Can help to bind ingredients together and is particularly useful when preparing low carb batters or doughs.

  • Can be used to add texture to a recipe.

The benefits of guar gum

Several studies have provided indications that guar gum can be beneficial to the health of those who consume it. These potential health benefits are:

It may aid digestion and relieve constipation – Due to its high fiber content, guar gum may provide relief to those experiencing constipation by enhancing movement within the intestinal tract. Furthermore, as a prebiotic it can encourage the growth of good bacteria and have a positive impact on the reduction of harmful bacteria within the stomach.

It can lower cholesterol – Prior research conducted in the 1990s found that people with type 2 diabetes that were given guar gum three times a day experienced a reduction in cholesterol levels by up to 7 per cent. The reason is because fiber attacks bile acids that are present in the body causing them to be expelled from the body. The liver then uses up cholesterol to produce more bile acids therefore decreasing a person’s overall cholesterol levels.

It can lower blood sugar levels – Because it contains a high amount of soluble fiber, guar gum can slow the absorption of sugar and lower blood sugar levels. This makes it a potentially advantageous additive for those who suffer from diabetes.

How to use guar gum in baking

Guar gum powder is commonly used for baking purposes, particularly when using gluten free flours. Typically you should add approximately  a tablespoon of guar gum for every cup of gluten free flour when making bread, whereas biscuits or cookies might require as little as a teaspoon per cup of flour.

Where do you buy guar gum?

Guar gum is becoming more sought after as more people switch to gluten free or keto diets. It isn’t necessarily easy to find in local supermarkets and it’s availability may depend upon local store stocking policies. Health food outlets may be another source. However, if you are looking for a reliable supply that has been produced organically, then you need look no further than Buy Organics Online.

Guar Gum Australia

At Buy Organics Online you can purchase guar gum that has been sourced from only the most trusted brands from Australia and internationally. Don’t delay, add this and other great food items to your kitchen pantry today!

name: Calendula Cream
description:
What is calendula cream?

Calendula cream is a cream made from the oil extracted from the marigold flower. Similar in application and use to calendula oil, pure calendula cream is not as heavy and provides a soothing gentle treatment that is widely used to treat dry and chafed skin. 

The cream can be applied to small cuts, chafing, sunburn and minor burns. A thin layer applied three times a day to the affected area after cleaning will usually aid in the healing process. While there is little doubt that using calendula cream as described is effective, there is some confusion as to why it actually works. The accepted view is that chemicals contained within calendula actively stimulate new growth in tissue while simultaneously preventing swelling.

Benefits of Calendula Cream.

Besides assisting with the treatment of minor scrapes and wounds, the cream is known to deliver the following benefits to the skin

  • Acne treatment. Numerous studies have confirmed that calendula oil may be effective in treating acne vulgaris. Applying organic calendula cream to the whole face or to acne prone areas may assist in reducing the incidence of acne.
  • The treatment eczema and psoriasis
  • Calendula cream for babies nappy rash is a soothing agent. Apply a small amount of cream to the affected areas several times per day for best results.

While calendula cream is safe to apply to the skin, it is always best to do a skin patch test before trying any new skin treatment. This ensures that you will reduce the risk of having an allergic reaction.

Is calendula oil good for your face?

After doing a skin patch test and determining that you are not allergic to calendula cream, you can apply it to your face. Many people use calendula oil specifically to treat acne vulgaris outbreaks and rosacea. There are multiple ways that you can choose to apply calendula cream to your face - you can use it as a cleanser, or apply it as a spot treatment to specific areas of your face. Some people also apply a calendula face mask treatment on a weekly basis.

Does calendula lighten skin?

There are some claims that calendula acts as a skin lightener, however, there is little evidence to support this. Calendula cream , however, does repair and soften skin. It is particularly effective in moisturising dry skin and is known to soften skin texture - many of these benefits may actually help the skin to appear lighter.

Is calendula good for eczema?

Calendula is widely recommended and used as an eczema treatment. It is a soothing gentle cream that is known to soothe itchy skin, aid in wound healing, fight bacteria, ease skin irritation and pain. As such, calendula ointment it makes an ideal eczema treatment.

Before applying liberally, it is always best to do a skin patch test to ensure that you are not allergic to calendula.

Calendula cream uses are not limited to humans, if you’ve been wondering, can I use calendula cream on my dog, you most certainly can use it to treat minor cuts, abrasions and insect bites. The application of calendula cream should bring some relief to these ailments fairly quickly. There are some people who will recommend the use of calendula cream to treat internal problems such as chronic colitis and candiadisas. Other than anecdotal accounts, there is little evidence to suggest that these treatments work. In any case calendula cream or oil should never be given as in internal treatment to a pregnant dog.

Where to buy calendula cream?

name: Activated Nuts
description:
Reap the added nutritional benefits by snacking on activated nuts! While nuts are often considered one of the healthier snack options available, the presence of phytic acid minimizes the potential nutritional benefits that this product can provide. Phytic acid binds itself to nutrients thus reducing the consumer’s ability to obtain maximum nutritional benefit. Activated nuts overcome this problem.

What are activated nuts?

Many wonder what are activated nuts? To maximise nutritional benefit, nuts are often activated. The process of activation involves soaking the product in water and salt for a 7 to 12-hour period. The product is then dehydrated at a low temperature for an additional 12 to 24 hours prior to consumption. Activation removes the toxins that are often present that inhibits proper digestion and nutrient absorption.

Are activated nuts better for you?

In a word, yes. Baking Soda Uses

-Used to freshen breath much like a mouthwash.
