name: Black Seed Oil
description:
What is black seed oil?

Obtained from the Nigella Sativa (n. sativa) plant, black seed oil (n. sativa oil) begins life as the seeds of a fruit. Found in Eastern Europe, Western Asia and the Middle East, these wonder seeds have been used for medicinal purposes for centuries with a long history of use dating back to ancient Egypt. It has been used to treat ailments ranging from diarrhea through to hair loss The seeds possess a bitter taste that has often been compared to oregano and is valued as an ingredient in many recipes.. This essential oil can also be found online as black cumin seed oil.

Besides being called black seed oil, the essential oil is also known as kalonji oil, black cumin, black caraway and even black onion seed oil.

Black seed is available in oil, capsules or in seed form. Black seed oil has all the benefits available from the n. sativa plant in liquid form. Organic black seed oil is a natural product that has been obtained from n. sativa plants grown without the aid of synthetic chemicals, harmful pesticides or genetically modified materials.

Wherever possible, we suggest organic black seed oil when it is available.

The oil can be ingested, used for cooking or applied topically according to your specific health needs.

What are black cumin seeds used for?

There are several ways that black cumin seeds can be used. Most commonly, they are used in tablet form to provide health benefits such as reducing blood pressure and alleviating the symptoms of asthma. They can also be added to cooking dishes as a spice in seed form to add flavour. Additionally, black seed oil can be applied to the skin for beauty purposes such as eliminating acne and the softening of skin.

What are the health benefits of Black seed oil?

For many, the biggest appeal of black seed benefits are the health related in that it provides to those who consume it regularly. The black seed oil benefits include:

  • It can reduce hypertension[1] – Taking black cumin seed oil products for a few months has been shown to reduce high blood pressure. N. sativa is known to have demonstrable antioxidant, hypotensive, diuretic and calcium channel blockading properties that make it effective in helping to reduce blood pressure, Clinical trials have shown kalonji or black seed oil to be most effective in helping to reduce blood pressure levels for people exhibiting moderate levels of high blood pressure.
  • Contains powerful antioxidants including thymoquinone [2]and t-anethol. Antioxidants are known to prevent cellular damage from free radicals and oxidants. Research suggests that antioxidants can guard the body against chronic diseases associated with oxidative stress including diabetes and heart disease. The antioxidant thymoquinone in particular has been shown to have powerful anti inflammatory and other health properties. Many nutritionists and biologists see thymoquinone as one of the most powerful antioxidants available. It is considered to be the most beneficial property produced by the nigella sativa plant. Thymoquinone has also been shown to alter molecular and signalling pathways in degenerative diseases.
  • It has been shown to assist in aiding weight loss[3]. Clinical trial studies have shown that black seed supplements may assist in reducing a person's overall BMI (Body Mass Index) Furthermore, the journal of diabetes and metabolic disorders has found that black seed oil can have a role to play in tackling obesity.
  • May help to fight bacteria. Studies have been very promising in this area[4]. One clinical trial showed that black seed oil was effective when applied topically to children suffering staphylococcal infections of the skin. Further studies have shown that Kalonji is effective in fighting MRSA - a bacteria that is resistant to many antibiotics. Further studies need to be conducted in this area , but the initial indicators are that the use of black seed in traditional medicine was justified.
  • It can help maintain healthy cholesterol[5]. Cholesterol is a necessary fat like substance in the body, however too much cholesterol can cause cardiac problems. Clinical trials have shown black seed to be effective in both increasing the good HDL cholesterol while causing a significant reduction in the level of bad ldl cholesterol. Interestingly, black seed or kalonji oil was shown to be more effective in reducing bad levels than the seed itself while the seed helped increase good levels.
  • It is beneficial for asthmatics[6] – The anti-inflammatory properties contained within can reduce inflammation in the airways which is a significant advantage for those suffering from asthma.
  • May help regulate blood sugar levels[7]. A clinical trial has shown that black seed taken over a period of three months greatly reduced average blood sugar, fasting blood sugar and insulin resistance. In 2016 the British Journal of Pharmaceutical research indicated that nigella sativa oil was substantially important in treating diabetes as it enhanced insulin production as well as glucose tolerance. The journal also noted that nigella sativa oil seemed to be responsible for a proliferation of beta cells.
  • N. sativa seed oil may also assist in treating diabetes patients with complications such as neuropathy[8], atherosclerosis and nephropathy
  • A 2013 clinical study[9] showed that diabetic rats when treated with a high dosage of n. sativa oil gained therapeutic effects from the the treatment
  • There is also some scientific evidence to show that n. sativa oil may be helpful in treating liver and kidney disease[10]
  • Can reduce inflammation. Inflammation is a natural response to injury or infection, however persistent inflammation can lead to degenerative diseases such as heart disease and diabetes. Indications are that black seed can help fight inflammation. One clinical study showed that a small sample of test subjects suffering rheumatoid arthritis taking just 1000mg of oil per day showed noticeable improvement after a period of eight weeks. Clinical trials on rats have shown promising results in this area, however further studies are required on human subjects to find exactly how and why black seed is anti-inflammatory.
  • It can ease an upset stomach – Taking the product regularly can help to reduce bloating, gas and ulcers therefore relieving stomach cramps and associated pain. Research in relation to stomach ulcer treatment at this stage has been limited to animal clinical trials, however, the results have been fairly promising.
  • May protect you from liver damage. Studies have shown that kalonji may have an anti-inflammatory effect on damaged liver areas although more research needs to be done.[10]

What are the potential side effects of using black cumin seed oil?

While black cumin (kalonji/black seed) is assessed by health authorities as being likely safe when taken in small quantities as either a food additive or a remedy, there are some situations where care needs to be exercised not to consume too much black seed oil.

There is evidence to show that black cumin seed can slow blood clotting which would make it unwise for people suffering bleeding disorders to consume.

Taking large amounts of kalonji while pregnant is considered unsafe as black seed is thought to slow contractions of the uterus.

As black seed can slow clotting, lower blood pressure and reduce blood sugar, it is recommended that consumption of black seed cease at least two weeks prior to surgery.

Who should not take black seed oil?

Theoretically, black seed oil could cause complications for people suffering low blood pressure or hypoglycemia as intake of the oil could exacerbate these conditions. Close monitoring of blood sugar levels and blood pressure should be undertaken in these cases.

What is black seed oil good for?

If you’re still wondering what is black seed oil good for besides the health benefits, the oil is used for various skin conditions and beauty applications these include

  • Acne treatment by consistently applying a lotion containing 10 percent black seed oil
  • Hair hydration 
  • The reduction of psoriasis and eczema
  • Skin softening
  • Topical application can reduce inflammation and promote faster healing of wounds

How does nigella sativa oil benefits skin and hair?

It is naturally anti bacterial making it an ideal natural remedy for acne.

Topical application of the oil allows it to interact directly with the skin and hair - helping to reduce irritation and redness and making the skin softer.

The ingredients Nigellone and Thymoquinone promote hair health and may help to prevent hair fall and stimulate hair growth. The effect of Thymoquinone in particular on hair has been well documented. The sativa oil is also said to significantly improve scalp health and may even reverse the effects of greying hair - whether this is due to the effect of thymoquinone or to the n. sativa seed itself is unknown.

Black seed oil is best mixed with other natural ingredients like olive oil, honey or coconut oil when applied to the skin or hair.

How do I use black seed oil on my face?

There is much evidence to suggest that using black seed oil (also known as nigella seed oil) in a moisturiser or face mask application can provide a complexion that appears smoother and clearer.

An effective moisturiser can be made by mixing 9 ml of black seed oil with 30 ml of jojoba carrier oil, 30 ml of sweet almond carrier oil, 20 ml of borage carrier oil 15ml of rosehip oil and 6 ml of vitamin E liquid. The mixture should be shaken vigorously to ensure it is blended well. Before applying it, the face should be cleaned then patted dry. Then rub about 7 drops of the mixture in your palms to warm it up before massage it gently into the face with light upward strokes. Care should be taken to avoid the eyes.

A nourishing face mask can be made by combining 1 Tablespoon of black cummin seed oil with 3 tablespoons of raw organic honey and 3 tablespoons of finely ground apricot shell exfoliant. After gently washing the face, apply 1 tablespoon of this paste to the face and gently massage the mixture into the face and neck using a circular motion. Allow the mask to soak into the skin for approximately 10 minutes then use a warm rinse to assist with massaging the mix deeper into the skin while washing off the mask. Then moisturise the skin with two drops of black seed oil.

Can black seed oil regrow hair?

There is some anecdotal evidence to suggest that applying black seed oil to thinning areas of the scalp may help to generate new hair growth. At this stage, although there are plenty of websites claiming success in this area, the evidence is anecdotal only.  There is no dedicated black seed oil for hair, all black seed oil would suffice.

Can you cook with black seed oil or black seed extract?

It is easy to incorporate black seed extract or oil into your cooking. Incorporating black seed extract or black cumin seed oil into your diet will aid digestion and help to improve appetite. You can use it straight by the teaspoon full or you can blend it with other ingredients to make a wonderful dressing.

A simple dressing recipe would include the following ingredients

:1/4 cup of black cumin seed oil

:1/4 cup apple cider vinegar

:1/4 cup of olive oil

: 2 tablespoons of honey

: 2 tablespoons of mustard

: 1 finely chopped garlic clove

Whisk the ingredients together until they are well combined.

The dressing will make a perfect addition to a number of salads and grain based dishes. It can also be used as a vegetable dip. Once made it should be kept in a refrigerated airtight container to keep fresh.

name: Comfrey Cream
description:
Comfrey Cream: A Natural Approach to Aches and Pains (Approach with Caution)

Harnessing nature's soothing power, comfrey cream has been a treasured remedies for centuries. Made from the herb Symphytum Officinale, this cream eases inflammation and alleviates pain on contact. Packed with anti-inflammatory compounds and allantoin, it's no wonder comfrey cream finds favor amongst individuals seeking relief from aches and pains.

When to Consider Comfrey Cream:

  • Bruises and bumps: Whether you've tripped over the curb or bumped into a doorway, comfrey cream can help tame swelling and ease discomfort (reference 1).
  • Sprains and strains: From a twisted ankle to a pulled muscle, comfrey cream can offer gentle relief and support the healing process (reference 2).
  • Wounds and gout: While not a substitute for proper medical care, comfrey cream may help wounds heal faster and soothe the pain associated with gout flare-ups (reference 3).
  • Back pain and osteoarthritis: Research suggests comfrey cream can be surprisingly effective in easing the discomfort of back pain and osteoarthritis (references 4, 5).

A Legacy of Healing:

The soothing properties of comfrey have been lauded in traditional medicine for over 200 years. Even today, its analgesic and anti-inflammatory qualities are recognized, making it a valuable addition to many natural medicine cabinets. However, approaching this powerful remedy with caution and awareness is crucial.

A Word of Caution:

Though natural, comfrey cream isn't without its potential downsides. Due to its alkaloid content, it should never be ingested and kept strictly out of reach of children. Even topical application allows for some alkaloid absorption, so always use small amounts for short periods (no longer than 2-3 weeks, reference 6). Consulting your doctor before using comfrey cream is paramount, especially if you have any existing health conditions like liver or kidney disease, are pregnant or breastfeeding, or take medications that may interact with it (references 7, 8).

Unlocking the Healing Potential:

Used wisely, comfrey cream can offer a range of benefits, especially for wound healing. Studies have shown its effectiveness in treating arthritis, back pain, and ankle sprains. However, it's important to remember that research is still ongoing, and its efficacy for other conditions requires further investigation.

Finding the Right Comfrey Cream:

At Buy Organics Online, we understand the importance of quality and safety. That's why we offer a curated selection of comfrey creams sourced from only the most trusted manufacturers. Explore our range and discover the soothing potential of nature's pain-relief treasure.

Seek Expert Guidance:

Remember, while comfrey cream can be a beneficial remedy, prioritizing your health and safety is crucial. Always consult your doctor before using it, and exercise caution and responsible application. For deeper research and expert insights, explore these credible medical resources:

  • National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3491633/
  • Mayo Clinic: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3491633/

By choosing comfrey cream with awareness and prioritizing responsible use, you can tap into its potential benefits while ensuring your well-being.

name: Carob Powder
description:
What is carob powder

Made from the dried fruit of the carob tree, carob powder is an all natural sweet tasting alternative to cocoa powder. Carob trees are now grown all over the world although originally were grown by the ancient Greeks. Carob is similar in flavor to chocolate but tastes sweeter r. The powder’s texture is a lot like cocoa powder. It is best used when added to desserts, drinks, and baked recipes.

One of its great advantages is that due to its natural sweetness there is no need to add additional sweeteners to it. Interestingly carob powder does not contain high levels of the dog and cat toxic compound theobromine, making it a safe treat to give to your four legged friends.Generally considered safe to eat, carob powder should not be consumed in large quantities by pregnant women.

What is carob powder made from

Specifically, carob powder is made from the dried pulp of the carob pod (after discarding the inedible seeds). Once the pulp has been dried it is roasted and then ground into powder that has a texture similar to cocoa powder.

How to use carob powder

Carob powder can be used as a chocolate or cocoa substitute in any recipe. When doing so, you may need to cut down on the amount of sugar specified as the natural sweetness of carob will sweeten the taste. As a broad rule of thumb you should substitute about three tablespoons of carob powder for each square ounce of chocolate.

Some great ways to make use of raw organic carob powder in your daily diet are to:

  • Use carob powder to  naturally sweeten smoothies

  • Use it as a topping on ice cream or yoghurt by sprinkling the powder over the top

  • Try the powder to make a hot drink as an alternative to hot chocolate

  • Use it to make brownies, pancakes or any other type cake

Benefits of using organic raw carob powder

The benefits of using carob powder are summarised below;

  • Low fat substitute for chocolate, Carob powder contains virtually no fat although it does contain some sugar. To illustrate this -1 cup of carob powder contains 51 grams of sugar and under one gram of fat. By contrast 1 cup of choc chips has 50 grams of fat and 92 grams of sugar,

  • Low salt content

  • Contains high levels of calcium 

  • Has no oxalates (Cocoa and chocolate do which prevents the absorption of calcium

  • Gluten and caffeine free

  • Excellent source of antioxidants

Ok, so now you must be asking, where can I buy carob powder? We’ve got the answer for you.

name: Linseed
description:
What is linseed

Linseed, sometimes called flax or flaxseed is said to be one of the richest sources of Omega 3 fatty acids, containing nearly twice the amount of Omega 3 as fish oil. Linseed is a suitable food source for everybody, as it sourced from plants - making it perfect for vegans, vegetarians and meat eaters alike.

Linseed has a slightly nutty flavour and is great for cereal and yoghurt toppings or smoothie additives. To gain the maximum benefit from linseed, it is suggested that the seeds be chewed so that the body can absorb all the goodness. It can also be consumed as an oil. Regardless of how you choose to use, it linseed and raw linseed should be kept refrigerated.

What is the difference between flaxseed and linseed?

Essentially flaxseed and linseed are the same thing. They both have the same nutritional value. What confusion there is comes from the Americanisation of our language, where the Americans call all forms of the plant flax. The only distinction is that flaxseed plants are larger and more often used commercially to produce rope and linen whereas linseed plants are harvested for their seeds and creating oil. In practical terms, however, the two words are interchangeable.

Benefits of eating linseed

In addition to the benefits contained with omega 3, linseed has been shown to have health benefits. These include:

  • Helps to lower high blood cholesterol and lower high blood pressure.

  • Helps to reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease by lowering blood pressure and normalising heartbeat.

  • Helps to reduce the inflammatory effects of arthritis

  • Helps kidneys to remove excess water

  • Helps to improve skin conditions

  • Helps to improve stamina and increase vitality

  • Omega 3 acids help to prevent the production of toxic biochemicals produced in times of stress

  • Improved lung function and potential asthma relief

  • Helps to improve blood sugar levels

What do you use linseed oil for?

Linseed oil is essentially a carrier oil that has practical uses in wood finishing, putty, paint binding and gilding. It is also recognised as a nutritional food supplement.

name: Flaxseed Meal
description:
What is flaxseed meal?

Flaxseed meal is ground flaxseed. Flaxseed is a nutrition powerhouse containing 7.8 grams of fibre per ounce. However, it is difficult to digest. Grinding flaxseed into meal keeps all the fibre and nutrition of flaxseed but is more easily digested.

Flaxseed is a product of the ancient crop, flax, which was grown in Egypt and Asia. It has been used for centuries and has a prominent role in Ayurvedic medicine.

Flaxseed meal, otherwise known as ground or milled flaxseeds, is rich in fibre, omega-3 fatty acids and protein. Gluten-free and low in carbohydrates, this product is a great breakfast choice for those looking for high nutritional content to fuel them for the day ahead. It contains a lovely nutty flavour and provides many health and nutritional benefits to those individuals who regularly consume it.

What is the difference between flaxseed powder and flaxseed meal?

There is very little difference between the terms flaxseed meal and flaxseed powder. For all intents and purposes, the two terms appear to be interchangeable. 

What are the key benefits of flaxseed meal?

If you are wondering what are the benefits of flaxseed meal, there are several key benefits that consumption of flaxseed meal can provide. These benefits include:

  • It is high in fibre. Flaxseed possesses a ridiculously high level of soluble and insoluble fibre. Adding fibre to your diet will help to keep you feeling full. It will also help to reduce the chances of contracting heart disease and cancers associated with digestion. It will also alleviate constipation. When adding flaxseed to your diet, it is best to start with minimal amounts (say a half a teaspoon initially) to avoid any discomfort with diarrhea.
  • It is a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids. Foods that contain a high level of omega-3 fatty acids help to keep the functioning of nerves, cells and membranes in balance.
  • It is a gluten-free product.
  • Contains lignans that demonstrate antioxidant activity that helps to promote health and fight disease.
  • May help to reduce blood sugar levels when taken regularly, however, studies in this area have shown conflicting results.
  • Helps reduce high blood pressure.
  • Thanks to the high level of fibre and healthy fats that flaxseed meal contains, it has the added benefit of leaving you feeling fuller for longer. 

How to use flaxseed meal?

All that goodness is waiting to be tapped into but the question is how to get the full benefit of flaxseed in a normal diet.

Adding flaxseed meal into your daily diet is relatively easy. The fact that flaxseed meal has the capacity to withstand intense heat makes it possible to add to both sweet and savoury dishes. The nutty flavour of flaxseed meal adds lots of interest to breakfast cereal. It can also be sprinkled over dishes as varied as fruit salads and mac and cheese. It also makes a worthy substitute for breadcrumbs.

Three easy ways to use flaxseed meal are: 

  1. Incorporate flax meal into your baking. You can swap out several ingredients for flax meal. Some easy substitutes are-: replacing half cup of flour with flaxseed meal, substituting a tablespoon of flax and there tablespoons of water for an egg or swapping three tablespoons of flaxseed meal for a tablespoon of margarine, oil or butter
  2. Add to smoothies
  3. Mix into breakfast dishes like yoghurt and grain dishes like oatmeal
  4. Add to homemade granola

name: Arrowroot
description:
Arrowroot

Arrowroot has seen a growth in popularity in recent years as it is a popular gluten free substitute for flour.

What is arrowroot?

Arrowroot is a product that has been extracted from the roots of the South American Maranta arundinaceae plant. It is a small herb with wide leaves that can often grow to a height of 5 feet. Arrowroot comes as a powder. To create this powder the roots are washed then dried and reduced to a starch which is then dried leaving us with arrowroot powder. The powder is clear white and contains no odour. It is most commonly used as a thickening agent in food products.
It is an effective thickener and it possesses a neutral  flavor. It also can be used to add a glossy finish to food. It ticks many of the health boxes being, gluten-free, vegan, and paleo-friendly. 

What is arrowroot starch?

Arrowroot starch is an interchangeable term for arrowroot or arrowroot powder. Theta ll essentially mean the same thing.

What is arrowroot flour made from

The flour is essentially made from the milky liquid extracted  from crushed arrowroot tubers. The liquid is then passed through a sieve to separate pure starch from “wet” starch. The wet starch is allowed to dry and forms the powder known as arrowroot powder.

The health benefits of arrowroot powder

Arrowroot powder can provide many health benefits for those people who regularly consume it. These benefits include:

  • It is gluten-free. Because arrowroot is gluten-free it makes for a perfect product for those that have corn and wheat allergies. It is commonly used in gluten-free cakes, breads and is the ideal substitute for wheat flour.

  • It is a great product to consume during pregnancy. Arrowroot possesses a rich source of folates

  • It is high in potassium. This makes it extremely beneficial because potassium.

name: Paleo Muesli
description:
Embrace the Sunrise with Paleo Muesli: Start Your Day the Paleo Way!

There's nothing quite like a steaming bowl of muesli to greet the morning sun. Packed with wholesome goodness, it fuels your body and spirit, leaving you feeling ready to tackle the day. But for those embracing the paleo lifestyle, regular oats are a no-go. The answer? Look no further than paleo muesli, your gateway to a healthy, grain-free breakfast feast!

Unwind the clock to ancestral bliss:

Imagine a time before pre-packaged nasties, when whole, unprocessed foods reigned supreme. That's the essence of paleo - a return to our roots, where vibrant ingredients nourish both body and mind. This isn't just a diet; it's a mindful embrace of what Mother Nature intended for us to eat.

Paleo muesli: A nutritional bounty in every bite:

Ditch the sugary cereals and artificial sweeteners. Paleo muesli bursts with naturally sweet fruits, crunchy nuts, and protein-rich seeds. It's:

  • A healthier choice: Ditch the hidden nasties of most cereals. Paleo muesli's low sugar and calorie count makes it a guilt-free way to start your day.
  • Fibre champion: Get your gut singing! Bursting with fibre, paleo muesli keeps you feeling full and satisfied, curbing unhealthy snacking throughout the day.
  • Beta-glucan bonanza: This mighty ingredient, found in paleo muesli, helps lower bad cholesterol and keeps your heart happy.
  • Naturally filling: The nutrient-dense bounty in each bowl keeps you satiated, eliminating mid-morning hunger pangs.

But what sets paleo muesli apart?

Forget oats! This grain-free wonder celebrates a symphony of other delicious ingredients. Think crunchy nuts, tropical flakes, sun-kissed berries, and a sprinkle of nutritious seeds. Every bite is a burst of flavour and texture, all while staying true to paleo principles.

Paleo perks in every spoonful:

By going grain-free, you unlock a world of benefits:

  • Paleo-perfect: Embrace the ancestral way with a breakfast that aligns perfectly with your dietary choices.

name: Pepitas
description:
What are Pepitas – One of nature’s nutritional superstars

For those wondering what are Pepitas (also known as pepita seeds), they are the little seeds that originate from the centre of specific types of pumpkins. Otherwise known as pumpkin seeds, they are a tremendous source of essential nutrients and possess the added benefit of tasting delicious. Popular in Mexican cuisine, they are incredibly versatile in how they can be prepared and are a welcome addition to a wide variation of dishes. Possessing a thick edible shell, they are generally roasted prior to consumption.

What is the difference between pumpkin seeds and pepitas?

Although the terms are often interchanged, there is a difference between pumpkin seeds and pepitas. Pumpkin seeds generally white or cream colored and have a tough outer shell. On the other hand pepitas are small and green seeds without a hull. They are found in specific types of pumpkin like Styrian or oilseed pumpkins

Pepitas benefits

Not only delicious, pumpkin seeds contain some wonderful benefits for those lucky enough to consume them on a regular basis. If you’ve been wondering, are pepitas good for you, they most certainly are. Just a quarter of a cup of pepitas  contains 150 calories, almost 10 grams of healthy plant protein, 15 grams of healthy fats and is packed full of other nutrients. 

So, what are the health benefits of pepitas?

  • They are high in magnesium. This is significant because magnesium has been shown to control blood pressure levels, while also improving overall heart health.

  • They are rich in zinc. This is important because zinc boosts immunity to a range of illnesses, enhances sleep, improves mood and can elevate sexual functioning in males.

  • They are a great source of omega-3 fatty acids. Omega-3 fatty acids can have a positive effect on reducing inflammation in the body.

  • They contain a high amount of tryptophan. This is an amino acid that your body can convert into serotonin and then a sleep hormone known as melatonin. The result is a better night’s sleep, especially if the pumpkin seeds are consumed with two hours of bedtime.

  • It contains natural phytoestrogens. Research have shown that the presence of phytoestrogens in food can decrease blood pressure, hot flashes, joint pain and other symptoms of menopause experienced by women.

What is a substitute for pepitas

Depending on the recipe, it may be possible to substitute ordinary pumpkin seeds for pepitas - particularly if they’re being used as a garnish to a dish. Other substitutes that can be used include squash and sunflower seeds.

Pepitas Australia

name: Sunflower Seeds
description:
Sunflower seeds

Full of hearty goodness, sunflower seeds originate from the yellow coloured sunflower. Small and edible, these seeds are mainly grey or green in colour. Historically, these seeds were cultivated as far back as 3200 B.C and long used for the sustenance that they provide to consumers.

What do sunflower seeds look like?

Ripened sunflower seeds usually have a black and white striped external shell or hull.

How to eat sunflower seeds

Because you want to make sure that you do not digest the shell, there is a specific way as to how to eat sunflower seeds. Historically, the most popular method, made famous by US baseballers, is to place about 20 or so into your mouth. Here, you keep them on one side between your gum and cheek, before cracking the shell with your teeth, rolling the seed around in your mouth and carefully spitting the shell out. Nowadays, however, manufacturers have removed this need and many products come unshelled and ready for consumption.

How many calories in sunflower seeds?

Just how many calories are in sunflower seeds will depend upon how you choose to consume them.According to the USDA nutrient database a quarter cup of 

  • Dry roasted sunflower seeds contains 186 calories

  • Raw sunflower seeds contains 204 calories

  • Seeds with edible hulls has just over 33 calories

  • Roasted in oil contains 200 calories

Benefits of sunflower seeds

There are some tremendous health advantages that come with consumption of this product. The benefits of sunflower seeds include:

  • It reduces the risk of heart disease. Because sunflower seeds possess a high amount of Vitamin E, they can have a positive effect on reducing heart disease risks. This is because vitamin E can reduce inflammation which, in turn, reduces the risk of heart disease, stroke and other serious afflictions.

  • It can help to strengthen bones. Sunflower seeds have a high level of magnesium. This is a trace mineral that most Australians are deficient in. Magnesium can help to increase calcium in the body and is effective in preventing conditions relating to a loss of bone density such as osteoporosis.

  • It can help maintain appropriate blood sugar levels. Frequent consumption of seeds and grains has been proven to help balance blood sugar levels which reduces the likelihood of developing diabetes.

  • It can minimize the risk of developing thyroid disease. The presence of selenium that is found in this seed can prevent hypothyroidism. This is because this condition is largely caused by the lack of selenium.

What are sunflower seeds good for?

With all the benefits available from sunflower seeds, they have to be good for a variety of purposes..and they are. Sunflower seeds are good for

  • Providing a healthy snack - the seeds can be munched on directly, providing a healthy alternative to sugary sweets.

  • Can be used in a variety of recipes to add body and fibre to a variety of dishes and salads. 

  • Can be toasted to add variety to snacks or to be sprinkled on other foods.

Sunflower seeds Australia

Where to buy sunflower seeds

Sunflower seeds  are widely available in Australian supermarkets and health food stores. However, if you are looking for quality natural sunflower seeds that have been grown organically without the use of harmful pesticides or chemicals, you need to visit the Buty Organics Online website.

name: Jackfruit
description:
Jackfruit Australia

At Buy Organics Online there are a range of jackfruit Australia products available for purchase that have been sourced from the most trusted brands in the marketplace. With a delicious flavour and great health benefits, this is a product well worth adding to the kitchen pantry. Don’t delay, purchase from Buy Organics Online today!

Benefits of eating jackfruit

This remarkable tropical fruit is packed with nutrients, fibre and antioxidants. Just two cups of this fruit contains 350 calories and the following assortment of vitamins and minerals.

  • Six grams of fiber

  • 5.6 grams of protein

  • 20% of recommended daily vitamin A intake

  • 36% of recommended daily vitamin C intake

  • 22% of recommended daily riboflavin intake

  • 30% of recommended daily magnesium intake

  • 28% of recommended daily potassium intake

  • 30% of recommended daily copper intake

  • 32% of recommended daily manganese intake

Jackfruit seeds are known to be particularly nutritious.

All that nutrition provides the human body with the following benefits:

  • Boosts the immune system, having antioxidants that help combat free radicals and good levels of vitamin C to boost immunity against cold and flu.[1]

  • The high dietary fiber content boosts digestion and helps to prevent constipation.[2]

  • The fruit contains phytonutrients like isoflavone and lignans.

  • Has a lower glycaemic load than wheat or rice but is still able to boost energy levels significantly without affecting blood sugar  levels.[3] This energy boost is derived from vitamin B and  vitamin B6

  • The potassium contained within the fruit will help to protect coronary health by regulating blood pressure, and helping to reduce the risk of stroke or heart disease. Potassium is known to counter the effects of sodium and reduce tension in the walls of blood vessels, thereby lowering blood pressure [1]

  • Good for eyesight as it contains a mix of vitamin A, beta-carotene, zeaxanthin and lutein which all help to maintain vision.

  • High calcium levels help to promote bone health.[2]

Besides the health and nutritional benefits, the delicious fruit has some benefits that make it part of the solution for an economically sustainable future.

As one jackfruit tree can produce up to 200 pieces of fruit each year it compares more than favourably to meat as a source of food. Jackfruit is readily available in many parts of the developing world and increasing its consumption could help to solve potential future food shortages.

Using Jackfruit in your daily menu

This versatile fruit is often featured in vegetarian recipes and vegan recipes. Your typical jackfruit recipe will often liken the finished product to pulled or shredded pork in texture and many recipes claim that a meat eater will not notice any difference from many meat meals.

Popular menu options  include taco, BBQ, salad and curry options. It also has been known to make a great addition to a natural smoothie.

Here are two popular jackfruit recipes.

BBQ jackfruit burgers with avocado coleslaw

With all the texture of a traditional meat burger these BBQ burgers are easy to prepare. For the burger you will need 2 X500 gram cans of  green jackfruit in water as opposed to syrup or brine; 2tbsp extra virgin olive oil;1 diced onion; 2 crushed garlic cloves; 1 tsp paprika (smoked preferably); 1 tsp dried oregano;a pinch of chilli flakes, 1 cup of BBQ sauce and 1/2 tsp ground cumin. 6 burger buns, lettuce leaves.

For the coleslaw you will need: 3 cups of raw shredded cabbage, 1 1/2 cups of shredded carrot, 1 1/4 cups of diced sweet onion, 1/4 cup of lemon juice, 1 tsp of salt , 2 large peeled and pitted avocados

To make the burger patties, drain the jackfruit then use two forks to separate jackfruit pieces and remove any seeds.  Put olive oil in a pan on medium heat and add onion and garlic. Fry until tender then add jackfruit and other herbs and spices. Cook for fifteen minutes.

While the burger mix is cooking, you can prepare the slaw as follows. Combine carrot, onion and cabbage in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl mash enough avocado to make 1 cup of creamy pulp then add lemon juice and other seasonings. Once thoroughly mixed add the avocado mash to the large mixing bowl. Dice/shred remaining avocado and add to coleslaw which is now ready for serving.

When the burger mix is cooked, halve buns, top with lettuce and add mix to each bun. Serve with a side serve of slaw.

Jackfruit tacos with pickled vegetables

This recipe uses Upton's natural sweet and smoky jackfruit. One 300 gram packet will suffice. Other ingredients required for pickles,one cup of white vinegar, 1/2 cup of water, 1tbsp salt, 2tbsp sugar, 1 thinly sliced red onion, for tacos: 12 corn tortillas, 2 peeled and grated carrots, 1/2 cup of pickled jalapenos, Avocado salsa/salsa Verde or other salsa according to taste.

To make pickles: Heat water and vinegar in saucepan on stovetop then stir in sugar and salt and wait until fully dissolved. Place onion slices in a jar and pour the warm brine mixture over the top. Allow this mixture to cool and stand overnight. The mixture can be safely stored in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.

To make Tacos:  Pan heat jackfruit for ten minutes and warm tortillas in the oven. When ready, spoon jack fruit onto tortillas and add pickles and salsa.

What is jackfruit?

Tremendously versatile, high in magnesium, vitamin V6 and rich in antioxidants, jackfruit is a highly nutritious choice for the food lover looking for something a little different. So, what is jackfruit and where does it come from? For starters, it is the largest fruit tree in the world.. It is extremely nutritious and can be used in a long list of meat alternative food products. The plant is a member of the breadfruit family and the fruit itself is quite large growing up to three feet in length and weighing up to 100 pounds. The oblong green fruit has a fleshy exterior. When cut open the inside of the fruit reveals many edible yellow bulbs all joined at the core of the fruit. The seeds of the plant are also edible.

Jackfruit trees are amazingly productive. One plant can produce over 200 fruit in a single year.

The jackfruit tree is found in many Asian countries across Southeast Asia, particularly and is the national fruit of Bangladesh. The fruit is now grown commercially in parts of Australia and the United States such as South Florida where a tropical climate exists.

What does jackfruit taste like?

Because it is a tropical fruit many are unfamiliar with, many ask what does jackfruit taste like? Well, the most common description is that jackfruit is very similar in taste to pulled pork. Others have described a taste like pear, pineapple, banana and papaya. Young jackfruit is not as sweet and its flavour has a more neutral quality. The unripe jackfruit is often canned and advertised as green jackfruit highlighting its relative lack of sweetness. Whatever the description of the taste, one thing is for certain… it is delicious!

How to eat jackfruit?

Another common question asked is how to eat jackfruit? Well as mentioned above there are numerous ways. It can be eaten raw and fresh, added as an ingredient into wintery soups. It is also a common ingredient in chips, ice creams, jams and juices. But most commonly people add it to a sandwich due to the delicious pulled pork taste that it can provide for the vegan and vegetarian.

Does jackfruit taste like meat?

As we’ve already mentioned, Jack fruit has a taste that has been likened to pulled pork. Many advocates for jackfruit believe that the secret to making this fruit a meat substitute is the preparation of complementary sauces and dressings including barbecue sauce, tomato sauce, paprika and the like.

While it is often used as a meat substitute, raw jackfruit can be consumed as a dessert with ice cream and some have likened this taste to juicy fruit chewing gum.

Is canned jackfruit healthy?

As with most canned foods, the canning process may cause the food to lose some of its goodness. However, if there are no other alternatives, canned jackfruit besides being a good source of protein, still represents a healthy food choice.

Can I Buy Jackfruit?

Jackfruit is becoming more readily available in Australia as its popularity rises and its versatility becomes more widely appreciated. You can buy ripe jackfruit whole from your local grocery store , however in most cases, a whole fruit is an awful lot of fruit to eat. Other options are canned or in natural packaged form provided by organic companies such as  Upton’s natural.     

Where to buy jackfruit?

You can buy organic Jackfruit Australia through Buy Organics Online.

How much does jackfruit cost?

The cost of fresh jackfruit will rise and fall with the laws of supply and demand similarly to other fruits. The best way to buy jackfruit initially is to purchase a small supply through Buy Organics Online. 300 gram packets of jackfruit can currently be purchased for under $10.

name: Besan Flour
description:
What is Besan Flour?

Besan flour is sometimes mistaken for chickpea flour but is ground from Chana dal or split brown chickpeas, whereas chickpea flour is made from white chickpeas. Besan or Gram flour as it is commonly called is a staple ingredient in many Indian recipes. The flour is gaining popularity across the world as a gluten free alternative to wheat-based flour. The words Besan flour, chickpea flour and bean flour are interchangeable in many recipes, although there is some difference in the texture.

Besan flour is a finely ground flour that has a similar taste to chickpea flour. It usually needs less water than chickpea flour to make a batter of the same consistency.

Is there a difference between Besan and chickpea flours?

While very similar, there are some differences between the two flours. Chickpea flour, or garbanzo bean flour is made from white chickpeas. Besan or gram flour is made from split brown chickpeas. Besan is a finer flour and will require less water than chickpea flour.

What are the health benefits of using besan flour?

A brief summary of the benefits of Besan flour is listed below.

  • Besan flour is loaded with vitamins and minerals including thiamine, magnesium, iron, phosphate, copper and manganese. Just 92 grams of flour contains an adult’s daily requirement of folate as well as ten grams of fibre.
  • Contains antioxidants known as polyphenols these antioxidants have been shown to reduce free radicals and in some cases reverse the damage caused to the body. This is particularly the case with plant-based polyphenols(1)
  • Contains significantly fewer calories than wheat-based flour allowing you to eat the same size portions and reduce calorie intake - this could assist with weight loss as maintaining portion sizes while reducing calorie intake appears to be an effective strategy. (2)
  • As Besan flour is made from legumes, it may help to reduce the feelings of hunger and promote feelings of fullness. Some research in this area appears to confirm this(3)
  • Low GI food which may result in decreased blood sugar levels compared to wheat-based flours. Chickpea flour in all its forms contains roughly half the carbohydrate levels of white wheat flour. (4)
  • Is a significantly higher source of fibre than wheat based flours. Additionally, at least some of this fibre comes in the form of resistant starch which remains undigested until it reaches the large intestine,making all forms of chickpea flour a potentially healthy influence on gut bacteria.(5)
  • Contains higher protein levels than other flours, making them an excellent protein source for vegans (6)
  • Gluten free flour making it a worthy substitute for wheat flour. Besan flour is considered to behave in very similar ways when used for baking.

How to use Besan flours?

As with any chickpea flour, gram flour is particularly versatile. It can be used as a binding agent for burgers and fritters. It also makes an ideal thickener for sauces, soups and gravies. In fact, wherever a recipe calls for wheat flour, any type of chickpea flour will work pretty well. Think about using it to make flatbreads or pancakes.

What does Besan flour taste like?

Like most other flours, all chickpea flour (including Besan) is pretty much tasteless. Flours will tend to absorb the flavour of other ingredients and take on that taste.

How long will Besan flour last?

If kept in an airtight container, the flour should last for at least sis months.

Where can I buy Besan flour?

Our products have been sourced from highly regarded ethical suppliers within the flour industry. Now you can switch to a healthier more nutritious type of flour that can be used in many recipes just as same as wheat-based flour. Experience the positive effects of flour & meals products by purchasing from Buy Organics Online today.

name: Extra Virgin Olive Oil
description:
What is extra virgin olive oil

Have you ever wondered what is extra virgin olive oil? Well, basically olive oil comes in two forms: unrefined and refined. The difference between olive oil and extra virgin olive oil is simple. The refined (olive oil) variety is altered to remove small flaws that make it more attractive to buyers, whereas the unrefined (extra virgin) variety is oil in its purest form. While refined oils lose the important antioxidants and anti-inflammatories, unrefined oils maintain these important properties. This makes extra virgin olive oil a much healthier option for consumers.

Extra virgin olive oil benefits

As such, there are some important advantages that a consumer can derive from consuming olive oil in its purest form. The extra virgin olive oil benefits include:

  • It can protect against diabetes. Extra virgin olive oil can help to regulate and balance insulin levels therefore providing great benefits to those at risk of developing diabetes.
  • It can protect against cognitive decline. Because this product is high in monosaturated fats it can slow down cognitive decline that is associated with diseases such as dementia and Alzheimer’s.
  • It boosts your immune system. This product contains a rich number of antioxidants that are essential for the protection of your immune system and can help stave off infections.
  • It can relieve pain. This product contains oleocanthal, which has anti-inflammatory properties and acts much like ibuprofen. Because inflammation can result in several diseases, anti-inflammatory agents such as oleocanthal can tremendously reduce the risk of such diseases while also reducing pain experienced in day to day life.
  • It can provide positive skin benefits. Extra virgin olive oil adds a protective coating to the skin when applied naturally or consumed, this has been shown to improve skin damage and provide anti-aging benefits.

name: Rice Flour
description:
White and Brown Rice Flour

Available in both white and brown rice flour forms, this sensational flour product is ideal for those looking to avoid wheat and gluten. It is made from milled rice and has long been a staple food for those in Japan, Southeast Asia and parts of Southern India. It is an extremely popular ingredient in soups and pasta sauces because of its ability to prevent liquid from separating. It also provides some handy health benefits for those who choose to consume it.

What is rice flour?

Rice flour is made much like other flours by grinding the rice grain down into a powder. Exactly how the flour is made will determine how healthy it is.
The grain has three distinct components, the bran, germ and endosperm. Rice flour is made by separating these three components and grinding them. How much of each component is included in the final product determines how it is classified. Whole grain rice flour contains all three components of the rice kernel. Whole flours have  reduced levels of bran and germ, while white rice flours generally only contains the endosperm.

What is rice flour used for?

Rice flour is generally used for baking and acts as a worthy substitute for wheat based flours. It is worth remembering that rice flour will need to be used in combination with other gluten free flours and starches to achieve a similar effect to all purpose flour. Most gluten free recipes that recommend rice flour will provide the right ratio of complementary  ingredients to achieve the desired effect.

How much rice flour to replace wheat flour?

The answer to this question will depend upon how you intend to use the flour. If you are using rice flour as a thickening agent in soup or gravy, you can safely use very similar amounts. However, when baking the answer is not so straightforward and may require some experimentation unless working with a recipe that specifically states the use of rice flour. Generally to substitute rice flour for all purpose flour you will need a mixture of rice flour, potato starch, tapioca flour and xanthan gum. 

The health benefits of rice flour

There are some great health benefits that come with the consumption of rice flour on a semi-regular basis. These benefits include:

  • It is a great gluten-free choice. Because rice flour is made using a gluten-free grain, it is a solid choice for those who have gluten intolerances or suffer from celiac disease. Gluten is most commonly found in grain products, such as wheat. These wheat products are often used in many dishes and this is less than ideal for those with intolerances. This can result in severe digestive problems. Rice flour offers the perfect alternative for these people.

  • It can lower cholesterol and maintain blood sugar levels. Rice flour contains an impressive amount of insoluble fibre. This type of fibre may help lower cholesterol and maintain blood sugar levels making it an ideal product for those at risk of heart disease and at risk of developing type-2 diabetes.

  • It may help improve liver functioning. Rice flour contains choline and this is an important macronutrient that can help the body to remove triglycerides and cholesterol from out of the liver to other parts of the body. This in turn leads to the individual maintaining a healthier liver than would otherwise be the case.

What to cook with rice flour

name: Spelt Flour
description:
Spelt Flour

Spelt Flour is a cereal grain that belongs to the wheat family, but interestingly, is not wheat at all. While it has the same genus as wheat, it originates from a different species altogether. It is an ancient grain that has been used for centuries but fell out of favour in the 19th century. It has made a comeback in recent times, largely due to the need for people to find alternatives to wheat due to intolerances.

Is Spelt Flour gluten-free?

Here is where people can get a little confused. Many ask if it is a wheat alternative, does this mean that spelt flour is gluten free? Well, no. While it is an effective alternative for those that suffer wheat intolerances, for those that suffer from celiac disease and other gluten allergies it needs to be avoided. You see, the gluten in traditional wheat products are made up of equal parts glutenin and gliadin. Glutenin provides elasticity, while gliadin provides stretchiness. With spelt flour there is a higher amount of gliadin as opposed to glutenin. This means that while it does contain gluten, it contains less than wheat and is therefore a good option for those looking to cut down on their gluten consumption. But again, it needs to be avoided by those that suffer from celiac disease and gluten allergies.

Spelt flour Australia

At Buy Organics Online you can access a range of spelt flour products that have been sourced from the most trusted brands from Australia and around the world. Great for those with intolerances to wheat or looking to reduce the amount of gluten in their diets. Don’t delay purchase this and other flour & meals products from Buy Organics Online today!

name: Sorghum Flour
description:
What is Sorghum Flour

A lot of people ask what is sorghum flour? Put simply, it is an ancient cereal grain that is native to parts of Africa and Australia. The plant that sorghum flour is extracted from is a member of the plant family known as Panicoideae. It is considered a versatile food source but is most commonly grown in commercial quantities for use as a gluten-free flour alternative. Either beige or white in colour, sorghum flour is considered mild-tasting and sweet in flavour.

The benefits of sorghum flour

If you have been wondering what are the health benefits of sorghum, there are some tremendous health benefits that come with using sorghum flour. These benefits include:

  • It is a gluten-free flour alternative. It is an excellent substitute for wheat flour and the ideal baking ingredient for those who cannot tolerate gluten such as those with celiac disease.

  • It contains no genetically modified ingredients. Foods that contain genetically modified ingredients, such as wheat flour, have been linked to learning disabilities, digestive issues and inflammation.

  • It is high in fibre. Because of this, sorghum flour is great for overall digestive and cardiovascular health.

  • It is a solid source of antioxidants. Where foods have a high source of antioxidants there can be tremendous benefits in relating to reducing the risks of diabetes, heart disease and some neurological diseases.

  • Sorghum has high nutritional value and is a wonderful source of vitamins, minerals and protein as well as being rich in fiber. 

  • It can help provide balance to blood sugar levels. Sorghum flour is low in GI which means that it slows the level of which sugar is absorbed into the blood stream. This is extremely helpful for anyone who suffers from diabetes.

So, is sorghum flour safe for celiacs.

Sorghum flour is gluten free and therefore should be safe for celiacs. However, it is important to check the labelling on sorghum products to ensure that the labelling states that the flour is gluten free. If this label is not present, it may indicate that some cross contamination has occurred either in the harvesting or packaging process.

Can I use sorghum flour instead of flour

Sorghum flour makes an excellent baking substitute for flour, there are, however, several things to keep in mind when using sorghum flour instead of traditional flours. As sorghum is gluten free, you will need to use a binding agent when baking with it. Binding agents that work include  egg whites, xanthan gum, gelatin or cornstarch. Alternately you can mix sorghum flour with sa starch flour such as arrowroot or sweet rice flour to attain similar results.

As a broad rule of thumb you can substitute sorghum flour for flour on a cup or cup basis. When adding binder to sorghum, half a teaspoon per cup will suffice for sweet recipes, while a full teaspoon per cup will be required for savoury and bread baking.

Is Sorghum flour high in carbs?

Sorghum flour is not considered to be a low carb flour, however, it isn’t at the high ed of the scale either. A quarter cup of sorghum flour contains approximately twenty five grams of carbohydrates.

name: Rye Flour
description:
Rye Flour – The healthiest alternative

Rye flour is produced of the rye grain and it is popular for its ability to balance your metabolism and aid in weight loss. Asides from weight loss, rye flour provides a large number of health benefits to its consumers. It has been consumed for centuries and it is one of the healthiest grains in the market. Though other grains such as wheat, oats and barley are more common in the shops, rye is worth looking for and introducing in your daily diet.

Organic whole grain rye flour is made from grain grown without the use of artificial chemicals, pesticides or gmo organisms.

Rye Flour Health Benefits

Although rye is not gluten free, it has many health benefits for the gluten tolerant ones. It has been found that rye is healthier than the mainstream  barley and wheat products due to the nature of the seed. In other words, the rye seed holds nutrients and fiber that are not omitted while producing the rye flour. This makes the flour even healthier since nutrients are being transferred in the final product.

Now, let’s look at some of the health benefits that rye flour provides and why it is in such high demand.

  • Weight loss and metabolism booster – It has been identified how rye flour can not only balance your metabolism but also helps you lose weight. That’s due to its ability to make you feel full much faster and reduce your appetite. This way it manages to reduce food and calorie intake.[1]

  • Lowers Diabetes Risk – Rye’s ability to improve glucose levels and insulin sensitivity can lower the risk of diabetes.[2]

  • Against cancer – Rye’s nutrients and fiber content can actually fight against the development of cancerous cells.[3]

  • Inflammation – Unlike wheat, rye can reduce inflammation as a result of reducing insulin sensitivity. Inflammation can also cause diabetes and so by reducing body inflammation results in lowering the chances of diabetes.[4]

What is Rye Flour used for?

Rye flour can easily replace other common flours in baking. Using whole grain rye flour is even more beneficial for your heart health and weight loss. The dark rye – whole grain one – is less processed and less refined which results in nutrients to be kept intact and offer many more health benefits. Opt for the dark rye flour in as many recipes as you can for maximum health improvement results. Rye is a popular choice or whole grain bread .

Rye Bread

Rye bread is a popular whole grain bread alternative to wheat flour bread and other whole grain breads. Organic rye flour bread has a sharper taste and thicker texture than most other cereal grain breads. The bread can be made from a combination of bread flours or from rye flour alone. The varieties of rye bread are numerous with whole grain rye flour bread and sourdough bread recipes being popular. Sourdough bread is not the same as rye bread but can be made from rye grain flour using the same process used in all sourdough recipes. Sourdough is created by using a starter dough mixture of flour and water to attract  yeast to leaven the bread. This dough may be left for several days.

Rye bread in all its forms is becoming increasingly popular and is said to have the following benefits.

  • Full of plant molecules known as phytoestrogens that help to balance hormone levels.[5]

  • Appetite suppressant. Research has found that whole rye bread sandwiches are more likely to keep people satisfied than sandwiches made with  bread made from whole wheat flour or white flour [6]

  • Controls blood sugar levels more effectively as it is low in the glycaemic index [7]

  • Rye whole grain Contributes to heart health, being a good source of magnesium and soluble fibre. Magnesium helps to control blood pressure, while soluble fibre contributes to lowering cholesterol levels.[8]

  • Plus all the regular benefits of rye whole grain.

Beside making great bread a good rye flour  can also be used as a traditional flour substitute in homemade pasta and a variety of pastries and baked treats. It is important to recognise that while the flour does contain some gluten it contains much less than other bread flour. Accordingly, many recipes advocate for a mixture of flours to achieve a lightness in the bread. Many bakers suggest a mixture of 25% rye to 75% traditional flour to achieve a balance between texture and the flavour of rye dough.

Rye berries are often added to rye bread to give some added texture and flavour. rye berries are simply the whole grain form of rye with the hull removed.

name: Ginger Syrup
description:
Ginger Syrup – So much more than just syrup

Ginger Syrup is one of the most beneficial syrups you can consume. Its ginger contents are responsible for improving your health while providing an amazing taste. Used as both a condiment and for medicinal purposes, ginger has many healing properties and has been widely used in Asian countries. It is rich in antioxidants and nutrients to help with a number of health conditions.

What is ginger syrup?

Ginger syrup is what is known as a simple syrup that has been infused with the ginger herb. A simple syrup is a solution of sugar dissolved in water. Simple syrups  usually have a 1:1 ratio.

Ginger Syrup Health Benefits

Ginger syrup, and ginger in general, is well-known for its antibacterial, antiviral and antioxidant properties. That is the reason why a great number of medicines include ginger in their ingredients. Lets have a look at some of the medicinal benefits ginger can provide and improve your overall health.

  1. Against infections – Ginger’s antibacterial and antiviral abilities can help prevent infections from taking place as well as treating them in case you’re already infected.

  2. Against inflammation – Ginger can also help with digestion and prevent inflammation. Inflammation can cause intestinal cramps and pains. While consuming ginger syrup you can treat such pains by reducing body inflammation and digesting much faster than what you would normally do.

  3. Antibacterial properties – Its antibacterial abilities can help treat colds and flus as well as sore throat.

  4. Prevents nausea – It is the perfect treatment for nausea. That is why ginger is usually recommended for sea sickness and morning sickness. It is considered safe to be consumed by pregnant women.

  5. Sore muscles treatment – Its anti-inflammation abilities can also treat sore muscles and it is recommended athletes and those who exercise.

What is ginger syrup used for?

As ginger syrup is a sweetener it can be used to sweeten just about anything. It is particularly popular as an additive to various cocktails and teas. Ginger syrup is also used as a topping on ice creams and other sweet dishes. Many marinade and basting sauce recipes also list ginger syrup as an ingredient.

How long will ginger syrup last?

How long ginger syrup will last will depend upon the sugar to water ratio. SImple syrup solution with a 1:1 ratio will last about two weeks. When the ratio  is increased to 2:1 the shelf life increases to three months. All ginger syrup products produced commercially will have a best before date.
If unsure, telltale signs that the syrup may have gone off are :

  • Visible signs of mould

  • A cloudier appearance

  • Any gas bubbles which would indicate that fermentation was occurring.

name: Kelp Noodles
description:
Kelp Noodles: A Comprehensive Guide to Health, Nutrition, and Culinary Delight

Embark on a culinary and health journey with our selection of kelp noodles at Buy Organics Online. Here, we highlight the distinctive features of our two primary kelp noodle products, along with the myriad benefits these noodles bring to your table.

Gold Mine Kelp Noodles (454g): Abundant in Size and Nutrients Gold Mine Kelp Noodles 454g cater to those who love hearty portions or meal prepping. While these noodles come at a slightly higher price, they offer ample quantity without compromising on the quality and nutritional value that kelp noodles are known for.

The Whole Foodies Kelp Noodles Original, 340g, Ideal for Everyday Meals For those seeking a more budget-friendly option, The Whole Foodies Kelp Noodles Original 340g are perfect. They provide a modestly smaller serving, suitable for individual meals or smaller households, while still delivering the full health benefits of kelp noodles.

Exploring the Benefits of Kelp Noodles

Kelp noodles are not just a simple pasta alternative; they are a powerhouse of nutrition and versatility.

  • Low in Calories and Fat: A great choice for anyone monitoring their calorie and fat intake, kelp noodles are remarkably low in both, making them an excellent component of a weight management diet.
  • Rich in Fibre: These noodles are a good source of dietary fibre, which is essential for healthy digestion and overall gut health.
  • Packed with Essential Minerals: Loaded with minerals like iodine, calcium, and iron, kelp noodles contribute significantly to your daily nutritional needs.
  • Versatile Culinary Ingredient: Their unique texture and mild taste make kelp noodles a versatile ingredient for a variety of dishes. From refreshing salads and hearty stir-fries to comforting soups, they adapt beautifully to different culinary styles.

Sustainable and Health-Conscious choices Both Gold Mine and The Whole Foodies kelp noodles align with a sustainable and health-conscious lifestyle. By choosing these noodles, you're not only nurturing your body with wholesome food but also supporting environmentally-friendly practices.

Recipes:

Fried Kelp Noodles with Sesame-Ginger Dressing

Ingredients:

  • 1 package kelp noodles
  • 2 tablespoons organic sesame oil
  • 1 tablespoon organic tamari
  • 1 tablespoon organic rice vinegar
  • 1 teaspoon organic honey
  • 1 teaspoon organic minced ginger
  • 1/4 cup chopped scallions
  • 1/4 cup organic sesame seeds

Instructions:

  1. Rinse and drain the kelp noodles thoroughly.
  2. In a bowl, whisk together organic sesame oil, tamari, rice vinegar, honey, and minced ginger.
  3. Toss the noodles in the prepared dressing.
  4. Sauté the noodles in a preheated skillet until they become slightly crispy.
  5. Garnish with scallions and organic sesame seeds.

Kelp Noodle Salad with Lemon-Tahini Dressing

Ingredients:

  • 1 package kelp noodles
  • 1/4 cup organic tahini
  • 1/4 cup organic lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon water
  • 1 clove organic minced garlic
  • 1/4 teaspoon Celtic salt
  • 1/4 teaspoon organic cracked black pepper
  • 1/4 cup chopped cucumber
  • 1/4 cup chopped red bell pepper
  • 1/4 cup chopped avocado

Instructions:Rinse and drain the kelp noodles.

  1. For the dressing, whisk together organic tahini, lemon juice, water, minced garlic, Celtic salt, and cracked black pepper.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the noodles with cucumber, red bell pepper, and avocado.
  3. Pour the tahini dressing over the salad and toss thoroughly.
  4. Serve this vibrant and nourishing salad immediately.

Conclusion:

Whether you opt for the larger pack of Gold Mine Kelp Noodles for family dining or the smaller pack of The Whole Foodies Kelp Noodles for individual meals, you're choosing a path of health and wellness. Our kelp noodles at Buy Organics Online offer a delightful blend of nutrition, taste, and versatility, perfect for anyone looking to enrich their culinary experiences while maintaining a health-focused diet.

name: Banana Flour
description:
What is Banana Flour

Banana Flour is a flour manufactured from green bananas. Green banana flour has been traditionally made in Africa and Jamaica but its production has grown with the discovery of its starch resistant properties. The flour is gluten free  Raw green banana flour has a faint banana flavour, but loses the flavour when cooked. Its texture is quite similar to other flours. Interestingly, it requires about 25% less volume than traditional wheat based flours. The flour is also favoured by some diets such as the Paleo diet which embrace its starch resistant properties.

Organic green banana flour is usually made using traditional methods and green bananas that have been grown without using harmful chemicals or pesticides.

Health benefits of Green Banana Flour

As well as  being gluten free the resistant starch properties of green banana flour make it a very healthy alternative when compared to other flours . The benefits of using green banana flour include:

name: Blackstrap Molasses
description:
What is blackstrap molasses? 

Blackstrap molasses is produced during the sugar cane refining process. It is a dark viscous liquid that is produced after the syrup produced during the refining process has been boiled for a third time. Blackstrap molasses contains the lowest sugar content of all sugar cane products produced through the process. It also has quite a lot of nutritional value in stark contrast to refined sugar.

Vitamins and minerals contained within organic blackstrap molasses include vitamin b6, iron, magnesium and calcium. When blackstrap molasses is extracted from unripened sugarcane It is often treated with sulphur dioxide in order to preserve it for longer.  Organic unsulphured blackstrap molasses is obtained from ripened sugarcane grown without the use of pesticides, chemicals or genetically modified organisms and not treated with sulphur dioxide. This allows it to retain a richer lighter flavour.

Benefits of organic blackstrap molasses

Some people claim that blackstrap molasses is a superfood and it certainly does contain a number of vital minerals. It's key health benefits include

  • Contains high levels of calcium and magnesium that will help prevent osteoporosis and promote a healthy bone structure

  • One tablespoon of blackstrap molasses contains 20% of the required daily intake of iron.  This makes it very worthwhile for people suffering from anaemia.

  • Loaded with potassium helping to prevent muscle cramps and potentially lowering blood pressure

  • When mixed with warm water and applied to hair for 15 minutes it can work to de-frizz  permed hair

What is blackstrap molasses good for?

Besides being taken orally, black strap molasses can be added to a variety of baking recipes, marinades and even smoothie drinks. It is particularly useful for

  • Acting as a sweetener substitute to sugar, making it attractive to both diabetes sufferers and people looking to control their weight.

  • Helping pregnant women battle anaemic problems. It is also useful in replenishing iron deficiencies caused by heavy menstrual periods.

  • Pantothenic acid contained in blackstrap molasses helps to combat fatigue and headaches.

  • High glucose levels also tend to stimulate the production of serotonin leading to a better night’s sleep.

How much black strap molasses should I take?

When starting to take black strap molasses, you should begin slowly as it does have a laxative effect. Ideally, you should commence taking no more than one teaspoon per day. After several days, you may be able to increase the dosage to three teaspoons per day. Under no circumstances should you take any more than six teaspoons or 30 ml per day. However, this dosage would be on the high side.

If you are taking back strap molasses to ease constipation a dose of between one and two teaspoons per day should be more than sufficient.

When taking black strap molasses, mix your dosage with a glass of warm water. Ideally the drink should be taken on an empty stomach in the early morning.

name: Coconut Flour
description:
What is coconut flour?

Coconut flour is a natural flour obtained from dried coconut meat. When coconuts are harvested and drained of their milk, some coconut meat is left behind in the shell. This meat can be dried at low temperature and ground into a fine gluten free flour that can be used for cooking purposes. The flour is a popular alternative flour and used by many people adhering to a grain restrictive diet.

Once you adapt to using coconut flour it can be used to bake cakes, breads and biscuits. The flour is quite absorbent and as such may require using more eggs than what otherwise would be required. Typically, coconut flour can be substituted for wheat based flour on a 1 to 4 basis. For every cup of coconut flour used, one egg should be used.

Health benefits of using organic coconut flour

Besides being gluten free, coconut flour is rich in nutritional value. Some of the health  benefits of coconut flour include:

  • Coconut flour contains high levels of fibre, protein and healthy fat. Consuming food baked with coconut flour will leave you feeling full and satisfied leading to little temptation to snack between meals.

  • Contains other essential nutrients including potassium, selenium, phosphorus, iron and vitamin B6

name: Rapadura Sugar
description:
What is Rapadura Sugar?

Many people have asked what is rapadura sugar and why should I use it over traditional sugar products? Put simply, it is an unrefined form of cane sugar that has a fine texture and can be used anywhere that you’d normally use white sugar. It possesses a rich caramel taste and contains more nutrients than traditional white sugar.

Rapadura sugar is produced in Brazil using a totally natural and organic process. Depending on where it is produced, it also can be called Panella, Raspadura, Chancaca and Piloncilla. Because of the way it is produced it can vary slightly in colour. 

The benefits of Organic Rapadura Sugar

There are some tremendous health benefits that comes with consuming organic rapadura sugar in place of traditional white sugar. These benefits include:

  • It has a low glycemic index. Because this product possesses a low GI, it is an ideal alternative to white sugar for those looking to slow the release of energy into the body. This results in the stabilization of blood sugar levels which can be extremely beneficial for those who suffer from diabetes.
  • It is high in vitamins and minerals. Rapadura sugar isn’t as processed as the alternatives. This means that it retains many essential minerals including potassium, calcium and magnesium. In addition, it is higher in Niacin, Vitamin A, B1, B2 and B6 which illustrates its value over the alternatives.
  • It is higher in iron than traditional white sugar. The standard 1 teaspoon serving of rapadura sugar contains 10% of your daily iron requirements. Iron is essential in the human body as it helps to produce the two proteins, hemoglobin and myoglobin. These proteins carry oxygen throughout the body which is crucial to healthy functioning.

Despite the benefits, it must be noted, that this is still a sugar product and as such should only be taken in moderation.

Is rapadura sugar the same as brown sugar?

This is a commonly asked question. Rapadura sugar and brown sugar are not the same. Rapadura sugar has been organically produced by extracting the juice from the cane and then cooking at very high temperatures to crystallise it. The molasses is not separated from the sugar at any time. Brown sugar on the  other hand is simple refined sugar with molasses added back to it.

What is a substitute for rapadura sugar?

If you do not have any rapadura sugar available and are looking for a substitute, the best alternatives would be muscovado or demerara sugar. Both of these sugars also undergo minimal processing.

name: Psyllium Husk
description:
What is Psyllium Husk?

Psyllium Husk is used in the medical industry for its laxative effect. It works by soaking up water in your stomach which, in turn, makes bowel movements much smoother and easier. In addition, it helps to boost regularity without increasing the occurrence of flatulence. People either turn to psyllium husk as a one-off to combat constipation or regularly as part of their diets to enhance overall digestive health and gastrointestinal care.

What is Ground Psyllium Husk Powder?

Psyllium husk powder is ground up Psyllium Husk which actually comes from the husk of the seeds of the plant Plantago ovata seeds.Just half a tablespoon of the powder can contain four grams of fiber. For that reason psyllium husk powder is used as an active ingredient in stool softeners. Psyllium husk powder can also help lower blood sugar and blood cholesterol levels, says Spritzler.

Psyllium Husk powder is highly sought after in the Keto diet community as it has practically no digestible carbohydrates and can be used to mimic the texture of such foods as bread.

What are psyllium husk benefits?

Advocates claim that there are a few advantages when using this product regularly. The psyllium husk benefits are:

  • It may improve digestion. As mentioned above, the most well-known claim relating to this product is its ability to enhance digestion and make bowel movements more effective. Those who suffer from irritable bowel syndrome and Chron’s disease are amongst the strong advocates of this product’s effectiveness.
  • It may improve heart health. The fibre that this product contains may help to reduce bad cholesterol levels, this is particularly important for those aged over 50. Where cholesterol is high, people can be at increased risk of heart disease.
  • It may help combat weight gain. Because psyllium husk powder absorbs water in your body, it may leave you with the feeling of fullness. This can decrease the chances that you will snack throughout the day therefore reducing the total number of calories consumed.

As with any medication, there is the risk of negative consequences from over use. If you experience any of the following psyllium husk side effects, then please consult a doctor:

  • Breathing difficulties
  • Swallowing difficulties
  • Stomach pain
  • Itching
  • Rash
  • Nausea
  • Vomiting

How much psyllium husk powder should I take?

In terms of the psyllium husk dosage that is recommended, adults should take no more than 1 to 2 teaspoons per day. Experts have recommended that a dosage more than 30 to 40 grams of psyllium husk powder should be avoided. Always consult your doctor prior to increasing your dosage of any medical product.

How to take psyllium husk?

Here are five easy ways to consume psyllium husk 

  • Add 1 tablespoon to a glass of water or juice
  • Add a tablespoon your smoothie.
  • Make it part of your breakfast by adding a tablespoon to your oatmeal.
  • Add it to recipes. It makes a great addition to bread recipes.
  • Use it to act as a thickener. Half a teaspoon should help to thicken things up nicely.

How long does it take for psyllium husk to work?

For bowel movements, psyllium husk will usually produce a result within between twelve hours and three days. If you are taking psyllium husk as a laxative it is recommended that you take it no longer than a week.
