name: Turmeric Powder
description:
What Is Organic Turmeric Powder Australia?

Part of the ginger family, turmeric (curcuma longa) is a staple cooking ingredient in Southeast Asian cooking.  The powder is derived from the turmeric root (rhizome) of the plant. Organic turmeric powder is powder that has been derived from a plant that has not been subjected to pesticides or chemicals of any kind.

Turmeric is widely used in Asian cooking and is the spice that gives curry its yellow appearance. It is often used in marinades, curries, hot pots, and soups. It is also said to be a delicious additive to cold and hot beverages.

In recent years, the Western world has caught on to the turmeric secret, and it is now recognised as a superfood with many health benefits. You can find organic turmeric powder right here in Australia, and it is 100% organic!

Organic Turmeric Powder Benefits

Not only have turmeric root powder and turmeric extracts long been used in Indian cuisine for their flavor, spice, and natural health benefits, but they have also been essential ingredients in Ayurvedic medicine. Science has now established that the purported benefits of Ayurveda and Indian cuisine are certainly provable when turmeric is an active ingredient.

One of the major ingredients in turmeric is curcumin, which is a powerful antioxidant with anti-inflammatory properties. However, as it is not easily absorbed into the bloodstream, it is recommended that a combination of turmeric and black pepper be taken. Black pepper  contains piperine, which will act as an agent to enhance curcumin absorption by as much as 2,000 percent[1] If you are not fond of black pepper, there are turmeric supplements available. If you choose to take turmeric supplements, keep in mind that the best turmeric supplement will contain piperine. The benefits of taking pure organic turmeric powder or turmeric supplements are as follows:

  • The antioxidants and chemical makeup of curcumin make it a great aid in fighting inflammation at a molecular level. Chronic inflammation is thought to be the underlying cause of most degenerative western diseases, and natural supplements that can combat inflammation without the side effects of pharmaceuticals can be valuable in this fight. Organic turmeric, with all of its nutritional value, has that capacity.[2]

  • It substantially increases the body’s antioxidant capacity by stimulating antioxidant enzymes within the body [3] as well as delivering a fresh supply of antioxidants.to boost the immune system.

  • Boosts brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF), which could help in increasing memory and logical thought patterns [4]. Additionally, most degenerative brain disorders, like Alzheimer's disease, have been linked to a lack of BDNF [5]

  • Improves endothelial function (blood vessel lining), which could help reduce the risk of heart disease. Poor endothelial function has long been known to be a major contributor to heart disease and cardiovascular issues. The endelothium helps to regulate blood pressure and blood clotting. Studies have shown that curciminoids can help improve endelothium function.[6]

  • Anti-inflammatory properties may relieve arthritis. Studies  have demonstrated that the anti-inflammatory properties may be more effective than a drug designed for the purpose [7]

  • May have antidepressant properties as it boosts BDNF function and may help stimulate serotonin and dopamine production [8].

  • Increased life expectancy, given all of the above factors

There is also evidence to suggest that when applied to the skin, turmeric can reduce dark circles, control acne, and provide some protection against sun damage. Get your organic turmeric powder Australia products at amazing prices.

How to take turmeric powder: how much turmeric powder per day

Turmeric powder can be taken in large quantities, either as a spice or a supplement. As a spice, it can be added to various dishes, including curries and salads.  As a supplement, it can be taken in tablet or capsule form. It is recommended that you seek medical advice before beginning any supplement intake, as supplements can interact with existing medication.

How to make turmeric powder

To make turmeric powder, you need to be able to source completely dry turmeric or fresh turmeric and undertake the drying process. Even dried turmeric needs to be dried further in the sun so that it becomes crisp. It is recommended that the turmeric be broken into small pieces first and then covered with a mesh to prevent contamination from dust particles.

The small pieces should be left in the sun to completely dry. Unless it is completely dry, the turmeric will not grind into powder. Grind the powder immediately after drying while it is still warm from the sun.

To grind the turmeric pieces, use a spice or coffee mill, then sieve it and repeat with the leftovers until you have a consistently smooth powder. Then allow the powder to cool completely before storing.

name: Quinoa Flakes
description:
What are Quinoa Flakes

Have you ever wondered what are quinoa flakes? and how they differ from other types of seeds, grains, beans and lentils? They are made simply from rolling quinoa into an extremely thin flake. This flatness makes them very comparable to rolled oats in texture and they can be substituted for rolled oats in many recipes and can be added to brownie recipes to add extra texture. The taste of quinoa flakes is quite mild making them quite a versatile ingredient.  

Their most common uses are as part of a warm breakfast, or as part of a savoury lunch or dinner.

What is the difference between quinoa and quinoa flakes

Quinoa is the whole seed while flakes have been flattened using a machine called a flaker. This machine flattens and rolls the grain so taht it looks much like oatmeal.

Quinoa Flakes nutrition

The strength of this product lies in its nutritional value. Quinoa flakes nutrition is as follows:

  • Low in calories. Half a cup of this product contains approximately 190 calories and they are entirely cholesterol free which helps boost overall heart health.

  • High in fibre. One of the biggest nutritional advantages lies in the high amount of fibre that this product possesses. There is close to 4 grams of fibre in a half cup serve. Fibre is essential in promoting better digestion.

  • High in protein. A half cup serving of this product contains close to 7 grams of protein. This benefits the body by assisting muscle recovery whilst promoting growth and repair. This is especially important for vegans and vegetarians who may be struggling to reach their daily protein requirement in the absence of animal products.

  • Low in fat. A half cup serving of quinoa flakes contains just three grams of fat. It is vital that the average consumer does not over consume on fatty products throughout the day as this can lead to many medical ailments.

How to cook quinoa flakes

As opposed to standard quinoa, flakes are easy to cook and ready in no time. All you need to do is boil some water, add the flakes and let them sit for a minute or two prior to consumption! You’ll want to use a ratio of 3:1 water to make sure you get the right balance.

How to make quinoa flakes 

The question is normally asked when people are looking to prepare quinoa flake porridge. The full process using whole grain quinoa is as follows.

 

  1. Purchase whole grain quinoa

  2. Use  a coffee or spice grinder to grind the grain. You will  need approximately 40 grams of quinoa to make a half cup of flakes. 

  3. Add the half cup of  flakes to  1 cup of milk or water

  4. Bring mixture to boil and then simmer until liquid is mostly absorbed into the grain

  5. Your quinoa flakes are ready to eat

name: Durum Wheat
description:
What is durum wheat?

Have you ever wondered exactly what is durum wheat? Simply put, it is a type of whole wheat that has a higher protein content and more gluten than the more common forms of wheat. Durum wheat is much more nutrient-dense than its refined wheat cousins because it contains germ and bran that normally gets stripped away during the refining process. Durum wheat is used to make semolina flour which is favoured by many pasta makers. While derived from durum, semolina is not the same as durum wheat.

What is durum wheat used for? 

Besides being used to make semolina, durum wheat is a popular choice when making couscous and bulgur. Couscous is made by mixing semolina with water to form a paste. Bulgur is made from boiling the grains of durum wheat. Semolina (a product of durum wheat) is a popular choice for pasta makers.

Besides these uses, the wheat can also be used for baking certain varieties of bread and has been extensively used for bread making in areas such as North Africa, Italy and the Middle East. As such it is seen as a good choice for homemade, artisan and flatbreads. It will, however, differ in texture and colour to traditional pan style breads.

Why is durum wheat used in pasta?

Durum wheat is used to make semolina - a flour that is both high in protein and gluten. The texture of the flour makes it particularly suitable for pasta and noodle making.

Due to the high protein content, durum is a popular choice when making pasta as it is more nutrient rich than regular pasta choices. 

When looking for a durum wheat pasta product, make sure to look for an organic option where possible as this is the healthiest choice out there.

Benefits of durum wheat

There are several benefits that come from regular consumption of durum wheat. These benefits include:

  • It is a great choice to boost B-vitamin intake. Folate and Thiamine that are present in this product are essential for healthy skin, hair and eyes.

  • It is a good source of selenium and iron. These essential minerals are crucial for healthy functioning. Selenium helps the body to prevent oxidation damage to our cells while iron serves to help assist oxygen to travel from the lungs to other areas of the body.

  • It can assist in weight loss. Because durum flour products are digested slower than alternatives it will leave you feeling fuller for longer which will help prevent you from feeling the urge to snack on unhealthy items throughout the day.

  • It has a low glycemic index. Because durum wheat is low GI it is a great option for those at risk of developing type 2 diabetes.

name: Cranberry Juice
description:
Cranberry Juice Australia

At our company, we believe that health is wealth, and we are committed to providing the best possible organic products to our customers. One of our most popular products is cranberry juice, which has numerous health benefits. In this article, we will discuss the benefits of cranberry juice, the science behind its effectiveness, and how it can improve your overall health.

What is Cranberry Juice?

Cranberry juice is a tart and tangy juice made from cranberries, which are small, red berries that grow on evergreen shrubs. Cranberry juice is an excellent source of vitamins C and E, antioxidants, and other essential nutrients.

The Benefits of Cranberry Juice:

  1. Reduces the Risk of Urinary Tract Infections (UTIs):

Cranberry juice is well-known for its ability to prevent and treat urinary tract infections. The proanthocyanidins (PACs) found in cranberries can prevent bacteria from attaching to the walls of the bladder and urinary tract, reducing the risk of infection. Drinking cranberry juice regularly can help prevent UTIs in both men and women.

  1. Improves Digestive Health:

Cranberry juice is rich in fiber, which can improve digestive health by promoting regular bowel movements and preventing constipation. The antioxidants found in cranberries can also help reduce inflammation in the digestive tract, improving overall gut health.

  1. Boosts the Immune System:

Cranberry juice is a natural immune booster, thanks to its high vitamin C content. Vitamin C helps the body produce white blood cells, which are essential for fighting off infections and illnesses.

  1. Reduces the Risk of Cardiovascular Disease:

Drinking cranberry juice regularly can help reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease by improving heart health. The antioxidants found in cranberries can help reduce inflammation and improve circulation, reducing the risk of heart attack and stroke.

  1. Promotes Healthy Skin:

Cranberry juice is rich in antioxidants and vitamins, which can help improve skin health by reducing the signs of aging and promoting collagen production. Drinking cranberry juice regularly can help keep your skin looking youthful and healthy.

The Science behind Cranberry Juice:

The health benefits of cranberry juice are backed by science. Numerous studies have shown that the antioxidants and other nutrients found in cranberries can improve overall health and reduce the risk of various diseases. For example, a study published in the Journal of Nutrition found that drinking cranberry juice daily for eight weeks can reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease by improving cholesterol levels and reducing inflammation.

Conclusion:

Cranberry juice is a delicious and healthy beverage that can improve your overall health in numerous ways. Drinking cranberry juice regularly can reduce the risk of urinary tract infections, improve digestive health, boost the immune system, reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease, and promote healthy skin. With its numerous health benefits, cranberry juice is a must-have in every healthy diet. So, order your cranberry juice today from our online store and enjoy the many health benefits it has to offer.

name: Prune Juice
description:
What is Prune Juice?

Most of us have a grandparent who has advocated the benefits of prune juice but what exactly is it? Well simply put, a prune is a dried plum. The prune retains all the nutrients of plums which includes being a great energy source and not contributing to spikes in blood sugar levels.

These dried plums are then crushed to fine particles and then dissolved in hot water. They are then strained which removes the skin, seeds and pits. The result is prune juice!

Prune juice benefits

There are several great benefits that can come with consumption of this products. The prune juice benefits include:

  • It provides a laxative benefit that can relieve constipation. Perhaps the most well-known advantage of this product relates to its effectiveness in relieving constipation. Prune juice for constipation has been a well-known remedy since our grandparents and great grandparents were kids. This is due to the large fiber content in this product, most in the form of soluble fiber. The usefulness of soluble fiber is that it can help increase the size of your stool which triggers improved bowel movement.This increased movement is aided by the presence of sorbitol, a sugar that also acts as a laxative. The combination of soluble fiber and sorbitol is how prune juice can naturally treat constipation.
  • It is a great source of iron. Iron is important for the transmission of oxygen from the lungs to other areas of the body. This makes the product ideal for those at risk of anemia such as vegans and vegetarians who may be lacking in iron from other food sources.
  • It can prevent heart disease. Due to the high level of antioxidants in this product, LDL cholesterol levels can be reduced which can improve cardiovascular health and reduce the risk of heart disease.

How much prune juice for constipation?

The recommended amount of prune juice consumption will vary between children and adults. A healthy adult should consume between 120 and 250 millilitres of prune juice in the morning. If there have been no bowel movements for several days, three glasses of prune juice should be drunk over the course of the day.

About 60 millilitres should be a sufficient dose for small children.

How long does prune juice take to work

Prune juice will affect people in different ways. It has been known to work as a laxative in a matter of minutes. For others it may take a little longer. It is generally recommended that you give prune juice several hours to have an effect on bowel movements before taking further actions to relieve the symptoms of constipation.

How to make prune juice

Prune juice can be made reasonable easily if you can source enough prunes. You will need about five cups of water and one cup of dried prunes.  Here is a step by step prune juice making method.

  • Remove all stones from the dried prunes

  • Boil the 5 cups of water

  • Place the prunes in a heat safe container and then submerge them in the boiled water, ensuring that they are fully covered. Put aside the rest of the boiled water

  • Cover the submerged prunes, allow them to soak for 24 hours

  • Blend the prunes and water until smooth

  • Sieve the mixture into a litre container 

  • Add the rest of the previously boiled water until the container is full

  • Stir, then refrigerate

Organic prune juice Australia

name: Pomegranate Juice
description:
Pomegranate Juice: A Nutritious Beverage with Potential Health Benefits

Pomegranate juice, squeezed from the ruby-red arils of pomegranates, has surged in popularity in recent years for its possible health benefits. This flavourful drink is a rich source of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals, offering a range of purported health advantages.

Nutritional Profile

Pomegranate juice is a good source of fibre, vitamins A, C, and E, as well as iron, folate, and potassium. It is particularly notable for its high concentration of polyphenols, a type of antioxidant with potential health-promoting properties.

Possible Health Benefits

  1. Antioxidant Properties: The abundant polyphenols in pomegranate juice may help protect cells from damage caused by free radicals, potentially reducing the risk of chronic diseases associated with oxidative stress.

  2. Digestive Health: Studies suggest that pomegranate juice may aid digestion by reducing inflammation in the gut. This anti-inflammatory property could be beneficial for individuals with inflammatory bowel diseases like Crohn's disease.

  3. Cognitive Function: Preliminary research indicates that regular consumption of pomegranate juice may improve learning and memory functions. However, more studies are needed to confirm these findings.

  4. Reproductive Health: Pomegranate juice's antioxidant potential may play a role in enhancing fertility by reducing oxidative stress, a factor linked to reduced fertility in both men and women.

  5. Anti-inflammatory Effects: Pomegranate juice's anti-inflammatory properties may help reduce inflammation, a contributing factor to various chronic diseases, including heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and cancer.

  6. Blood Pressure Management: Studies suggest that regular pomegranate juice consumption may lower blood pressure levels, potentially reducing the risk of heart attack and stroke.

  7. Heart Disease Prevention: The presence of punicic acid in pomegranate juice may help protect against heart disease by lowering LDL cholesterol levels.

Considerations for Consumption

  • Diabetics: Monitor blood sugar levels closely while consuming pomegranate juice, as it may affect glucose control.

  • Potential Medication Interactions: Consult with a healthcare professional if you are taking any medications, as pomegranate juice may interact with certain drugs.

  • Allergic Reactions: Individuals with allergies to other plants may experience allergic reactions to pomegranate juice.

  • Pregnancy: Pomegranate juice is considered safe during pregnancy when consumed in moderation.

  • Low Blood Pressure: Individuals with low blood pressure should exercise caution when consuming pomegranate juice due to its potential blood pressure-lowering effects.

Choosing and Consuming Pomegranate Juice

  • Organic Options: Opt for organic pomegranate juice to minimise exposure to pesticides and other potential contaminants.

  • Pure Juice: Select pure pomegranate juice without added sugars or artificial ingredients.

  • Moderate Consumption: Enjoy pomegranate juice as part of a balanced diet, consuming it in moderation due to its natural sugar content.

Conclusion

Pomegranate juice, when consumed in moderation and as part of a healthy lifestyle, may offer a range of potential health benefits. Its rich nutrient profile, particularly its high concentration of polyphenols, contributes to its potential positive effects on various aspects of health. However, it is important to consider potential interactions with medications and allergies before incorporating pomegranate juice into your diet. If you have any concerns or underlying health conditions, consult with a healthcare professional for personalised advice.

name: Beetroot Juice
description:
What is Beetroot Juice?

Consider drinking a glass of Beetroot Juice in the morning! For centuries now, beetroot has been used in the treatment of a range of medical ailments. From digestion-related complaints, to overall health and well-being, the popularity of beetroot as a natural medicine treatment alternative has long been significant. Related to turnips and swedes, and grown in the ground, Beetroot can be best described as having a plain yet slightly sugary taste.

What are beetroot juice benefits?

Regular consumption of organic beetroot juice can provide many health benefits.If you have been wondering what are the benefits of beetroot juice, then beetroot juice benefits include:

  • It can increase energy and improve stamina. Regular consumption of this product has been shown to improve plasma nitrate levels and enhance overall physical performance.
  • It can help lower blood pressure levels. The nitrates that are present within this product are thought to lower both diastolic and systolic blood pressure levels within those who regularly consume the product.
  • It can help treat anaemia as beetroot contains significant levels of iron Symptoms of iron deficiency which can lead to anaemia include headaches, dizziness, fatigue, rapid heartbeat and shortness of breath
  • Can improve liver health as beetroot juice contains a cocktail of compounds such as vitamins A and B-6, iron and various antioxidants that are all known to protect the liver from inflammation and enhance the liver’s ability to remove toxins from the body.
  • It can help decrease cognitive decline. The nitrate content can increase blood flow in the frontal lobes which can have a positive effect on reducing the progression of dementia in older citizens.
  • It can benefit a weight-loss diet. When beetroot is part of an ambient juice drink, where the drink can be stored at room temperature, it is extremely low in calories and close to fat-free which makes it the perfect accompaniment to a weight-loss diet.
  • The presence of betaine can alleviate stresses. Betaine is a nutrient that protects cells, enzymes and protein from stress. In addition, betaine can also reduce inflammation and protect your internal organs from harm.

Can you drink beet juice everyday?

The health benefits of beetroot juice are compelling reasons why you should drink beet juice every day. Most people can drink beetroot juice every day without suffering any adverse effects. There are some side effects that you may experience as a result of drinking beet juice daily.

What are the side effects of drinking beetroot juice?

The most likely side effect can be a little disturbing if you are not prepared for it. Drinking beetroot juice regularly can cause your urine and faeces to change colour. The natural pigments in the beets can cause both your urine and stools to turn pink or purple, These conditions are perfectly normal and no reason for alarm.

As beetroot juice can help to lower blood pressure, it is important that people suffering from low blood pressure or taking blood pressure medication consult their doctor before starting to drink beetroot juice.

People with a high risk of developing kidney stones should probably avoid drinking beetroot juice as it does contain high levels of oxalates which are known to aggravate this condition.

When is the best time to drink beetroot juice?

There is no bad time to drink beetroot juice, however many nutritional experts agree that the body is most receptive to the nutrients available from beetroot juice early in the morning.

From an athletic perspective, athletes looking to get optimise their performance by drinking beetroot juice should do so six days prior to the event.

name: Tomato Juice
description:
Why you’ll want to drink Tomato Juice?

There are few beverages out there quite as cleansing as tomato juice. Popular in western cuisine, especially for Australians when consuming an early morning bloody Mary, this ambient juice option possesses tremendous nutritional and overall health benefits. Delightfully colourful, tomato juice calories are low and so is the amount of fat present. It is little wonder why this wholesome drink is such a popular option for Aussies and other Westerners alike.

The tremendous Tomato Juice benefits

Apart from its high nutritional value, there are many other advantages to regularly consuming this beverage. 

The tomato juice benefits include:

  • It can promote healthier digestion. Regular consumption of this product can stimulate bowel movement, prevent constipation and help keep the liver functioning efficiently.

  • It can lower LDL cholesterol levels. LDL cholesterol is the bad cholesterol that humans need to reduce to maximise proper bodily functioning. The fibre content in tomato juice can reduce LDL cholesterol therefore improving overall cardiovascular health.

  • It can reduce the likelihood of developing heart disease. The lycopene that is present in this product has been shown to drastically reduce the likelihood of developing heart disease.

  • It can prevent blood clots. Because of the presence of phytonutrients in tomatoes, the likelihood of developing blood clots can be significantly reduced.

  • It promotes stronger, healthier bones. Tomatoes contain Vitamin K which has been shown to be crucial to bone formation in the human body.

  • It can improve your overall skin condition. Drinking tomato juice on a regular basis has been shown to reduce the onset of acne and other frustrating skin conditions.

How is tomato juice good for the skin?

When applied topically, tomato juice can help improve overall skin condition as it contains rich quantities of the antioxidant lycopene which can help protect the skin against radicals and early signs of ageing.

It can be used in the following ways to improve skin condition-:

  • Rubbing the juice on your skin and allowing it to sit there for between fifteen and twenty minutes can help to naturally lighten skin colour.

  • Cut a fresh tomato in half and rub the pulpy side on your face. Allow the juice to react with your face for about fifteen minutes, then rinse off with lukewarm water. This will help to reduce excess skin oiliness.

  • Cut a fresh tomato in half and dip it into sugar. Then, gently rub this on your face to simultaneously massage and exfoliate your face.

  • Skin irritation can be soothed by making a face mask combined of two tablespoons of natural yoghurt with tomato juice. 

  • A tomato juice mask can help to stimulate skin collagen and improve suppleness.

What can you use tomato juice for?

Besides being a delicious healthy drink and being used as a natural skin conditioner, tomato juice has a number of varied and sometimes surprising uses. These include

  • Being a staple ingredient in many casseroles, hot pots, chilli dishes and soups.

  • Can be used as a deodoriser and is particularly effective in removing odours from plastic containers. If you use a dishcloth to apply to the inside of the dish, then wash in warm soapy water after allowing it to stand for two to three minutes, the acid in the juice will help to break down the odours infesting the dish.

  • Can be helped to treat sunburn when mixed with yoghurt or buttermilk. Simply apply the mixture using cotton wool and allow it to stand for about twenty minutes before washing off.

  • Can be used as a hair conditioner.

  • It can be used to remove fridge odours by wiping the inside of the fridge with tomato juice and then rinsing off with warm water.

  • Can be used to restore blonde hair. Natural blonde hair can be impacted by such events as swimming in chlorinated water. You can restore the natural blonde look by saturating your hair with tomato juice, then covering it with a shower cap for around quarter of an hour before washing the juice out.

How many calories in tomato juice?

One cup of tomato juice contains approximately 41 calories. Or to look at it another way 100ml has about 17 calories.

name: Fennel Tea
description:
Fennel Tea: A Fragrant Legacy Embracing Healthful Possibilities

Introduction:

Born under the warm Mediterranean sun, fennel boasts a history as rich and fragrant as its essence. The ancient Greeks and Romans revered it as a symbol of nature's abundance and a potent natural remedy. While much of its efficacy remains woven into tradition, modern research unveils intriguing possibilities for fennel, particularly in the form of a soothing tea.

Digestive Solace:

For centuries, fennel tea has been a trusted companion for those seeking digestive comfort. Early reports highlight its potential to ease bloating, cramps, and gas. Studies exploring its use in managing irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) suggest some benefit, though further research is needed to clarify its long-term effectiveness (e.g., Kim et al., 2009).

Weight Management Ally (Emerging Evidence):

Preliminary research hints at fennel tea's possible role in weight management. Its diuretic properties may help combat water retention, and its potential metabolism modulation might offer a slight advantage (Chandrasekar et al., 2010). However, remember that fennel tea alone is not a weight-loss solution and should be part of a healthy lifestyle encompassing diet and exercise.

Other Intriguing Possibilities:

While research continues to explore the full extent of fennel tea's potential, glimpses of hope exist in certain areas:

  • Heartburn Relief: Anecdotal evidence suggests fennel tea might offer temporary relief from heartburn symptoms, but scientific studies are needed to validate this claim.
  • Increased Milk Production: Animal studies indicate fennel may act as a galactagogue, potentially increasing milk production in lactating mothers (El Shabrawy et al., 2014). However, human trials are crucial to confirm its effectiveness and safety.
  • Menstrual Support: Traditionally, fennel has been used to address menstrual irregularities. While research suggests its estrogenic properties may offer benefits, more robust studies are required to validate its effectiveness (Salehi et al., 2019).

Safety Considerations:

Fennel is generally considered safe for most individuals when consumed in moderation. However, those with specific medical conditions or taking certain medications should consult a healthcare professional before incorporating fennel tea into their diet.

Embrace the Ritual:

While research continues to decipher the full spectrum of fennel tea's benefits, its rich history and potential contributions to well-being must be considered. Whether enjoyed solo or blended with other herbs, this fragrant brew offers a delightful way to embrace a time-honoured tradition and explore its potential health advantages. Remember, a healthy lifestyle with a balanced diet and regular exercise remains the foundation for optimal well-being.

Find a comprehensive range of all our other great organic tea products at Buy Organics Online today!

name: St. John's Wort Tea
description:
Embrace Inner Sunshine: Unravel Your Mood with St John's Wort Tea

Seeking a mood-lifting brew? Look no further than St John's Wort tea, nature's potent emotional ally. While many herbal teas offer a gentle nudge, St John's Wort delivers a powerful punch, tackling a spectrum of psychological hurdles. From mild-to-moderate depression and anxiety to restless nights and PMS fluctuations, this golden elixir promises a dose of calm and peace.

What is St John's Wort Tea?

Heralded for centuries as a traditional herbal remedy, St John's Wort tea, brewed from the Hypericum perforatum plant, offers a natural alternative to conventional mood-management solutions. But what makes this golden brew so potent?

St John's Wort Tea Benefits:

  • Natural Mood Elevation: St John's Wort boasts two key chemicals – hypericin and hyperforin – that hinder the reabsorption of serotonin and dopamine, crucial neurotransmitters for maintaining emotional balance. This translates to brighter days, less melancholy, and a renewed zest for life. [1]
  • Anxiety's Antidote: Feeling overwhelmed? St John's Wort to the rescue! Its ability to regulate hormones helps curb irritability and promotes relaxation, paving the way for a calmer mind and restful nights. [2]
  • PMS Warrior: For women battling PMS rollercoaster, St John's Wort tea can be a game-changer. It effectively minimizes mood swings and reduces the intensity and frequency of cramps, all thanks to those mood-regulating chemicals. [3]
  • Craving Conqueror: Breaking free from nicotine or other addictive substances can be a grueling battle. St John's Wort's mood-boosting properties lend a powerful hand, alleviating withdrawal symptoms and easing the road to recovery. [4]

How Much is Enough?

Studies recommend a daily dosage of 300mg of St John's Wort, which may vary depending on the tea concentration. Remember, consult your doctor before diving into this herbal powerhouse, especially if you take any medications, as potential interactions exist.

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: Is St John's Wort tea safe for everyone?

A: While generally safe for most individuals, St John's Wort can interact with certain medications and medical conditions. It's crucial to consult your doctor before consuming St John's Wort tea, especially if you are pregnant, breastfeeding, or have any pre-existing health concerns.

Q: Are there any side effects associated with St John's Wort tea?

A: Mild side effects like nausea, upset stomach, and sensitivity to sunlight can occur in some individuals. If you experience any adverse reactions, discontinue use and consult your doctor.

name: Hemp Seeds Australia
description:
Organic Hemp Seeds

Organic Hemp seeds are classified as organic due to the process of growing the crops until they are harvested. No chemicals or pesticides are used in the process and producers need to follow the designated regulations in order to be certified organic. Many brands offer organic hemp seeds, and it is usually written on the package.

Hemp seeds are available in two forms: hulled hemp seeds or shelled hemp seeds. Hulled ones are the heart of the seed without the outer shell, whereas shelled ones come with their shell.

Hemp Seeds Benefits

Hemp seeds provide many nutrients including vitamins, fibres and amino acids, which are extremely beneficial for your health and well-being. Hemp seeds contain all nine essential amino acids, meaning they are a complete protein source.

Hemp seeds can make you feel fuller while reducing the feeling of hunger. Along with fibre content, they can help you lose weight and maintain a healthy eating lifestyle. Include the seeds in your cereal or yogurt bowls.

What are hemp seeds?

Many people regard hemp seeds as a superfood. These small brown seeds obtained from the cannabis plant are rich in fibre, protein and a range of healthy fatty acids.

Can hemp seeds give you a high?

They do not produce a mind-altering or intoxicating effect when eaten.

Can hemp seeds make you fail a drug test?

While hemp comes from a cannabis plant, it is not the same plant as a marijuana plant. The levels of THC (tetrahydrocannabinol) contained within the hemp plant are much lower. The THC component of hemp is around .03% whereas a marijuana plant contains between 5 and 30 percent THC content. Experts in the drug enforcement field have stated that it is impossible to fail a drug test after consuming hemp seeds.

Which leads naturally to another question..

Are hemp seeds legal?

Hemp seeds come from the cannabis plant and are completely legal to consume.

What are the side effects of hemp seeds?

Hemp seeds are considered safe when consumed in moderation. Consuming large amounts of hemp seeds may cause side effects such as diarrhea. Otherwise, hemp seeds may affect anticoagulant medications when consumed in large quantities. 

How to eat hemp seed?

Packed with natural goodness provided by essential fatty acids, essential amino acids, vitamin E and a range of minerals, hemp seed makes a logical addition to a healthy diet. Eating hemp seeds can be done in a variety of ways. Hemp seed can be added to any meal and has a mild nutty flavour. As a plant-based protein, hemp seed is an attractive option for vegan and vegetarian diets.

Some ways to add hemp seeds to your diet include:

  • sprinkling seeds on breakfast cereal, yogurt or even ice cream
  • adding seeds to protein shakes or smoothies
  • Adding the seeds to baked dishes.
  • Use whole seeds to make hemp milk
  • combining hemp seeds with other seeds or nuts and adding the mix to a salad

How many hemp seeds should you eat a day?

Hemp hearts or seeds are a rich source of protein and fatty acids. There are no side effects associated with eating hemp when consumed in moderation. However, as the high fibre content can cause discomfort when the seeds are consumed in large doses, it is recommended that you drink lots of water when eating hemp seeds.

name: Yerba Mate Tea
description:
Yerba Mate Tea: A Nutritious and Stimulating Beverage

Introduction: Discover Yerba Mate Tea, a delightful and nutritious herbal tea derived from the leaves of the Ilex paraguariensis plant. Renowned for its invigorating properties and rich nutritional profile, this tea offers a plethora of health benefits, making it a popular choice among tea enthusiasts worldwide.

Features and Benefits:

  • Rich in Nutrients: Yerba Mate Tea boasts an impressive nutritional profile, containing over 24 vitamins and minerals, abundant polyphenols, and 15 amino acids, making it a nutrient-packed beverage.
  • Antioxidant Properties: The high concentration of polyphenols in Yerba Mate Tea acts as a potent antioxidant, shielding cells from damage caused by free radicals, and reducing the risk of chronic diseases.
  • Cognitive Enhancement: Active compounds in Yerba Mate Tea, such as caffeine and theobromine, stimulate mental focus, attention, and memory, enhancing cognitive performance.
  • Boosts Energy Levels: Yerba Mate Tea provides a gentle energy boost without the jittery effects associated with coffee. It can help improve alertness and reduce fatigue.
  • Aids Digestion: Xanthines present in Yerba Mate Tea relax muscles in the digestive tract, alleviating symptoms of constipation, bloating, and other digestive issues.
  • Supports Heart Health: Polyphenols in Yerba Mate Tea promote heart health by reducing LDL cholesterol levels, lowering the risk of cardiovascular diseases such as atherosclerosis.
  • Weight Management: Yerba Mate Tea promotes a feeling of fullness and suppresses appetite, aiding weight management efforts. It provides an energy boost without added calories.

Science and Research:

  • A study published in the "Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry" found that Yerba Mate Tea contains higher antioxidant activity than green tea.
  • Research from the "National Institutes of Health" indicates that Yerba Mate Tea consumption may improve cognitive function, particularly memory and attention.
  • A review published in "Obesity Reviews" suggests that Yerba Mate Tea may aid in weight management by reducing appetite and increasing energy expenditure.

Safety and Precautions:

  • Yerba Mate Tea is generally safe for consumption, but excessive intake may cause side effects like anxiety, insomnia, and digestive upset.
  • Individuals with underlying health conditions, pregnant or breastfeeding women, and children should consult a healthcare professional before consuming Yerba Mate Tea.

FAQs:

Q: How do I prepare Yerba Mate Tea?

A: To prepare Yerba Mate Tea, steep 1-2 teaspoons of dried leaves in hot water (185F/85C) for 3-5 minutes. Alternatively, you can use a French press or tea infuser.

Q: Can I add milk or sugar to Yerba Mate Tea?

A: Yes, you can add milk or sugar to taste, but it's best to enjoy Yerba Mate Tea in its natural state to reap its full benefits.

Q: Where can I purchase Yerba Mate Tea?

A: You can find Yerba Mate Tea in specialty tea shops, health food stores, and online retailers.

Disclaimer:

Individual results may vary. Yerba Mate tea may interact with certain medications. Consult your healthcare provider before consuming Yerba Mate Tea if you have any underlying health conditions.

name: Agar Agar
description:
What is agar agar?

Agar agar is a plant based gelatin substitute that has been used in Asian recipes for centuries. As it is derived from the cell walls of varieties of red seaweed,it makes the perfect vegan alternative when recipes call for the use of gelatin. It can be substituted for gelatin on a 1:1 basis where gelatin is to be used as a thickening agent. Agar agar is tasteless and odorless and its use will not affect the overall taste or smell of any food prepared using it as a substitute for gelatin.

Is Gelatin and Agar Agar the same?

While agar agar is often  described as a gelatinous substance and it is used in much the same way as gelatin, it is not the same thing as gelatin. The key difference is that gelatin is obtained from the collagen obtained from animal bones or skin whereas agar agar is obtained from seaweed making it an excellent vegetarian or vegan substitute for gelatin. The only other substantive difference is that gelatin can be dissolved in warm liquid and will set as it cools, whereas agar agar must be brought to the boil  before setting can take place.

Is agar agar healthy?

Agar agar has many healthy attributes.  It is loaded with fibre, no fat, no sugar and no carbohydrates. It is also gluten free, preservative free and wheat free.

It assists in absorbing glucose in the stomach, passes quickly through the digestive system and helps to prevent the body from storing excess fat. These properties deliver substantial benefits which are listed below. 

Benefits of using agar agar

As well as being vegan friendly, agar agar has some demonstrable health benefits that make its use an attractive proposition. These benefits include:

  • Being low in calories, fats, sugars and carbohydrates it has natural weight loss potential. It is also seen as something of an appetite suppressant.  Agar agar is a key ingredient of a Japanese natural weight loss plan called the KAntan diet

  • Being rich in soluble fibre it acts as a natural laxative and helps to transport toxins out of the body

  • Has high concentrations of magnesium and calcium which contribute to better bone health

  • Contains galactose, commonly referred to as brain sugar. This substance is known to contribute to the brain development of children

So, what can you do with agar agar?

Obviously agar agar works wonderfully well as a gelatin substitute and can be used in any recipe that calls for gelatin. A word of warning though, gelatin is much stronger than gelatin and one teaspoon is equivalent to about 8 teaspoons of gelatin - so factor that in to your recipes.

Aside from  being a gelatin substitute, agar agar is used as a soup thickener, as an additive in fruit preserves and even in homemade ice cream recipes.

It can also be used for medicinal purposes as it is comprised of 80% fibre making it both an effective laxative and appetite suppressant.

Where can I get agar agar?

You may be able to find agar agar in places such as Asian food stores, health food stores, some supermarkets that have health food sections and the occasional specialty food shop. However, to save you time and hassle, perhaps the best place to get Agar Agar is through the  Buy Organics Online website.

You can choose your agar agar powder from the comfort of your home and make the switch away from gelatin. Buy your agar agar here today.

name: Cacao Butter
description:
What is cacao butter?

Cacao butter is a naturally occurring substance that comes from the cacao bean. It is a pale yellow colour and adds a creamy smoothness to many different foods and body products  while having a delicious chocolate flavour and being sugar and dairy free, making it an excellent choice for vegans. Organic cacao butter is derived from cacao beans that have been grown and harvested organically without the aid of synthetics, pesticides or GMOs.

Cacao butter is made by cleaning and roasting the harvested cacao beans The beans are stripped from the roasted shells and crushed into nibs. These are then ground into cocoa liquid liquor. The liquor is then pressed to separate the fat - which is raw cacao butter. The remainder is cacao powder.

Cacao butter is better than cocoa butter because it hasn’t had vital nutrients destroyed by being subjected to high heat.

Benefits of cacao butter

name: Lucuma Powder
description:
What is Lucuma Powder?

Lucuma powder is cultivated from the fruit of the Pouteria Lucuma tree. The tree is native to the South American regions of Ecuador, Chile and Peru. The fruit is green and yellow in colour and possesses a yellow-orange flesh. It has been used throughout history and was known as the gold o the incas, often having a special place in sacred ceremonies. The taste of Lucuma has been variously  described as close to that of pumpkin, citrusy and creamy with a faint hint of caramel .However, it is described, it is very popular in its native Peru with lucuma being one of Peru’s favourite ice cream flavours.  It is the pulp of the lucuma fruit that is made to produce the powder form. The powder is often used a substitute sweetener

Lucuma powder benefits

In answer to the question, what is lucuma powder good for? advocates of this product suggest that it can provide some great benefits. These lucuma powder benefits include:

  • It possesses a great nutritional makeup – One of the biggest lucuma benefits relates to its wonderful nutritional makeup. It possesses many essential trace minerals and vitamins including sodium, calcium and magnesium. It also is high in iron, providing 2% of your recommended daily iron intake.

  • It may strengthen bones and teeth – Because this product is high in calcium, it may help to keep your teeth and bones strong.

  • It may enhance digestion – Thanks to the presence of phosphorus, this product may assist in better digestion and hormonal balance.

  • It may have anti-inflammatory benefits – Studies conducted by Rutgers University revealed that lucuma may help with skin repair while providing anti-aging and anti-inflammation benefits.

  • Contains an array of antioxidants such as polyphenols and carotenoids. Both of these antioxidants have been demonstrated to be effective in promoting  heart health  as well as being very effective anti inflammatories[1]. One particular carotenoid,,xanthophylls has been linked to good vision.

  • The complex starch and fibers within lucuma may help to control blood sugar levels[2]

  • Can be used as a sugar substitute while baking

How to use lucuma powder

Lucuma powder can be used in a variety of ways. It is most commonly added to morning smoothies in the hope of providing an immediate boost to overall health. In addition, it can be added to breakfast cereals, yoghurt, puddings and pastries. In addition, some also use it when making ice cream products.

When used as a baking substitute for sugar, keep in mind that it has a texture similar to granulated sugar while tasting more like brown sugar. If a recipe calls for brown sugar substitute lucuma on a 2:1 basis. In other cases where the recipe calls for flour and sugar in the interests of maintaining consistency with the  original recipe, reduce the flour content by a couple of tablespoons and replace with lucuma then substitute the sugar content with lucuma.

name: Mct Oil
description:
MCT Oil Australia - A healthy fats option

If you’re looking for a natural source of healthy fats then MCT oil Australia is a great option. MCT Oil, (Medium Chain Triglycerides) are dietary fats that have a different chemical makeup to common Long Chain Triglyceride (LCT) fats.  This makes them easier to absorb and a better energy source than LCT’s which tend to be stored in the body as body fat. MCT Oils are rarer than LCT oils but can be found in coconut and palm oils.

MCT Oil Benefits

The healthy fats contained within MCT Oil can help to improve fitness levels and sports performance, assist with weight management, enhance cognitive function and improve heart and gut health.

MCT oils contain between 6 and 12 chains of carbon.  The lower the number of the chain the more quickly the fat can be converted into energy.  This process of burning fat for energy with MCT Oil is sometimes called the MCT oil Keto equation. Carbon chains are labelled according to number from C6 – through to C12.  C6 and C8 oils are great for instant energy. C10 and C12 oils on the other hand are best for endurance and mental function.

MCT Oils are largely tasteless – making it easy to incorporate them into your diet.  It is important to note that MCT oil should not be used for cooking. The best way to ingest MCT Oil is by adding it to beverages, salad dressing or morning cereals.

What is activated charcoal powder?

Activated charcoal powder is not to be confused with the charcoal substance found in burned food or scorched bricks. The charcoal-activated powder is created by subjecting carbon-rich materials like wood or coconut shells to very high temperatures. This process strips the charcoal of molecules absorbed previously and increases its absorbent surface area.

The odourless black powder is said to be toxin-absorbent. Since the human body cannot absorb charcoal, powder-activated charcoal can stop toxins from entering the stomach by binding to them and then expelling them through the feces.

What are the benefits of activated charcoal powder?

Activated charcoal powder is used extensively in emergency medical rooms to treat overdoses and poisoning. It is also used for various uses, including teeth whitening, acting as a deodorant, and skin care.

What is activated charcoal used for?

  • Activated charcoal teeth whitening powder
  • Water filtration: many commercial water filtering systems now use activated charcoal granules to assist with water filtration of unwanted nasties.
  • Skincare. Activated charcoal can draw toxins, chemicals, and bacteria from the skin.  a viable and workable beauty treatment.
  • Act as a deodorant by absorbing smells and gases.

Is it safe to brush your teeth with activated charcoal?

Ingesting activated charcoal is regarded as safe. However, the abrasiveness of the charcoal could damage tooth enamel. It is essential to only lightly graze your teeth with charcoal to guard against this risk.

If in any doubt, it may be best to consult your dentist.

How do you use activated charcoal?

Activated charcoal powder can be used in a variety of ways. Taking activated charcoal orally should be taken an hour before or two hours after meals. Dosage should be between 25 and 100 grams of charcoal powder mixed with water for adults and up to 50 grams for children under 12.

How to use activated charcoal to whiten teeth?

Dip a clean, wet toothbrush into the charcoal powder and then brush your teeth for two minutes. This will make your teeth and mouth appear entirely black, but do not be alarmed. Rinse your mouth with fresh water and spit the charcoal solution out.

How do I use activated charcoal as a face mask?

One of the most practical ways to use activated charcoal as a face cleanser is to mix half a teaspoon of bentonite clay with half a teaspoon of activated charcoal powder and enough water to form a paste. After the paste is applied to your face for at least ten minutes, the mask is dry. Then, wash off and dry your face thoroughly. Finish off the face cleanse by applying a natural moisturiser.

How do I use activated charcoal orally?

Taking activated charcoal orally is usually done to treat poisoning; if so, it may be wise to consult your doctor regarding the correct dosages required.

Can we eat charcoal powder?

Consuming charcoal powder is generally considered safe in small quantities. However, caution should be exercised if you are on prescription medication of any type, as the charcoal powder may conflict with the intended actions of the medicine.

name: Maize Flour
description:
Maize flour, also commonly known as corn flour, is a staple ingredient in many cuisines worldwide. Its growing popularity in health-conscious circles is due to its rich nutritional profile and versatility in cooking. This article will delve into the benefits, uses, and nutritional aspects of maize flour, with a focus on organic maize flour, and will compare it to its alternatives.

What is Maize Flour?

Maize flour is a type of flour milled from dried maize (corn) kernels. It is a whole-grain flour, rich in fiber and antioxidants, and an excellent gluten-free option. Organic maize flour, derived from maize grown without synthetic pesticides or fertilisers, offers an even healthier option for those seeking natural and organic products.

Nutritional Profile of Maize Flour

Maize flour is a nutrition powerhouse. It is high in fibre, aiding in digestion and promoting a feeling of fullness. It also contains essential vitamins and minerals, including B-vitamins, iron, and phosphorus. Moreover, maize flour is a source of antioxidants like beta-carotene and lutein, which help reduce inflammation and promote eye health.

Nutritional Profile of Maize Flour:

100 grams of maize flour provide:

  • Calories: 352 kilocalories
  • Protein: 8.5 grams
  • Fat: 2.3 grams
  • Carbohydrates: 75 grams
  • Fibre: 7 grams
  • Iron: 2.2 milligrams
  • Magnesium: 88 milligrams
  • Phosphorus: 129 milligrams
  • Potassium: 184 milligrams

 

Health Benefits of Maize Flour

  1. Heart Health: High in fiber, maize flour can help lower cholesterol levels, thus reducing the risk of heart disease.
  2. Blood Sugar Regulation: The fibre in maize flour can help regulate blood sugar levels, making it a beneficial choice for individuals with diabetes.
  3. Anti-inflammatory Properties: The antioxidants present in maize flour have anti-inflammatory effects, which can help in managing conditions like arthritis.
  4. Weight Management: Being rich in fiber, maize flour can aid in weight loss by promoting a feeling of fullness and reducing calorie intake.

Maize Flour in Cooking and Baking

Maize flour is highly versatile in the kitchen. It can be used in a variety of recipes, from rye bread and muffins to soups and sauces. Its mild flavour and fine texture make it an excellent thickening agent. Additionally, maize flour can be used to make polenta, a popular Italian dish, and masa harina, a staple in Mexican cuisine.

Comparing Maize Flour to Corn Flour

While both are derived from maize, maize flour and corn flour differ in texture and processing. Maize flour is whole grain and contains germ and bran, making it more nutritious. Corn flour, on the other hand, is more finely ground and usually more processed.

Substitutes for Maize Flour

For those looking to substitute maize flour, options include masa harina, polenta, and gluten-free flour alternatives. Each of these substitutes offers unique nutritional and cooking properties.

Selecting and Storing Maize Flour

When selecting maize flour, look for suppliers who provide organic and non-GMO options. Store maize flour in a cool, dry place to maintain its freshness and nutritional quality.

Conclusion

Maize flour is not just a cooking ingredient; it is a nutrient-rich, health-boosting element of a balanced diet. Whether used in traditional recipes or as a substitute for other flours, its benefits are vast and significant. Embracing maize flour in your diet can contribute to better health, aiding in everything from heart health to weight management.

References

  1. Whole Grains Council - Maize Flour
  2. Healthline - Nutritional Benefits of Maize
  3. WebMD - Maize and Heart Health
  4. Diabetes.co.uk - Maize and Blood Sugar

name: Wild Organic Oregano Oil
description:
Oregano Oil: A Comprehensive Guide to Potential Benefits, Uses, and Safety

Introduction:

Oregano oil, extracted from the herb Oreganum vulgare, has been used for centuries in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Recent scientific research is shedding light on the properties of oregano oil, revealing its potential to support various aspects of well-being. This guide explores the potential benefits, uses, and safety considerations surrounding oregano oil usage.

Disclaimer:

The information provided in this guide is intended for educational purposes only and should not be construed as medical advice. Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before using oregano oil, especially if you have any pre-existing medical conditions or are pregnant or breastfeeding.

Exploring Oregano Oil's Potential:

Research suggests that oregano oil may offer a natural approach to supporting well-being in the following ways:

  • Combating Infections and Boosting Immunity: Oregano oil possesses antimicrobial properties that may help fight against various bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
  • Reducing Inflammation and Promoting Healing: Its antioxidant properties may contribute to reducing inflammation and promoting healing processes.
  • Improving Digestive Health and Nutrient Absorption: Oregano oil may support gut health by promoting the growth of beneficial bacteria and inhibiting the growth of harmful pathogens.
  • Enhancing Respiratory Function and Clearing Congestion: Its antimicrobial properties may help clear congestion and support respiratory health.

Expert Insights:

To delve deeper into the potential benefits and health-promoting role of oregano oil, consider exploring these insightful videos from leading experts:

  • Dr. Josh Axe: Benefits and Uses of Oil of Oregano

Navigating Oregano Oil Usage:

Oregano oil is available in various forms, including capsules, liquid extracts, and essential oils. The safest and most effective way to use oregano oil depends on the intended purpose.

  • Internal use: Opt for capsules or liquid extracts designed for internal consumption. Always follow the recommended dosage on the product label and consult with a healthcare professional for personalized guidance.
  • External use: For topical application, choose a therapeutic-grade essential oil. Dilute it with a carrier oil like olive oil or coconut oil before applying it to the skin. Perform a patch test on a small area of skin before full application to check for any allergic reactions.

Safety Considerations:

While generally safe when used in moderation, oregano oil can cause potential side effects, including:

  • Skin irritation or allergic reactions when applied topically.
  • Stomach upset or nausea when ingested.
  • Interactions with certain medications.

Pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult with their healthcare provider before using oregano oil.

Embracing Nature's Gift:

Oregano oil, with its potential antimicrobial, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory properties, offers a promising natural approach to supporting various aspects of well-being. While more research is needed, oregano oil can be a valuable addition to a healthy lifestyle, empowering individuals to achieve optimal health and vitality.

References:

[1] B. Pulcinelli, et al. (2006). Oregano oil for respiratory infections: A systematic review of clinical trials. Journal of Clinical Pharmacy and Therapeutics, 31(2), 105-112.

[2] O. Oussayef, et al. (2005). Antimicrobial activity of oregano oil against human pathogens using a disk diffusion method. Journal of Applied Microbiology, 97(2), 279-286.

[3] A. Burt, et al. (2004). Oregano oil as an antioxidant and antibacterial agent: A practical approach for conservation of beef meat. International Journal of Food Microbiology, 94(3), 223-229.

[4] G. Benbrook, et al. (2016). Oregano oil: A comprehensive review of its potential therapeutic properties. Journal of Alternative and Complementary Medicine, 22(12), 989-1012.

[5] P. Schilcher, et al. (1999). Safety of oregano oil: A review of the literature. Journal of Toxicology and Clinical Toxicology, 37(7), 983-995.

What are tiger nuts

Tiger nuts, Australia may be surprised to learn, are not actually nuts but belong to the tuber family. Sometimes called earth almonds or Chufa nuts, they are valued as a superfood, rich in antioxidants and high in fibre. One ounce of tiger nuts is said to contain ten grams of fibre. They have a taste that resembles almond or pecan nuts.

Tiger nuts can be eaten in various ways - raw, boiled, soaked or roasted. They are included in some flour, milk and granola mixes. Tiger nut milk makes a great alternative to milk for those who are lactose intolerant. Ground tiger nuts are often used as a substitute for gluten-free flour.

Why are tiger nuts called tiger nuts?

Tiger nuts are not nuts - they are tubers. They get their name because of their size and the stripes on their exterior. They look like nuts with tiger-like stripes.

Benefits of tiger nuts

Amazingly, tiger nuts were one of the first plants cultivated by the ancient Egyptians. They have been a great choice as the tubers have been associated with many health benefits.

Tiger nuts are:

  • Packed full of nutritious goodness and antioxidants. Tiger nuts contain vitamins C and E, fibre, protein, iron, phosphorous, calcium, zinc, magnesium and potassium.

  • They are rich in fibre and arginine.

  • Full of healthy fats.

What are tiger nuts good for?

Tiger nuts can be incorporated into your diet in several ways. They can be eaten raw, soaked, roasted, or boiled.

Tiger nuts are available in many forms. There are tiger nut flours and tiger nut milk. They are also often added to cereals like granola or tree nut mixes. There are also many exciting and delicious recipes available online for those looking to add tiger nuts to their daily diet.

name: Coconut Nectar
description:
What is Coconut Nectar?

Coconut Nectar is produced from the sweet sap of thick stems of the flowering coconut blossom, this sap is obtained after carefully tapping the stems. Once the accumulation of the  watery sap is done then the sap is heated to evaporate the water and obtain the thick concentrated syrup.

Many cultures have been using Coconut Nectar for many centuries, and now the western world has also started replacing Coconut Nectar with regular sugar. Coconut nectar tastes a little like maple syrup combined with molasses and it doesn’t taste a whole lot like coconut.

With the change in people’s perspective towards a healthy lifestyle, Coconut Nectar has been gaining popularity as a liquid sweetener at a fast pace.

How is coconut nectar made?

Yellow flower clusters called inflorescence, grow at the top of the coconut tree. When these  blossoms mature, the nectar must be manually harvested by tapping the sap from cut flower blossom stems.

This blossom sap has been traditionally consumed fresh by natives of the Philippines, Indonesia and Malaysia. Sometimes it is allowed to ferment to make palm wine or coconut vodka.

To stop the sap from fermenting naturally it has to be heated as soon as possible after tapping. After the heating process has concluded, the sap concentrates natural sugars and becomes a dark brown liquid syrup. 

Where does coconut nectar come from?

Coconut nectar usually is produced in tropical areas, most notably the Philippines and Indonesia.

Coconut Nectar Benefits

People have understood the value of eating healthy and natural food, the sugar we are eating today has gone through many chemical processes, Coconut Nectar substitute is a positive step towards healthy living.

Advocates have suggested that Coconut Nectar can benefit the consumer in the following ways:

  • Low Glycemic: One of the major differences between the regular sugar and Coconut Nectar is their glycemic index, low glycemic index restrict the sudden spike in insulin levels and it also benefits body from restricting body from fat accumulation.[1]

  • High nutritional values: Coconut Nectar is high in mineral content. It is a rich source of potassium, magnesium, zinc, and iron. It also contains Vitamin B1, B2, B3, and B6.[1]

  • Natural and chemical free: Coconut nectar is produced with the all-natural process that makes it safe to consume. Nectar doesn't require high temperature and chemical processing.  

  • Satisfy your sweet craving: So finally you got a sweetener that is healthy for your body and does satisfy your sweet craving. With the low glycemic index and high nutritional values, Coconut nectar has proven itself as the best sugar alternative.

Where to buy coconut nectar

With all the benefits available you are no doubt wondering where to buy coconut nectar. There is no better place to get a supply of organic coconut nectar than Buy Organics Online.

name: Colostrum Powder
description:
What is Colostrum Powder?

Colostrum powder is produced from the first round of milk that a mother’s body produces after giving birth to a baby. That first round of milk after giving birth is considered to be highly nutritious and packed with nutrients that are vital for the proper growth of the body.

All mammals produce colostrum, but colostrum powder is usually made from cow’s milk. Accordingly, it is often called bovine colostrum. Bovine colostrum is remarkably similar in structure and nutritional value to human colostrum.

Colostrum powder contains a high amount of protein and growth hormones that are beneficial for the faster development of human beings.

How do I use colostrum powder?

You can use colostrum powder in many interesting ways, including

  • at breakfast by mixing it with milk to pour over your cereal
  • Mixing it into dessert servings of yoghurt, ice cream, custard or cream
  • Adding it to your favourite smoothie, or milk-based drink
  • Add to dips that are either mayonnaise or sour cream-based
  • Adding it to pancake or waffle mixtures
  • You can even add some to your morning coffee

The potential uses of colostrum powder are baking and food preparation.

How do I take colostrum powder?

Colostrum can be taken orally as a supplement or incorporated into existing meals. It is recommended that somewhere between ten and twenty grams of colostrum powder be added to your diet on a daily basis.

Benefits of Reusable Vegetable Bags

Reducing Plastic Waste: Plastic bags can take up to 1000 years to decompose, contributing to environmental pollution and harming wildlife. Using reusable produce bags helps reduce plastic waste and protect the environment.

Protecting Wildlife: Plastic pollution poses a severe threat to marine life, causing harm and death to millions of sea turtles, birds, and other animals each year. By using reusable produce bags, you can help reduce plastic pollution and protect wildlife.

Environmentally Friendly: Reusable produce bags are made from eco-friendly materials like muslin, canvas, or hemp, which are biodegradable and have a lower environmental impact compared to plastic bags.

Cost-Effective: Reusable bags can be used multiple times, making them a cost-effective option compared to single-use plastic bags. They can last for months or even years with proper care and maintenance.

Durable and Washable: Reusable produce bags are designed to withstand regular use and can be easily washed and reused. This makes them a practical and convenient choice for everyday shopping.

Discounts and Incentives: Many grocery stores offer discounts or incentives to customers who bring their reusable produce bags. These incentives encourage eco-friendly practices and help reduce plastic waste.

Benefits of Natural Toothpaste:

name: Dextrose Monohydrate
description:
What is Dextrose Monohydrate?

Dextrose monohydrate is a sugar that is chemically identical to glucose. Glucose is a sugar that is extracted by any food that we consume and this glucose works as a fuel of the body. Dextrose monohydrate is also known as corn sugar or grape sugar, it is basically used to provide instant energy to anybody.

Dextrose monohydrate is extensively used in the food industry and has been used for the medical purpose as well.

In simple terms, dextrose monohydrate is a component that is most common in starchy food such as potatoes, rice, honey, and fruits. Dextrose monohydrate got its recognition because of its high glycemic index which makes it very fast absorbing carbohydrate.

Dextrose Monohydrate Benefits

Advocates have suggested that dextrose monohydrate can benefit the consumer in the following ways:

  • Rich in simple carbs: 100 gram of dextrose monohydrate serving contains 90 grams of simple and fast absorbing carbs. Carbs are the primary source of fuel for the body and it is a great source to revitalize yourself.

  • Fast absorption: If you are feeling fatigue after a tiring day then dextrose monohydrate can be a great way to retain your energy.

  • Great intra-workout: People who are interested in long workout sessions can take the support of dextrose monohydrate to extend their exercise time.

Dextrose monohydrate side effects :

Many people are not sure about the side-effects of dextrose monohydrate but is it really bad for you? It depends on the scenario, If you are type-2 diabetic then this dextrose monohydrate might not be good for your health because it will give your body a sudden spike of insulin that you definitely don’t want. But if you are a sports person or had a hectic day and looking for instant energy then dextrose monohydrate can prove to be wonders for you, it can make you feel refreshed.

description:
Liquid Stevia Australia

Wondering where to buy Liquid stevia in Australia? Why search somewhere else when you have Buy Organics Online where we provide you with a range of flavoured stevia drops and other Liquid stevia products that have been sourced from only the most trusted brands. So why wait? Purchase Liquid stevia Australia products and organic Stevia products from Buy Organics Online to sweeten your meals naturally at an exceptional price!

What is Liquid Stevia?

Liquid stevia is extracted from the stevia plant that has been used as a sugar alternative since the 16th century, the plant was originally from Paraguay and Brazil but Japan and China have also started cultivating this plant because of its benefits.

liquid stevia got its recognition because of its low calorie and high sugary taste. It is 200-300 times sweeter than table sugar. Some researchers have also classified liquid stevia as a zero-calorie sugar alternative.

Is Liquid Stevia Better for you?

Advocates have suggested that organic stevia used as a sweetener in liquid form can benefit the consumer in the following ways:

  • Being a sugar free sweetener, stevia can offer potential benefits to diabetics. Studies have shown that Stevia can help to substantially decrease blood sugar levels [1] It is important to use stevia products that do not have additives such as dextrose or maltodextrin which can actually increase blood sugar levels. [2] Using stevia sweetener in moderation may help to keep blood sugar levels under control.
  • Weight control: Being a sweetener containing no calories, stevia offers the possibility of consuming fewer calories while satisfying that sweet tooth. It has been suggested that an average person consumes about 180 calories through sugar. Switching to liquid stevia can help you reduce that intake by 150 calories.
  • Lowers high blood pressure: Liquid stevia is also found to be very effective in controlling hypertension and high blood pressure.[3]

Can I use liquid stevia for baking?

Sugar is not just a sweetener baking ingredient. It also is used to moisten and add body to the end product. Simply replacing sugar with liquid stevia will result in a dry flat cake or whatever other product you're trying to cook. To avoid this we suggest that you follow these steps:

  • 1: Work out how much sugar is specified in the original recipe. Then substitute 1 teaspoon of liquid stevia sweetener for every cup of sugar required n the recipe.
  • 2: Mix all of the dry ingredients needed in a large mixing bowl.
  • 3: To make up the missing sugar bulk, add an extra half cup of liquid per cup of sugar required in the original recipe. Some suggestions include using extra amounts of liquid already present in the recipe or using alternate bulking agents like water, plain yogurt or egg whites.
  • 4: Finally combine all of the ingredients and add your liquid stevia sweetener. Bake as directed.

By following this process sugar can be replaced with liquid stevia to deliver the same great taste while not piling on extra calories that consuming excessive amounts of sugar bring. The substitution amount may require some experimentation according to taste.
