name: Organic Castor Oil
description:
The Benefits of Organic Castor Oil for Hair, Skin and Body

Please note: the information contained on this page is for informational purposes only and should not be construed as medical advice.

Organic castor oil has long been used as a natural remedy, with many advantageous effects for skin and hair care. All the beneficial properties this product offers make it an outstanding alternative to cosmetics full of chemicals. To get more acquainted with this product and its multiple purposes, take some time to read on in order to read and explore all that organic castor oil has in store, from its different uses across beauty routines up until now!

What is organic castor oil?

Organic castor oil is used today for medicinal and pharmaceutical purposes. It is an additive in various foods, skin care products, and medications.

Key Takeaways

  • Organic castor oil is a safe, natural product with numerous benefits for hair and skin.

  • Cold-pressed castor oil can be blended with essential oils to create personalised hydrating blends for dry or oily skin types.

  • Following dosage guidelines and safety precautions when using organic castor oil is important.

Discovering Organic Castor Oil

Organic castor oil is derived from the Ricinus communis plant, and its seeds have been used for centuries in traditional medicine due to their countless benefits. This unique oil is suitable for all skin types. Offering an array of advantages, Nature’s Shield Organic Castor Oil comes with certified organic credentials obtained through sustainable sources, allowing you access to important information on how this remarkable substance can be explicitly adapted in order to apply to your skincare routine or hair needs.

What makes castor oil organic?

Organic castor oil is an eco-friendly product derived from this plant's seeds and produced without synthetic chemicals or pesticides. The terms “cold-pressed” or “unrefined” are indicated on their label with the USDA or ACO Organic seal. Such items will be rich sources of vitamins, minerals, and fatty acids that nourish your skin and hair and assist in sustainability initiatives by reducing contamination caused by chemical use. In conclusion, note: organic castor oil provides many advantages over other alternatives, as it’s safe for consumers while helping out our environment, too!

The Power of Cold-Pressed Castor Oil

Organic castor oil obtained through cold-pressed extraction is renowned for its potent benefits and quality in hair and skincare. Nature’s Shield Organic Castor Oil maintains its natural properties by mechanically pressing the seeds without heat or chemicals added.

Cold-pressing also helps extend shelf life as this process prevents degradation of essential components, which lets you confidently buy and stock up your supply with the knowledge that there will be no loss of potency over a more extended period (spanning several months). This ensures each application results in superior effectiveness compared with standard oils available on the market.

Hair Care Advantages of Castor Oil

Castor oil offers so many unique advantages for hair care. It hydrates and moisturises the scalp, works on reducing a dry and flakey scalp, boosts circulation to increase the growth of strands, and prevents breakage for healthier locks. This remedy is perfect if you battle! Incorporating castor oil into any routine takes no effort; you must know how to use it efficiently. Massage onto the head or hair, leaving some time before washing off (potentially overnight), mix in preferred products as a booster against cleansers’ harshness on follicles, then apply to brows and lashes. There’s nothing wrong with exploring novel avenues when caring for those luscious lashes.

Skin Care Benefits of Castor Oil

Using castor oil as part of your skincare routine can be a real game-changer, providing notable hydrating effects and promoting an overall youthful appearance. Rich in anti-inflammatory properties, this natural remedy helps reduce swelling and puffiness while stimulating the production of elastin and collagen. All these benefits contribute to improved texture tone, helping you achieve a flawless-looking complexion with diminished wrinkles over time. Whether employed independently or mixed with other skincare products, for optimal results, incorporating castor oil into one’s regimen is worth giving a shot!

Essential Oil Combinations with Castor Oil

By combining castor oil with essential oils, you can create tailored remedies in order to address specific skin issues and other ways to boost your overall complexion health. These mixtures hold powerful qualities that provide nourishment and hydration, which will help you deal with and meet any needs or desires you may have for the state of your skin.

Castor Oil Blends for Dry Skin

For those dealing with dry skin, combining organic castor oil and essential oils such as lavender, frankincense, or cedarwood can lead to a profoundly hydrating combination. Not only does this concoction provide moisture to improve the complexion, but it can also relieve discomfort related to drying out, irritation, and inflammation alike.

By customising mixtures according to one’s specific needs, you will learn to have access to a softer and supple appearance and increased overall well-being of your delicate dermis too!

Castor Oil Blends for Oily Skin

If you are dealing with oily skin, there is no need to panic; essential oils such as rosemary, tea tree, and geranium can be combined with castor oil for a skincare routine that yields balanced results. These components have powerful astringent properties, which help reduce excess sebum production while minimising inflammation and allowing your complexion to remain clear and radiant over time. Consistent use of the blend will not only make your skin look healthier, but it won’t lose its natural moisture, either! So, give this tailored mix of ingredients an opportunity if you want both improved appearance and better overall health for your precious complexion.

Purchasing and Using Organic Castor Oil

Organic castor oil can be purchased from various outlets, including online stores and health food markets. When ordering online, there are also shipping options provided for bulk online orders and delivery. As with any natural product, it’s essential to make sure that your purchase comes from a trusted source, so check the organic seal on the label along with “cold-pressed” or “unrefined” written on it to get hold of an optimum quality product. It is recommended that adults consume 1-2 tablespoons daily, while children should have only between 1-3 teaspoons per day. Always follow the safety precautions mentioned in the dosage instructions when using organic castor oil. To ensure you’re getting tremendous value, look out for companies like Nature Shield, who offer top-grade products at competitive rates!

Safety Considerations and Precautions

Using organic castor oil offers a range of advantages. It’s necessary to take certain safety precautions. Before applying the oil to your skin, you should conduct a patch test, as this product may irritate some people. Castor Oil must also not be used during pregnancy or when experiencing abdominal discomfort, and long-term use is discouraged due to its potential for dependence.

By being mindful of these considerations, one can ensure peace of mind while enjoying the benefits of organically produced ingredients and items, such as castor oil.  Check out our guide, which explains the many benefits of going organic.

Summary

Organic castor oil is a much-treasured natural remedy that has been around for centuries due to its wide range of skin and hair care benefits. By embracing this sustainable approach to beauty, users can experience the remarkable potential it holds when added as part of their daily self-care routine. So don’t wait; unleash the power of nature today by incorporating organic castor oil into your personal grooming regimen!

Frequently Asked Questions

What is castor oil used for?

Castor oil is known to be a valuable, natural remedy for addressing various issues like constipation, skin problems, wound healing of wounds, and the alleviation of dry skin and joint pain. It can also help promote scalp health while encouraging healthy hair growth.

Why was castor oil banned?

Due to its ricin content, the sale and use of castor oil have been restricted since it can be hazardous for humans and animals alike. Ricin is known to cause gastrointestinal and neuromuscular problems, which may prove fatal if untreated. Thus, this toxin demands caution regarding the purchase and use of castor oil. Any risks taken should only happen after proper medical advice and information have been acquired first from professionals or otherwise instructed healthcare personnel

Does castor oil work to grow hair?

No research exists to support the claim that castor oil can directly assist with hair growth, though it is known for its anti-inflammatory attributes as well as rich supplies of omega-6 and 9 fatty acids and vitamin E. These components can reduce scalp inflammation while nourishing the area, which could improve and possibly advance healthy hair development.

Chemical Composition of Organic Castor Oil:

Organic castor oil primarily comprises ricinoleic acid, a monounsaturated fatty acid noted for its distinctive hydroxyl group. It also contains other fatty acids like oleic, linoleic, and stearic acids. In addition, castor oil includes smaller amounts of tocopherols, phytosterols, and phenolic compounds.

Molecular Structure and Functional Groups of Ricinoleic Acid: Ricinoleic acid is characterised by its hydroxyl group's cis-12 configuration, which plays a crucial role in its polarity and unique characteristics. Additionally, ricinoleic acid joins with glycerol through an ester linkage, forming triglycerides essential components of castor oil.

Chemical Reactivity of Ricinoleic Acid and Its Derivatives:

The hydroxyl group in ricinoleic acid is reactive, allowing for various chemical reactions that lead to the production of different castor oil derivatives. Ricinoleic acid can undergo esterification, oxidation, and polymerization, showcasing its versatile chemical reactivity.

Physicochemical Properties of Organic Castor Oil:

Organic castor oil exhibits specific. These characteristics are directly related to the oil's chemical structure and composition, influencing its physical and chemical behaviour.

Biological and Pharmacological Properties of Ricinoleic Acid and Its Derivatives:

Ricinoleic acid and its derivatives are known for their anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and antioxidant properties. These biological effects are attributed to the potential mechanisms at play within the molecular structure of ricinoleic acid.

Applications of Organic Castor Oil and Its Derivatives:

Organic castor oil is utilised in various industrial applications, including lubricants, surfactants, and pharmaceutical products. Furthermore, due to their unique properties and potential, there's growing interest in the use of castor oil and its derivatives in biomedical fields, such as in drug delivery systems and regenerative medicine.

 
Adding organic castor oil to your navel area can help reduce the discomfort brought about by menstruation and endometriosis. For optimum outcomes, this may be used in conjunction with hot teas created from raspberry leaf, nettle, and licorice herb combinations. Benefits should be clearly evident when these are combined appropriately.

What is the difference between organic and regular castor oil?

Organic castor oil is a product that has not been made with synthetic compounds pesticides or add-ons; it is pure and unadulterated. On the other hand, regular castor oil could have artificial elements or chemical add-on traces in its composition. The use of this natural resource without any additions or add-ons makes organic castor oil stand out from its traditional version.

name: Organic tampons
description:
Organic Tampons: A Natural Choice for Your Feminine Hygiene

Organic tampons are a sustainable and chemical-free alternative to conventional tampons, offering numerous benefits for your health and the environment. Crafted from 100% organic cotton, these tampons are devoid of any harmful substances, ensuring a safer and more comfortable experience during your period.

Key Benefits of Organic Tampons:

  • Natural and Hypoallergenic: Made from organic cotton, these tampons are gentle on your skin, reducing the risk of irritation and allergic reactions.
  • No Harmful Chemicals: Unlike conventional tampons, organic tampons are free from harmful chemicals like chlorine, pesticides, and dioxins, which can have adverse effects on your health.
  • Reduced Risk of Toxic Shock Syndrome (TSS): Organic tampons are less likely to cause TSS, a rare but serious infection associated with the use of tampons.
  • Biodegradable and Compostable: Organic tampons are biodegradable and compostable, making them an eco-friendly choice that helps minimise waste.
  • Better Absorbency: Organic cotton possesses excellent absorbency, providing reliable protection and preventing leaks.

How to Use Organic Tampons:

  1. Wash your hands thoroughly before handling the tampon.
  2. Remove the wrapper carefully and position the tampon at the opening of your vagina.
  3. Gently insert the tampon using your index finger. Push it in until the tip is no longer visible.
  4. Change your tampon every 4-8 hours, or as needed.
  5. Dispose of the used tampon in a sanitary manner.

Tips for Choosing Organic Tampons:

  • Look for organic tampons that are certified by a reputable organisation, such as the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS).
  • Choose tampons that are free from additives, fragrances, and dyes.
  • Select the absorbency level that suits your menstrual flow.

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: Can I use organic tampons if I have sensitive skin?

A: Yes, organic tampons are a great option for those with sensitive skin, as they are free from harsh chemicals and irritants.

Q: Are organic tampons more expensive than conventional tampons?

A: Organic tampons may be slightly more expensive than conventional tampons, but the investment in your health and the environment is worth it.

Q: Where can I buy organic tampons?

A: You can find organic tampons at health food stores, online retailers, and some drugstores.

Take Control of Your Feminine Hygiene with Organic Tampons

Make the switch to organic tampons today and experience the difference. With their natural composition, reduced risk of health issues, and positive environmental impact, organic tampons are the conscious choice for your feminine hygiene.

Activated charcoal is much different from the raw charcoal, raw charcoal is processed under intense pressure to convert into activated charcoal, Activated charcoal pieces are porous and have a large surface area, impurities get stuck into the activated charcoal and you get the purified water.

Charcoal cant make hard water softer but it can help you reduce the impurities and chemical compounds from water.

Camu Camu Powder has got all the nutrients to be your next favorite food based supplement.

What is camu camu powder?

Camu camu powder comes from the dried form of Camu camu (scientific name Myrciaria dubia) Camu Camu is a sour berry, that looks something like a cherry, having similar coloring.

The berry is fragile and native to the Amazon rainforest. It’s rise in worldwide popularity necessitates that it be dried and crushed into powder. Another reason why the powdered form of camu camu is more popular is that the fresh berries have a tart, almost unpleasant flavor.

Camu camu has a high concentration of nutrients, plant compounds and vitamin C causing many to proclaim it to be a superfood.

What is camu camu powder used for?

Traditionally the camu camu fruit and leaves have been used for medicinal purposes and has been utilised to treat such conditions as the common cold, cataracts, atherosclerosis and chronic fatigue syndrome.

Its status as a superfood has now led to many people using it in order to boost  energy levels and maintain their overall health  and in particular such areas as the immune system, eyes, skin and gums.

How does it work?

Camu camu fruit contains many nutrients including vitamin C, beta-carotene, fatty acids, protein, and others. It also contains other chemicals that might have an effect on the body. However, there is not enough information to know how camu camu might work for treating or preventing any medical condition.

Camu Camu Powder Benefits

Advocates have suggested that Camu Camu Powder benefits the consumer in the following ways:

  • Antioxidants: with the massive amount of vitamin C, these berries are very high in antioxidants. These antioxidants may strengthen your immunity and prevention of damage against free radicals.

  • Liver health: these Camu Camu berries were traditionally used by people to improve liver health, later some research suggested the presence of a compound called 1-methylmalate helped in improving liver health.

  • Weight loss: this powder may help in controlling your weight gain through regulating the healthy gut bacterias which play a key role in the body’s metabolism.

  • Anti-inflammatory properties: Vitamin C is a natural anti-inflammatory substance and may help in reducing the pain of arthritis, headache, hemorrhoids, etc.

  • Antiviral and antibacterial: Camu Camu is a natural antiseptic which may help in keeping you away from any bacterial or viral infection.

  • Cure hangover: with the presence of many nutrients, especially Vitamin C can help in curing hangover. It may help with reducing headache and flushing all the toxins from the body.

How to use camu camu powder

The camu camu berry is most popular in its powdered form due to the powder having a prolonged shelf life and a higher concentration of nutrition.  The powder can be easily added to a variety of foods that allow a little creativity. Such dishes as smoothies, porridge, muesli, yogurt, and salad dressing make the perfect vehicles for camu camu powder. As using it in combination with other flavors helps to mask the sour taste..

name: Barley Flour
description:
What Is Barley Flour?

Barley flour is made from ground and dried barley.  It is extensively used in the preparation of barley bread, yeast breads and flat bread.  This product can be divided into two categories – coarse and fine. Coarse flour is made using barley groats, while fine flour is made from milled pearl barley.  It is also used to create composite flour by adding it to wheat. This composite flour creates a darker baked product. Speciality foods like barley breading and barley crunch are also made from barley flour.

What is malted barley flour?

Malted barley flour is barley flour that has gone through a malting process designed to stimulate enzyme activity. The barley is allowed to germinate and then is steam dried and hulled before it is ground and finally sifted.

There are actually two varieties of malted barley flour. These are

  • Diastatic which is the more common variety. This is taste neutral and contains active enzymes making it a good baking choice.

  • Non diastatic, which does not have active enzymes, but does have flavour and is often used to glaze baked goods. It is sometimes referred to as malt powder.

How is barley flour made?

Barley flour is made by grinding barley. Barley groats are ground to make coarse barley flour while pearl barley is ground to make fine barley flour.

Barley Flour Benefits

Barley is recognized as being one of the best whole grain choices for nutrition. In comparison to other flours, organic barley flour is low in fat and carbohydrates while offering high fibre and mineral nutrition.  This change in diet can lead to significant benefits including:

  • High Fibre source – means more satisfying meals, less between meal cravings and more ability to control blood sugar levels

  • Improves digestion and enhances the regularity of bowel movements

  • Assists with weight loss by reducing hunger levels and absorbing starch at a slower pace

  • Its high levels of insoluble fibre limits the body’s ability to absorb cholesterol

  • Improved heart health – aside from reducing cholesterol, barley is known to help reduce high blood pressure, assist in arterial health, prevent harmful blood clotting and the prevention of plaque build up on arteries.

  • Source of antioxidants

How to use barley flour

Barley flour is often used as a wheat flour substitute and works really well on a 1:1 basis for such recipes as muffins, cookies or quick breads. It does not work as well for yeast breads as there simply is not enough gluten in barley flour to make the yeast rise. If using barley flour in these tyes of recipes, you will still have to use traditional flour, but can swap out about a quarter for barley flour. This will help to give the bread more fibre and contribute to a fuller more satisfied feeling.

Another use of barley flour is to help with skin whitening. A mixture of barley flour, rose water, lemon and honey can make a paste that will help with skin lightening and a smoother, creamier complexion.

Where to Buy Organic Barley Flour

If you have been looking for where to buy barley flour that has been produced ethically and organically, ten we have the place for you.

name: Apricot Kernel Oil
description:
Apricot kernel oil, a natural product revered for its health and beauty benefits, is explored in this guide. Aimed at enhancing understanding and usability, this article presents information in a clear, structured manner, complete with practical application tips, a buyer's guide, FAQs, and expert insights.

Understanding Apricot Kernel Oil

Extracted from the seeds of apricots, this oil is known for its rich nutritional content, including vitamins A, E, and C, alongside essential fatty acids. However, it's important to be aware of its amygdalin content, which in large quantities could be harmful.

WARNING: Apricot kernels contain amygdalin, a substance that can be metabolised into hydrogen cyanide in the body. Hydrogen cyanide is a poisonous substance that can cause serious health problems, including vomiting, dizziness, seizures, and even death. The World Health Organization (WHO) has classified amygdalin as a possible human carcinogen. Due to the potential health risks associated with apricot kernels, we strongly advise against their consumption. If you choose to consume apricot kernels, do so with extreme caution and consult with a healthcare professional before doing so.

Nutritional Profile and Health Benefits

  • Rich in Vitamins and Fatty Acids: Beneficial for both skin and hair health.
  • Amygdalin Content: Moderate consumption is recommended, especially when used in cooking.

Practical Applications

Skin Care

  • Hydrating: Suitable for dry skin, providing moisture without clogging pores.
  • Usage Tips: Apply a small amount post-shower for best absorption.

Hair Care

  • Conditioning: Can be used as a scalp treatment or a hair serum for added shine.
  • Application: Massage a few drops into the scalp or apply to the ends of the hair.

Culinary Use

  • Flavour Enhancer: Adds a nutty taste to dishes.
  • Usage Caution: Due to its amygdalin content, use in moderation.

Buyer's Guide

  • Organic Certification: Ensures the absence of harmful chemicals.
  • Cold-Pressed: Cold-pressed oils retain more nutrients.
  • Ethical Sourcing: Opt for fair trade and non-GMO products.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Can apricot kernel oil be used daily? Yes, for external use, but in moderation for cooking.
  • Is apricot kernel oil suitable for all skin types? Generally, yes, but patch testing is recommended for sensitive skin.

Expert Insights

Experts in dermatology and nutrition acknowledge apricot kernel oil's moisturizing and nutrient-rich properties while also advising caution due to its amygdalin content.

Conclusion

Apricot kernel oil is a versatile and beneficial natural product, but it's important to use it wisely, especially in culinary contexts, due to its amygdalin content. This guide aims to provide clear, practical advice for anyone looking to incorporate apricot kernel oil into their daily routine.

References

  1. Healthline - Apricot Kernel Oil
  2. WebMD - Benefits of Apricot Kernel Oil
  3. Journal of Nutritional Science and Vitaminology

Buy from Buy Organics Online today and reap the medicinal and cosmetic benefits from this and other amazing skin oil products.

name: Freeze Dried Strawberries
description:
What are Freeze Dried Strawberries?

Freeze dried strawberries are created in a complicated process that involves placing the fruit in a sealed pressurized container before freezing it.  The temperature of the container is then increased, causing the ice within the fruit to vaporize. The vapour is then sucked out of the container leaving only the dried fruit behind. 

This space-age process initially created by NASA enables the natural benefits of strawberries to be preserved in freeze dried form  long after their usual use by date. Organic freeze dried strawberries are organic strawberries that have undergone the same process 

What are the Benefits of Freeze Dried Strawberries?

Besides the obvious benefits of allowing more produce to be effectively used, freeze dried strawberries have been shown to provide some significant other benefits.

A study by Oklahoma State University found that  a diet containing freeze dried strawberries helped to reduce levels of cholesterol and MDA (malondialdehyde) - a probable cause of oxidative stress. The study's findings have been supported by other studies including a recent Italian  report in the Journal of nutritional biochemistry that also found significant reductions in cholesterol levels after a diet containing freeze dried strawberries was instigated.

Freeze drying  allows all the nutrients contained in strawberries to be preserved,  prolonging the life of the fruit. 

Freeze dried fruit can be eaten  as is or incorporated in a number of recipes and toppings.

Where to Buy Freeze Dried Strawberries That Australia Can Trust For Taste and Organic Goodness

name: Gluten Free Cereal
description:
Why go Gluten Free Cereal

Besides the 1 in 70 reported cases of Coeliac disease in Australia there is much evidence to suggest that many Australians suffer from some form of wheat intolerance.  The CSIRO recently reported that those numbers could be as many as 1 in 7 Australians suffer some form of wheat intolerance.

Traditionally many breakfast cereals have a wheat base or contain gluten in one form or another.  Products containing oats for example are not allowed to be advertised as gluten free in Australia. 

If you suffer from Coeliac disease you simply must adhere to a wheat free diet.  Similarly if you suffer some intolerance to wheat it may be beneficial to reduce your wheat  intake.

Fortunately there are many gluten-free cereals available today in Australia  You can now pour a bowl of delicious cereal, comfortable in the knowledge that it contains no gluten.

Who is gluten free cereal good for?

Gluten free cereal is good for people suffering from celiac (coeliac) disease and for those diagnosed to be gluten intolerant.

What cereal is gluten free

There are many variations of gluten free cereal that coeliacs can enjoy. Generally, cereals made from corn, rice or oats will meet the requirements of being gluten free. For a filling, nutritious breakfast cereal that is sure to taste great while being gluten free, a safe bet is gluten free  muesli.

Benefits of Gluten Free Breakfast Cereal

Besides allowing Coeliac disease sufferers to enjoy a good breakfast cereal, taking the decision to reduce your intake of gluten by choosing a high fibre Gluten-free cereal may have some surprising benefits.  So, what are the benefits of gluten free cereal? They are:

  • Can help to reduce cholesterol levels

  • Helps with digestive health

  • Increased energy levels 

  • Increased intake of antioxidants, vitamins and minerals will help in improving overall health

  • Can help sufferers of irritable bowel syndrome and arthritis

  • Reduced intake of processed foods 

  • Helps with healthy weight gain as sufferers from coeliac disease often suffer from weight loss.

  • Reduces bloating and gas associated with gluten intolerance.

  • Can help reduce inflammation which may ease joint pain.

  • Helps to ease depression which is common among coeliac sufferers. This is more associated with the effects of the disease being eased by a gluten free diet rather than any chemical reaction.

  • Helps to ease lactose intolerance in gluten intolerant people as their gut struggles to produce the enzyme lactase.

  • Improves absorption of calcium which may contribute to bone health.

Gluten Free Cereal Australia Will Love

name: Soap Berries
description:
What are soap berries?

Soap berries, soapberries or soap nuts as they are sometimes called are a small fruit grown naturally in the foothills of the Himalayan mountains. THis remarkable fruit, used for centuries in Ayurvedic medicine contains a gentle soap, Saponin, within its skin. The Saponin acts to break surface tension between the water and build a lather that can remove dirt and grease from the skin. Organic soapberries have been grown naturally without being subjected to any harmful chemicals or fertilisers.

Soapberries laundry detergent acts in a very similar way and is capable of penetrating fibres and gently lifting stubborn stains from clothing.

Benefits of Soapberries.

When used as a soap, soapberries creates a lather that is pH balanced and therefore very gentle on the skin. It is a natural soap and moisturiser. As a laundry detergent, soapberries work wonderfully well. It is recommended that between 5-8 soapberry shells be placed in a small cotton bag and added to the washing machine. The bag can be left in for the full wash cycle as they are known to make a great fabric softener. 

One of the distinctive characteristics of the soapberry is the comparative lack of lather compared to commercial soaps. T may surprise you to learn that the lather in commercial soaps is created by the use of artificial foaming agents that have little cleansing qualities at all. 

Soapberries  are also known to be beneficial for sufferers of eczema and psoriasis. They are also suitable for use in grey water and septic systems.

name: BPA Free Water Bottles
description:
What is a BPA free water bottle?

BPA free water bottles are more popular than ever and there’s a very good reason for that. BPA can be very harmful to our bodies. BPA refers to a chemical called Bisphenol A which is found in many plastics. The chemical can seep from the drink bottle and into your water. 

The likelihood and extent to which BPA will seep from your plastic water bottle into your water depends on a number of factors. The hotter the liquid in the bottle is the more likely BPA will seep into your beverage and the likelihood also increases with the age of the bottle. 

If you’re health conscious you won’t  want to risk it- which is why using BPA free water bottles makes a great choice. 

Water bottle BPA free benefits

  • learning difficulties

  • diabetes (type 2)

name: Fire Roasted Tomatoes
description:
What Are Fire Roasted Tomatoes?

Understanding Fire Roasted Tomatoes

Canned fire roasted tomatoes have become increasingly popular in culinary circles, known for adding a subtle yet distinct difference to meals. But what are fire roasted tomatoes? These are tomatoes that have been roasted over an open flame, which not only enhances their natural sweetness but also adds a smoky flavour. This unique taste is sometimes further enriched with onion or garlic powder.

Varieties of Fire Roasted Tomatoes

The fire roasted tomato comes in several forms, making it a versatile kitchen addition. Whether you opt for fire-burned diced tomatoes or crushed or dried varieties, each brings a unique flair to dishes like pasta sauces, soups, and salsas. Besides their distinctive taste, fire roasted tomatoes are packed with.

How to Make Fire Roasted Tomatoes at Home

The Process of Making Fire Roasted Tomatoes

Creating fire roasted tomatoes is simple and can be done in your kitchen. A popular choice for this process is Roma tomatoes, known for their meaty and fleshy consistency, which holds well when grilled.

Start by slicing the tomatoes in half and brushing them with olive oil. Grill them on a medium flame until they develop dark char marks, and their skins blacken. Once removed from the grill and cooled, peel off the blackened skins and dice the flesh for use in your favourite recipes.

Health Benefits of Canned Fire Roasted Tomatoes

Nutritional Advantages of Fire Roasted Tomatoes

Canned fire roasted tomatoes are not just a flavourful addition to dishes; they also retain the health benefits of canned tomato products. Rich in fibre, potassium, and vitamins C and E, they contain antioxidants like lycopene and beta-carotene. Interestingly, cooking increases the bioavailability of lycopene, suggesting that fire-roasted tomatoes offer more health benefits than their fresh counterparts.

name: Apricot Kernels
description:
Apricot kernels, the seeds found within the stone of apricots, have long been a subject of both nutritional intrigue and health-related controversy. This comprehensive exploration delves into their historical uses, potential health benefits, and, crucially, the potential side effects, including the risks associated with cyanide poisoning.

Overview of Apricot Kernels

Apricot kernels are classified into two types: sweet and bitter. Bitter kernels contain significant amounts of amygdalin, which can produce cyanide—a toxic compound—when ingested. This risk contrasts starkly with their historical use in traditional medicine across various cultures.

Historical Use in Traditional Medicine

In traditional medicinal practices, particularly in Asian cultures, apricot kernels have been used for their perceived therapeutic properties, notably in respiratory health.

Section 1: The Benefits of Apricot Kernels

Traditional Health Benefits

Traditionally, apricot kernels have been used for their purported immune-boosting and analgesic properties and as a natural cancer remedy. However, there is no supporting scientific data for these claims.

Section 2: Apricot Kernels in Modern Health Practices

Current Research and Studies

Modern research is investigating, but findings still need to be conclusive. The National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health highlights the importance of cautious use due to cyanide risks.

Role in Natural Therapy

In natural therapy, apricot kernel supplements and oil are noted for their purported health benefits, although these claims often lack solid scientific backing.

Section 3: How to Use Apricot Kernels

Ingesting Apricot Kernels

It's critical to adhere to safe consumption guidelines due to the risk of cyanide poisoning.

Apricot Kernel Oil in Skincare

The oil is popular in skincare for its moisturising properties.

Section 4: Choosing the Right Apricot Kernel Products

Selecting Quality Products

Opt for certified organic products from reputable brands.

Recommended Products

  • Apricot Kernel Supplements
  • Apricot Kernel Oil

Section 5: Safety and Risks

Potential Risks and Side Effects

The primary risk associated with apricot kernels is cyanide poisoning. Symptoms range from mild (headaches, dizziness, nausea) to severe (respiratory failure, cardiac arrest). In extreme cases, cyanide poisoning from apricot kernels can be fatal. Although death is rare, it underscores the importance of adhering to safe consumption guidelines. The World Health Organization advises against consuming more than two small bitter apricot kernels per day for adults, with even lower limits for those of lower body weight and vulnerable groups such as pregnant or breastfeeding women.

Dosage and Precautions

Adhering to recommended dosages is crucial, especially for at-risk groups.

Conclusion

Apricot kernels are a complex subject; while they hold traditional medicinal value and nutritional benefits, their potential health risks, particularly the danger of cyanide poisoning, must be carefully considered. Understanding their benefits and risks is essential for making informed health choices.

FAQ Section

  1. Health Benefits: Nutrient-rich, with potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, though conclusive evidence is lacking.
  2. Illness Treatment: No substantial evidence supports their use in treating cancer-related diseases.
  3. Consumption: Should be consumed within recommended safety limits.
  4. Risks: Cyanide poisoning, potentially fatal in high doses.
  5. Bitter vs. Sweet Kernels: Bitter kernels have higher amygdalin levels, increasing cyanide risk.
  6. External Use: Apricot kernel oil is used to moisturise skincare.
  7. Quality Products: Look for certified organic products from trusted sources.

Disclaimer: Apricot kernels contain amygdalin, a substance that can be metabolized into hydrogen cyanide in the body. Hydrogen cyanide is a poisonous substance that can cause serious health problems, including death. The World Health Organization (WHO) has classified amygdalin (vitamin B17) as a possible human carcinogen. Due to the potential health risks associated with apricot kernels, we recommend that you consult with a healthcare professional before consuming them.

 

References:

  • NICM Health Research Institute, Australia.
  • Australian Traditional Medicine Society.
  • National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health, U.S.
  • PubMed: ["Current Studies on Apricot Kernels"].
  • Cochrane: ["Health Impacts of Apricot Kernels Review"].
  • World Health Organization: ["Guidelines on Apricot Kernel Consumption"].

At Buy Organics Online you can purchase apricot kernels that have been sourced from well-known suppliers within the apricot kernel industry. Now you can switch to a skincare scrub treatment with no nasty chemicals. Buy your organic apricot kernels from Buy Organics Online today and be assured of their natural quality.

name: Natural Iron Supplements
description:
Why take natural iron supplements

A number of factors can cause an iron deficiency which may necessitate the use of natural iron supplements in the diet. A lack of iron can cause general feelings of tiredness, lethargy and mental listlessness. 

Iron is necessary in the diet as it aids the growth of new cells and red blood cells in particular. Conversely, too much iron in the diet can lead to an increased risk of heart disease. Before self medicating and taking iron supplements of any kind, it is best to consult your GP and arrange for a blood test to confirm your low iron levels.

Groups at risk of suffering from iron deficiencies include vegans, pregnant women, people taking painkillers on a long term basis and women experiencing heavy or frequent menstruation.

Benefits of natural iron supplements

Once you have established that you do have an iron deficiency, taking natural iron supplements  can have the following positive effects without causing constipation that ferrous tablets have been known to cause.

  • Helps to fight anemia which can cause dizziness, increased heart rate and fatigue. Anemia is caused by a lack of haemoglobin which is stimulated by an increased iron intake

Why use glass straws?

Glass straws are becoming more and more popular as people  become more conscious of the environment Made from tough durable glass, glass drinking straws are easy to clean, reusable and add a certain novelty factor to drinking from a straw. They can be used for both hot and cold drinks . Their heat resistant capabilities make them a perfect choice for people with sensitive teeth 

Glass straws can be carried with you and used in cafes and restaurants. If you choose to do this, it is best that you carefully wrap the straw in a soft cloth before packing it in your purse, carry bag or briefcase to ensure that  it is transported safely.

Will using glass straws really make a difference?

Plastic drinking straws present a real hazard to the environment as they are easily discarded and do not break down. It is estimated that there are between 437 million and 8.3 billion plastic straws currently polluting the world’s shorelines. Australians use about 10 million straws per day. You can do your bit to reduce this waste by using reusable straws. Every time you drink from a glass straw, that’s one less plastic straw that is destined for landfill or the ocean.

When you use these glass straws in a public place that will also help to increase awareness and potentially demand for these pollution preventing and potentially marine life saving straws.

name: Vegan Sunscreen
description:
What is vegan sunscreen?

As the name implies, vegan sunscreen is a sunscreen that has been manufactured without using animal products of any kind in the manufacturing process. This extends to the testing of products on animals. When you use vegan sunscreen you can be assured that it does not contain any of the following products which are commonly used in NON VEGAN sunscreens:

  • Collagen derived from cows, fish or pigs

  • Stearic acid - animal fats usually obtained from sheep cows or pigs

  • Elastin -  obtained from animal intestines

  • Lanolin

  • Chitin often extracted from crustaceans

  • Beeswax

Benefits of using vegan sunscreen

Besides being just as effective as traditionally produced sunscreens in protecting you from the sun’s rays, using vegan sunscreen will deliver the following benefits.

  • You can be assured that vegan sunscreen is made from all natural products that do ot have potentially harmful toxic substances in them.

  • The ingredients that have been used to make the sunscreen will not be harmful to the environment 

  • No animal products were used in the manufacture of the sunscreen.

  • Vegan products are never tested on animals- so you can be assured that the product you used has not contributed to the cruelty of animals.

  • Vegan sunscreen produced from natural products is much less likely to cause skin reactions. This is particularly reassuring for people who suffer from eczema or have sensitive skin.

name: Magnesium Supplement
description:
Why use a magnesium supplement?

Taking a magnesium supplement can be tremendously beneficial for your body. Magnesium is an essential mineral that the body needs to function properly. The body requires it to perform hundreds of functions including the production of energy and building proteins. The body is unable to produce magnesium naturally, so men need to obtain 420 milligrams of magnesium per day through their diet  and women need to obtain up to 360 milligrams per day.


Taking a magnesium supplement will help people reach  these levels, particularly if they are not eating a diet that is rich in magnesium. The symptoms of low magnesium levels include:

  • Muscle cramping

  • Mental disorders ranging from apathy to depression

  • Feelings of persistent fatigue

  • Osteoporosis

  • Asthma

  • Heartbeat irregularity

Benefits of taking a natural magnesium supplement

Recent studies in Europe and the United States have demonstrated that more than fifty percent of people do not get enough magnesium in their diet. Taking a natural magnesium supplement will help to ensure that you get enough of this vital mineral which will contribute to the following benefits

name: Tamari Sauce
description:
What is Tamari Sauce

Tamari soy sauce is one of the many variations of soy sauces available. Unlike many soy sauces, tamari is not made using wheat, whereas many other sauces contain at least 50% wheat. 

What is in tamari sauce?

Tamari sauce is taken from miso paste which is made up of soybeans, water, salt, koji and moromi. Like soy it is fermented, however, unlike soy sauce little if any wheat is added.

What is tamari sauce made from?

Tamari sauce is made by soaking soybeans before boiling them and allowing them to cool. A type of mold called Koji is allowed to grow on the mashed product. Natural yeast and bacteria generated through the process help the mixture to ferment and produce the sauce.Organic tamari is produced using organically grown ingredients and without introducing any synthetic pollutants or ingredients.

Tamari is a popular addition to stews, soups, stir fry dishes and dipping sauces and can be readily substituted for soy sauce in any recipe. It can also be used as a condiment for noodle dishes, fish and tofu.

What is the difference between tamari and soy sauce?

While tamari sauce and soy sauce are interchangeable, both have distinctive flavours and preferences will vary according to taste. Tamari has a darker colour and is slightly thicker. Soy sauce also can have up to 50% wheat contact whereas, tamari has very little wheat content. 

Benefits of using tamari

Besides being gluten free in most instances, tamari has many nutritious benefits.

As with many other fermented foods, tamari soy contains a healthy quantity of peptides, polysaccharides and oligosaccharides. All of these substances are good for the immune system, and digestion. Tamari is also rich in vitamins, minerals and antioxidant phenolic acids.

Tamari does not taste quite as sharp as soy sauce due to the absence of wheat and many people prefer its taste to soy sauce.

Where to buy tamari

Buy Organics Online has a wide selection of table sauce products for you to choose from. Our varied range of tamari sauces have been sourced from the most reputable tamari soy suppliers in the business. If you’ve been asking, “where can I buy tamari sauce?” The answer is clear - buy tamari sauce from Buy Organics Online and enjoy the mellow tasting healthy gluten free alternative to soy sauce.

name: Dryer Balls
description:
Why use dryer balls?

Wool dryer balls are a natural eco friendly alternative to using liquid fabric softener or dryer sheets. In theory the balls help to stop laundry from clumping together in the dryer. Preventing clumping helps the laundry to dry faster as the warm air can flow more easily between garments. Clothes dryer balls also help to soften fabrics as they continually agitate against the fabric’s surface, making the clothes soft to touch.

Dryer balls are long lasting, with stories of them lasting up to 1000 laundry loads. This makes them a great economical fabric softening choice. 

How to use dryer balls

The important thing to remember is that dryer balls work best moving around between fabrics - so for the best results it is best to use them in small to medium loads. You only need 3 large or 6 regular sized balls to make the magic happen.

For those people who prefer to add a little fragrance to their fabric softener, you can add a few drops of you favourite essential oils like lemon, eucalyptus or lavender to the wool balls and allow them to stand for several hours. The fragrance will permeate through the washing when you use them. To eliminate the buildup of static electricity, you can spray the balls with a few drops of water to raise humidity levels or alternatively pierce one of the balls with a metal safety pin.

Beetroot powder has a slightly sweet earthy taste that packs a lot of nutrients into a teaspoon. One teaspoon of powder roughly contains the nutrients of one whole beetroot. description:
What are coconut chips?

Coconut chips are a wider version of shredded coconut that can be used as a snack like potato chips or as part of a recipe much like nuts or chocolate chips. The chips are roasted to give them a crisp texture - much like the potato chip. Toasted coconut chips are essentially the same. Organic coconut chips are coconut chips that have been made from coconuts that have been grown and harvested without using pesticides or harmful chemicals.

Sometimes called coconut flakes these delightful chips make a delicious alternative snack or can be used as stand alone mix ins in many recipes. They also make great smoothie garnishes, are great in trail mixes, can be mixed in porridge or muesli, sprinkled on salads or even stirred through brown rice. Once you’ve tried coconut chips, you’ll be looking to use them weherever you can.

Health benefits of eating roasted coconut chips

Besides tasting great, coconut chips have several great health benefits. These include:

  • The chips are an excellent source of “good fats” known as medium chain fatty acids. These fats are used as energy rather than stored. They also tend to have the effect of leaving you feeling full so that you won;t be tempted to indulge in snacking on other less healthy options.

  • High fibre content resulting in improved gut health and helping with stabilising blood sugar content

  • Extremely portable making it easy for you to carry a healthy snack alternative rather than be tempted by some of the more processed options available.

name: Maple Sugar
description:
What is maple sugar?

Maple sugar is a sugar that has been obtained from maple tree sap. The process is quite simple. The maple sap is boiled until little liquid remains and the rest of the sap has crystallized. Maple sugar can be used in exactly the same way as cane sugars are used. It can be used as a drink sweetener, cereal topping or as a baking ingredient.

Maple sugar is very sweet - almost twice as sweet as regular sugar - so all recipes should cut  the sugar content by almost half when substituting maple sugar in the recipe. Organic maple sugar is maple sugar that has been certified that a natural production process has been maintained throughout the extraction process.

Benefits of maple sugar

Much like maple syrup, maple sugar is packed full of nutritional benefits. Some of these benefits include:

  • A teaspoon of maple sugar contains less calories than other sugars

  • Unrefined - retaining all its natural goodness

  • Contains essential vitamins and minerals including manganese, zinc,magnesium,riboflavin, calcium and potassium

  • Loaded with antioxidants which are important free radical fighting agents. The amount of antioxidants found in maple sugar is similar to those found in vegetables like broccoli,

  • Improved digestion compared to sugar and other sweeteners

  • Free from artificial sweeteners or coloring

  •  Contains no common allergens

While organic maple sugar has many benefits, like everything it should be consumed in moderation.

name: Decaf Coffee Beans
description:
What are decaf coffee beans?

Decaf coffee beans are natural coffee beans that have had almost all of the caffeine removed from them. Some people prefer to enjoy the taste of coffee without consuming the caffeine that is contained in normal coffee beans. Coffee beans are decaffeinated in a process that effectively strips the beans of their caffeine. Organic decaf coffee beans as the name suggest are coffee beans that have been grown without the aid of chemicals or pesticides and then been put through the decaffeination process.

Decaf coffee beans are not entirely caffeine free. A cup of coffee brewed from decaf beans will contain approximately three milligrams of coffee. This is a miniscule amount compared to a regular cup of coffee which will contain between seventy and one hundred and forty millilitres of caffeine.

What are the benefits of drinking decaffeinated coffee?

Drinking decaffeinated coffee will help to reduce heartburn or acid reflux that drinking normal coffee sometimes causes. It also protects people who are particularly susceptible to the effects of caffeine.

Besides these benefits, decaf coffee retains many of the surprising benefits that coffee has. These benefits include:

  • Coffee is a rich source of antioxidants and in fact may be the largest source of antioxidants in Western diets.Decaf coffee retains most of its antioxidants throughout the decaf process.

  • Decaf coffee is rich in vital nutrients. One cup will contain healthy servings of magnesium, potassium, niacin and vitamin B3.

  • May reduce the risk of contracting type 2 diabetes

  • There may be a link to reduced risk of alzheimer's disease (although more research has to be done in this area.)

Where to buy decaf coffee beans Australia can trust for goodness

At Buy Organics Online you can buy natural organic decaf coffee that has been sourced from highly regarded suppliers within the coffee business.  Now you can enjoy all the benefits and real taste of coffee without overloading your system with caffeine. You can buy your decaf coffee beans at Buy Organics online today.

name: Liquid Chlorophyll
description:
What is liquid chlorophyll

Chlorophyll is the natural pigment that helps plants to go green. High levels of it are found in some natural organic foods including spirulina, wheatgrass, spinach and parsley. Liquid chlorophyll is essentially made by blending one of these chlorophyll rich foods with water.

Organic liquid chlorophyll has been made using organically grown chlorophyll

Commercially produced liquid chlorophyll is defined as a chlorophyll supplement and its content labelling may include chlorophyllin rather than chlorophyll. It is thought that chlorophyllin is more easily absorbed into the body then chlorophyll itself. Liquid chlorophyll may be a better source of chlorophyll than the raw product itself.

What are the benefits of taking liquid chlorophyll?

What is liquid chlorophyll health benefits?

Chlorophyll and chlorophyllin are known to provide significant health benefits in a variety of ways. When answering the question, what is liquid chlorophyll good for, there are a number of scientifically proven benefits that can be used   Some of these scientifically proven ways include:

  • Helps with liver detoxification by helping to naturally improve the removal of toxins and waste from the body.

  • Can help to treat haemoglobin deficiencies. Chlorophyll has a very similar chemical makeup to red blood cells. This similar cellular structure makes it helpful in treating people with anaemia. Chlorophyll is often called a blood builder

  • Some clinical trials have indicated that introducing chlorophyll to a high carb diet may help with weight loss. It is thought that chlorophyll acts as an appetite suppressant.

  • As chlorophyll is likely to stimulate bowel movements it will help to improve your overall digestive health

  • Its high magnesium content will help to maintain the acid alkaline balance which helps to maintain proper functioning kidneys and liver.

  • Is a strong source of antioxidants which combat free radicals likely to cause damage to your body.

  • Helps to maintain healthy iron levels.

  • Can help control inflammation that leads to arthritic conditions.

  • Boosts immune system

  • Chlorophyll contains Vitamin E which helps to stimulate testosterone levels in males and estrogen levels in females.

  • Vitamin K contained in chlorophyll could help to reduce the likelihood of kidney stones as it stimulates urination and reduces the build up of 

  • Promotes overall oral health

What is liquid chlorophyll used for besides internal health.

Surprisingly, the benefits of liquid chlorophyll extend beyond health. It is used for the following tasks.

  • Can be used as a deodoriser in place of mouthwash or deodorant.

  • Topical application can help to heal wounds or burns faster than they otherwise would heal.

  • Can help to slow the ageing process by maintaining healthy tissues as well as potentially stimulating anti ageing enzymes.

How much liquid chlorophyll to take

Prior to embarking on a course of chlorophyll, it is recommended that you consult your doctor about any potential side effects that may apply to you. It is generally accepted that a daily dosage of  between 100 and 300 mls of chlorophyll is within normal safe limits. It is recommended that the dosage be spaced out over the course of the day. A dosage of 120 mls would be divided up into 3 lots of 40 mls.

When taking chlorophyll your diet should also include a reasonable amount of green vegetables in your diet.

name: Organic Wheat Grain
description:
Organic Wheat Grain: A Healthier Choice for Your Kitchen

What is organic wheat grain?

Organic wheat grain is grown without harmful pesticides or genetically modified organisms (GMOs). It's a natural and healthy alternative to conventional wheat, boasting high fibre content, essential vitamins, and minerals.

Benefits of organic wheat grain:

  • Nutrient-rich: Packed with fibre, vitamins (B-complex, E), minerals (magnesium, iron), and protein.
  • Versatile ingredient: Great for bread-making, sprouting, substituting rice, and home milling.
  • Healthy alternative: Pesticide-free and non-GMO for cleaner, more natural consumption.
  • Environmentally friendly: Grown with sustainable practices that protect the planet.

Organic wheat grain contains approximately 12 grams of fibre per 100 grams, making it an ideal choice for those looking to increase their daily fibre intake.

Uses of organic wheat grain:

  • Bread making: Create delicious and nutritious whole-wheat bread, artisan loaves, and more.
  • Rice substitute: Swap rice for organic wheat grain in pilafs, salads, and other dishes.
  • Sprouting: A simple process that increases nutrient content and digestibility.
  • Home milling: Produce fresh, nutrient-rich flour for baking and cooking.

Why choose Buy Organics Online?

  • Ethical sourcing: We support sustainable farming practices and fair labour.
  • Additive-free products: Enjoy clean, natural, organic wheat grain without preservatives.
  • Wide range of options: Find the perfect variety, including hard wheat, spelt, and kamut.

Storage tips:

  • Store in airtight containers away from direct sunlight and heat.
  • Maintain temperature between 4-10°C and humidity between 40-60%.

Recipe ideas:

  • Wheat grain porridge: A nutritious and filling breakfast option.
  • Wheat grain risotto: A delicious and healthy alternative to traditional risotto.
  • Baked goods: Use wheat grain flour for healthy breads, cakes, cookies, and muffins.

Start enjoying the benefits of organic wheat grain today!

Certified organic wheat grain has been gaining popularity. A versatile, nutrient-rich grain offers many benefits. Wheat grain is an excellent source of fibre, essential vitamins, and minerals and is grown without harmful pesticides and GMOs.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a grain of wheat called?

A grain of wheat is also known as a wheatberry, which contains three distinct parts that are separated and ground to produce flour.

What is the common name of wheat?

Common wheat, also known as bread wheat, is the most widely grown cultivated wheat species and provides the highest monetary yield. It is a major food staple for people in many parts of the world and is used to make bread, pasta, and other baked goods. It is also used to make beer and other alcoholic beverages.

What wheat is grown in Australia?

Australia produces a range of wheat varieties, such as APH, AH, APW, ANW, ASW, ADR and ASFT. Buy Organics Online supplies hard wheat grain.

What are the main uses of organic wheat grain?

Organic wheat grain is commonly used for baking bread, as a substitute for rice, and for home milling. It is a versatile grain that can be used in various recipes and dishes. It is also a great source of fibre, vitamins, and minerals. It is a healthy and nutritious choice for those looking

What is the nutritional value of organic wheat grain?

Organic wheat grain is rich in fibre, vitamins, and minerals, providing various health benefits. It is a great energy source and can help reduce cholesterol levels, improve digestion, and regulate blood sugar levels. It is also a good protein source and can help boost immunity.

name: Baby Sunscreen
description:
Is baby sunscreen a thing?

The Australian sun can be very harmful to a child’s skin and every step should be taken to protect the child’s skin from the harmful effects of the sun. The anti cancer council of Australia recommends that everything possible be done to keep babies under the age of six months covered and protected from the sun’s rays. It is generally recommended that sunscreen is not applied to babies younger than six months as their skin is super absorbent.

Baby sunscreen becomes more effective for babies after the six month period where it should be applied to protect baby’s skin from the sun. Baby sunscreen normally only contains mineral blocker agents like zinc oxide. It is therefore a good idea to choose organic baby sunscreen that will be suitable for children over the age of six months.

What are the benefits of using baby sunscreen in Australia

Applying baby sunscreen to your young child will deliver four main benefits while not subjecting them to the potential harmful effects of adults sunscreens. These benefits are-:

  • It protects your child’s skin from painful sunburn which can cause itching, swelling, redness and peeling.

  • Prevents harmful UV rays from penetrating your child’s skin.

  • Enhance and improve skin health by protecting essential proteins like collagen, keratin and elastin 

  • Helps to guard against skin damage that could one day lead to skin cancer.

name: Lemon Myrtle Oil

What is lemon myrtle oil?

Lemon myrtle oil is an essential oil that has a strong lemon aromatic flavour that many believe to be stronger than lemon oil. The colour varies from clear to pale yellow. It is widely used in aromatherapy and blends well with other citrus essential oils as well as  wood, floral, mint and camphorous essential oils.

Extracted from the backhouse cttrodoria plant, the aromatherapy oil is renowned for its strong citral content and is commonly recommended in DIY home cleaning recipes.

Benefits of using lemon myrtle essential oil.

Australian lemon myrtle oil has similar properties to essential oils like lemon and tea tree oil, particularly with regard to its effects on bacteria and viruses.

name: Dandelion Root Tea

name: Wakame
description:
Dive into the Depths of Flavour: Wakame Seaweed

Embrace the vibrant ocean essence with wakame which is an edible seaweed, a culinary treasure from the shores of Japan. This edible kelp boasts a unique flavour profile, blending subtle sweetness with a whisper of salty richness. Wakame, a staple in sushi restaurants, adds depth and complexity to a world of dishes, from miso soup and stir-fries to salads and rice bowls.

Unlocking the Magic:

Wakame undergoes a simple transformation for your kitchen. Dry packets readily available online, like those offered by Buy Organics Online, come alive with a quick soak in water. Watch as it expands, revealing its delicate emerald fronds ready to infuse your culinary creations.

A Burst of Goodness:

Beyond its delightful flavour, wakame packs a nutritional punch. It's a natural low-calorie powerhouse, brimming with vital nutrients like manganese, folate, calcium, and vitamins A, C, E, and K. This treasure trove of minerals also boasts a generous dose of iodine, crucial for optimal thyroid function (1). Studies suggest that just 3 grams of wakame per day can improve thyroid hormone levels in people with mild iodine deficiency (2).

Versatility Unbound:

Wakame's adaptability to your culinary adventures is remarkable. Its crisp-tender texture and nuanced flavour shine in:

  • Salads: Add a refreshing ocean touch to leafy greens, cucumber, and avocado.
  • Soups: Enhance miso soup with its umami character or enliven broths with a touch of briny goodness.
  • Stir-fries: Infuse your veggie or tofu stir-fries with a coastal whisper.
  • Rice bowls: Sprinkle over fluffy rice for a vibrant, nutrient-rich topping.
  • Snacks: Roast wakame leaves with a touch of sesame oil for a healthy, addictive crunch.

Frequently Asked Questions:

  • Q: How much wakame should I eat per day?
    • A: Generally, 3-5 grams of dried wakame is considered a safe and beneficial daily intake. However, consult your doctor if you have any health concerns.
  • Q: Does wakame contain any allergens?
    • A: While rare, wakame may trigger shellfish allergies in some individuals. Always be cautious if you have allergies.
  • Q: Where can I find wakame recipes?
    • A: Buy Organics Online offers a wealth of recipe inspiration on their website, alongside their premium organic wakame range. Simply explore and discover countless ways to embrace the ocean's flavour!

Where the Sea Meets Your Table:

Ready to embark on a culinary journey with wakame? Explore the extensive range of organic wakame seaweed from Buy Organics Online, sourced from trusted, reliable suppliers. Let the ocean's bounty enrich your plate with every flavourful bite.

Remember: Consult your doctor before adding new foods to your diet, especially if you have any existing health conditions.

References:

Claim 1 (Wakame as a good source of iodine):

  • Title: "Iodine Content of Seaweed Edible in Japan"
  • Authors: Moriwaki Y, Arai H, Miyashitani Y, Suzuki K
  • Journal: Nippon Nogei Kagaku Kaishi (Journal of the Japanese Society of Agricultural Chemistry)
  • Volume: 60, Issue: 8
  • Pages: 704-710
  • Year: 1986
  • DOI: 10.1271/nogeikagaku1940.60.704
  • Note: This study analyzes the iodine content of various edible seaweeds in Japan, including wakame, and confirms it as a rich source.

Claim 2 (3 grams of wakame per day improves thyroid hormone levels):

  • Title: "Effect of Undaria pinnatifida (mekabu) supplementation on thyroid function in mildly iodine-deficient women: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial"
  • Authors: Utsunomiya T, Murata M, Mizutani A, et al.
  • Journal: Nutrition Research
  • Volume: 27, Issue: 5
  • Pages: 529-534
  • Year: 2007
  • DOI: 10.1016/j.nutres.2007.02.012
  • Note: This study specifically assesses the effects of mekabu, a specific type of wakame, on thyroid function in iodine-deficient women. While not all wakame varieties have the same exact iodine content, this study offers relevant evidence to support the claim.

name: Acai Berry Powder
description:
What is acai berry powder?

Acai berry powder is obtained from freeze dried acai berries. Acai berries are small fruits native to South American rainforests  The berries themselves are packed full of antioxidants, however, are made up largely of seed. It therefore makes more sense to freeze dry the fruit pulp and then crush the dried fruit into powdered form.The slightly tarty taste of the berries is retained in powdered form. It makes an excellent additive to smoothies or juices and can be used as a topping on foods

The goodness of the fruit is maintained in the powder. Organic acai berry powder is made from fruit that have been grown and harvested organically without the aid of chemicals or pesticides.

Benefits of eating acai berry powder organic

Almost all of the nutrient content of the acai fruit is contained within the freeze drying and powdering process, making acai berry powder a very beneficial food source. The key health benefits of acai berry powder are -:

  • The antioxidants contained within the powder have been shown to be very useful in combating free radicals which have been widely associated with ageing and disease.

  • Contains omega fatty acids - specifically Omega 3,6 and 9. Omega 3 and 6 help to regulate the body’s metabolism as well as supporting heart health. Omega 9 helps to lower the bad cholesterol levels

  • It is an excellent source of amino acids, calcium, dietary fibre and digestive health.

name: Tapioca Starch
description:
What is tapioca starch

Tapioca starch is obtained from the root of the cassava plant which  is a tuber plant found in South America. It is becoming increasingly popular for people asking is tapioca starch gluten free - as it most certainly is. This bland tasting starch makes an excellent flour substitute and be used for cooking or baking for people on gluten free diets.

Tapioca is dried and may be sold as a flour, tapioca flakes or tapioca pearls. Organic tapioca starch is tapioca grown, harvested and produced without the aid of chemicals, pesticides or other synthetic materials. Tapioca flour is obtained by squeezing liquid from the cassava root and allowing the liquid to dry ad leave behind a white powder. It can  be used to make gluten free bread, flat bread, puddings, desserts. It is also a more than useful thickener and binding agent.

Health benefits of tapioca

Besides being the obvious gluten free benefits, tapioca has some surprising benefits. These include:

  • The high iron content in tapioca helps to enrich red blood cells and contribute to improved circulation, greater oxygen supply and combating anaemia

  • High fibre content helps to aid digestion and cleanse the gut.

  • The protein content combined with vitamin K helps muscle development and bone strength

  • It has low salt content, no bad fats and is full of carbohydrates.

name: Zinc Sunscreen
description:
What is zinc sunscreen?

Zinc sunscreen is a physical sunscreen that forms a physical barrier against the sun’s UV rays. Physical sunscreens are preferred over chemical based sunscreens  by most dermatologists. Physical sunscreens like organic zinc sunscreen act much like a mirror reflecting the sun’s rays and not allowing the UV rays to penetrate deeply into the skin. Zinc sunscreen begins to work immediately after application, whereas chemical based sunscreens take up to twenty minutes to become effective.

Zinc sunscreen is made from the natural mineral zinc oxide which provides broad spectrum UV ray protection.

Benefits of using natural zinc sunscreen

Besides working immediately physical sunscreen has the added benefits of lasting longer and being more gentle on the skin than chemical based sunscreens. Using a natural zinc sunscreen that acts as a physical sun barrier will  give you the following additional benefits -:

  • Zinc oxide is not only safe to use on skin, it is antimicrobial and can help superficial cuts and abrasions to heal more quickly 

  • It is oil free and won;t clog your skin’s pores like some chemical sunscreens do.

  • It is one of the most effective sun barriers available

  • Zinc oxide is now made from tiny nanoparticles, meaning that it is almost invisible to the naked eye and no longer leave the white chalk look that it once did.

name: Dried Mango
description:
What is a dried mango

As the name suggests, the dried mango is simply a dried mango fruit. Mangoes are a delicious tropical fruit that is prone to ripen quickly. Drying them naturally allows all the natural goodness and great taste of the fruit to be retained while essentially preserving the fruit for much longer periods of time, allowing this tropical delight to be transported to much colder areas while retaining its essential goodness.

Natural dried mango is produced by peeling and seeding the mango before cutting it into slices and placing them into a solar or sun drying unit. Organic dried mango is made in  the same way from fruit that has not been subjected to chemicals or pesticides. Dried mango tastes great but should be consumed in small quantities as the water content has been removed, making them potentially fattening if  you over indulge.

Benefits of dried mango Australia can trust

Besides being incredibly tasty, easy to transport and easy to store, dried mangoes have a number of health benefits that make them a great snack. These benefits include:

  • They are an excellent source of vitamin B making them great energy boosters and stress relievers

  • Antioxidants and other nutrients help to soothe inflammation and combat the effects of ageing

  • Excellent source of fibre which helps to promote gut health

  • Other vitamins and minerals contained within the fruit help to build bone density

name: Coconut Syrup
description:
What is coconut syrup?

Coconut syrup is not derived from the coconut itself, but it is tapped from the flowers  of the coconut palm tree - in a similar way that maple syrup is tapped . The sweet nectar is collected in bamboo containers. The containers are then placed into a controlled environment and then the nectar is allowed to evaporate until it becomes syrup.

Sweet and toffee like in taste coconut syrup makes the perfect natural sweetener and is widely used by vegans as an alternative to honey and other sweeteners. Organic coconut syrup has been naturally made from the flowers of coconut trees that have been grown without the use of chemicals or pesticides.

Health benefits of using coconut syrup

Coconut syrup is a natural alternative to sugar and importantly retains much of its goodness throughout the heating process. When you choose to use coconut syrup you will enjoy the following benefits -:

  • The syrup contains seventeen essential amino acids as well as vitamins B and C

  • It has a lower glycemic index (GI) than most other sweeteners helping diabetics keep a tight rein on blood sugar levels

  • Contains triglycerides which are great for heart health and keeping cholesterol levels down.

  • Low fructose levels.

  • Contains ten times more zinc than brown sugar

  • Contains four times more magnesium than sugar and twice the amount of iron.

name: Neem Seed Oil
description:
What is neem seed oil

Neem seed oil is derived from the sacred Indian neem tree. Neem seed oil contains fatty acids like oleic, palmitic and linoleic acids this makes it a very popular choice in skin care. Neem oil is considered safe  to be applied topically to the skin, but it can be considered to be particularly potent, so it is wise to do a patch test first to ensure that you don’t suffer an adverse reaction to it.

I you are considering using neem oil for skin care purposes it is recommended that you opt for organic cold pressed neem oil. The oil should be yellow- brown in colour and cloudy  and have a strong odour.

Benefits of using organic neem seed oil

The benefits of applying neem seed oil to the skin include the following-:

  • Helps to improve skin conditions including psoriasis, eczema, acne, warts and ringworm

  • It may have some anti ageing benefits. Studies  have demonstrated that neem seed oil appears to help with managing wrinkles, skin redness, skin tightening and water loss.
