name: Vegetable Glycerin
description:
What is vegetable glycerin

Vegetable glycerin (sometimes referred to as vegetable glycerine or glycerol)is a clear sugar alcohol. The odorless liquid is obtained from plant oils. Triglyceride rich fats such as soy, palm oil or coconut oil are heated with a strong alkali to make vegetable glycerin. This process causes the glycerin to separate from the fatty acids and mix with water to form a sweet tasting odourless syrup. Organic vegetable glycerin uses vegetable products that have been grown and harvested without the use or intrusion of chemicals, gmo substances or pesticides. Certified organic vegetable glycerin in Australia has been certified by one of several bodies as meeting the AS 6000 standard for organic products  Glycerin is a popular ingredient in cosmetic products,hair care products and  toothpaste  as well as being widely used in the food industry. There are a variety of uses for vegetable glycerin in the home.

Benefits of using natural vegetable glycerin.

From a cooking perspective, glycerin’s sweet taste can be used to offset the bitter flavor of some herbs when used as abaking supply. It is commonly used as an alcohol substitute and an artificial sweetener that adds flavor while not causing blood sugar levels to rise. It can also be used in the baking process to maintain moisture content and to facilitate fusion between water and oil based ingredients.

Glycerin can also be used to prevent some foods like yoghurt from freezing.

Perhaps one of the most popular uses of natural glycerin is in the personal care area. Glycerol works well as a skin cleansing agent. Applying it can help to soften skin. For this reason it is often used  to make home made clear soaps and facial creams. It has also been known to make  effective hair shampoo and  conditioner when mixed with aloe vera.

Personal care

Glycerol is used in many commercially available skin care products as  when it is applied topically can deliver significant benefits to the skin including:

  • Reduces the effects of ageing by drawing moisture towards the skin's surface[1]and smoothing out wrinkles. Studies have shown that regular application of glycerol actually helps to slow the effects of ageing by guiding young cells to  close to the skin's surface helping to reinforce the skin's protective barrier.

  • Glycerol is effective in fighting acne.[2] As it is not an oil, it does not clog skin pores and unlike some acne treatments is not harsh on the skin and will not cause irritation and redness.

  • Glycerol is used in over 120  baby products and well over 15000 cosmetic products giving a clear indication of how highly regarded it is as a safe personal care product compared to many other body care products and cosmetics   that actually clog pores cause skin dryness and irritation.

  • This natural emollient works as a gentle non abrasive exfoliant making it the perfect choice for people looking to rid themselves of dry skin - acne sufferers in particular can really benefit from the use and regular topical application of glycerol

  • Glycerol can repair and heal damaged skin and is particularly useful in helping treat conditions like eczema and psoriasis[3]. It actually improves skin function and will speed up the healing process.

  • Acts as a strong moisturizing agent promoting  overall skin care.

  • When combined with other products, glycerol acts as a preserving agent that ensures a long shelf life for any cosmetic product containing glycerol. This is because it has strong antiviral, antibacterial and antifungal properties.

How to use glycerol in herbal remedies, toners and other applications?

When combined with other natural products, organic glycerin can be used to make a number of luxurious skin treatments. Several recipes appear below:

  • To make a pleasant smelling facial cleanser combine 4 tablespoons of raw honey with 2 tablespoons of pure vegetable glycerin, half a cup of brewed green tea and about 10 drops of a combination of the following essential oils - lemon, patchouli and geranium. Thoroughly mix all of the ingredients using a blender then store the cleanser in a dark colored bottle (preferably with a pump action)
  • For a smooth body lotion suitable for sensitive skin, place 140 grams of shea butter in a heat safe container then put it in a double boiler. Heat the shea butter until it is melted then add two tablespoons of fractionated coconut carrier oil and one tablespoon of jojoba carrier oil then thoroughly stir the contents together. Next place the mixture into the freezer for ten minutes allowing enough time for a crust to form. Remove the mixture from the freezer then use an electric beater to whip it while slowly drizzling vegetable glycerol into it. The mixture should be whipped until it becomes darker (opaque) in appearance and its consistency stiffens. Slowly add 1 tablespoon of cornstarch (1/4 tbsp at a time) to the blend and whip the mixture each time after adding.Then add a quarter teaspoon of vitamin e-liquid followed by around six drops of your preferred essential oil - some that work well include frankincense, lavender and cedarwood - these will help to enhance the restorative properties of the formulation. The outstanding moisturizer can be used immediately and has a shelf life of between 4 and six months
  • Non-comedogenic acne serums that are reputed to reduce the incidence of acne blooms overnight can be made by combining half a tablespoon of vegetable glycerol with an equal measure of orange blossom water and four drops of Tea tree oil. Apply this mixture to the desired area and leave it on overnight. Rinse thoroughly in the morning.
  • To tackle blackheads you can make a homemade paste using two tablespoons of pure vegetable glycerin. Simply add one tablespoon of earth clay and 4 tablespoons of almond powder and mix thoroughly. Apply to affected areas and rinse off after the the paste has dried

Glycerin can also be used to make many different household chores that bit easier. Glycerin can be used for purposes varying from greasing cupcake pans to preventing hydraulic jacks from freezing.

name: Wild Rice

Wild rice or Indian rice, Canadian Rice or water oats only bears a passing resemblance to traditional rice. Wild rice is a common term used to describe four different types of grass grains that can be harvested for consumption. The grain has a chewy outer grain. The inner grain is full of rich nutrients. 

Wild rice has become increasingly popular as it is now known to be a great source of antioxidants fibre, minerals, protein and vitamins. name: Coconut Aminos
description:
What are coconut aminos?

Coconut aminos are the choice of many people looking to reduce salt, avoid gluten, or eliminate soy from their diets. The sauce is similar in consistency and colour to soy sauce and can be easily substituted in many gravy and sauce recipes.

What does coconut aminos taste like?

Made from fermented coconut sap and sea salt, coconut aminos taste a little sweeter than soy sauce but, perhaps surprisingly, do not taste like coconut. As the taste is somewhat sweeter, coconut aminos do not make a perfect substitute for soy sauce, but they still make an excellent addition to salads, dipping sauces, and marinades.

What are the benefits of coconut aminos?

Compared to other sauces like tamari and soy, the main benefits of coconut aminos are that they are gluten-free and low on salt content (73% less salt than soy). Other reputed benefits of the sauce include:

  • Contains seventeen different amino acids. Amino acids are the building blocks of protein and are recognised as essential in building muscle. Coconut aminos contain 14 times the amount of amino acids that soy sauce contains.
  • If you have been wondering what raw coconut aminos are, the answer is quite simple. Coconut aminos are processed raw, meaning that all the goodness is retained in the processing process.

How do I use coconut aminos?

Whenever a recipe or meal calls for the use of soy sauce, you can confidently use coconut aminos. It is important to remember that when using coconut in cooking, heat will destroy much of the natural goodness. To get around this, simply add coconut aminos to the dish after it has already been heated. Coconut aminos go well with stir-fries of all descriptions, as well as different salads, seafood, and chicken dishes.

How long do coconut aminos last?

Most bottles of coconut aminos should have a best-before label printed on them. If this is difficult to read, it is said that a refrigerated bottle of coconut aminos will last for up to 6 months once opened. There is anecdotal evidence that it can last longer than that. You can always test its suitability by smelling it. If it smells sweet, it should be fine. However, if it has a vinegar-like odour, it has gone off.

name: Borlotti Beans

Borlotti beans, sometimes called Cranberry beans or even French horticultural beans. Fresh borlotti beans come in large red and beige pods. The exterior shell is not edible, however the fruit contained inside is thought by many to be a delicious delicacy. Fresh beans tend to last only a short while and most available beans sold in commercial quantities are are either dried or come as tinned borlotti beans.

The beans have quite a meaty, somewhat chestnutty flavour and can make an excellent addition to meals or even feature as a main dish. The beans blend well with spices and can form the base for an excellent bean salad.

Borlotti beans health benefits

name: Millet Flour
description:
What is Millet Flour?

Millet flour is a light flour that resembles wheat flour but has the distinct advantage of being entirely gluten free. The flour is best used in combination with other flours. To maintain its gluten free properties it can be mixed with other gluten free flours such as sweet rice flour, tapioca flour or gluten free oat flour.  The flour is fine and powdery and has a mildly bitter nutty taste.

Millet is one of the oldest grains in the world and it is regaining favour as a grain flour. Organic millet flour is flour obtained from millet that has been organically grown without the aid of synthetic pesticides chemicals or genetically modified material.

Benefits of consuming Millet Flour

When used in moderation, millet flour can be beneficial. Over eating it can lead to thyroid problems, so the product should be used in moderation - preferably in combination with other flours.

The benefits of millet include -:

  • Contains magnesium and fibre making it healthy for the heart.[1]

  • The fibre content in millet helps reduce the likelihood of gallstones and has been shown to help lower bad cholesterol levels.[2]

  • Magnesium content helps to reduce the incidence of asthma [3]

  • Rich nutrient profile.

  • Magnesium content helps reduce the incidence of migraine

  • May help to improve digestive health

  • Can help reduce fatigue

It is highly alkaline, making it easy to digest and easy and even soothing to the stomach. Millet comes in many different varieties, the most common being pear and foxtail. name: Wild Yam Cream
description:
What is wild yam cream?

Wild yam is a plant that has been used in traditional and alternative medicine for many years. Wild yam is also known by various other names including devil’s bones, rheumatism root and China root.  Wild yam cream contains diosgenin which is known to activate what is known as the Mevalonate Pathway which aids the production of several natural compounds.

Organic wild yam cream is derived from wild yams that have been grown organically without the use of pesticides, synthetics or chemicals.  Wild yam cream should be applied externally to the inner thighs, arms, chest and stomach.

Benefits of using wild yam cream

Potential benefits of wild yam cream include the following -:

  • There is some anecdotal evidence to suggest that wild yam cream helps to ease the symptoms associated with menopause. It is thought that  the wild yam may help to stabilise or even increase estrogen levels.

  • Anti inflammatory properties associated with wild yam cream may help to relieve rheumatoid arthritis

Wild yam cream is thought to be safe for external application for most people, however, it may cause an allergic reaction for a small percentage of the population. Wild yam can be taken orally, usually in tablet form. When taking orally, stick to the recommended dosages stated on packaging.

name: Celtic Sea Salt
description:
Celtic sea salt is a fully mineralised natural salt, hand-harvested from the pristine coastal regions of France, and offers a unique taste and a range of health benefits. This blog post will explore how it can be used for skin care and healing. So, let’s dive into it.

Key Takeaways

  • Celtic Sea Salt is a type of natural sea salt harvested from the coastal region of Brittany, France.

  • It contains over 84 essential minerals such as magnesium, calcium, and potassium, which, along with lower sodium levels, make it an ideal replacement for other salts.

  • The unique flavour and texture make it popular among chefs for culinary uses, while its healing properties make it ideal for skincare treatments.

Celtic Sea Salt: The Origins

Celtic salt or sea salt, also known as "sel gris" in French, means gray salt, primarily due to the colour distinctly grey compared to traditional sea salt. It is harvested in the coastal region of Brittany, France. The traditional hand-harvesting methods in these pristine coastal regions ensure that the salt retains its natural mineral content and flavour. Unlike black lava salt, which originates from volcanic areas, Celtic sea salt is derived from the waters of the Celtic Sea.

Celtic sea salt should be stored in an airtight container in a cool, dry environment away from direct sunlight. The shelf life of Celtic sea salt is up to 36 months when stored properly.

Nutritional Profile: Comparing Celtic Sea Salt with Table Salt

*Percentages are approximate and can vary by source.

Unlike highly processed regular table salt, which consists primarily of sodium chloride, Celtic sea salt and rock salt are rich in essential minerals like magnesium, calcium, and potassium.

Celtic sea salt offers a more diverse range of minerals than regular table salt. While sodium chloride makes up the majority of minerals in both types of salt, Celtic sea salt retains various other beneficial minerals due to its minimal processing. Regular table salt often undergoes refining processes that remove many of these minerals, and additives like anti-caking agents are frequently included.

Sources:

- "Sea Salt: Harvesting Nature's Saltwater Minerals" by Randi Minetor

- "Salted: A Manifesto on the World's Most Essential Mineral, with Recipes" by Mark Bitterman

- Journal of Food Science and Nutrition studies comparing sea salt and table salt mineral content

- FDA guidelines on food labeling and mineral content

By opting for Celtic sea salt over regular table salt, you're not just seasoning your food, you're also enriching it with essential minerals.

While Celtic sea salt offers a variety of health benefits, it contains significantly less iodine than iodised table salt.

While Celtic sea salt is often perceived as a healthier option than table salt due to its trace mineral content, the nutritional differences between the two are relatively small.

Celtic sea salt: where to buy it?

Buy Organics Online sells reputable brands of Celtic salt in Australia.  We often find and have stock available when our competitors cannot source.

Top Health Benefits of Celtic Sea Salt

Celtic sea salt offers various perceived health benefits, including:

  • Electrolyte balance

  • Hydration

  • Aiding in alkalising the body

Essential minerals and natural trace elements necessary in fully mineralised natural salts like Celtic sea salts, such as sodium, potassium, magnesium, and calcium, are pivotal in maintaining these physiological bodily functions.

A popular TikTok health hack suggests that dissolving a few crystals of Celtic sea salt on the tongue before drinking water can improve water absorption due to the salt's magnesium content. However, this method of hydration needs more scientific consensus.

Please see this video below:

Consult a doctor for personalised recommendations on daily salt intake to ensure you are consuming an appropriate amount of salt for your health needs.

Culinary Uses and Flavour Enhancements

Celtic sea salt’s unique, full-bodied yet not overpowering savoury flavour, combined with its slightly moist and pale gray hue, makes it a versatile ingredient in cooking. It can enhance the taste of various dishes, from vegetables and grains to meats and seafood, and even help retain moisture in baked goods.

"Celtic salt comes in coarse and fine ground. Coarse Celtic sea salt is ideal for seasoning dishes after they are cooked. Fine-grade Celtic sea salt is more suitable for adding during cooking and baking. When using the coarse texture of Celtic sea salt in baking, it is advisable to dissolve it in a minimal amount of liquid before incorporating it into the recipe, as it may not dissolve as readily as traditional salt.

Professional chefs and culinary enthusiasts highly appreciate Celtic sea salt. This is due to its larger crystals, which balance the flavours in lesser quantities. This distinctive flavour and texture set it apart from other salts, making it a popular alternative for those looking to elevate their dishes to new heights.

Comparing Celtic Sea Salt to Other Specialty Salts

Celtic sea salt differs from specialty salts like Himalayan salt, kosher salt, and Fleur de Sel in taste, mineral content, and culinary uses. While Celtic sea salt has a robust and salty flavour that can enhance culinary applications, Himalayan and kosher salt often have a milder taste.

In terms of other types of mineral content, Celtic sea salt is unique in its sustainable hand-harvesting methods, which guarantee purity and retain essential trace minerals. Some of the minerals found in Celtic sea salt include:

  • Magnesium

  • Calcium

  • Potassium

  • Iron

  • Zinc

Fleur de Sel, on the other hand, is renowned for its delicate flavour and texture and is often used as a finishing salt.

Each type of salt has its advantages.

  • Celtic salt is slightly better for you, with lower sodium levels.

  • Himalayan salt offers a more subtle taste.

  • Fleur de Sel is prized for its delicate flavour and texture, making it an excellent choice for a finishing salt.

Experimenting with specialty salts, such as truffle salt, can help you find the perfect salt to elevate your culinary creations.

Safety Concerns and Recommended Daily Intake

When consuming Celtic sea salt, moderation is vital to avoid potential health risks. Monitoring your salt intake is essential, and the American Heart Association recommends that healthy adults equivalent to approximately one teaspoon.

For individuals with a history of heart disease or those who are at high risk for heart disease, it is recommended to consume no more than 1,500 mg of sodium per day. To ensure you consume an appropriate amount of salt for your health needs, consult a doctor for personalised recommendations on your daily sodium intake.

Where to Buy High-Quality Celtic Sea Salt

In Australia, Celtic sea salt can be found in several places. It is available at health food stores, some supermarkets, and reputable online like Buy Organics Online.

Celtic Sea Salt for Skincare and Healing

Celtic sea salt contributes to skincare and healing. Incorporating Celtic sea salt in salt baths and scrubs can provide exfoliation, improved circulation, and treatment for minor skin issues. The minerals found in Celtic sea salt, such as magnesium, calcium, and potassium, nourish and hydrate the skin, unclog pores, and even assist to balance the skin’s pH levels.

So, whether you’re soaking in a relaxing salt bath or using a rejuvenating salt scrub, Celtic sea salt offers a natural and effective way to improve your skin’s health and appearance.

What specific skincare treatments can Celtic sea salt be used for?

1. Exfoliation: Celtic sea salt is a natural exfoliant that can help remove dead skin cells and promote cell turnover. Mix a small amount of Celtic sea salt with your favourite oil (such as olive or coconut) and gently massage onto your skin in circular motions.

2. Help with Acne: Celtic sea salt has natural antibacterial properties that may help fight acne. Mix a small amount of Celtic sea salt with water to create a paste, then apply to any areas with acne and leave on for 5-10 minutes before rinsing off.

3. Hydration: Celtic sea salt contains essential minerals that can help improve skin hydration and prevent moisture loss. Add a pinch of Celtic sea salt to your toner or moisturiser for an extra boost of hydration.

Summary:

In conclusion, Celtic sea salt is a versatile and beneficial addition to your pantry, offering unique flavour enhancements, better for you than traditional salts, and even skincare and healing properties. By incorporating Celtic sea salt into your daily life, you can experience its advantages while supporting sustainable and conventional harvesting practices. So, why not try Celtic sea salt and discover the wonders it can bring to your life?

But it doesn't stop at merely selling products; the store also serves as a rich resource for consumers looking to understand the benefits of choosing an organic lifestyle. From in-depth articles to customer reviews, Buy Organics Online provides valuable insights that help individuals make informed purchasing decisions. As a result, it has a comprehensive guide to organic and natural well-being.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is unique about Celtic sea salt?

The presence of magnesium in Celtic sea salt assists with water absorption in the body, which is crucial for maintaining the body and cellular balance. Its natural and balanced mix of minerals makes it a much healthier alternative to regular table salt, which is often loaded with additives and anti-caking agents. Chefs and food enthusiasts are particularly drawn to its distinct, robust flavour, which can elevate dishes to a new level of delicious complexity.

Is Celtic salt better than Himalayan salt?

Overall, both Celtic Sea Salt and Himalayan Salt have unique benefits and uses, so neither can be said to be definitively better.

Is Celtic salt available in Australia?

Yes, Celtic salt is available in Australia through Buy Organics Online, which has been supplying it since 2013.

What is the difference between Celtic salt and regular salt?

Celtic Sea Salt is unrefined and contains 33% sodium and 50.9% chloride, whereas Himalayan Salt contains 98% sodium chloride. Additionally, Celtic Sea Salt has a higher mineral content than Himalayan Salt, and it does not contain any added iodine or anti-caking agents.

What are the health benefits of Celtic sea salt?

Celtic sea salt is beneficial by providing electrolyte balance, hydration, and improved muscle function, while also helping to alkalize the body. It is a natural source of minerals, including sodium, potassium, magnesium, calcium, and trace minerals. It is also unrefined and unprocessed, so it retains its natural balance of minerals. This makes it a healthier alternative to table salt.

What are some specific culinary uses and recipes that incorporate Celtic sea salt?

It's recommended to try Celtic sea salt as a finishing salt on roasted vegetables or grilled meats. It can also be used in baking, particularly in bread recipes. One popular recipe is for Celtic sea salt focaccia bread. Sprinkle a generous amount of Celtic sea salt on the bread dough before baking for a delicious and unique flavour. Additionally, you can use Celtic sea salt in homemade salad dressings or as a seasoning for soups and stews.

name: Coconut Flakes
description:
What are coconut flakes

As the name would suggest, coconut flakes are shredded or grated flakes obtained from the meat of a dried coconut. They are a versatile kitchen ingredient that can be used for decoration and baking of sweet and savoury dishes, and as individual snacks.  It is important to distinguish between coconut flakes and desiccated coconut. Desiccated coconut is liable to contain such additives as corn syrup and preservatives. Organic coconut flakes will not contain any such impurities.

Coconut flakes will add texture and flavour to many different recipes from breakfast to dessert and even main meals  Using them will not only add flavour and texture to your dishes but deliver healthy benefits as well.

Benefits of eating coconut flakes

Coconut  meat is rich in manganese,  copper, medium-chain triglycerides (MCT) and fibre. Unsweetened coconut makes a welcome addition to any diet and will deliver the following benefits.

  • Coconut meat including flakes contains coconut oil which is liable to improve good cholesterol ( HDL)  while lowering bad cholesterol(LDL). Improvement in these areas may reduce the risk of heart disease

  • The high level of MCTs contained within coconut meat may promote feelings of fullness as well as aid in the burning of calories and fat. This may help support weight loss

  • Fibre content in coconut my help to  keep the digestive system healthy by improving bowel regularity  while the MCTs in coconut are known to improve gut bacteria

  • Coconut meat is also believed to be beneficial in stabilizing blood sugar, improving immunity and even improving brain function

What to use coconut flakes with

Coconut flakes are surprisingly versatile and can be used in a variety of sweet and savoury recipes. One of the more interesting uses of coconut flakes is to use them as bacon substitute. This can be done by marinating the flakes in a solution of soy sauce, maple syrup and bacon smoke then baking them in the oven at a temperature of 180 degrees celsius for around twelve minutes. The flakes will be a little sweeter and “nuttier” than the real thing but they make a fine vegan substitute.

Coconut flakes can also be used in a variety of ways to make recipes more interesting. Consider such options as coconut onion rings, coconut chicken, date and coconut energy balls, coconut rice and coconut shakes. What you can use coconut flakes with may only be limited by your imagination.

How to toast coconut flakes

There are several ways to toast coconut flakes using either the stove top, the oven or even the microwave. Here are all three ways 

If you choose to use the stove top method, you will need to place your coconut flakes in a large pan and place the pan over a low-medium heat, watching carefully and stirring often until the flakes turn mostly golden brown.

With the oven you will need to preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius, before spreading the 

flakes thinly on a baking sheet. Then bake in the oven for between five and ten minutes. GIve the flakes a stir after a few minutes to ensure an even coloring.

Microwave toasting involves spreading about ½ cup of coconut flakes on a microwave safe plate and then microwaving the flakes in 30 second installments. Stir the flakes after each 30 second bake until the coconut is suitably toasted.

It is worth remembering that sweetened flakes will take less time to toast then unsweetened flakes.

name: Ginger Powder
description:
What is ginger powder

Ginger powder, or ground ginger, is a very popular herb and spice product found in most kitchens. It is used to add flavour and aroma to a variety of dishes and has been used for centuries for medicinal uses in  parts of the Indian subcontinent. The powder is extracted from the dried ginger root (rhizome). It usually is off white or slightly brown in appearance and has a particularly strong aroma. Ginger powder will usually last for approximately one year ma king it easy to store.

Ginger has a variety of uses and recipes will often call for dry ginger, fresh ginger, ginger extract or simply organic ginger. In most cases ginger powder and dry ginger can be taken to mean the same thing, while dry ginger will often work as a more than adequate substitute for fresh ginger. Ginger extract or dry ginger powder is used to make ginger tea, ginger ale, chutney, gingerbread, ginger sauce, salad dressings and a variety of savory dishes. It can also  make an excellent addition to smoothies as well as adding a tang to your favourite beverage.

The powder should be stored in an airtight container and will last for some time if stored properly.

Organic ginger powder is ground ginger obtained from the ginger root that has been grown without the use of chemicals, pesticides or genetically modified organisms. Ginger powder is used widely in Ayurvedic medicine and it's properties are becoming more widely recognised by the wider community.

Ginger itself has a distinctive spicy flavor and aroma that come from the oils within it. most notably the oil known as gingerol. Gingerol is known to be the main component associated with ginger's therapeutic qualities. Gingerol is known to have powerful antioxidant and anti inflammatory properties [1]

 Organic ginger powder benefits

Ginger is known to have anti-inflammatory  and antibacterial properties as well as containing antioxidants, Vitamin C  and important minerals including magnesium and zinc. When used appropriately it can provide the following  health benefits

  • Ginger can ease upset stomachs. The anti-inflammatory properties within the powder help to neutralize gastric juices and stimulate digestion and  food absorption. It has been demonstrated to be most effective in treating nausea in many forms. Ginger has been used by pregnant women to treat morning sickness[2]to great affect. However,it is recommended that pregnant women exercise some caution when taking ginger for this purpose as some believe that taking ginger can cause miscarriage although there is no evidence to support this. It is therefore recommended that pregnant women seek medical advice prior to consuming large amounts of the powder. Dry ginger powder mixed with water has been shown to also be effective in treating motion sickness

  • Contains thermogenic agents which and can boost the body’s metabolism

  • May help to reduce muscle pain brought on by exercise. The effect is progressive in nature and does not act instantaneously.[3]

  • Studies have shown that patients who suffered from osteoporosis who took an extract of dry ginger powder required less pain medication and suffered less joint pain.[4]

  • Relatively new research has shown that ginger may lower blood sugar levels.[5] This may be significant for people suffering a health condition like Type 2 diabetes.

  • Appears to be effective in treating menstrual pain.[6]

  • The anti-inflammatory properties with ginger help to relieve the symptoms of the common cold.  A solution of ginger powder and lukewarm water is said to have an almost immediate effect on the symptoms

  • Adding ginger powder to various curries and stews can help to prevent excess gas and treat flatulence

  • Ginger can be added to beauty treatments and face packs. The anti-inflammatory properties within ginger powder are thought to help prevent acne and pimples

We take pride in stocking and supplying the very best organic products. Visit our website today and choose from our range of ginger powders.

References

name: Rice Syrup
description:
What is rice syrup?

Organic rice syrup sometimes called brown rice syrup or organic rice malt syrup is a sugar substitute derived from cooking brown rice so that it breaks down and converts the rice and starches into sugars, mainly maltose and glucose. Importantly, brown rice syrup contains no fructose.

 Rice syrup  is popular because it is all natural and in many cases, organic being derived from rice that has been grown and harvested without the aid of chemicals, pesticides or genetically modified organisms.  The syrup is popular with vegans as refined sugar is known sometimes to use bone char from animals in the refining process, whereas rice syrup does not.

Uses of brown rice syrup 

Rice syrup is used in pretty much the same way as any other liquid sweetener he can be added to popular drinks like tea or coffee or can be used to add extra sweetness in any recipe.  It works really well as a drizzle for waffles, pikelets or pancakes. It can also be used as a dessert topping 

When cooking with rice syrup it can be used straight out of the jar there is no preparation necessary.  It is perfect as a natural sweetener in any recipes that you want to be vegan or gluten-free. Care needs to be exercised when using it with baked recipes as  it can cause the dish to be too crispy. Rice syrup does not taste the same as sugar or maple syrup. It is mildly sweet with a faint nutty taste that has been compared to butterscotch 

Where to buy rice syrup

name: Vegan White Chocolate
description:
What is Vegan White Chocolate?

Is white chocolate vegan? The answer is no, unless milk is replaced with a milk substitute.  White chocolate does not contain cocoa powder but uses cocoa butter instead. Usually white chocolate contains around 3 to 5% milk fat and about 14% of milk solids in it's makeup.  Vegan white chocolate replaces these milk ingredients with a suitable substitute such as almond milk to obtain a similar result.

White chocolate as a rule does not contain caffeine, making it appealing to  many sweet tooths. White chocolate has a distinctive taste that is reminiscent but not the same as dark chocolate  and loved by many. Consumed in moderation it has some health benefits of note

Benefits of eating white vegan chocolate

Besides being vegan friendly, white vegan chocolate has similar benefits to traditional white chocolate these include

  • The cooking and storage process has remarkably little oxidation impact upon white chocolate this makes it a less carcinogenic option than dark chocolates

  • Having a high concentration of saturated fats may make white chocolate a viable protection against fatty liver

  •  Unlike dark chocolate,  white chocolate does not contain carcinogenic mycotoxins and aflatoxins.

  • Studies have shown that white chocolate significant improved the platelet function of men eating white chocolate

  • Contains low levels of theobromine making it less likely to spark allergic reactions

  • It has  a distinctive taste  and can be added to a variety of recipes and desserts.

The nutritional value and health benefits of eating white chocolate will vary greatly according to the  ingredients used to make the product. Ideally vegan white chocolate should contain no more than 55% of sugar and  around 30% of cocoa butter.

name: Dried Cranberries
description:

  • Add them to salads for a burst of vibrant colour and flavour.
  • Mix them into yoghurt or oatmeal for a satisfying breakfast.
  • Bake them into muffins or breads for a healthy treat.

name: Raw Almonds
description:
What are raw almonds

The term raw almonds can be applied to almonds harvested directly from the almond tree and in some circumstances uncooked almonds that have undergone the pasteurisation process. Many Australian companies now pasteurise all of their almonds.  Pasteurisation is done to raw or roasted almonds to avoid contamination.

Organic raw almonds can be eaten as a snack or  make great additions to a variety of meals and dishes including salads, desserts and baked items. Sometimes raw almonds can be confused with natural almonds. The term natural almond is applied to any almond that has retained the skin. A natural raw almond is therefore an uncooked almond that retains the skin and may or may not have been pasteurised.

Benefits of raw almonds

Nuts in general are rich in omega-3  fatty acids which are known to have cardio health benefits. They also are good sources of critical minerals like magnesium, potassium and iron. Almonds have additional health benefits including:

  • They contain copper which is an important mineral that helps with red blood cell formation a s well as helping to make collagen.

  • They contain manganese which metabolizes glucose and helps with normal bone structure.

  • They also contain useful levels of Vitamin B2 which is required for tissue growth and repair

  • They contain high levels of Vitamin E  which is known to boost the immune system, prevent cataract growth and help with heart health

name: Amaranth
description:
What is Amaranth?

Amaranth grain is an ancient grain made up of over sixty different types of seeds. It was once a staple part of the ancient Inca and Mayan civilisation’s diet. While not classified as a cereal, amaranth shares much of the characteristics of cereals and it can be used in similar ways to cereals in a variety of dishes.

It is relatively simple to prepare and is best cooked when amaranth seeds have been sprouted. Sprouting is done by soaking the Amaranth seeds in water and allowing them to germinate over a period of between one and three days. Cooked amaranth can be used in a variety of ways including 

  • Pasta, rice or couscous dishes
  • As an additive to smoothies
  • In soups or stews as a thickener
  • As an ingredient in breakfast cereal

It has a slightly nutty, earthy flavour.

What are the benefits of Amaranth?

Amaranth has many health benefits including

  • Packed full of nutrition, particularly fibre and protein but also magnesium, iron, phosphorus and manganese
  • Contains high levels of antioxidants which are critical in guarding against cell damage caused by free radicals in the body.
  • May act as an anti inflammatory
  • Amaranth has been found to have cholesterol lowering capabilities particularly with LDL or “bad cholesterol
  • Being rich in fibre and protein may help with healthy weight loss as high protein diets have been connected to a loss of appetite 
  • Is naturally gluten free making it a perfect choice for gluten intolerant people.

If you’re looking for an organic gluten free alternative to the cereals that you currently use then Amaranth grain may be your answer. name: Shredded Coconut
description:
What is shredded coconut

Shredded coconut is simply (usually) dried coconut meat shredded into small thin strips. It is a popular and versatile ingredient in many sweet and savoury dishes, being particularly popular in Thai and Vietnamese dishes. It adds a sweet rich flavour to many recipes. Shredded coconut is an economical and practical alternative to purchasing fresh coconut meat.

Organic shredded coconut is simply shredded coconut grown organically without the aid of synthetic fertilisers, pesticides or genetically modified material.

Benefits of eating shredded coconut

Unsweetened shredded coconut retains a good portion of healthy fats and nutrients.  These benefits include:

  • The fatty acids contained in coconut may be beneficial in reducing “bad” cholesterol as well as potentially reducing the risk of cardiovascular disease. [1]

  • Contains the mineral manganese which is known to assist in proper nerve function as well as produce sex hormones. A half cup of shredded coconut contains 55 micrograms of manganese which is at least half the recommended daily intake for men and 67% of an adult females recommended intake

  • Contains the mineral selenium which assists with the proper function of the thyroid gland. One half cup of shredded coconut contains approximately 8 micrograms of selenium which is about 15% of the recommended daily intake for both men and women.

  • Contains  the minerals copper and iron which help to produce energy and red blood cells.

What is pea protein isolate?

Pea protein isolate or pea protein powder is a natural vegetarian vegan approved protein powder that can make an excellent substitute for whey protein powder. Organic pea protein powder is made entirely from n peas that have been grown without the assistance of synthetic chemicals, pesticides or genetically modified organisms.

name: Popcorn Kernels
description:
What are popcorn kernels?

Popcorn is a variety of corn that expands and “pops” when heated. Popcorn kernels are whole grain that retain the germ and bran intact. What makes them “pop” when heated is the moisture inside them that turns to steam as the kernel is heated. Popcorn kernels are loaded with fibre and antioxidants and are extremely low in calories. That doesn’t make all popcorn nutritious - some of the commercially produced popcorn is smothered in unhealthy oils. However, when properly prepared organic popcorn kernels popped at home can be full of all that nutrition and goodness.

How to pop popcorn kernels properly.

To pop corn you need a covered pan and some healthy cooking oil such as olive oil, coconut oil or avocado oil. These ils will add flavour and are full of healthy fats. Stay away from processed oils like sunflower oil which are likely to have fatty oils in them.  The pan should be deep enough for the corn to move around in. heat the oil over a medium heat and be careful not to start burning it as the burnt flavour will be transferred to the popcorn. Then add a couple of kernels to the pan and wait for them to pop which will indicate that the oil is at the right temperature.

Then simply add the rest of the popcorn to the pan and cover it for about a minute. Then give the pan a shake and lift the lid enough to allow some steam to escape. Shaking the pan constantly will allow the popped kernels to rise to the top, while the unpopped ones will fall to the bottom and be subjected to the heat of the oil. Pour the popped  popcorn into a bowl and allow more room for the unpopped kernels to pop.

Within minutes you will have a delicious and highly nutritious snack.

name: Soya Beans
description:
What are soya beans?

Soya beans, sometimes  cold soybeans, are a legume grown extensively in Asia. They are very popular with vegans and vegetarians as they contain all of the protein found in meat, Eggs and milk products and are considered a superfood. The soybean, or as the Japanese call it, Shoyu, is used to make a number of soy products ranging from soy sauce right through to miso and tofu. Mature beans are fairly bland to taste, however, the younger green soya bean is much more appetizing. 

Organic soya beans are grown using traditional methods and without synthetic fertilizers, chemicals or genetically modified organisms.

Benefits of eating soya bean

Half a cup of soya beans contains between 40 and 75 mg  of isoflavones. It is generally accepted that between 30 and 50 g of isoflavones provide health benefits. These specific health benefits include -:

  • Decreased risk of cardiovascular related disease including heart attack and stroke. This is due to soy’s ability to reduce total and LDL levels of cholesterol [1]

  • Decreased effects of menopause, particularly reduced instances of hot flashes [2], 

            thought to be due to the high level of phytoestrogens contained within soy.

  • Lowering blood pressure levels[3] and improved elasticity of artery walls[4]

  • Better bone health [5]

  • Potentially improve cognitive function [6]

name: Soy Milk Powder
description:
What is soy milk powder?

Soy milk is dehydrated soy milk. While retaining most of the goodness and nutrition of soy milk, it has the added benefit of being a convenient milk additive. If refrigerated, soy milk powder can be kept for a long time, whereas liquid soy milk will lose its flavour and goodness after a couple of weeks. Both forms of milk are obtained in much the same way - by filtering soy beans with water - the powder is obtained by allowing the liquid to dehydrate. Organic soy milk is made from organic soybeans that have been grown organically, without the aid of harmful chemicals, pesticides or genetically modified organisms.

Benefits of drinking soy milk

Soy milk is an attractive alternative to milk for vegans in particular as its nutritional profile is very similar. Powdered soy adds the extra benefit of convenience. Te health benefits associated with drinking soy milk in either form are -:

  • Contains a range of healthy monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats. This is in direct contrast to cow's milk which is high in saturated fats which can contribute to such conditions as high levels of  cholesterol and associated heart conditions

  • Is the only dairy alternative that contains similar amounts of protein to cow’s milk

  • Naturally contains isoflavones which are antioxidants known to have anti inflammatory properties.[1]

  • There is some evidence to indicate that consuming soy milk may lower LDL cholesterol  levels [2]

name: Almond Flour
description:
What is Almond Flour?

Made from finely ground, blanched almonds, almond flour is a versatile and nutritious alternative to traditional wheat flour. Unlike its coarser cousin, almond meal, which uses the entire almond (skin and all), almond flour is a light, white powder with a mild, nutty flavour. This makes it a popular choice for gluten-free baking, but its benefits extend far beyond just avoiding gluten.

Packed with Nutrition:

Don't let the delicate texture fool you – almond flour packs a serious nutritional punch. Each cup boasts:

  • Fibre: Aiding digestion and keeping you feeling fuller for longer.
  • Protein: Supporting muscle growth and repair.
  • Calcium: Essential for strong bones and teeth.
  • Iron: Contributing to energy production and oxygen transport.

Baking with Almond Flour:

While almond flour shines in gluten-free baking, it does require some special considerations. Here are some key tips:

  • Texture: Almond flour alone can lead to denser baked goods. To achieve a lighter texture, consider blending it with other gluten-free flours like arrowroot or coconut flour.
  • Eggs: Eggs play a crucial role in adding structure when using almond flour, so don't skimp on them!
  • Experiment and Explore: Don't be afraid to get creative! From delicious cookies and cakes to savoury crusts and pancakes, almond flour opens up a world of gluten-free possibilities.

Frequently Asked Questions:

What can I use instead of almond flour?

Finding a perfect substitute isn't always easy, but some good options include:

  • Sunflower seed flour: Similar consistency and gluten-free, but watch out for a green tint when using baking soda. Add a touch of lemon juice to counteract!
  • Cashew flour: Works 1:1, but has a distinct cashew flavour. Perfect if you love cashews!

How to make almond flour at home?

With a blender and blanched almonds, you can easily whip up your own almond flour! Simply blend until a fine powder forms, taking about 5 minutes.

Where to buy almond flour?

You've found it right here!

Storage Tips:

Store almond flour in an airtight container in the fridge or freezer for optimal freshness.

Ready to Bake with Almond Flour?

Head over to our recipe section for a variety of delicious and gluten-free treats featuring almond flour! You'll be surprised at how versatile and satisfying this alternative can be.

Happy Baking!

name: Barley Flakes
description:
What are Barley Flakes?

Barley flakes are made from the cereal grain, pearl barley. Barley is quite similar to wheat and is actually a member of the grass family. Barley flakes are made by removing the outer hull and then steaming and rolling the remainder of the harvested plant. Organic barley flakes are made precisely the same way from organically grown pearl barley.

Barley flakes are small and round in appearance and look similar to rolled oats. They have a vague nutty flavour and while not a whole grain, as they have been hulled, they still retain some of the benefits of barley. Barley flakes’ nutrition value is reduced compared to whole grain barley but the flakes will still contain some protein, thiamine, iron riboflavin and other important minerals. Barley is considered to be a valuable nutrition source, however, as flakes have been hulled, some of that nutritional value is lost.

Barley flakes health benefits largely revolve around them being a high fibre source. Fibre is considered to be beneficial in assisting regular and full bowel movements as well as potentially absorbing some potential nasties such as cholesterol.

Are barley flakes gluten free?

Unfortunately barley is a whole grain food that contains between 7 and 8 % gluten. Even after having the hull removed, barley flakes are likely to contain traces of gluten and as such should not be consumed by people suffering from celiac disease.

How to cook barley flakes?

Cooking barley flakes in their simple form is done in much the same way as cooking oats. Prior to cooking the flakes, it is a good idea to give them a rinse to ensure that they are cleaned and fit for consumption.

Using a conventional stove top and one cup of barley flakes, you should add three cups of water to a saucepan and then bring the water to boil, then add the cup of barley flakes, reduce the heat and allow to simmer for between five and ten minutes. Then remove from heat and allow to cool for about two minutes before serving with milk and honey. 

Using a microwave the process is somewhat similar - combine half a bowl of water with 1 cup of barley flakes, stir then microwave on high for between three and five minutes. Remove the bowl from the microwave and let the flakes stand for two minutes. Then serve.

How to cook flaked barley?

As per above. Flaked barley can also be added to other ingredients in a variety of recipes and even used as a pasta or starch substitute in some stews and soups.

name: Colloidal Silver Cream
description:
Colloidal Silver Cream: Exploring Potential and Limits

Colloidal silver cream, containing microscopic silver particles suspended in water, has garnered attention for its supposed antibacterial, soothing, and restorative properties. While some potential benefits exist, it's essential to cautiously approach its claims due to limited scientific evidence and potential safety concerns. Let's delve deeper into its possibilities and limitations.

Possible Benefits:

  • Limited Antibacterial Activity: Research suggests colloidal silver may exhibit some antibacterial properties, potentially aiding in wound healing and mild skin conditions like acne. However, it's not a substitute for proper wound care or antibiotics.
  • Soothing Relief: Topical application may temporarily relieve mild irritation from insect bites, stings, and minor skin abrasions. It's important to patch test first and discontinue use if irritation worsens.
  • Individual Benefits: Some individuals report success using colloidal silver cream for specific skin concerns like eczema or psoriasis. However, individual experiences vary, and scientific evidence is lacking.

Important Considerations:

  • No TGA Approval: Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) has not approved colloidal silver for any medical conditions. Its effectiveness claims remain largely unproven and require further research.
  • Argyria Risk: Overuse of colloidal silver, primarily through ingestion, can lead to argyria, a permanent condition where skin, eyes, and organs turn a bluish-grey. Topical use poses a lower risk, but consult your doctor before using it, especially if you have pre-existing skin conditions.
  • Limited Evidence for Specific Uses: There's insufficient evidence to support using colloidal silver against infections like sinusitis. Do not replace antibiotics or professional medical advice based on anecdotal claims.
  • Medication Interactions: Colloidal silver may interact with certain medications. Always consult your doctor before using it, especially if you take any medications.

Misconception Clarification: Applying colloidal silver cream in recommended amounts will not result in argyria, the bluish-grey skin discolouration associated with excessive silver intake. While argyria remains a potential concern from long-term, high-dose ingestion of silver, the risk associated with topical use is significantly lower. Responsible application according to manufacturer instructions and doctor's recommendations poses minimal risk of skin discolouration.

 

Responsible Usage:

  • Always follow manufacturer instructions regarding dosage and application.
  • Store in a cool, dark place and use within the expiry date.
  • Keep children and pets out of reach.
  • Dosage Information: While there's no universally standardised dosage for colloidal silver cream, some reputable sources suggest the following general guidelines (please note these are for informational purposes only and should not be considered a substitute for professional medical advice):
    • Minor wounds and skin irritations: Apply a thin layer to the affected area 1-3 times daily.
    • Acne: Apply a small amount to individual blemishes 1-2 times daily.
    • Eczema or psoriasis: Apply a thin layer to affected areas 2-3 times daily.
    • Always follow the specific instructions provided by the product manufacturer.
    • Consult your doctor for personalised dosage recommendations based on your condition and needs.

Alternatives and Proven Treatments:

Remember, colloidal silver cream should not replace established treatments for wounds, burns, acne, or other conditions. Consult your doctor or dermatologist for diagnosis and proper treatment for persistent or severe concerns.

Misconceptions and Clarifications:

  • Colloidal silver is not a miracle cure and should not be used as a substitute for professional medical advice.
  • It is not recommended for internal use due to the risk of argyria and other potential side effects.
  • Applying colloidal silver cream will not turn your skin blue unless misused excessively.

Further Resources:

  • Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA)
  • Mayo Clinic: https://www.facebook.com/NPR/posts/the-mayo-clinic-writes-that-colloidal-silver-is-unsafe-while-the-webmd-result-is/10155871895246756/: 

Disclaimer:

Colloidal silver cream is not a risk-free product. Use it with caution and consult your doctor before using it, especially if you have any existing health conditions, take medications, or are pregnant or breastfeeding.

name: Glucose Powder
description:
What is Glucose Powder?

Glucose powder is essentially dried corn syrup. The powder is readily soluble in water and is widely used in preparing food and beverages, cooking and is also used in pharmacology.

Glucose is one of the major ways that the body is able to generate energy and as such is regarded as an important source of fuel for the human body. Primarily, glucose powder benefits compared to other forms of glucose relate to its convenience and its ease of substitution for granulated sugar. To be specific, glucose powder is more soluble, faster fermenting and does not leave as much sediment.

Besides being often used as a sweetening agent, glucose powder is often used as an athletic supplement.

The terms glucose and dextrose are interchangeable - dextrose powder is the same as glucose powder.

What does glucose powder contain?

Glucose powder is made up from dried plants and glucose itself is derived essentially from the photosynthesis process involving water and carbon dioxide. Glucose powder contains vitamin D, Calcium and Phosphorus. All of these elements provide health benefits as detailed below.

Is glucose powder good for health?

While the powder is primarily used as a source of energy, it does have some other health benefits that are worth considering.

Vitamin D assists with the absorption of calcium and therefore can help with strengthening bones. Phosphorus is a nutrient that aids with proper cell functioning. All of this goodness translates into the following health benefits.

  • Glucose is one of the primary sources of energy . Once absorbed through the bloodstream, glucose is transformed into glycogen which is then stored as muscle until required.
  • Being a source of energy, has the spin off effect of assisting with endurance.
  • There is now some evidence to suggest that brain function is aided by glucose. Depletion of glucose levels in the brain can cause issues with memory and focus.
  • As well as being a source of energy, glucose powder can help with the recovery process after exertion.
  • Generates energy to perform physiological functions such as respiration, muscle contraction, heart rhythm and regulating body temperature.
  • Glucose can also aid with skin and hair health

As with most foods, too much glucose can be a bad thing for your health. Over consumption of glucose may lead to unhealthy weight gain and diabetes.

Does glucose powder give you energy ?

Glucose is a major source of energy and as glucose powder is immediately soluble, popping some powder into some water and drinking it straight away will give you an immediate energy boost.

name: Iodised Sea Salt
description:
What is Iodised sea salt?

As the name suggests Iodised sea salt. Is sea salt that has been mixed with a sprinkling of the mineral iodine. Iodine is one of the many nutrients that the body requires to function at its optimum. The Western diet has seen many people suffer from iodine deficiency. This has resulted in iodine being offered in a variety of supplemental forms.

While sea salt has some traces of iodine, these are insufficient to make any tangible difference to iodine intake. Iodised sea salt (sometimes spelt iodized) is one way of addressing iodine deficiency. 

When taken in moderation, Iodised sea salt benefits include -:

      Helps to improve the thyroid gland function in producing the hormones that regulate body temperature, blood pressure and heart rate.

      A healthy thyroid promotes a healthy metabolism that will aid in weight control.

      Proper iodine intake can help to ensure a healthy pregnancy.

      Helps to remove toxins such as lead from the body.

      Salt also helps with proper hydration levels.

      As sea salt is obtained through a drying process, it retains some sea nutrients including important minerals such as potassium, calcium and iron.

What is the meaning of Iodised sea salt?

Iodised sea salt is a salt that has been obtained from the sea. Iodised cooking salt is not necessarily the same thing as some Iodised salts have been ground to the point that there natural goodness is lost.

What is the difference between sea salt and Iodised salt?

Salt marketed as Iodised salt has generally been mined from underground, then finely ground before being sprinkled with iodine.

Sea salt on the other hand has been obtained from the sea after sea water has been evaporated and the salt collected. Generally sea salt is coarser and has more flavour than Iodised salt.

Iodised sea salt offers the advantages of Iodised salt plus the flavour and goodness that sea salt affords.

Which salt is better Iodised or not?

Ultimately your choice of salt will boil down to whether you have an iodine deficiency or not. If you do have an iodine deficiency then Iodised salt could be part of the answer to combating that. Iodine deficiency is considered to be a health problem in Australia with parts of South East Australia in particular being flagged as at risk.  Vegans and vegetarians also find it difficult to get enough iodine in their diets.

Signs that you may have an iodine deficiency include symptoms like general lethargy, unexpected weight gain, pregnancy complications and dry skin.

name: Millet flakes
description:
What are Millet Flakes?

Millet flakes are made from one of the oldest cereals consumed by man - millet. Millet flakes are made by crushing the whole millet grain and critically compared to many other whole grain cereals, does not contain gluten.

Millet flakes make a healthy meal eaten alone or make an excellent ingredient to add to baked biscuits or energy bars. Millet flakes nutrition wise, are made up of complex carbohydrates, a range of B Vitamins and minerals including magnesium, phosphorus, iron and copper.

It is worth mentioning that while millet itself does not contain gluten celiac disease sufferers should be careful and pay attention to the labelling as some millet flakes may pick up traces of gluten during processing.

Millet flakes - gluten free are available through the Buy Organics Online website with products like Lotus Millet Flakes Rolled Organic.

Millet flakes substitute readily for rice, oats and even corn flakes in some recipes.

Is Millet healthier than wheat?

There is a lot of debate about whether millet is healthier than wheat. Millet is recommended as being higher in fibre and more filling than wheat. It is also gluten free making it an obvious choice for the gluten intolerant.

Which is better oats or millet?

Both oats and millet are highly regarded as grain foods. Oats generally have been regarded as being superior, nutritionally. It has over 40% more nutritional value, is high in fibre, and has higher thiamin and phosphorus content. Millet contains more calcium.

Both grains in their whole grain form are gluten free.

name: Palo Santo Sticks
description:
What are Palo Santo Sticks?

Palo santo sticks are wood obtained from what is regarded to be a sacred or mystical tree that grows in parts of South America. The tree is related to more commonly known natural scents such as frankincense, copal and myrrh. Palo Santo literally means holy wood and burning these sticks is seen as a sacred practice by indigenous tribes of South America who use the sticks to drive out evil spirits. This practice is known as smudging.

What are Palo Santo Sticks used for?

Besides the spiritual significance of palo santo, palo santo sticks benefits are tangible and worth investigating. They include the following

  • Healing. Traditionally, the wood has been used to ward off colds and flu as well as evil spirits. Advocates today claim that burning these sticks helps to relieve stress as well as reduce the symptoms of asthma, relieve headaches, and assist with relieving anxiety and even depression.
    The scent certainly has a calming effect which may help to support both the nervous system and the immune system.
  • Cleansing - a side product of burning the sticks is that rooms smell fresher and cleaner. There is the added bonus of the scent keeping mosquitoes and other insects from the area.
  • Relaxation and meditation. The scent of palo santo is a great reliant and is particularly useful to get you in a meditative mood.

What do you say when using Palo Santo?

If you are interested in conducting a smudging ceremony there are several mantras you could use while cleansing your area.

Some things to consider would be

  • I cleanse my home of negativity and heaviness.
  • I am grateful for my health, my abundance and my happiness
  • I release myself and my home from any worry
  • I choose joy

The point of this is to essentially reinforce positive energy within yourself as you go through the smudging process.

How to use Palo Santo?

Using palo santo sticks is a relatively easy process. Simply light a palo santo stick and then allow it to burn for about half a minute before blowing it out. THis should generate enough smoke for you to smudge an area. Pay particular attention to the corners of rooms and move through your home, smudging as you go. If you need more smoke, simply reignite the sticks.

name: Soy Flour
description:
What is Soy Flour?

Soy flour is milled from one of nature’s pure sources of protein - the soya bean. The beans are milled in a process that first involves roasting them and then grinding them into a fine powder.

It is appreciated by many cooks for adding a unique pleasing taste and texture to food. Many low carb diets use soy flour.

Soy flour health benefits are related to the natural goodness of the soybean and include

  • Known vegetarian source of high quality protein.
  • Naturally rich source of nutrients including vitamins, isoflavones, and lecithins that are known to lower cholesterol and to fight free radical carcinogens and strengthen bone density.
  • High source of fibre.
  • May help to reduce coronary heart disease as it contains high levels of Omega-3 fatty acids and also contains low levels of fat and salt.
  • Soy flour protein is said to be beneficial for post menopausal women.
  • From a calorie counting perspective, soy flour calories are lower than wheat flour calories. A cup of soy flour contains 320 calories compared to 406 calories contained in a similar measure of wheat flour.

Is Soy Flour and Soya Flour the same?

While the terms soy flour and soya flour are often interchangeable, there can be a slight technical distinction between the two. Soya flour is always ground from whole soybeans. Soy flour on the other hand may contain some of the husk material. While there is a distinction, the term soy flour is often applied to flour that has been ground from whole soybeans.

What happens if you eat too much Soy?

Too much of a good thing can be bad for you and there is growing evidence to suggest that overconsumption of soy can cause fertility problems. This is because soy is made up of isoflavones that are closely linked to the production of estrogen. Some studies now suggest that overeating these compounds could cause infertility in women, as well as triggering puberty prematurely. The bottom line is that consuming soy in moderation is good for you. The US Food and Drug Administration recommends a daily dose of up to 25 grams of soy per day, but cautions against consumption over that amount.

name: Yeast Torula
description:
What is Yeast Torula?

Torula yeast is an edible fungi that grows on wood alcohols. Its scientific name is candida utilis and is harvested as a byproduct from the paper manufacturing industry. As wood is converted into paper, conditions arise that allow Torula yeast to grow on a liquid produced from the pulping process.

When dried, the torula yeast becomes a dried tan powder that has an unmani flavour.

Torula yeast health benefits center around its nutritional value. The yeast is rich in protein, having a similar protein content to soybeans, a full range of B-complex vitamins and all the amino acids necessary.

What is Torula Yeast made from?

Torula yeast is a natural growing fungus that is dried. There are no additives to torula yeast. The fungus grows on wood alcohols.

Does Torula Yeast contain gluten?

Gluten is found in foods made from rye, barley and wheat. As Torula yeast grows from wood alcohols it contains no traces of gluten. As the yeast is often listed as an ingredient in many soups and other processed foods, it need not be a deterrent to people suffering from celiac disease.

How to cook with Torula Yeast?

Torula yeast is used as an ingredient in a variety of recipes. When cooked it takes on a distinct meaty flavour, making it a popular choice in many vegetarian and vegan dishes.

Torula yeast is now often used as a MSG substitute. MSG has been traditionally used as a flavour enhancer but has been known to have some unfortunate side effects. Torula yeast is a worthy substitute for MSG being an effective food stabiliser and holding the flavour and aroma of food while adding texture and body.

If you are looking for recipes that use torula yeast, it may be easier to search for recipes using nutritional yeast and to simply swap one yeast for the other.

Cooking with torula yeast is usually a simple matter of sprinkling the powder into food. It can also be added into dressings, sauces and gravies or alternately sprinkled onto dishes such as cooked vegetables, grains or various snacks.

Torula yeast should be stored in a cool, dark, place for a period of two months. If kept refrigerated it can last for as long as two years. Moisture should be avoided, so it is important to keep it in a sealed airtight container.

name: Bicarb Soda
description:
What is Bicarb soda?

Bicarb soda (Bicarbonate soda) is an alkali powder most commonly used as a leavening agent in baking. Bicarb soda needs to be combined with some form of acid in order to create a reaction that causes carbon dioxide to be released and expand the mixture. As the mixture cooks, air replaces the carbon dioxide creating a light fluffy bread or cake.

What is Bicarb soda used for?

While baking is seen as the primary use of bicarbonate soda. Other uses of bicarb soda include-:

A variety of skin and beauty applications such as 

  • Being used to make homemade toothpaste by being combined with hydrogen peroxide.

  • Making an exfoliating skin scrub by making a mixture of oatmeal, water and bicarb. The mix ratio should be 3 parts bicarb, i part oatmeal, 1 part water

  • Use as a natural deodorant

  • Hand cleanser using 3 parts bicarb to 1 part water

Basic First Aid

Including splinter removal, sunburn relief, treating insect bites, relieving skin irritation and even the relief of indigestion.

Bicarb soda cleaning

Bicarb soda has a variety of household cleaning applications. These functions include -:

  • Scrubbing any surface - simply sprinkle the powder over the surface and use a damp sponge to scrub.

  • Oven cleaning by sprinkling bicarbonate on the oven, spraying with water and allowing it to sit overnight. The oven should be able to be wiped clean with a damp cloth.

  • Polishing furniture and silver

  • Carpet cleaning

  • Shoe deodoriser

What is the difference between baking soda and bicarbonate of soda?

Baking soda and bicarbonate of soda are names for the same powder, Australian recipes usually call for bicarbonate soda whereas American recipes usually list baking soda. Where the confusion sometimes arises is when recipes call for the use of baking powder.

Baking powder is not the same thing.  It is a bicarb soda substitute. It is  bicarb soda mixed with an acidic agent , so that the reaction will occur naturally without adding some form of acidic ingredient.

name: Gluten Flour
description:
Gluten flour is a versatile and essential ingredient in the food industry, prized for its unique properties and role in various food applications. This article will explore the characteristics, production process, and applications of gluten flour, providing valuable insights for food professionals and enthusiasts alike.

  1. What is gluten flour?

Gluten flour is the natural protein found in wheat that is responsible for the elasticity and structure of dough. Composed primarily of two proteins, gliadin and glutenin, gluten flour forms when these proteins combine with water. The resulting gluten network is crucial for the development of texture and chewiness in many baked goods, especially bread.

  1. Production Process

The production of gluten flour involves a series of steps, including:

A. Flour hydration: Wheat flour is mixed with water to form a dough, allowing the gliadin and glutenin proteins to combine and create gluten.

B. Washing: The dough is washed to remove starch, bran, and other water-soluble components, leaving behind the insoluble gluten mass.

C. Drying: The wet gluten mass is then dried, typically using hot air, to remove excess moisture and obtain a stable, powdered product.

D. Milling: The dried gluten is milled into a fine powder to create the final gluten flour product, which is then packaged and distributed.

  1. Applications

Gluten flour has a variety of applications in the food industry due to its unique properties, such as:

A. Dough strengthening: The addition of gluten flour can improve the elasticity and strength of dough, leading to better volume and shape in baked goods.

B. Protein enrichment: As a concentrated source of plant-based protein, gluten flour can be used to increase the protein content of various food products, including vegetarian and vegan meat alternatives.

C. Texturizing agent: gluten flour can provide a chewy, meat-like texture to food products, making it a popular choice for creating seitan, a vegetarian meat substitute.

D. Binding agent: The ability of gluten flour to absorb water and form a cohesive network makes it an effective binder in various food applications, such as meat products and meat analogs.

  1. Considerations

While gluten flour is an essential ingredient for many food applications, it is crucial to note that it is not suitable for individuals with celiac disease, gluten intolerance, or those following a gluten-free diet. Alternative ingredients and formulations must be considered for these populations.

In conclusion, gluten flour plays a significant role in the food industry, providing essential properties that contribute to the texture, structure, and nutritional value of various food products. Understanding its production process, applications, and limitations is crucial for food professionals and enthusiasts seeking to create innovative and high-quality products.

name: Mung Beans
description:
Unlock the Mighty Mung Bean: A Tiny Treasure Trove of Health and Flavour

Don't be fooled by their unassuming size - mung beans are poised to become your new pantry champion! These tiny green gems, hailing from the Fabaceae family and known botanically as Vigna radiata, are revered in Ayurvedic medicine for their wealth of nutrients and antioxidants. From boosting your heart to aiding digestion, mung beans offer a multitude of benefits that extend far beyond their humble appearance. Prepare to be dazzled as we delve into the world of this mighty bean!

Unlocking the Nutritional Powerhouse

Beneath their unassuming exterior, mung beans conceal a treasure trove of essential nutrients. They boast an impressive array of B vitamins, manganese, zinc, potassium, magnesium, folate, copper, and fibre. Additionally, they're a rich source of protein and resistant starch, making them a remarkably filling and satisfying addition to your meals.

A Feast of Benefits Awaits

  • Heart-healthy heroes: Regular consumption of mung beans has been linked to a reduced risk of heart disease, thanks to their cholesterol-lowering properties and ability to lower blood pressure.
  • Diabetes defence: The high fibre and protein content of mung beans help regulate blood sugar levels, making them a valuable ally in managing diabetes.
  • Digestive delight: Mung beans are incredibly easy to digest, promoting gut health and regularity.
  • Weight management wonders: The high fibre and protein content of mung beans contribute to feelings of fullness, aiding in weight management efforts.
  • Antioxidant allies: Mung beans are rich in antioxidants that protect cells from damage and inflammation, potentially reducing the risk of chronic diseases.

A Culinary Chameleon

Versatile and adaptable, mung beans seamlessly blend into a kaleidoscope of culinary creations. Explore their diverse forms:

    Split mung beans: Perfect for hearty soups, stews, and dals.
    Mung bean flour: Whip up gluten-free pancakes, breads, and noodles.
    Sprouted mung beans: Add a refreshing crunch to salads, sandwiches, and stir-fries.
    Whole mung beans: Enjoy them cooked or ground into flour for a variety of dishes.

Whether savoury or sweet, mung beans embrace many flavours, making them a culinary delight for any palate.

Incorporating Mung Beans into Your Life

To reap the full benefits of mung beans, it's essential to introduce them gradually into your diet. Start with cooked mung beans and drink plenty of water to aid digestion. Those with legume allergies should consult a healthcare professional before consumption.

Unleash the Culinary Magic

name: Oat Groats
description:
What are Oat groats?

Groats is an old Scottish word that was used specifically to refer to whole grain oats. An oat groat contains all the nutrition and goodness of the whole grain oat. It has the endosperm, the germ and the bran. Groats have a chewy texture and need to be soaked before simmering so that they soften. This process can take up to an hour and is perhaps the biggest drawback of groats compared to other forms of oats. Synonymous with breakfast, oat groats can also be used in a variety of recipes and are sometimes substituted for rice.

They have an earthy somewhat nutty taste.

What are the benefits of Oat groats?

In general, oats have a number of benefits and these benefits are enhanced fully in whole oat groats.

Oat groat benefits include 

  • Contain vitamin E, and a range of B vitamins as well as potassium, calcium and magnesium

  • Also contain trace minerals such as iron, manganese and selenium.

  • Are said to be beneficial to heart health

  • Help with the prevention of diabetes

  • Excellent source of soluble and insoluble fibre

  • Whole oat groats nutrition value is higher than other forms of oats

  • Whole oat groats are digested quite slowly making them quite a filling meal.

What is the difference between Oats and Oat groats?

Oat groats are what could be called the “raw” product. They basically are “as harvested” and contain the whole groat. They take a long time to cook because of their size.

All other versions of oats are modified in some way. Other oats include 

  • Steel cut oats (sometimes referred to as Irish oatmeal). Steel cut oats are still oat groats. The difference is that the groat has been cut into smaller pieces. This helps reduce the cooking time while retaining all the essential goodness of whole oat groats.

  • Scottish oats are steamed steel cut oats that have been ground into oat meal - this has the dual purpose of increasing their water absorption capacity as well as reducing cooking time further.

  • Rolled oats, commonly known as oat meal - which has been flattened between rollers

  • Oat bran - a combination of oatmeal and some of the outer bran. This is done to give the cereal extra fibre.

Where to buy Oat groats?

We have a range of organic oat groats sourced from reputable organic suppliers. Make sure that  your next breakfast is full of nutritional goodness-make it oat groats and get your supplies from Buy Organics Online today.
