name: Colon Cleanse
description:
What is Colon Cleanse?

Colon cleanse, sometimes called colonic irrigation or colonic hydrotherapy is a process that flushes the colon with fluids (usually water, but sometimes a solution containing herbs and even coffee) to remove waste. The practice dates back to ancient times and the theory behind the practice is that digestive waste can be toxic to the body.

A full colon cleanse is often performed by a medical professional and involves  using a tube to send 60 liters of fluid into the rectum. A separate tube is then used to expel the toxins. 

If you cannot find a “colon cleanse near me” there are home colon irrigation products available online or through your local chemist. 

Alternatively there are some natural supplements that can be taken which will deliver many of the benefits of a full colon cleanse.

How do you do a Colon Cleanse?

Doing a full colon cleanse procedure from home will be most likely uncomfortable and messy. You can purchase a colonic irrigation product that will do the job, or alternatively purchase a supplement that can be taken orally. Supplements work effectively and deliver all the benefits of a colon cleanse. If you think that you need the full procedure, it may be best to seek advice from your physician.

Is it good to get your Colon Cleansed?

The purported colon cleanse benefits commonly associated this detoxification process are -:

  • Boosted energy levels  

  • Reduced incidence of constipation

  • Elimination of toxins associated with causing diarrhea

  • Clearer skin.

  • Weight reduction, as a colon cleanse will flush a lot of intestinal waste from your system

  • Potentially fresher breath. Bad breath is often caused by food that has not been properly digested and an imbalance diet - a colon cleanse can help remove the root cause of the problem. 

  • Muscle Pain relief.

  • Better cognitive processes and reduced stress.

  • Boosted immune system.

Do Colon Cleanses really work?

Do colon cleanses really work? History and anecdotal evidence would seem to suggest that they do. However, there is some argument from some health professionals that full colon cleanses may be unnecessary and could in some cases cause dehydration. 

Is a Colon Cleanse necessary?

Every person’s situation is different and if in in any doubt it is recommended that you consult with a physician

Where can I get a Colon Cleanse in Australia?

Consultation with local physicians should enable you to organise a full colon cleanse if required. However, a more convenient solution may be to choose one of the natural oral supplements offered by Buy Organics Online.

What are Foot Detox Patches?

Detox foot patches are foot patches that adhere to the feet. They are usually applied to the feet before retiring to bed. Detox foot patches work on the principle of drawing body toxins through the soles of the feet. They also help to improve blood circulation.

The foot is where many nerves end. This makes the sole of the foot an appropriate place from where to draw toxins from. Detox foot patch uses are not limited to the soles of the feet with some users applying then to the back and shoulders.

Like much Eastern medicine, there has been little clinical investigation of foot detox  patches but there is sufficient anecdotal evidence for many people to adopt them and swear by them. How do Foot Detox Patches work?

  • After a good night’s sleep the patches are removed.

  • When the patches are removed they will have a dark discoloration - apparent proof that the patches have indeed drawn toxins from the body during the night. 

For many centuries users of detox patches have believed that foot patches containing a mixture of herbal ingredients have worked to draw toxins out of the body through the soles of the feet. 

How often should you use Detox Foot Patches?

How long you need to use detox foot patches will vary from individual to individual. Length of use should be guided by the amount of waste apparent on the patches in the morning. After an initial seven day detox period, the patches remain black and sticky, it is recommended that you continue to use them until such time as they become less sticky. If the foot patches are still presenting as black and sticky after the initial days, this is an indication that your body has a high level of toxins built up in the body and use may need to continue for as long as a month.

After the initial detoxification period, it is recommended that you repeat the process every eight weeks or so.

name: Fruit and Vegetable wash
description:
What is Fruit and Vegetable wash?

A fruit and veg wash is used to remove bacteria, pesticides and other chemicals from fruit and vegetables. Washing produce in water is often ineffective in removing these potentially harmful substances, whereas a fruit and vegetable wash is effective in removing these chemicals and penetrating food grade wax without harming the food.

What is Fruit and Vegetable wash made of?

As fruit and veg wash is designed to clean chemicals and other substances from produce, it follows that the washes will be made from a variety of clean economically sustainable products. While the product ingredients will vary from brand to brand you will find that the fruit and veg wash will typically include a mix of purified water, a natural agent that helps blend oil based liquids and water, a form of citric acid, a natural solvent or suffocant and other natural cleaning agents . 

To illustrate this the ingredient list of Abode Fruit and Vegetable wash is Purified water, Sodium Gluconate, Sodium Cocoamphodiacetate (mild surfactant originating from coconuts), Lauryl Glucoside (extracted from renewable plant resources), Grain Alcohol  Acacia Gum, Xantham Gum, plant derived Glycerine (food grade), Sodium Levulinate, Sodium Anisate, Citric Acid.

How does Fruit and Vegetable wash work?

Essentially a naturally formulated  fruit and veg wash contains mild sufficants that are capable of helping to dislodge chemicals, wax and other potential toxins from the fruit or vegetable. If you’re looking for how to wash fruit and veg, the best way is to fill a tub with cold water and add a small amount of fruit and veg wash. Use a clean scrubbing brush to scrub fruit and vegetables. For leafy greens, place them in a salad spinner and add some cold water. Then after rinsing add some more water with some drops of fruit and veg wash and give them another spin.

name: Moringa Powder
description:
What is Moringa Powder?

Moringa powder is made from the dried leaves of the Moringa tree. The Moringa tree is a native to Northern India. All of the tree is edible and it is packed full of nutrition and antioxidants. 

The classical ancient civilizations grew moringa trees for their nutritional value. The plant has a range of minerals including calcium, iron and potassium as well as Vitamins A, C and E. Moringa leaves also contain several important vitamins:

Moringa powder acts to sterilise a wide range of bacteria and fungi, and is often used as an antiseptic to sterilize surfaces that may be contaminated. 

It has also been used for treating illnesses such as malaria, typhoid fever, hypertension and diabetes. The health benefits of moringa powder have been traced to its numerous plant-based compounds.

Moringa powder benefits include :-

  • Pain reduction

  • Anti inflammatory properties 

  • May help to lower blood sugar levels

  • Can help to lower cholesterol levels.

  • Can assist in reducing arsenic toxicity.

Is Moringa Powder good for hair?

Vitamin A is an integral compound for healthy hair growth Moringa powder contains vitamin A and as such would appear to be a good fit. Too much vitamin A, however, actually causes hair loss, so rather than use supplements, it is best to consume vitamin A through foods like Moringa powder is the safest option. 

Is Moringa Powder good for skin?

Moringa powder, whether consumed or applied topically can be quite beneficial to skin as it contains many nutrients. These include :-

  • Vitamin A, an essential ingredient in building collagen.

  • Vitamin C, assists with combatting the signs of ageing. 

  • Vitamin E, which contains anti-inflammatory properties.  

How do you take Moringa Powder?

How to use moringa powder is a simple matter of mixing 1 or 2 teaspoons into any drink or dish that you would like to try seasoning it with.

How to store Moringa Powder?

Moringa powder will keep for almost two years when stored in a dark, dry, cool space.

name: Papaya Leaf
description:
What is a Papaya Leaf?

A papaya leaf comes from what is commonly known as the paw paw plant. The fresh leaves are quite large, being between 50 and 79 centimetres in diameter and up to 90 centimeters long. 

The papaya leaf has great nutritional value and that value is often harnessed in the form of papaya leaf extracts or papaya leaf concentrate. 

The leaves grow from hollow stems right at the top of the tree. Each papaya leaf is full of a white liquid. The papaya leaf is crisp, but can be bitter to taste. The bitterness will depend on how mature the plant and leaf is.  

What is the use of Papaya Leaf?

Fresh harvested papaya leaves are often boiled. They are often used in a form of tea that can be used for medicinal purposes as a tonic or to help with digestion. The leaves can be used in a similar way to sinach. Boiling tends to remove the bitter taste. Papaya leaf extract is available in tablet and powder forms and is generally used as a tonic or for medicinal purposes. 

What is Papaya Leaf good for?

Green papaya leaf benefits can be gained through taking papaya leaf extract or incorporating the fresh leaves into your diet. The key benefits are:-

  1. Contributes to a healthier looking skin.
  2. Vitamins A and C help to give the immune system a boost. 
  3. Strong anti-Inflammatory properties mainly delivered by high concentrations of Papain
  4. Aids the digestive process by facilitating the proper breakdown of protein and carbohydrates.
  5. Boosts Blood Platelet Production.

What is the shape of a Papaya Leaf?

Describing the shape of a papaya leaf is not a simple task. To give you an idea about papaya leaf, it is best to provide a broad description. The leaves themselves are broad, flat, and palm shaped. They are thin, flexible and have prominent yellow veins extending through their lobes.

name: Sour Cherry Juice
description:
What is Sour Cherry Juice?

Sour cherry juice is juice made from tart cherries. Sour cherries offer all the benefits of regular cherries and then some. This is because they contain a high number of anthocyanins which offer significant health benefits to the consumer.

Regular consumption of organic sour cherry juice offers significant benefits with some potential side effects. Sour cherry juice benefits and side effects include:

Benefits:

  • Boosts recovery after an intensive workout. 

  • High level of antioxidants helps to build the immune system. 

  • The same antioxidants can help to alleviate inflammation.

  • Antothyacins can help to prevent obesity.

  • All cherry drinks can help reduce swelling and pain.

  • Increases the production of melatonin which may help with sleep problems. 

Side Effects

There are potentially some side effects that can be potentially associated with cherry juice, particularly when over consumed are :-

  • Stomach ache 

  • Diarrhea

  • Increased calorie intake 

Is Tart and Sour Cherry juice the same?

Tart cherry juice and sour cherry juice are essentially the same thing.

Does Sour Cherry Juice help you sleep?

Sour cherry juice contains high, melatonin levels. Melatonin is often called the sleep hormone as its production helps you to get off to sleep. Many studies have clearly demonstrated a connection between sour cherry juice at least twice daily and better sleep. There is something unique about sour cherry juice that separates it from other foods that contain melatonin. While the reason is not clear it could be due to one or all of these factors.

  • Sour cherries contain significant amounts of the chemicals procyanthin and anthocyanin. Both chemicals have been shown to possess anti-inflammatory properties that may aid sleep.

  • Consuming sour cherry juice appears to lower levels of kynurenine in blood. Kynurenine is associated with sleep deprivation. This is particularly so with depressed people.

  • There is a theory that some chemicals in the cherry could affect the amino acid tryptophan. Tryptophan is the amino acid that generates serotonin and melatonin.

For whatever reason, sour cherry juice does seem to have a distinct positive effect upon helping people get to sleep.

name: Tapioca Pearls Seeds
description:
What are Tapioca Pearls Seeds?

Seed pearl tapioca, tapioca pearl seed and tapioca starch are all names for a gluten-free, thickening agent that can be used in baking. Tapioca makes a suitable addition to a range of baked goods like cakes, pancakes, puddings and muffins. It can also be used as a thickener for tasty soups, gravies, sauces and pie fillings.

The beauty of using seed pearl tapioca as a thickener is that it won't affect the taste at all and will form a clear glossy gel that adds an enticing sheen to the dish.

See pearl tapioca can be added to a variety of recipes or cooked separately.

Seed Pearl Tapioca how to cook

Cooking seed pearl tapioca is a simple process. This seed pearl tapioca recipe is easy to follow and will give you great tasting Tapioca.

Ingredients: 100 grams of tapioca pearls, 1000 ml of water, 25 grams of brown sugar (or honey)

Method:

  1. Pour 1000ml of water into a large pot.

  2. Bring the water to boil.

  3. Carefully put the tapioca pearls into the boiling water.

  4. Once the tapioca pearls reach boiling point, give them a stir and lower the heat to medium.

  5. Set your timer for 25 minutes, stir the mixture occasionally.

  6. While the tapioca  is brewing, prepare the sugar syrup which will sweeten the tapioca. This is pretty simple. 

  7. Mix the brown sugar with an equal amount of hot water. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved, then pour the syrup into a bowl.

  8. When the 25 minutes expires, take the tapioca off the heat and allow it to stand for 10 minutes. Cover the pot with a lid.

  9. Then pour tapioca into a colander and rinse with cold water for about two minutes.

  10. Once all the water is drained from the colander, place the tapioca into the premade syrup. Then allow it to sit for about 15 minutes to allow the sweetness of the syrup to penetrate fully.

  11. Serve

This seed pearl tapioca recipe should serve two to four people.

Are Tapioca Seeds and Pearls the same thing?

Tapioca seeds, tapioca pearls and tapioca balls all refer to the same simple gluten free food that is obtained from the cassava root.

What is Tapioca Seed?

Tapioca seed is another name for seed pearl tapioca.

What are Tapioca Pearls made out of?

Tapioca pearls are made entirely from tapioca starch which is obtained from the  cassava root. Not only are the pearls gluten free, they are also vegan friendly.

name: Vanilla Bean Paste
description:
What is Vanilla Bean Paste?

Vanilla bean paste is made from combining the contents of the vanilla bean pod, a thickening agent and a sugar-water syrup. In many respects it represents a happy medium between the vanilla bean and vanilla extract. 

While the vanilla bean is going to have more vanilla flavour, the vanilla bean paste price is much more affordable and long lasting than a fresh bean. 

It can be interchanged quite readily with vanilla extract, however, it is thicker and more jelly-like. The taste of vanilla bean paste is not as intense as whole vanilla beans but it still has plenty of flavour. 

How to use Vanilla Bean Paste?

As mentioned previously, if you’re looking for tips on how to use vanilla bean paste, it is fully interchangeable in recipes calling for vanilla extract. If you want to add vanilla flavor, simply add one or two teaspoons of vanilla bean paste extract to your favorite sweet baked dishes and custards. It can be used in most recipes, but works especially well with cakes and biscuits. 

If you need to substitute vanilla bean paste for vanilla beans, a broad guideline of one half vanilla bean is equivalent to one teaspoon of vanilla bean paste. 

What is Vanilla Bean Paste made of?

Vanilla paste is made from a combination of finely ground vanilla beans/seeds, Made from finely ground vanilla seeds, a small amount of sugar and water and usually some form of thickening agent. 

How long does Vanilla Bean Paste last?

The paste won’t last indefinitely but if treated properly will last for a substantial length of time. The thing to remember with this paste is that while it will contain some natural sugar it won’t have added sugars. This should mean that once opened and as long as it is kept in its original container, it will last for nearly twelve months if kept refrigerated.

name: Window Cleaner
description:
What is Window Cleaner?

Before looking for window cleaners near me and paying for a professional cleaner, it might well be worth considering doing window cleaning yourself. Before making this decision, you should understand what a natural window cleaner is. 

A natural window cleaner that won’t leave streaks behind. It is a solution that will remove stains, dirt and grease buildup on a window. As the term natural window cleaner implies, it will be made up of all natural products like baking soda, grain alcohol and purified water. Typically they will be ammonia free, contain no toxic chemicals and be non polluting.

What is the importance of Window Cleaner?

The best window cleaner delivers important benefits to the home. These include :

  • Create a welcoming first impression. Clean windows get noticed - they create a positive image and improve the aesthetic appeal of a property. Regardless of whether it is your family home or your business premises, clean windows create a positive vibe. 

  • Clean windows let more sunlight in - making the rooms a little brighter, healthier and warmer.

  • Window cleaning helps to prevent etching which tends to scratch and weaken glass. Etching is caused by exposure to the elements like  salt, sand and dust.

  • It improves the environment of the room. Dirty windows are home to mould, mildew and must that can be released into the atmosphere.

  • Most importantly, clean windows make it easier to enjoy the view.

How does Window Cleaner work?

Commercial window cleaners contain solvents and suffocants that stick to the glass and remove dirt and grime. Natural window cleaners often use baking soda in place of solvent and a natural suffocant.  

Can you use Window Cleaner on glasses?

Care needs to be exercised with using window cleaner to clean eyeglasses. Most commercial cleaners contain harsh abrasive chemicals that are likely to harm any anti reflective coating on your eyeglass lenses. 

What is the best Window Cleaner?

There are a lot of effective window cleaning products on the market. What separates the good from the best is what the window cleaning solution actually contains. It is our belief that the best window cleaner is the window cleaner that cleans effectively, doesn’t leave streaks and most importantly is not going to expose your skin, eyes, nose or mouth to harmful chemicals. name: Japanese Green Tea
description:
What is Japanese Green Tea

Japanese green tea is used to describe a large variety of green teas that have been developed in Japan. Green tea is derived from the leaves of the Camellia Sinensis plant and is widely consumed in Japan. There are several popular varieties of green tea which can be divided into two categories - those grown in the shade and those grown in the sun.

Varieties of green tea grown in the shade include the very popular Matcha and Gyokuro varieties. Matcha comes in the form of a green powder while gyokuro is sold as a leaf tea. Varieties grown in full sun include sencha and genmaicha varieties.

Organic Japanese green tea has been grown and harvested without the aid of harmful synthetic chemicals or pesticides. 

Is there a difference between black tea and green tea

The difference between black and green teas is in how they are processed. Leaves determined to become black tea are left to dry and ferment. This process causes the tea to oxidise and take on the earthy flavours that are associated with black tea. Whereas green tea is obtained by steaming the leaves almost immediately. This prevents oxidations and gives the tea a herby flavour. 

Benefits of Japaneses Green tea

All Japanese green tea contains a bioflavonoid known as catechin. Catechin has numerous antioxidant and antiviral properties, giving credence to the medicinal value that the Japanese have placed upon it for centuries. Some of these health benefits include-:

  • Strong antioxidant properties help to fight free radicals

  • Helps to prevent the formation of LDL (bad cholesterol) and reduces the risk of stroke, heart attack and arteriosclerosis.

  • Strong antibacterial properties

  • Can help prevent viral infections like influenza. Gargling with green tea is said to be very effective.

  •  Helps to moderate the effects of allergies.

  • Contains Theanine (Teanin) amino acid that has shown to have a positive effect on brain function .

  • Contains Vitamins C and E which when combined with catechin help to boost the immune system

  • Contains low levels of caffeine which helps to maintain alertness

  • A rich source of other minerals including manganese, calcium and potassium.

name: Quick Oats
description:
What are Quick Oats? 

As well as being a breakfast staple for many Australians, quick oats have become a vital ingredient in many baking recipes. So, what are they and how do they differ from steel cut or rolled oats?

Essentially quick oats are steamed in much the same way as rolled oats. The  difference is that the oat groats are rolled much more thinly than regular rolled oats. This causes them to break apart a little, giving them the appearance of being roughly chopped. The reduction in size results in less cooking time - hence the name quick oats. While the cooking time is reduced the taste and flavour of quick oats remains the same. Quick oats have a slightly different texture to traditional rolled oats, being thinner and creamier. They also retain all the goodness of other oat forms.

Organic quick oats are organic oats that have been grown without the aid of chemicals or synthetic fertilisers and steamed in the same way. 

Benefits of quick oats

Quick oats retain all the benefits of regular oats and being less dense get absorbed into the bloodstream quicker. The key benefits of oats are -:

  • Promotes better digestion as they have high fibre content

  • Helps to lower bad cholesterol levels and blood pressure leading to a healthier heart.

  • Slows down the absorption of sugar into the body helping to keep blood sugar levels under control 

  • Being high in fibre, oats tend to promote the feeling of a full stomach while being low in fat and low in carbohydrates making them a weight control ally.

  • High concentration of antioxidants helps to build your immune levels.

  • Gluten free cereal makes it suitable for sufferers of celiac disease.

Quick oats of course have the added benefit of taking less time to cook, while retaining all these benefits. That makes them an easy choice to make.

Quick oats uses 

Besides the obvious morning cereal use, quick oats make a healthy and interesting addition to many recipes. A quick perusal online will reveal quick oats recipes for everything from meatloaf through to a range of tempting sweet snack and dessert dishes.

An example of a popular quick oats recipe that takes just five minutes to prepare and is sure to satisfy any afternoon hunger cravings is as follows.

Basic Ingredients: 

  • 1 cup quick oats

  • 1/4 cup creamy peanut butter

  • 1/4 cup honey

  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

 Optional Ingredients (can be altered according to taste

  • 1/4 cup chocolate chips 

  • 1/4 cup dried banana chips,

Method: 

  1. Combine the basic ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Use a spatula to keep stirring until the mixture is sticky and moist throughout.

  2. Fold in any optional ingredients that you have and ensure that they are evenly distributed throughout the mixture. 

  3. Place the mixture in the refrigerator for at least half an hour, so that it hardens up. 

  4. Remove the mixture from the refrigerator and then scoop out tablespoons of the mixture and roll them into balls. If you want to make them look a little like a regular biscuit, flatten them out a little.

  5. Then eat! If there are any left, they can be stored in an airtight container on a sheet of wax paper for as long as one week.

name: Gluten Free Gravy
description:
Gluten Free Gravy

Gravy recipes usually have three essential elements - flour, stock and some sort of fat or juice. Making gluten free gravy usually involves using a gluten free flour and some sort of thickening agent to help give the gravy body. 

You can make organic gluten free gravy by purchasing a packet mix of orgran gluten free gravy which will give you a rich tasty gravy that will thicken nicely or you can choose to make your own gluten free gravy using a particular gluten free flour. 

Gluten free gravy recipe 

Being on a gluten free diet doesn't necessarily mean that you have to have a boring colorless diet. Gluten free biscuits and gravy is every bit the treat that biscuits and gravy lovers enjoy.

Here is how to make gluten gravy using a gluten free flour - orgran gluten free flour. which makes the perfect substitute for wheat-based flour. It is made from a combination of rice flour,  and tapioca starch. It can be swapped on a 1:1 basis for wheat flour in many recipes and additionally it has the added benefits of being gluten, egg, dairy, soy and nuts free. Orgran gluten free  flour is also vegan and Kosher..

Ingredients: 

  • 20 grams of butter

  • A touch of thyme - 3 fresh sprigs or alternatively ½ a teaspoon of ground thyme

  • 2 Tablespoons of Orgran gluten free flour

  • Crushed garlic according to taste (½ a tablespoon is probably enough)

  • Salt and Pepper

  • Either 3 tablespoons of cooked meat juices or one and a half cups of a suitable stock (typically beef, chicken or vegetable)

  • 1 ½ cups of hot water

Optional Ingredients

A thickening agent - 2 teaspoons of corn starch mixed into a quarter of a cup of cold water works well.

Method:

1. If you have fresh thyme and garlic it's time to finely chop them.

2. Then add the thyme and  butter to the pan and cook on medium heat until the butter has completely melted.

3. Add the orgran flour and stir to combine.

4. Then add the chopped garlic and salt and pepper 

5. Then pour in the meat drippings(or the food stock) and 1 ½ cups hot water 

6. Then let the mixture simmer for between six and eight minutes, stirring regularly to stop gravy getting stuck to the pan.

7. If you need to change the texture of the gravy, you can thicken it by adding :two tablespoons of cornstarch dissolved in ¼ cup cold water. Alternatively the gravy is too thick you can add more hot water to achieve the desired thickness. 

8. You can strain the gravy to remove the thyme pieces if you like.

name: Bircher Muesli
description:
What Is Bircher Muesli?

Bircher Muesli, first introduced by Swiss physician Maximilian Bircher Benner at the dawn of the 20th century, is the forerunner to what we today call muesli. The physician noticed that a balanced meal of raw vegetables and fruits combined with regenerative therapy was having a positive impact upon his patients.

Most popular brands of muesli today are derivatives of the original bircher muesli recipe. Unfortunately, most mass produced muesli cereals either have added sugar or salt - and bot these additives tend to detract from the overall health benefits that Bircher Muesli provides.

Fortunately, there are still some companies that adhere to the original recipe and produce organic bircher muesli made from locally produced fruit and vegetables. 

What is the difference between Bircher muesli and regular muesli?

Bircher muesli is the traditional muesli version of what many people know as overnight oats. While the modern regular muesli is crunchy and dry, bircher mueslis are usually made to be soaked for a period before eating. Cream and lemon juice are too popular choices added to soak bircher muesli in.  

What are the Health Benefits of Bircher Muesli?

Bircher muesli is a healthier alternative to conventional mueslis or cereals for the following reasons.

  • It helps to keep bowel movements regular. While this can be said of most mueslis and cereals, the high gout healthy fibre content of Bircher muesli helps to alleviate symptoms of constipation while promoting overall gut health. 

  • Does not contain ingredients that could be classified as harmful.
    While a lot of cereals make all sorts of claims about being healthy and good for you, many contain a list of ingredients guaranteed to baffle you. Those long sounding scientific names often disguise potentially harmful preservatives and chemicals not to mention the dreaded sugar and salt components..
    Whereas, Bircher muesli is made from natural food ingredients that haven’t  been altered or stripped of their natural goodness. A good example of Bicrher muesli contents would be Real Good Foods’ Organic Bircher Muesli. The contents of this package are instantly recognisable Rolled Oats, Sultanas, Sliced Almonds, Diced apple and sunflower kernels - no added sugar or salt - just natural goodness. 

  • Is easily digestible and helps with the absorption of nutrients. 

Bircher muesli should be soaked overnight as this helps to break down the starch content in rolled oats making the digestion process easier. Additionally, this process decreases the phytic acid content of the muesli. Phytic acid naturally occurs in every plant-based ingredient. Its presence slows down the absorption rate of nutrients and minerals such as calcium iron and zinc.

  • Oats have been demonstrated to assist in lowering high blood cholesterol levels. 

  • Some varieties of nuts used in Bircher muesli contain high levels of omega-3 fatty acids Omega-3 is widely connected to a raft of health benefits, including assisting with the development of the nervous system. 

  • The Bircher muesli is a high-calorie and healthy heart food. 

  • Can help to reduce sugar levels provided no sugar or honey is added.

How to Make Bircher Muesli 

This Bircher muesli recipe serves two people, and is really a guide as ingredients can be carried according to taste

This can be made with fruit juice, soya milk or rice milk. Alternatively you could opt for the original  recipe  ingredients which stipulated water and cream. It is recommended that you trial  different ingredient combinations.

Variety is the spice of life here. You can swap out the walnuts for almonds and the fruits are interchangeable. Blueberries are a sure hit. Be careful though with sharp tasting fruits like pineapple which could contrast with the sultana taste.

 Ingredients 

  • Rice milk, soya milk  or fruit  juice (orange)

  • 4 large scoops of oats

  • 1 scoop of sultanas

  • 6 strawberries

  • 1 banana

  • 2 apples

  • 1 scoop of walnuts

  • 1/2 of a lemon

Method

To ensure that the sultanas become soft and juicy and to lower the scratch content of the oats, Bircher muesli should be prepared the night before.  This preparation will involve:

  1. Pouring the oats and sultanas into a large  mixing bowl.

  2. Thoroughly mixing them together

  3. Add your chosen milk or juice to the bowl without covering the oats.

  4. Stir it all together. Add more liquid if the mixture appears to be a little dry. Be careful not to drown your oats and sultanas.  The oats will absorb  a lot of the liquid in the coming hours. . 

  5. Cover  the mixture and store it in the refrigerator overnight. 

When you wake in the morning and you’re ready to eat, remove the bowl from the refrigerator, then add your fruits to the mixture . ..

  1. Try grating the apple or alternatively you could core it and chop into small pieces.

  2. Chop the  banana into small pieces. .

  3. Chop nuts into small pieces..

  4. Chop the strawberries and add.

  5. Squeeze in the juice of half a lemon. The lemon not only adds a zesty freshness it will help keep the apple from browning.

  6. Mix thoroughly

  7. Serve into bowls

  8. Eat!

Where can I buy Bircher Muesli in Australia 

If grabbing all those ingredients and making up your own Bircher Muesli seems a bit much, you can get some wonderful organic bircher muesli packs made from Australian ingredients. Buy your bircher muesli from Buy Organics Online and start eating a healthier breakfast.

name: Coconut Shampoo
description:
What is Coconut Shampoo?

Coconut shampoo and conditioner are shampoos that use coconut based ingredients as one of its base ingredients. There are a range of coconut shampoo products which may use coconut oil, coconut milk or coconut water. While there are many varieties of coconut oil shampoo and coconut shampoo available, many are manufactured using harsh and potentially harmful chemicals. Choosing an organic coconut shampoo will deliver all the benefits that coconut offers without subjecting you to the dangers that many commercial products do.

Which is Better: Coconut Oil Shampoo or Coconut Milk Shampoo?

All naturally made coconut based shampoos are going to offer plenty of nourishment to your hair. Which one is better will depend largely on what type of hair you have and what condition it is in. Coconut oil is particularly useful in treating dandruff Whereas coconut milk is gentler on the hair and is particularly beneficial for curly hair. 

Benefits of using coconut shampoo and conditioner

While helping to keep your hair fresh and clean, organic coconut shampoos also have many other benefits. These include

  • Detangles hair by eliminating frizz and making hair more manageable. Keeping hair free from tangles will help to prevent hair damage and split ends. 

  • Nourishes and restores damaged hair. Coconut oil or milk contained in shampoos and conditioners can penetrate deep into hair roots and help with hair regeneration. This is particularly helpful for hair that may have been damaged by frequent coloring and styling.

  • Dry hair moisturiser

  • Contains lauric acid and medium chain fatty that have been associated with stimulating hair regrowth.

  • Strengthens hair as it contains Vitamins K and E which are beneficial to hair follicle health. 

  • Restores your hair’s natural glow

  • Has antifungal properties which help to eliminate dandruff and ease general scalp itchiness.

  • Natural coconut oils help to protect hair from the sun damage.

  • Softly scents the hair with a pleasing fragrance.

name: Gluten Free Granola
description:
What is Gluten Free Granola?

Granola is a popular breakfast cereal and snack, made primarily from oats and a variety of seeds and fruits. Typically no grains are used in a granola pack and you could assume that it is therefore gluten free. However, many packaged granola products use oats that have been tainted with grain during processing. Many of these cereals therefore cannot be certified as gluten free granola.

To be gluten free granola, the oats and other ingredients must not have been contaminated with grain during harvest or processing. The products selected by Buy Organics Online not only meet that criteria but also use ingredients that have been grown organically - giving you the opportunity to choose organic gluten free granola.

Gluten Free Granola Recipe 

Home made gluten free granola is a relatively simple process, provided you can source gluten free products at reasonable prices and you enjoy getting your hands dirty in the kitchen. As with all granola recipes, ingredients can be swapped in and out as your taste desires - so long as you keep everything gluten free. But you can use this as a starter recipe and experiment with the ingredients as you go.

Ingredients:

  • 300 grams of oats (gluten free)

  • 100 grams of peanut butter(crunchy)

  • 85 ml of maple syrup

  • 60 grams of coconut oil

  • 100 grams of raisins

  • 50 grams of pecan nuts (or similar)

Method:

  • Preheat your oven to 160 C (or 140 if fan forced)

  • Line two baking trays with greaseproof paper

  • Chop up the nuts or alternatively crush them if you have a mortar and pestle. Add to a large mixing bowl.

  • Place the oats, maple syrup, peanut butter and raisins into your mixing bowl

  • Pour the coconut oil into a saucepan and then melt on low heat. When thoroughly melted, pour the oil over the bowl  mixture

  • Thoroughly stir the mixture to ensure an even spread. Use a spatula or wooden spoon for this task. 

  • When mixed evenly, pour the mixture evenly out over the two lined baking trays.

  • Place the two trays in the oven and allow to bake for between 20 and 25 minutes until it is a golden colour.

  • Remove from oven and allow to cool

  • Store in a cool dry place in an airtight container.

Where to buy gluten free food near me

Sourcing quality gluten free food can be problematic. Fortunately Buy Organics Online has a complete range of gluten free food, including organic gluten free canola, that you can rely upon for a satisfying healthy meal. Get you supply of gluten free granola from Buy Organics Online today.

name: Granola Keto
description:
What is Granola Keto?

Granola is a popular healthy breakfast cereal option that usually contains grains, carbohydrates and sugar that make it unsuitable for a paleo diet. Granola Keto is made by switching out the grains and sugars with products that can be substituted while retaining the overall taste, texture and goodness of granola. 

Granola Keto usually combines some but not all of the following ingredients and categories 

  • Seeds and nuts. These could include almonds, pistachios, macadamia nuts, evans, hazelnuts, chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, flax seeds, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds and chia seeds.

  • Sugar free sweeteners like Stevia, Erythritol or Lakanto. 

  • Healthy fats which might include coconut oil. Coconut flakes, grass fed butter, shredded coconut (unsweetened) and cacao nibs.

  • A binding agent like peanut butter or egg white.

Some keto granolas choose to add extra flavour via cinnamon or vanilla extract.

Naturally all ingredients contained within an organic granola keto are organically grown and harvested. 

What is the Keto Diet?

The keto diet, or more accurately the ketogenic diet is a diet that has low carbohydrates and high healthy fats. Its adherents claim that it aids with weight loss as well as easing other medical conditions.

The theory goes that consuming less carbohydrates causes your body to burn and use fat as fuel.

What are the benefits of Granola Keto

Keto Granola makes a great low carb start to the day that will leave you feeling satisfied and full for hours. Keto Granola deliberately weeds out high carb foods like oats. Oats are not Keto friendly and also contain some levels of sugar that could spike your blood sugar levels Granola Keto can contain less than 2 carbohydrates per serving, is quick and easy to prepare, makes for a delicious filling meal and can be used as a topping on other healthy foods like Greek yoghurt.

Granola is known to provide the following benefits that are retained in Granola Keto 

  • Can help to lower blood sugar levels. The combination of dried fruit, nuts, and seeds can  help control and even reduce blood sugar levels. This is more likely to have an effect with people who are obese or have prediabetes.

name: Tigernut Flour
description:
What is Tigernut Flour

Tigernut flour is derived from the acclaimed superfood alternately called tigernut, nut grass, yellow nuts edge or edible galingale. Tigernut is a tuber that grows from the chufa sedge plant. 

The flour is obtained by first roasting the tubers and then grinding the roasted roots into  powder. While not strictly comparable to wheat flour it can still be added to baked goods or used as a thickening agent for gravies,  soups or stews. It also makes a useful flavouring addition to  many foods ranging from jam to ice cream.

Tigernut flour is becoming increasingly popular as it is gluten free and paleo diet friendly. 

What does tigernut flour taste like? 

The tigernut tuber has a distinctive but mild, slightly nutty flavor. As with many root vegetables it has a sweet earthy taste.
This translates across to the flour which  is slightly sweeter grain flours. This sweetness is attributable to the natural sugars contained in the tuber. For best baking results it is recommended that tigernut flour be mixed with another with another non-wheat  flour.

Health Benefits of Organic Tigernut Flour

As organic tigernut flour is processed without the aid of synthetic materials, mush of the goodness contained within the tigernut is transferred to tigernut flour. Tigernuts are now regarded as a superfood and with good reason. The following health benefits are the main benefits of tigernut:

  • Rich in antioxidants 

  • The fibre content of the tiger nut exceeds such “go to” high fibre foods as prunes, whole grains and chia seeds. The benefits of a high fibre diet are well documented. 

  • Rich source of magnesium Magnesium is one of those vital minerals that perform wonders in the body. Magnesium aids more than three hundred biochemical actions and reactions within the body. Remarkably 100 grams of tigernuts supply around 15% of a healthy adult’s daily magnesium needs. 

  • An excellent source of potassium which helps to regulate the heart and ensures the proper functioning of the cells of the body as well as process carbohydrates. On a proportional basis, the tigernut contains more potassium than the banana

Tips For Baking With Tigernut Flour

Some simple tips to follow when using tigernut flour are:

  • The texture of tigernut flour can at first seem a little coarse. This can be mitigated to some extent by sifting the flour to achieve a finer texture

  • If you’re working on new recipes for baked foods, you will likely find it necessary to combine the flour with a binder with some starchy properties. Some good choices could be arrowroot starch or tapioca starch. 

  • It may take a little while to master baking ith tigernut flour, but the results will be worth it!

To point you in the right direction we’ve included this simple chocolate chip recipe

Tigernut Flour Recipe - Chocolate Chip Cookie

Makes 12 cookies

Ingredients 

  • cup of coconut sugar or cane sugar
  • ¼ cup melted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract 
  • 1 egg
  • 160 grams of tigernut flour
  • ¼ tsp of sea salt
  • ¼ cup of dark chocolate chips 
  • ¼ tsp of baking soda

Method 

  • Use a medium sized bowl to whisk sugar, melted butter, vanilla extract and egg together.

  • Then add flour, sea salt and baking soda. Stir until combined. Then fold in the chocolate chips.

  • Place the mixture in the fridge for an hour and allow to cool.

  • Line a baking tray with greased paper and preheat oven to 180 C.

  • Remove the mixture from the fridge and scoop out 12 evenly sized dough balls and place the m on the baking tray.

  • Slightly flatten the balls and add a few more chocolate bits to the top of each cookie.

  • Place the baking tray in the oven and allow the cookies to bake for between 12 and 15 minutes. 

  • Once removed from the oven, allow the cookies to cool on the tray for ten minutes before transferring them to a wire rack.

  • Allow to cool completely before eating.

  • The cookies can be stored for 2-4 days in a cool airtight container.

Where to buy Tigernut flour?

If you’re looking for where to buy small quantities of organic tigernut flour or bulk tigernut flour supplies you will find that the Buy Organics Online website has a range of products that will suit you. Try tigernut flour and enjoy the health benefits that this alternate flour provides. Get your supply at Buy Organics Online today.

name: Loving Earth
description:
What is Loving Earth?

Loving Earth is a Melbourne based company with a mission to work with small producer communities around the world to ethically produce quality foods using organic whole food products like their acclaimed loving earth chocolate, organic superfoods, loving earth business and activated breakfast cereals. 

First and foremost Loving Earth is recognised for its exquisite chocolate products made from Cacao sourced from the Ashaninka people from Peru. 

Loving Earth Chocolate and the Ashaninka community

The fair trade collaboration with the Ashaninka community is critical in ensuring the continued sustainability of the Ashaninka people and their care for the rainforest. 

The community still cultivates the prized Amazonico Criollo Cacao beans. This particular variety of cacao is now highly sought after due to the rapid introduction of hybridized rapidly growing cacao plants that produce greater quantities of beans but lack the quality of flavour of the original beans. 

Loving Earth in  partnership with the rainforest foundation has assisted the Ashaninka community to form a certified organic, fair trade cooperative. Having helped to establish this cooperative known as Kemito Ene, Loving Earth moved quickly to cement the relationship by committing to buy Kemito Ene’s complete 10 tonne cacao crop for a price substantially higher than what  they would have obtained through the usual local channels. 

From these humble beginnings, the Ashaninka are now able to produce a 40 tonne crop. Complete financial independence will be achieved when they are able to produce 160 tonnes of cacao each year. 

Loving Earth is committed to helping them achieve sustainability within the next few years. To provide the Ashaninka with the lifeline they desperately need, more chocolate needs to be sold. 

What does loving earth chocolate taste like?

The short answer is that Loving Earth chocolate products taste the way chocolate is meant to taste. All chocolate products are made from the finest ingredients and are dairy free. You can expect a smooth rich chocolate taste that is sure to have your taste buds begging for more. 

Loving Earth Chocolate Varieties 

There is no doubt that the people at Loving Earth love their chocolate. They produce a range of delicious chocolate products including a range of chocolate bars, dark chocolate, white chocolate caramel chocolate and the enticing buckinis chocolate clusters.

What are Loving Earth Buckinis

Buckinis is the name given to activated buckwheat. Buckwheat is not a grain but a fruit  seed that contains a powerful nutritious punch. 

The buckwheat fruit is closely related to rhubarb. Being a seed, it is gluten free. The small seeds are triangular in shape and contain high levels of protein as well as all  of the essential amino acids. Other nutrients contained in this triangular seed include -:B Vitamins, zinc, magnesium, iron manganese and copper,. However the raw seeds contain phytic acid which prevents the vitamins and minerals from being accessible. The way to unlock that goodness is to activate the seed. Activation requires soaking, draining and then dehydrating the seeds.

Loving Earth have sourced quality organically grown and harvested buckinis and packaged them up in a variety of interesting and delightful flavours. These include caramelised buckini clusters, buckini berry and cacao cereal, buckini nut and seed cereal, buckini chocolate clusters and many more. 

Where to Buy Loving Earth Chocolate and Other Products 

Loving Earth products are becoming more prevalent in Australian stores these days, but for pure convenience and stress free shopping you can’t go past the range of Loving Earth products supplied by Buy Organics Online. Buy Organics Online stock the full range of Loving Earth Chocolate, Loving Earth Buckinis and Loving Earth cereals. Get your Loving Earth supply here today and help build a better, more sustainable world.

name: Wild blueberries
description:
Why Wild blueberries?

Wild blueberries are recognised as one of nature's supreme superfoods. Wild blueberries thrive in very cold conditions, due mainly to the high levels of flavonoid anthocyanin. This phytochemical gives the wild blueberry extra protection against harsh conditions. This natural phytochemical production is the reason why wild blueberries have a naturally occurring higher anthocyanin content than  commercially farmed blueberries. 

Getting those wild blueberries from the wilderness to you fresh can be quite a task. Fortunately, modern methods have made it possible to get all the goodness of wild blueberries packed in the form of wild blueberries powder,

Benefits of wild blueberries 

One of the best things about wild blueberries is that they are so full of natural goodness to gain tangible benefits from eating them. The fact that they taste great makes them all the better. The key health benefits of wild blueberries are -: 

Wild Blueberries are loaded with antioxidants. Antioxidants help to guard against the effects of inflammation which among other things is believed to be a major contributor to Alzheimer’s, and other similar degenerative diseases. Perhaps more importantly, wild Blueberries have been measured as one of the highest cellular antioxidant activity fruits. 

Can help keep with heart health. packed with fibre, wild blueberries can lower LDL cholesterol levels thereby lowering the risk of of heart disease and stroke.

Wild Blueberries may assist in boosting brain function. Academic research across the globe is making connections between better concentration and memory

In addition to improving cognitive function, there is also growing evidence that wild blueberries have a positive effect upon mood. 

Can help to reduce the risk of Type 2 Diabetes. Research is now indicating that eating blueberries helps to process glucose more efficiently. This is thought to be related to the high phytochemical content. 

Anththyacins have been demonstrated to aid vision recovery after exposure to bright lights. Additionally blueberries may help to reduce the likelihood of cataracts.

Ongoing research is investigating wild blueberries potential positive effects upon muscle recovery, wound healing and exercise performance.

name: Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray
description:
Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray: Possible Sinus Relief

Colloidal silver is a liquid solution containing tiny particles of silver suspended in water. It has been used for centuries in health and wellness circles and is considered to have antibacterial and antiviral properties. If it is used in small doses, colloidal silver is considered safe to use. Given its antibacterial and antiviral properties, colloidal silver is ideally suited to a nasal spray.

People with regular sinus infections may find that a colloidal silver nasal spray treatment can alleviate their symptoms.

Potential (limited evidence) Benefits of Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray

  1. Can help to soothe sore, irritated nasal passages. Colloidal silver is a natural anti-inflammatory, which can help to soothe sore, irritated nasal passages. This can also help to ease referred sinus pain, which often manifests as headaches.
  2. Antibacterial and antiviral properties may help with infections in the nasal passages and prevent further infection. Colloidal silver is effective against many bacteria and viruses, including those that cause sinusitis, colds, and flu.
  3. Some people use it for ear and throat infections. Colloidal silver has also been used to treat ear and throat infections, such as otitis media and strep throat.  Again, there is no credible scientific evidence to support this.

Side Effects of Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray

Colloidal silver can be potentially harmful if used for prolonged or high doses. Some medical authorities have warned of the dangers of colloidal silver, most notably the skin taking on a bluish hue if people are exposed to too much. The condition, although not lethal, is irreversible in most cases. On occasions, ingestion of colloidal silver has led to kidney damage if taken in high enough doses.

How to Use Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray

Some people use colloidal silver nasal spray for common ailments, including sinusitis, colds, flu, hay fever, and ear and throat infections. To use the nasal spray, spray it into each nostril as directed on the product label. Current research on the use of colloidal silver for ear and throat infections, including otitis media and strep throat, is limited. Therefore, its effectiveness for these conditions remains to be determined.

Where to Buy Colloidal Silver Nasal Spray in Australia

Buy Organics Online has a full range of colloidal silver products available to the Australian market. We only stock the best available colloidal silver supplies. If you're searching for a new way to treat your sinus conditions, you can rest assured that many others have chosen colloidal silver nasal spray. Get your colloidal silver nasal spray from Buy Organics Online today.

Disclaimer

Colloidal silver is far from a cure-all and should never be used as a substitute for medical advice. See your doctor if you are experiencing severe sinus pain or other symptoms.

References

  1. Colloidal Silver: A Review of Its Antimicrobial, Antiviral, and Anti-inflammatory Properties. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8203226/
  2. The Use of Colloidal Silver as a Nasal Spray for Treating Sinusitis. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3815111/

Questions and Answers

Q: Is colloidal silver nasal spray safe to use?

A: Colloidal silver is sometimes considered safe to use in small doses. However, using colloidal silver in medium or high doses or taking it for prolonged periods is not recommended. See the disclaimer above for important information about safety and limitations

Q: How do I use colloidal silver nasal spray?

A: To use the nasal spray, spray it into each nostril as directed on the product label. You can also use the spray in your ear, but care should be taken not to flood the ear as this will cause discomfort. See the disclaimer above for important information about safety and limitations

If you're looking for a natural way to relieve your sinus symptoms, colloidal silver nasal spray may be the right choice.

name: Patchouli Incense
description:
What is Patchouli Incense?

Patchouli incense is extracted from the leaves of patchouli- flowering plants that have a distinct fragrance.  The incense itself has been used for centuries. Patchouli has even been found buried with Egyptian mummies. Patchouli incense can be purchased in several different forms, the most popular being incense sticks, cones, smudge sticks, and the oil itself. 

What does the Patchouli Incense scent smell like?

The first test for an affective incense is that it must smell good and patchouli certainly does that. It gives off an aromatic scent that has been variously described as sweet, earthy, slightly woody, musky and spicy Of course, the scent may vary slightly but it affects most people by having a calming influence on them. Our sense of smell is the most direct sense that affects emotions and pleasant smells often evoke good emotions. 

Numerous benefits and uses of Patchouli

The incense is used for a variety of purposes including spiritual, medicinal, meditative purposes and as an insect repellent. Some people also use patchouli incense as an aphrodisiac.

From a spiritual perspective, patchouli is often burned to cleanse an area of unclean energies and replace them with better ones. 

The health benefits of this incense are largely associated with its use in aromatherapy. The benefits here are:

  • Helps to reduce stress and worry. Inhaling the fragrance helps to calm and soothe the senses. This calming effect appears to be related to the scent stimulating blood oxygen levels, regulating breathing and helping to lower blood pressure. 

  • It may help to relieve headaches.

  • It helps to balance emotions.

  • Has antibacterial and antifungal properties that may help to relieve respiratory infections.

Patchouli incense is widely used in meditation and yoga classes as its soothing fragrances help to clear the mind. 

Are there adverse Patchouli Incense effects?

As a broad rule of thumb, patchouli is quite safe. However, a small group of people have allergic reactions to the smoke. There is also some evidence to suggest that pregnant women should avoid inhaling patchouli incense.

The same principles apply to household pets although some cats and dogs may be irritated by the smoke. 

Where to find Patchouli Incense near me

Accessing quality patchouli incense has never been easier, now that Australian website Buy Organics Online stocks the finest and most natural grades of patchouli incense available. If you would like to add the calming scent of patchouli to your home, there is no better place to buy than Buy Organics Online. Get your supply today.

name: Sugar Free Granola
description:
What is Sugar Free Granola?

Although having substantial nutritional value, granola breakfast cereals often contain significant amounts of sugar. This is done to sweeten the overall taste. Adding sugar reduces the overall health benefits that can be obtained from eating granola. Choosing sugar free granola restores the overall health benefits that granola offers while not compromising on the overall taste. 

Sugar free granola recipe that tastes just as good

This simple recipe uses stevia to retain the customary sweetness.

Ingredients:

  • 1 ½ cups of rolled oats make sure that they are certified gluten-free if you need to make gluten free sugar free granola.

  • 2 tablespoons of flaxseeds

  • 1 cup of unsweetened coconut flakes

  • 1 tablespoon of cinnamon

  • ½ cup of walnut pieces

  • ½ cup of slivered almonds

  • 2 ½ tablespoons of stevia (can be varied according to taste)

  • cup of almond butter

  • 2 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract

  • ½ cup of dried cranberries (may contain added sugar so leave out if in doubt)

  • ½ teaspoon of salt.

Method:

Line a baking tray with greaseproof paper. Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celcius. Soak flaxseeds in the water and allow them to soak and thicken for five minutes. Then combine oats, nuts, coconut flakes, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl. After waiting for a couple of minutes stir flaxseeds and water, then add in almond butter, stevia, and vanilla. Stir thoroughly until the mixture is smooth. Pour this wet mix into the bowl containing the oats. Stir until mixture is evenly combined and well coated. Spread the mixture out evenly over the baking tray. Place in oven for ten minutes then remove and stir. Return to oven and allow to bake for a further ten minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Add dried fruit if desired 

Where to buy Sugar Free Granola

name: Unbleached Flour
description:
What is Unbleached Flour?

As the name suggests, unbleached flour is milled flour that has not been through the bleaching process. Bleached flour is treated with chemicals such as benzoyl peroxide, potassium bromate, chlorine gas, and other chemicals to whiten it, thus removing its natural yellow tinge. Unbleached flour is allowed to age naturally and this takes extra time. The extra processing time usually results in slightly higher prices for unbleached flour. When used for baking, unbleached flour usually delivers a coarser, crustier result.

Bleached flour vs unbleached flour - what is best?

Bleached flour is renowned for its fineness and it makes baking, somewhat easier in most instances. However, some recipes specifically call for unbleached flour and this is generally to ensure that a certain texture is achieved. 

Aside from baking, unbleached flour has several distinct advantages over bleached flour. These are-:

  • Unbleached flour has greater nutritional value than bleached flour as it retains some vital nutrients that the bleaching process leaves out. Unbleached flour has more fibre, contains more antioxidants and retains the minerals manganese and copper as well as Vitamin E.

  • Unbleached flour has a protein content of around 11% compared to bleached flour which has a protein content of 8%.

  • The chemicals used in the bleaching process are potentially harmful. Potassium bromate is the main cause for concern as it has been linked to kidney damage in studies. Benzoyl peroxide has also been linked to the body’s inability to break down antioxidants.

While these concerns about bleached flour are real, the consensus of opinion is that more research needs to be done before a definitive conclusion can be reached.

Bread flour vs unbleached flour - which one should you use?

Bread flour is specifically made for bread making. Usually, bread flour has been bleached which means that many of the advantages and disadvantages of bleached flour compared to white flour can be applied here.

What is Unbleached Flour used for?

Unbleached flour can readily be interchanged with bleached flour in most recipes. It will provide a denser end result. It is best suited to recipes that require the food to hold its shape. This makes unbleached flour perfect for recipes for éclairs, pastries and yeast bread.

Where to buy organic Unbleached Flour.

Searching for natural unbleached flour is no longer a problem, as Buy Organics Online offers a range of unbleached flours that have been chosen for their natural goodness. If you’re looking to transition away from white flour or simply need unbleached flour for a specific recipe, buy your supply today from Buy Organics Online.

name: Vegan Granola
description:
What is Vegan Granola?

At first glance, most granola cereals would appear to be vegan. However, a lot of off the shelf granolas contain ingredients that are considered to be non-vegan. Some examples of these ingredients are honey, which is deemed by many strict vegans to be non-vegan, and chocolate although dairy-free chocolate is quite acceptable.

Organic vegan granola is made from ingredients that have been organically grown and harvested while meeting the requirements of a vegan diet. 

Vegan gluten-free granola will not contain oats or grains. Oats are a staple ingredient of most off-the-shelf granolas. Oats are considered to be grains and while gluten-free, they are often contaminated with gluten during processing.

Benefits of vegan granola

Vegan granola allows vegans to enjoy the crunch taste and overall goodness of grandpa while being true to their principles. Granola cereals are renowned to be beneficial in a variety of ways. These include:

  • Rich in fibre and protein

  • Helps lower cholesterol levels

  • Helps to keep blood sugar levels under control

  • Excellent source of antioxidants

  • improves gut health

Sugar free granola recipe vegan

Preparation time: 15 minutes  Cooking time: 50 minutes

Ingredients:

  • of a cup of maple syrup

  • 2 Tbsp of melted coconut oil

  • 2 Tsp vanilla

  • 2 tbsp nut butter

  • 3 cups of certified gluten-free rolled oats

  • 1 cup of raw almonds (chopped)

  • 1/2 cup of raw walnuts (chopped)

  • 1/2 cup of raw unsalted sunflower seeds

  • 1/2 cup of raw sesame seeds

  • 1/2 cup of raw pumpkin seeds

  • 2 Tbsp of coconut flakes

  • 1 tsp of cinnamon

  • Pinch of nutmeg

  • 2/3 cup of dried fruit,

Method: 

Preheat the oven to 160C.

  1. Whisk the nut butter, vanilla, maple syrup, and coconut oil. To ensure that they combine well, it may be necessary to gently heat the mixture.

  2. Combine the gluten-free oats, nuts, seeds, coconut flakes, nutmeg, and cinnamon in a large bowl.

  3. Pour the maple syrup mixture over the dry mixture. Mix until all ingredients are coated evenly.

  4. Spread the sugar-free granola mix onto a baking tray lined with greaseproof paper. Bake until golden brown for between half and three-quarters of an hour, pausing to stir every 10 minutes.

  5. Remove from the oven when golden brown, and allow to cool for 20 minutes. Add the dried fruit, then store it in an airtight container. The granola will keep for a month if refrigerated.  

Where to buy vegan granola

Buy Organics Online has a range of quality pre-packed vegan granola products. However, if you wish to make your own vegan granola, you will find a range of organic vegan products that will suit your needs, Whatever your preference, Buy Organics Online is the place to shop for vegan granola. Buy your supplies today.

name: Spelt Flakes
description:
What are Spelt Flakes?

Spelt flakes are derived from a grain belonging to the wheat family known as spelt. Spelt is a lighter grain than wheat and has a slightly nutty flavour. When rolled flat, it forms flakes which can be made into a nutritious meal much like oat bran. 

Individual spelt grains are known as spelt berries. When the berries are flattened they become rolled spelt flakes. The flattening process usually occurs after the grain has been lightly toasted. It is then pressed and flattened. The flattening process is done in one of two ways -:

  • Using a hot roller steam roller to soften the grain during the rolling process.

  • Or using a cold press. This way helps to preserve more of the nutritional content and quality of the grain.

Spelt vs Oatmeal

Both of these grains are nutritious and healthy - which one is more suitable for you will depend on what type of diet you need. 

Spelt has more vitamins and minerals than oatmeal. On the flip side, it also has more carbohydrates and more sugars. Both kinds of cereal pack a healthy nutritional punch and which one is right for you will depend on what you’re looking for. 

If you’re on a low carb diet, oatmeal is preferable. The same goes for low sugar and fat diets. However, if you’re looking for a diet that is low on the glycemic index, spelt wins hands down.

Nutritional benefits of spelt flakes

Packed with vitamins and minerals, spelt provides a range of health benefits including:

  • Supporting digestion as spelt is high in fibre content.

  • Contains complex carbohydrates that tend to be digested slowly, enabling them to provide you with more energy for longer periods.

  • Spelt has a low glycemic index when compared to other grains, making it a better choice when trying to manage diabetes.

  • The fibre in spelt helps to lower bad cholesterol levels (LDL).

  • Contains complex carbohydrates and amino acids that help to prevent inflammation.

  • Contains phosphorous and calcium in sufficient quantities to support and strengthen bones. 

Where to buy spelt flakes in Australia

If you’re looking for a breakfast cereal that gives you that full feeling that oatmeal does, but need to keep an eye on your glycemic index, you will find that spelt flakes will meet your needs. Ayurvedic soap is a soap manufactured according to the principles of Ayurveda. Ayurveda is a traditional form of Indian medicine. 

Ayurvedic medicine operates on the principle that your skin’s health reflects the whole body’s health. As the skin is your body’s largest organ, it is capable of absorbing way more nutrients than you might realise. Ayurvedic soap is made from organic ingredients with the idea of nourishing the skin. Gentle on the skin, it is a natural and holistic means of skincare designed to deliver clean healthy moisturised skin all over. 

An Ayurvedic soap recipe is not just a recipe for cleansing and nourishing the skin. The soap bars are infused with aromatic herbs that can help to improve your mood and state of mind. 

Benefits of Ayurvedic soap

The key benefits of using Ayurvedic soap are:

  • The naturally made soap retains antioxidant properties which help with skin cell rejuvenation, This helps with keeping skin looking healthy.

  • Contains natural antibacterial agents that help to prevent acne and other related conditions.

  • Minimises health risks associated with parabens and sulphates found in regular soap. These chemicals can be absorbed into the body and may be harmful to your overall health.

  • More environmentally friendly than regular soap. Made from all-natural ingredients, Ayurvedic soap is easily biodegradable, making it less harmful to the environment. Regular soaps tend to contain chemicals that can be quite toxic to the environment and they have the potential to disrupt marine life in particular.

  • Helps to keep skin looking youthful. The soap contains many ingredients that help to maintain the skin’s complexion and elasticity. 

  • Free from animal fat. Not tested on animals.

  • Naturally moisturises the skin and helps to prevent ailments such as dermatitis.

  • Ayurvedic soap is made up of a cocktail of natural herbs that have natural  restorative and recuperative powers. They not only enrich your skin but have the power to enliven and nourish your senses as well.  Science has now conclusively demonstrated that our sense of smell can have a direct effect on our emotions. Some natural scents can have a significant impact upon our state of mind and emotional well being.  Ginger and lavender, for example, are both known to have a relaxing, calming effect on the body.

What is in Ayurvedic soap?

The ingredients of this soap may vary slightly according to individual recipes but the ingredients list of Chandrika Ayurvedic Soap gives a reasonable sample of what is contained in Ayurvedic soap. These ingredients are -:

name: Nutri Leaf Slim Tea
description:
What is Nutri Leaf Slim Tea?

Nutri Leaf Slim Tea is a specially formulated tea that acts as an all-natural herbal laxative. Drinking it will encourage regular bowel movements. It has been deliberately designed to be taken to assist dieters with weight reduction. This natural organic tea contains a blend of natural herbs that have appetite suppressant properties.

There is a suggestion that drinking Nutri leaf slim tea may help in breaking down excess fat and stimulating the body’s metabolism to “run faster.”.

Senna is the main ingredient of this tea. This herb is used to treat constipation. It is sometimes taken in order to clear the large intestine prior to surgery. It usually takes effect within twelve hours of being taken orally. Glycosides are the key laxative agent within Senna. These organic compounds are common to many species of plants.

Nutri leaf slim tea side effects.

The African Journal of Traditional, Complementary and Alternative Medicines states that Senna is a stimulant laxative. In other words, Senna causes the bowel to push waste out faster than it usually would. This means that people contemplating taking this tea should be prepared for some discomfort. Many reviews of the product state surprise at how quickly it worked. There is also some evidence to suggest that a small minority of people experience severe allergic reactions to Senna in particular. It is, therefore, suggested that it is wise to consult your doctor before adding this tea to your diet.

How to use Nutri leaf slim tea 

This tea should be drunk by adults only. The tea should be prepared only using porcelain or glass utensils. Preparing it is a simple process.

  1. Boil water.

  2.  Add 1 teabag to each cup. 

  3. Pour boiled over the tea bag, and then cover the cup. 

  4. Let the brew steep for between 3 and 5 minutes.

  5. Stir cup well before serving as this will help release the full potency of the herbs.

Where to buy Nutri leaf brand slim tea

name: Pomegranate Juice Concentrate
description:
What is Pomegranate Juice Concentrate?

As the name suggests pomegranate juice concentrate is pomegranate juice with most of the water content extracted. Juice concentrates normally have up to 90% of the water content removed. Often, the juice concentrate contains additives to maintain the original flavour of the juice. This practice tends to lead to some of the natural goodness of the original product being diluted. The best pomegranate juice concentrate therefore would contain no additives and ideally would be an organic pomegranate juice. Pomegranates are known to be one of the healthiest types of fruit in the world. Drinking pure pomegranate concentrate will have many benefits.

Benefits of organic pomegranate juice

  • It is a major source of fibre, minerals, vitamins and bioactive plant compounds.

  • Contains powerful antioxidants known as Punicaligins. These are said to be responsible for pomegranates having three times the amount of antioxidant activity as green tea or red wine.

  • Contains important fatty acids

  • Helps to reduce inflammation

  • It may help to ease hypertension and lower blood pressure when drunk regularly.

  • There is some evidence to suggest that it can ease arthritis and given its anti-inflammatory properties, this would seem to be logical. 

  • Improves heart health by helping to lower cholesterol levels and lowers blood pressure.

  • Antibacterial properties within the juice may help to ease some conditions including gum disease.

  • May act to help protect memory function, Some initial studies have linked it to guard against Alzheimer’s disease.

  • Contains dietary nitrates which have been linked to improved athletic or exercise performance. 

Side effects of pomegranate juice

Most people will find the consumption of pomegranate juice to be safe to consume. However, in some rare instances, people have been found to have an allergic reaction to the juice.

How to use pomegranate juice concentrate

Besides drinking it neat, there are some great ways to add pomegranate juice concentrate to your diet. Here are some suggestions.

  • Add it into salad dressings - there are some suggestions that it can be substituted for vinegar entirely or simply add a few drops for added flavour.

  • Add to iced tea or sparkling water for a refreshing not too sweet drink.

  • Used it as a meat glaze.

  • Add a few drops of olive oil and use it to baste roast vegetables

  • Use it to add some punch to any Mediterranean style dip.

name: Ingredients
description:
Dive into the World of Ingredients: Unleashing Nature's Power for Health and Beauty

Welcome to your one-stop destination for exploring the incredible world of natural ingredients! Here, you'll discover a treasure trove of potent plant extracts, nourishing oils, and revitalising minerals, all carefully chosen for their ability to enhance your well-being and elevate your beauty.

Whether you seek to soothe your skin, boost your energy, or nourish your gut, we've curated a diverse collection of ingredients, each with its own unique story and set of benefits. Dive deep into their properties, learn how to incorporate them into your daily routines, and experience the transformative power of nature firsthand.

What you can expect:

  • In-depth ingredient profiles: Delve into the fascinating science behind each ingredient, exploring its historical uses, medicinal properties, and applications in various wellness practices.
  • Expert insights and curated recommendations: Gain valuable advice from trusted professionals and discover personalised suggestions for incorporating these ingredients into your lifestyle.
  • Sustainable sourcing and ethical practices: We believe in harnessing nature's bounty responsibly, so you can be confident that our ingredients are sourced with integrity and respect for the environment.
  • A vibrant community of wellness enthusiasts: Join us on your journey towards natural health and connect with like-minded individuals who share your passion for harnessing the power of nature.

Ready to embark on your next wellness adventure? Explore our ever-growing collection of ingredients, discover their hidden potential, and unlock the secrets to a healthier, more vibrant you.

Stay tuned as we expand our ingredient library, offering you a world of possibilities to explore and experience!

name: Natural Handcrafted Soaps
description: Explore our curated selection of natural handcrafted soaps, where each bar is a sliver of cleansing art. Our soaps are meticulously crafted by skilled artisans using traditional methods and natural ingredients. Indulge in the gentle touch of organic essences that leave your skin feeling soft, nourished, and rejuvenated. From the calming scents of lavender to the invigorating zest of citrus, each bar promises an alluring aroma, a luxurious lather, and a pure, soothing cleanse. Embrace the fusion of nature's finest elements and the art of soapmaking in our Natural Handcrafted Soaps collection.
meta_title: Natural Handcrafted Soaps - Artisanal Cleansing Bars
meta_description: Discover the best Natural Handcrafted Soaps made with organic ingredients. Luxurious, nourishing, and gentle, our artisanal soaps offer a pure and soothing cleanse with captivating scents. Shop now for an enriching skincare experience.
